Reviews.Content: We have no problem with the quality of the picture and the features of the TV.The real issue is that our TV reboots unexpectedly at seemingly random intervals. We tried resetting the factory defaults, unplugging the ethernet cable, disconnecting from WiFi, and unplugging individual HDMI cables. The TV has rebooted at least once in all but two days of ownership (we've had the TV for three weeks now in hopes of the problem "going away"). We are returning it.We've had two other Samsung products and it's a shame that there are many people (over the last couple of years) seeing the same issue. We are very reluctant to have this item replaced with another Samsung TV at this point.

Reviews.Title: Nice TV, but...
Reviews.Author: photomate
Reviews.Content: After a month or so, the TV went into a power recycling loop. First, it started to power off by itself. Turning off and on a few times seemed to get it back to normal. But a few days later, it just wouldn't quit power recyling itself -- screen goes blank, power light goes off, then it tries to power on again, you see the splash screen but never get a picture, shuts off and tries to power on again with no success. This is endless unless you unplug it, the power button on remote or TV have no capability to keep it off. Hoping it would be ok after cooling down, I plugged it back in the next morning but still in an endless loop... aggravating to say the least.I found others with similar problem reported on the net with Samsung TVs, some dating back several years. (There's even a couple of Youtube videos on this problem, even one that shows how to replace components if yours is out of warranty). Cannot figure out why they would still be shipping some TVs with this issue, mine was built in 2013. Obviously, will be returning this one, possibly will get another brand. Real drag to setup all of the netflix and amazon streaming stuff and have this happen. Too bad, because I liked the TV pretty well up till this happened. Oh, also had problems with some Amazon streaming videos freezing. Netflix OK.

Reviews.Title: Can we get 0 stars?
Reviews.Author: A Customer
Reviews.Content: Samsung software must be the worst in the business.  If you are buying this for the Smart functionality (ie, watching Netflix, Hulu or Amazon), don't:  the software doesn't work.  I was stuck with non-functioning Netflix and Amazon VOD for more than six months after an update broke everything.  Do a search for "samsung netflix doesn't work" and you'll start to see some of the many horror stories.  The CNET forums are particularly rife with people in the same boat.  An update finally fixed that, but less than four months later, another update has left me, again, with a brick.Never again will I buy a Samsung product of any sort.

Reviews.Title: Good little TV
Reviews.Author: capn gary
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying I am not much of a TV watcher. I don't have (or want) cable or dish. I simply refuse to pay the price for something that would be of limited use to me. (I don't want/need 150 channels of junk, shopping, physical fitness, etc.) I do like to watch an occasional movie, so I have a Blu-Ray player.As far as the image is concerned, it's fine, and I spent 35 years in the medical xray business, so I know a good image when I see one (which is why I bought Samsung to begin with). The blacks are black and the whites are white. I haven't seen any image 'tearing' or pixelating.The speakers are what you can expect from something this small. Don't expect ground shaking explosions. But for people talking or watching Victory at Sea or something like that, they're fine.Turn on/start up was fast and easy. I plugged the TV into my U-verse modem and let it do what it wanted. It took about ten minutes, I think.As for the TV tuner, I live in a 'fringe' area for TV reception, so I bought a 'Jack OA-8000' antenna which has a preamp built into the plastic housing (which houses a modified Yagi antenna, for anyone interested). After installing the Jack antenna I'm able to pick up about 14 digital stations from town, which is about 50 miles away. The 'front end' on the TV must be pretty good, because this is supposed to be a bad area for TV reception, according to my neighbors. So now I can at least turn on the local news and weather. (You can believe the weather, mostly...the news??? I don't believe a word of what they say.)HDMI connection from the Blu-Ray was a matter of plugging in the HDMI cable. I'm pumping the audio back out via fiber optic cable to my Pioneer amplifier. Not so sure the decoder in the TV is doing things right, because I don't seem to be getting the DTS signal back to the Pioneer. I may switch the audio back to direct from the Sony Blu-Ray or just add another audio fiberoptic cable and do a bit of reprogramming on the amp.I have an ancient VHS tape recorder and it does as good as it ever did using the simple video/audio inputs.My laptop has an HDMI output, and it also works just fine, so I was able to bring in the recent presidential debates via the internet.I have not tried connecting to Hulu, or Netflix, so I have no idea if that part works or not.Colors are near perfect. The green is down about 3%, according to my test equipment. That's about right, I think, for Samsung. They've always done red and blue much better.

Reviews.Title: Among The Best!
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: This was a difficult TV to find - Samsung don't seem to be pushing this particular model - but well worth the search. Fantastic picture, great features - and it has THREE HDMI slots - which the 'mainstream' model doesn't - weird decision Samsung!

Reviews.Title: Terrible "Smart Hub" Software Ruins This Television
Reviews.Author: Steve McKay
Reviews.Content: Poke around at the other 1-star reviews for details about what's wrong with this TV. I'll just give you a brief description with the hopes of saving you some unnecessary grie.What you're going to find in those 1-star reviews are people complaining about the "Smart Hub" feature. "Smart Hub" is software that runs on your TV the same way Android and iOS runs on your phone, or Windows runs on your desktop computer. The TV (and you) depend on this software to run apps like Netflix and Amazon Video Streaming. You pay extra money for this feature when you buy this TV. Sadly the software is broken by design.When you first start Smart Hub you might not see all of the apps you see on the packaging or in promotional pictures. What you'll see in this case is just some generic apps (like a Web Browser and some "lifestyle" category sections). If you're in this boat you've either not connected your TV to the internet OR, and this is the case that is vexing so many people, you *have* connected your TV to the internet but the Smart Hub can't connect to a particular server (think website). When this happens the Smart Hub won't let you start any apps, and won't even *show* you the most useful apps like Netflix and Amazon Video. It's worth noting here that in my case while Smart Hub was claiming it couldn't connect to the internet, other software on the TV (the non-smart part of it presumably) downloaded and applied a firmware update verifying that the TV was correctly connected to the Internet.So if you buy this television planning on using Smart Hub to watch Netflix, Amazon Video, Hulu or another streaming video service, you're setting yourself up disappointment. Get another brand with "Smart" features or buy a Roku or Google TV box to get the "smart" stuff.I hope this was helpful.

Reviews.Title: Problems after 4 months !!
Reviews.Author: Winston E. Evelyn
Reviews.Content: Bought this TV in Dec 2012 and 4 months later the SmartHub connects when it feels like and the TV turns off and on after 5 mins repeatedly. Updated the firmware, it worked for a day and it did the same thing all over again. Every 5 mins off and on . . . off and on . . . . off and on. Buyers beware of "Smart TVs" I would give this technology a couple more years. I own 3 other Samsung TVs with no issues.

Reviews.Title: Good TV, but Netflix app issue fix had to be found
Reviews.Author: Andrea Polk
Reviews.Content: // To view this video download Flash Player (version 9.0.115 or higher)'); } } catch(err) { fp_resizePlayerSpace('cv_moH2KZ0Q8PRWRB', 0, 0); } return false; } function _cv_moH2KZ0Q8PRWRBloadSwf(movieID, playerVersion) { var swfLocation = "http://g-ecx.images-amazon.com/images/G/01/am3/20120510035744301/AMPlayer._V148501545_.swf"; logTag.type = "text/javascript"; logTag.src = "/gp/customer-media/du/log.html?ie=UTF8&p=CustomerImage&s=CustomerVideoPlay"; head[0].appendChild(logTag); } if (cv_moH2KZ0Q8PRWRBcurrentClick) { return cv_moH2KZ0Q8PRWRBcurrentClick(); } } } Length:: 3:26 MinsRecently my step-father started asking me to look into finding a budget priced TV so that he could cut the cord with cable TV. (I recently published: Simple Guide to Over-the-Air Free TV and had been encouraging him to do so for over a year.) Knowing that his 4 cable box habit couldn't be kicked with over-the-air TV alone, I suggested a smart TV from a favorite brand (Samsung) which has apps for Netflix (he is already a subscriber), Amazon (he just got Prime), Hulu Plus (suggested he give it a try to see if he likes it) and Vudu (for those seasons that he just can't do without). This smart TV at the 46" size seemed like a stellar buy at fifty less than Black Friday prices, so they bought it and today I set it up for them (after a stop at the cable company to drop cable TV...) and showed them the ropes.After putting on the base (very easy to do, but the directions are poor) , connecting the power cable, a sound bar via optical audio cable, attaching a Mohu Leaf 50 Indoor HDTV Antenna for over-the-air network TV, and connecting a DVD player via HDMI, we fired it up. The start setup screen appeared immediately and was easy to follow. I chose 'automatic' for the time and progressed through to autoscan in the menu to capture over air channels (19 in HD for free...), and then to the Smart Hub.In the Smart Hub Netflix and a couple others appeared. The TV went through multiple updates after WiFi info for their home network was set and eventually it seemed the updates were done, and we were good to go to the Samsung Channel store (in the Smart Hub to the left) to add Hulu Plus and a few others. Each time an app was added, I could see how much internal memory was left to be used for app data, which was nice.I signed in and activated Amazon Instant Video without an issue. My parents were thrilled to be watching The HBO Collection immediately! I then attempted to sign them into Netflix and all I got was a black screen with 'connecting' and a wheel in the upper right hand portion of the screen. From experience I knew this was a software issue, but I really didn't want to reset the system to see if that fixed it so I went to the internet and did a search for 'Samsung Smart TV Netflix app issue'. After about 15 minutes I had several possible fixes, but I went with the easiest one first - and it worked!FIX: IF you cannot open the Netflix App on your Samsung Smart TV - reset the TV's time clock to 'manual' from automatic. It's in settings and easy to do, and once you do this, restart the TV and try the Netflix app again. It should work. Apparently Netflix's app has an issue with the automatic time clock but if you manually input it, all's well.Once that was fixed, there were no other issues. The picture is very good for a 60Hz LED, and uncompressed 1080i over air TV looks great! Colors would need adjusting out of the box for some, but for those who like vibrant reds and deep colors, the factory settings may be ideal. You can adjust so much in the Menu on this TV, you could take hours getting things 'just right'. I found small increments worked best for refinement.I also found a bunch of helpful videos on YouTube related to the Samsung smart TVs, which I directed my folks to check out at their leisure. The Samsung site has a downloadable PDF e-manual that is also found in Support in the TV's Menu. (I encouraged them to check that out as well.) The PDF is easier to read and can be printed out if need be, which I like.I really like the apps that are available on this TV, and using a wireless connection at 60Mbps allows for no buffering using Wifi. There's a port for a wired connection, which undoubtedly would be that much more stable. The internet browser is a nice feature, but tough to navigate with the remote, so I bought a Logitech K400 that works well with the system.HD content looks great, color adjustments are easy, and the refresh rate of 60Hz is very good for movies and every day network programming. Looking at the set straight on gives the best viewing experience, but it was very good at up to a 45 degree viewing angle at about 10'-12' away. Opening apps can be somewhat sluggish, but the apps seem to work as they are supposed to if they open initially.My parents (who are in their 70's) are very happy with the picture on this TV, but the sound was initially a bit disappointing. They did appreciate the addition of a sound bar, which when combined with Sound settings for Movie - were great for most of their viewing. They also appreciated the apps for Netflix, Amazon and Hulu Plus all being on the TV, as well as the access to the web browser and Android apps available for their Samsung Galaxy S4's.Overall, this was a solid purchase due to the screen size, purchase price and the smart TV features. It was frustrating to not have Netflix work out of the box though, and as I'm sure not everyone jumps into troubleshooting tech issues as I do, this may leave some people very frustrated with this TV and lead them to have to contact Samsung support.Ease of use is a big issue, and the lack of quick launch buttons for apps on the remote, app software issues that need addressing, and the so-so sound, some novice users may be happier with a 'dumb' budget TV like the RCA LED46C45RQ 46-Inch LED-Lit 1080p 60Hz TV (Black) and a Roku HD Streaming Player - Manufacturer Refurbished for the same price.FYI... No YouTube app, but you can use the web browser to play YouTube videos.NOTE: I could not get the Logitech Wireless Touch Keyboard K400 with Built-In Multi-Touch Touchpad to work with this this TV. I will be trying others and will update this review if I find one that works for me.

Reviews.Title: Calibration is key
Reviews.Author: Mbot
Reviews.Content: After much research, settled on this as an additional tv for our bedroom. Love it.I was not happy with the picture out of the box, nor with the settings listed on one of the reviews her, then found another suggested calibration that makes a truly beautiful picture (watched Game of Thrones on the app HBOGO last night, streamed, fantastic).Sound is definitely not great. I will try and tweak some more and then likely get some additional speakers.Mounted it easily to the walk with Cheetah Mounts arm - purchased at the same time from Amazon.Here are the settings I am using - with a Joey box HDMI connection through Dish.Pictures Settings - standardBacklight: 20Contrast: 93Brightness: 45 on StandardSharpness: 5Color: 37Tint: 50/50Advanced Settings:Dynamic Contrast: OffColor Space: AutoGamma: 0Black Tone: OffFlesh Tone: 0Motion Lighting: OffWhite Balance: R-offset: 24, G-offset: 25, B-offset: 23, R-Gain: 6, G-Gain: 31, B-Gain:41Picture Options:Color Tone: Warm 2Size: Screen FitFilm mode: offDigital Noise Filter: OffLED Motion Plus: Off

Reviews.Title: Beware..You tube doesn't work in this model now
Reviews.Author: subramaniam
Reviews.Content: Got this TV today.. Got really frustrated as i understood after powering on that You tube support for this TV is removed. For me a smart TV without you tube is a total waste.

Reviews.Title: What has happened to SAMSUNG?
Reviews.Author: Dr. B
Reviews.Content: We have owned SAMSUNG TVs in the past, but this latest LED HDTV has been rife with problems, from basic power and control features, to lack of functioning with applications like Netflix and constant Smart Hub updates. After spending hours with their customer service, following their instructions for trouble shooting and letting them attempt to repair issues remotely, I am regretting this purchase. Samsung's problem with Netflix alone ("incompatible software upgrades") is enough to send us to another brand. It's been two weeks that Samsung has said they were addressing the Netflix issue, and it's still not working. In the past, we would recommend SAMSUNG; now, probably not.

Reviews.Title: Great TV, Lousy software
Reviews.Author: david stanislowski
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV at Costco a while ago. Picture and everything is great. I use it exclusively for Netflix and other services through the network and my review is entirely in regards to the SmartHub software.Unfortunately, SmartHub is terribly designed. Any app you run has to work through Samsung servers. These servers often go down for maintenance or some kinds of problems. When they do, you are unable to run any apps. But to add insult to injury, instead of clearly stating the problem in the app with a simple error message, all you get is a very generic error, "ERROR_MODEL_BIND". Not until you call into tech support will you hear the actual issue.This is really pathetic of Samsung. They should know better. Backup servers, or at least ones capable of notifying TVs that they are undergoing maintenance, seems obvious.

Reviews.Title: Best TV I have ever owned
Reviews.Author: Donna Davidson "bargain shopper"
Reviews.Content: My TV arrived yesterday--super easy to set up I was watching TV 20 minutes after I opened the box.  Software updates went smoothly and quickly. As others have said it took a little tweaking to get the picture right but it is an awesome picture.  Easily connected to my Direct TV remote and am up and running.  I haven't tried all of the Smart Hub features but the ones I did play with worked fine.  The price was attractive and delivery perfect and as promised.  This is the first Samsung product I have owned and I understand why it is ranked so high!!  Definitely would recommend it.Just wanted to add this for those that might not be home when the TV is delivered.  The set comes in the display box so it is clear with all the pictures on the box  exactly what is in the box--might be very tempting for someone driving by and seeing it sitting there, fortunately I was home when the delivery came but thought it was worth mentioning so you could schedule your delivery when someone could receive it.

Reviews.Title: Great TV, would recommend to others
Reviews.Author: B. Caldwell
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV with a little skepticism because I realize that it is in the budget arena as far as Smart TVs go, but here are my thoughts. In short, I am extremely pleased. I am writing based on the 46", which is the model that I purchased.Form: TV is 9" deep with the stand, without the stand, probably less than 3. I was surprised how slim this TV was for being a back-lit LED. Bezel around the edges is as pictured, very slim.Function: TV boots to cable/coaxial input, which I am not using because we only use streaming services at this time. The smart tv interface is pretty intuitive and easy to use. It is not quick when performing certain functions, but if you can live with that, everything works very well. Keep in mind what you paid for it. The remote is basic and quite frankly typing in your account information for Netflix or searching for a show is painful when using the arrows and selecting each letter. They should really have a qwerty remote for Samsung like some other brands have, especially for a smart TV. Wireless keyboard and mouse support is available through the usb ports, but my keyboard does not work in the netflix app, just FYI. I have not tried a mouse.Features: I am not using the HDMI at the moment, but I am sure they are fine. I found that one of the USB ports did not recognize my keyboard, though the other one did. I am not sure if this is intentional or not.Picture: Here is where the TV shines. The picture is magnificent. I have not compared it to a 3k dollar OLED or anything, but I bought this TV with the intention of having a nice, properly sized TV in our living room so we could actually watch our shows together in the living room instead of separately on our computers.Side note: Clearmotion 120 that Samsung advertises is just marketing bs, this TV is a 60hz refresh rate and that is what I wanted. Neither of us can stand the soap opera effect of 120hz and above, so I bought a 60hz intentionally and I have no complaints. Everything looks the way it "should", and not overly smooth like you will get with a higher refresh rate.Final thoughts: I am very happy with this purchase. It was in my price range, has a lot of features to get you started, and the picture is wonderful. I will probably buy a roku 3 to replace the built in Smart TV functions since the built in system is very budget oriented and can be slow at times, but it does work and is fulfilling my needs at this time.Thanks for reading.

Reviews.Title: Good Picture with Tweaking, Great Value
Reviews.Author: CFH Review
Reviews.Content: Our 32and 26 Samsung LCD's had the capacitor failure Samsung is paying to fix. The 26 was fine but the 32 main board had a blown resistor as well. Samsung will only fix the capacitors and not anything that may happen to the LCD due to cascade failure! Anyhow the price to fix the 32 was close to $300! So for a bit more we bought the 40 with Smart TV.We had tried the better Samsung 40 LED with 3D and faster processor in the past but found the picture with the faster processing to be fake looking and would turn that feature off. The 3D worked but we felt it would be best for a larger TV and will consider it when we replace our Pioneer Elite 60 Plasma. Hopefully not for a long time Just Love that TV and wish Pioneer had stayed in the game.As many reviewers have stated; and it is the case with most slim LEC/LED's with the speakers in the back; the sound can be low at times. We have adjusted the settings for clear voice. It seems that conversation is the first to be effected and the sound can be too low to hear. We always have the remote in the ready to turn the volume up and rewind to hear what we missed. Sure you could turn the volume up; and we have; but it becomes too loud.It took a bit but I finally got the screen / color settings to our liking. Our set had a push to the red side and flesh tone was off most of the time. Even now it will shift from time to time. One second the flesh tone will seem fine and the next it looks like everyone has a tan or slight sun burn. Not sure if this is due to the background colors present. Another item is the off screen angle doesn't seem to be as good as the higher level sets. Colors and settings are a personal choice and some might light the all the settings on and the picture really bright. I prefer the subtle approach and will turn most settings down. If you turn on the Black enhancement features to full you will crush you your shadows and details. I found there to be enough settings to make the adjustments that were needed. Also this is a 60Hz set with 1080p. Don't let the 60Hz scare you or be fooled into needed the 240Hz. The picture is great and as stated before we found the higher speed sets to look fake. Almost like watching a live play.The Smart TV works great for us. We have it connected via a hard connection and are not using the wireless. Having the wireless is a Great feature but a hard connection is always best if you can. The update has added Amazon Prime to the menu which is something we were looking for. We were using our PS3 to connect to Amazon Prime and now only use the Samsung to do so. Amazon Prime has quit a bit of children programing and my son loves Thomas the Train.The remote has all the functions you will need and lights up! It also controls our PS3 if we watch a Blu Ray!The downside. This TV doesn't have a swivel stand! Out 32 Samsung did and we need this feature so everyone can see the set. Also with the weaker off angle on this set it is needed to direct to the screen to the viewing area. This is mainly need for us because we have the TV in the corner. If you had the set straight it would be fine. We bought this TV Swivel at Amazon that works great - B009UDTUNGA minor but weak area is the cable retainer. It does not stick to the stand! The stand has a small area that is not flat to attach the retainer to but the double sided tape to hold the cable retainer to the set keeps falling off. The cable retainer held firmly on one older 26 and 32 Samsungs.For the price it is the perfect set for our living room. We use the Pioneer for our home theater setup. I would recommend this set.

Reviews.Title: WE LOVE THIS 'S M A R T HDTV'
Reviews.Author: Mart Hyatt "AMAZON BUYER"
Reviews.Content: I purchased it from DELL but Amazon has a better price. It is a replacement for my teenage daughter's 32", no name brand HDTV. She wanted a Smart TV and I kept coming back to ""40" Class (40.0" Diag.) LED 5300 Series Smart TV.""It is a good replacement for anyone that wants or has a 32" HDTV. The 40" seems much larger, but not at all too large for any room size.She loves it and uses it for viewing cable channels as well as using the Smart TV apps like Netflix, HULU, You Tube, Amazon Prime streaming, etc. Samsung already has these apps and others installed but using the Samsung apps selection app she can choose from several free apps. It wirelessly steams movies as if you're watching cable. The only problem I've noticed is occasionally YouTube will freeze. I blame my wireless service for this. There is a 'Contact Samsung' app on the settings screen but we haven't bother calling yet. It does have remote assistance that is covered under the manufactures warranty for a year. At less than $500, I wouldn't bother with the extended warranty, but this is a personal choice.The settings menu is like our main TV, which is a 60" Samsung. It is very user friendly and the only adjustments I made were to change the screen mode to 'Dynamic' and to go through the set up screens to personalize my preferences. This includes wifi connections. Set up is a breeze. I prefer to connect from my cable box HD DVR via a good HDMI cable.I promised to keep this review short, so I will not go into the product details except for explaining how well my daughter loves the set and what a bargain it is. $475 will buy one of the best brands on the market-Samsung, but there's more. You get a full 1080p Backlit LED, 40" HDTV, built in wireless or wired Internet connection, a very user friendly but well functional remote control.... By the way, the remote is lighted as well. Samsung and Amazon will deliver all this with no tax and free shipping, plus one one the best no hassle return policies if you get a bad apple. FYI - this is not a 3D set, but it is well worth the money for one of the best Smart or Internet HDTV.

Reviews.Title: Birthday present
Reviews.Author: B. Wagner
Reviews.Content: I purchased this as a birthday present for my wife.  It replaced an older flat screen that quit working.  It was easy to set up out of the box, only a phillips head screwdriver needed.  The set up program runs automatically when you first start it, the procedure was easy.  I had it connected to my satellite and wi-fi with no problems.  I then connected to netflix to test wi-fi connection and it worked first time.  It has several programs and features that make this set fun to use.  True to Samsung's reputation the picture was sharp, clear and terrific.  Whatever signal you are using whether antenna, satellite, or cable you might need to make some minor color adjustments to fine tune picture quality.  You can navigate the menus with ease.  I referred to the owner's manual only a couple of times and the instructions were easy to follow.  I am extremely happy with the performance of the television and its' features.

Reviews.Title: Great smartTV, but know what you're buying.
Reviews.Author: Jason Fowler
Reviews.Content: I have owned this T.V. for 24 hours now and I absolutely love it. However, I have one issue that I think EVERYONE needs to be aware of before buying this product:On the box and all over the marketing for this product it says "120 Clear Motion Rate". I assumed that this meant the television was 120Hz. It is not. The refresh rate of this product is 60Hz. Samsung's stance is that there are three factors that go into the ability of a TV to display fast motion:1. the image processor2. the panel refresh rate (In Hz)3. The back-light technologySamsung factors all three of these together and brands this T.V. as 120 Clear Motion Rate. But again, this T.V. is 60Hz. I know it says in the amazon description that the T.V. is 120Hz, and I'm absolutely sure I'm reviewing the correct product. You will not get that ultra liquid smooth picture that you get from a true 120Hz T.V.However, I forgive Samsung for that bit of shady marketing because for a 60Hz T.V. this product is AMAZING. The picture is brilliant, colorful, sharp and on full brightness setting, I actually have to squint when staring straight at it. The smart TV apps work flawlessly and make this product function like a second computer.Also: There are 2 USB ports on the side. You can plug in a mouse and keyboard and they work instantly. With a mouse and keyboard this T.V.'s web browser makes a very capable computer substitute. I have not tried a wireless keyboard and mouse, but I suspect they would work just fine.The only criticism I have (besides the fact that I thought I was buying a 120Hz TV) is that the apps load a little slower that I'd like. It takes perhaps 10-15 seconds to load Netflix or Hulu. It sounds short, but that's a long time to stare at the screen watching the progress bar.The sound is adequate. It definitely fills the room, and the 3D-SRS sound does work well. But if you want theater quality sound with bass you can feel, you'll need a separate sound system.All in all, this product has exceeded my expectations in most ways and I would absolutely buy it again.

Reviews.Title: Black Dot
Reviews.Author: D. Reder
Reviews.Content: I bought this 32" TV in May and was generally happy with the picture and features.  Now there is a 1/4 diameter black circle on the bottom edge of the screen.  I called Samsung support and was informed that I need to drive 30 minutes away to bring my TV in for repair.  Samsung at home service is only valid for TVs above 32 inches.  I haven't even owned the TV for 6 months.  Not good...

Reviews.Title: A TV for people without enough problems in their lives
Reviews.Author: B. Cecil
Reviews.Content: I expected this to be a turnkey device -- turn it on, and it works.  It is an appliance, after all.  And so it was for the first 4 months.  However, it now has turned out to be another Big Deal in my life, something I neither expected nor needed.  Its operational problems pale in comparison with the systematic problems of the Samsung "Support" system.  They should rename it the "Want More Misery?" system, in the interest of honesty.Operationally, two months ago the set began on its own to power off and on, five minutes after the initial start-up.  Then five minutes after its restart, it displayed a message "Smart Hub has successfully updated."  This process would sometimes repeat for two or three cycles.Actually, Smart Hub had ceased operation, despite the bogus "successfully updated" messages.  It wouldn't begin loading.  This meant I had no internet.  Not what I bought a "smart" television for.The TV required up to three attempts to turn it off.  It would restart itself two minutes after an attempt to turn it off.  This happened using a number of remote control devices, as well as using the manual button at the set's bottom rim.Using the at-home methods shown in the written manual, the e-manual, and the Samsung website to remedy these problems was not successful.I contacted Samsung "Support" via email, and was instructed to download the latest firmware version.  Should it fail to remedy the problems, I was informed I would get a technician to come to work on the set.  The latest firmware installation failed to remedy the problems. So I set about contacting Samsung in order to get a technician to come to my home and fix my television.I spent three hours yesterday doing the following: 1) I tried to contact Samsung "Support" again via e-mail using the code number assigned to my first contact with them, so as not to have to repeat the series of problems again.  This failed.  2) I tried to submit a request for service via the Samsung website.  After spending twenty minutes filling the form out, it failed to submit.  3) I registered the product with Samsung, expecting to be able to request service.  This failed after a successful registration.  4) I tried again to request service.  After filling the form out again, upon hitting "Submit" I was taken to another page for me to click on the problem areas to attempt a home remedy again (I think Samsung is using the "Submit" button on their website in place of a more accurate label, which would be "Surrender").  5) I clicked "Chat" and spent more than an hour "Chatting" with something which may well have been an artificial intelligence program meant to placate the complaints of human customers.  I ended up getting a repair order number, which entitles me to de-install and ship my television out of my home, to a distant repair facility, at my own expense.  Then, following an unknown amount of time, my TV will be sent via return shipping, possibly again at my own expense, to my home, there to be re-installed again.  And then, perhaps to repeat again the three failure modes current afflicting the television, or perhaps more, and then to begin again the process of getting Samsung to deal with the problems I had to pay them to provide for me in the form of this television.This isn't what I signed up for.  On paper, this is the best TV available.  In practice, it is best ordered by people who enjoy wasting their money and who are happy wasting their time and being treated badly.

Reviews.Title: Great TV Experience
Reviews.Author: JSK
Reviews.Content: This is a great TV. The sound and picture are great. It has a small profile and is very thin and light weight. The best thing about the TV is the built in wifi. The internet connection is superb. No noticeable blur and the black is very good. Lots of menu options for the picture or you can leave all of the options on auto.

Reviews.Title: Don't buy!!!
Reviews.Author: Born2Shop
Reviews.Content: At first I LOVED this t.v. and I only wished the remote had a slide out QWERTY pad to type on while browsing internet. My love only lasted about 2 weeks! On day I turned on my t.v. and it just kept switching between a black screen, the samsung logo, and screen showing HDMI was connected and it would not respond to remote. Samsung customer service wasn't able to help so they said they would have a rep from their local servicing center come out and someone would contact me within 48 hours to schedule a time. Well 4 days later I called Samsung customer service and was informed 32 inch t.v.'s must be shipped to be serviced. I had been waiting 4 days for a call I was never going to receive. Anyway, I just got my packing label so I can ship t.v. to be repaired. Don't buy this t.v.!!! It's really not worth the hassle. I wish I would have listened to previous reviews, but I'm such a fan of Samsung I had to buy it anyway. Please don't make the same mistake.

Reviews.Title: Spyware and just BAD software
Reviews.Author: James Tucker
Reviews.Content: The TV by it self would get 5 stars. Excellent picture quality. Sound is amazing, the 3D effect is really nice and I found myself looking around as the surround parts happened as the sounds seemed to be really coming from the sides. Now for the software. It is HORRIBLE. The clunky interface forced paid apps onto the front screen with no way to remove them. This forces you to constantly scroll to get to Amazon and Netflix apps. I noticed a lot of new traffic on my network after I connected this TV. I checked the traffic and found that the TV was calling home several times a day and was passing information about what apps I was using and when. I then tried to remove it from my wireless network, but the interface doesn't let you forget a network. Go figure. I ended up blocking this TV's MAC address so it is not able to call home. If you don't mind this company mining your viewing habits, then go ahead. It is really a shame that such a good TV is crippled with BAD software.

Reviews.Title: Bargain Samsung HDTV not such a great buy
Reviews.Author: Dreamcaster70
Reviews.Content: This Tv worked for 3 weeks without issue then had a major malfunction with picture. Ghosting and double images with crackling sound were the problems. Samsung technical support was excellent however they were unable to fix problem remotely. I Opted  to return the TV for a full refund instead of messing around with further troubleshooting after I read this was a common problem with this model TV.

Reviews.Title: TV is fine, but delivery was sketchy
Reviews.Author: Carol S
Reviews.Content: This television is everything we wanted.A word of warning on delivery, though:  Because of a glitch, our television was delivered to the wrong address (still ours, but all the way across the US from where we needed the television).  When FedEx delivered, they just left the box on the front porch.  Under ordinary circumstances, that might be just fine. But BE WARNED:  it is delivered in a "store" box, which has pictures of the television and all the things you can do  with it--in living color, no less--on the OUTSIDE of the box.  Prime theft material.  I was disappointed that the driver did not deliver them to another door (as has been done in the past).  So, be sure you are home or give specific instructions for delivery.

Reviews.Title: Smart TV isn't so smart anymore
Reviews.Author: drumbum
Reviews.Content: I purchased the Samsung not only because of the picture quality but the good reputation in the name.  The main reason for buying this model was because the price and size was right for me and it was a "Smart" TV.  Well I got the thing streaming Netflix like it's suppose to and after about 2 or 3 weeks it took a dump and won't stream anymore.  I've tried everything from resetting to factory settings to logging in numerous times only to be disappointed that it will not stream Netflix.  Now i'm looking at purchasing another ROKU so I can enjoy streaming again.  I've read blogs on this problem and it only appears to be with Samsung and they say they are working on correcting the problem with Netflix but it doesn't look like they are jumping through any hoops to make the customers happy.  Needless to say I will never purchase a Samsung item again.  From what I see they are the only brand having this problem.  If I knew what I know now when I was looking for a Smart TV I would of purchased an LG, JVC, Sony or something that would work.  Beware of all the Samsung Smart TV's.  From what I see the problem is not with only this particular model.  Very Very disappointed and annoyed.

Reviews.Title: Great TV at a Great Price
Reviews.Author: K. Young "Rabid Shark"
Reviews.Content: It is my first personally owned Hi-Def TV and I enjoy it so much.  The picture quality is awesome and I love the internet capability.  The Smart Hub by Samsung is also an awesome feature, being able to watch Amazon, Vudu and the ability to watch your twitter feed on the tv as your watching a show.  I'm looking for a second Hi-Def TV for another room and it's definitely going to be another Samsung.I was leary about ordering a TV through online to be delivered because of the way some packages are handled, but as everything else i've ever ordered from Amazon the packaging was not damaged in any way and no damage to the product inside.I'd have no problem recommending this TV to anyone.

Reviews.Title: Streaming video issues
Reviews.Author: bill
Reviews.Content: For the most part I love this TV. However, While I am watching TV on-line, the TV will stop streaming the video and take me back to the page that I chose the show on. Many times I cannot even get through 15 minutes of the show before it "boots" me out and I have to start over. Since I wanted and paid more for TV with a web browser, this is a serious drawback to this TV. Unless I can figure out how to fix this, I would not spend the extra money on this TV if I could do it all over.

Reviews.Title: Great picture but some odd features are omitted
Reviews.Author: Samer S. Rayyan
Reviews.Content: The picture on this set is really good as long as you turn the sharpness setting to 0. I use this mostly for games and watching Netflix and for those purposes it is awesome and has a good response time. However, I was very surprised to learn that there is no YouTube app for this model and if you try to watch YouTube using the web browser it will run out of memory almost instantly. It also does not seem to support wireless screen mirroring if you have a Galaxy S4 or S5. Other than that I am very happy with this set but the lack of a YouTube app is such a glaring omission that I can't give it 5 stars.

Reviews.Title: nice picture and fast shipping
Reviews.Author: William Kline
Reviews.Content: Tv setup with no problems, watching netflix is real nice.  The only problem I have is this system was used, but sold as new.  When I clicked on the videos and folders in the Samsung link, I was shocked to see 23 porno movies not homemade movies but downloaded movies from the internet and family videos of children in school plays.  I'm thankful I scanned through the options before my grandkids used the TVWhy was this system sold as new  ??????

Reviews.Title: Great TV for a great price
Reviews.Author: Pat Carr
Reviews.Content: After 7 years with my 42 inch Panasonic Viera series plasma it died and I was a little skeptical about moving to an LED and losing that dark tone quality. I read many many reviews and followed "Gordons" settings for the UN32EH5000 as one suggested. Amazing picture, great tones! Here are the setting I suggest for the UN50EH5300:Mode: DynamicBacklight: 18Contrast: 85Brightness: 50Sharpness: 80Color: 70Tint: G/R 50/50I've toyed with Sharpness down to 75 and 70 but not a bad thing to leave it at 80. Now I will say setup with all the apps and registering will take some time! The only problem I found was hooking up my Sony BluRay player to the HDMI input. Once I selected the input it did an "auto recognize" thing and would not allow it to properly startup. After unplugging the HDMI from behind the player and disconnecting the ethernet from it, it worked fine. The Netflix and VOD play on this set is great! So far I have nothing to complain about but I'll update it if something shows up. Price paid on 3/2014 $699 with free shipping, how can you go wrong?

Reviews.Title: im very pissed off with this buy
Reviews.Author: bbigb
Reviews.Content: ok let me say this came in fast and also was packaged great. i got it set up and then started watching tv, then i started to notice something the sound comes and goes. now im stuck with a tv that half the time i cant even hear anything.

Reviews.Title: Buy a dumb TV and a roku, you will be happier!
Reviews.Author: William Goldberg
Reviews.Content: I have this TV and DO NOT LIKE IT!  It seems smart, but in reality, it is quirky and finicky.  It has its good and bad days.Pros:* good picture quality* I love being able to plug an external hard drive or thumb drive in and play a movie.* I like having youtube built-in.Cons: pretty much everything else.[b]Buy a non-smart TV and a Roku:[/b]Roku allows you to go to netflix, amazon, hulu, etc directly. The Samsung Smart TV uses apps for those services and you go through samsung servers to get to netflix, amazon, hulu, etc.  This creates a lag time and if samsung servers are having problems, it doesn't work. At least once a week, I have problems getting to netflix or hulu (odd "server errors"). I usually have to do a factory reset or at least unplug the TV and replug it in.[b]Web browser shabby and need universal remote with keyboard and mouse[/b]We thought it would be great to get to the internet directly through the TV, but it's not! You cannot do anything with videos through, not enough memory. Also, if you have ever tried using the arrow buttons on your remote as a mouse and then spelling everything one letter at a time . . . it is not fun![b]Sound unpredictable levels and awful in a cabinet[/b]We bought the 32" because it fit almost perfectly in our cabinet.  However, the speakers are on the back and are muffled by the cabinet meaning that for some shows, we have the volume a 100.  Then you change the channel and get blasted by really loud sound. Granted, I could get a sound bar, but shouldn't have to.[b]non universal remote [/b]Whose idea was it to include a complicated remote but not give it features for cable or a DVD player?  I am now back to three remotes and not happy.[b]Samsung support support is LOUSY [/b]Every time I report the problems related to netflix and hulu, all they do is ask for the model number and the version of firmware . . . and then they never get back with a solution.Buy a dumb TV, a roku, and a universal roemote!

Reviews.Title: I want to love this TV, but can't
Reviews.Author: Natalie Mortensen
Reviews.Content: This TV does a lot of things, WHEN IT WORKS. Netflix fails more often than not. It is frustrating. Amazon Prime Video fails. Software/firmware updates are constantly being applied and often cause issues. The "Smart" part of this TV is severely underpowered.I do love how I can make my phone's screen show up on this TV, but it is not a stable Smart TV. Don't pay for the "Smart" feature. Get a small Linux box and put XBMC on it instead. You'll be much happier.The wireless USB keyboard I use ONLY WORKS FOR THE WEB SEARCH APP, and NOTHING ELSE!!!! Imagine how frustrating it is to type in a long email and password for the Netflix app again and again (because of constant Samsung/Netflix updates conflicting with each other and making it forget my authentication) while my 2 year old howls for his favorite show, only to have it not work because of other issues. I hate this TV. If it just worked, I would love it. Hopefully someday soon they will settle their firmware/software issues and make it function as advertised.

Reviews.Title: Smart Hub erratic
Reviews.Author: Larry H.
Reviews.Content: The TV is fine - good picture, etc.  It is the 'smart hub' internet connectivity that has issues.  Sometime it connects just fine, sometimes it will not connect at all,  and then sometimes it connects with no sound!  I use it for Netflix mostly - have checked to be sure I have the latest software and I do so I am not sure what exactly causes the issues.  It is NOT my wireless router since all other devices in my home connect just fine (and the Smart Hub on the TV says it is connected - but will not open any apps).  So, if you use  Netflix or other streaming services - keep your Roku handy -- it works when the smart hub will not.

Reviews.Title: The Smart part of the TV is STUPID
Reviews.Author: Shenbagaraman
Reviews.Content: The TV is fine, but the smart part of it is pain. The TV would be better off without it.The Smart Hub is dead slow in performance. half the time Netflix wont play, skype wont work.You have to do a reset and then it updates everything and then it will work for 10 days.Then same cycle - again, reset, reinstall , use 10 days, on and on. SAMSUNG is known for poor quality software.They dont care if it works well or not - they just would like to get it to market.I would be happier if they would sell a regular 40 inch without smart stuff - which I can buy from someone who knows their stuff like Tivo or Roku.Waste of money. I should have returned it , but  couldnt do so inside the return window period - now live with the pain, till I sell it to someone sooner

Reviews.Title: Plays video from an external harddrive.
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Purchased this TV a few days ago.  This is my first "smart tv".  I purchased it so it could access television from the internet, like Amazon prime without using a separate computer.  It works great for this.  Samsung offers a multitude of apps for this tv.  So far I have just used the Youtube and Amazon prime apps.You can also connect an external harddrive to the usb port and play video files.  It works with a variety of formats including .vob files ripped from DVD's.This tv has a LAN port and wireless built in.  It includes 3 HDMI ports. 1 HDMI port also has an audio port for using with a computer with DVI to HDMI adapter.  It has 1 set of inputs component/composite video and L/R audio.  1 audio output jack and 1 optical audio output.  It includes 2 usb ports, 1 is 0.5 amp and 1 is 1.0 amp for external drives.

Reviews.Title: Such a breeze!
Reviews.Author: Matthew Landman
Reviews.Content: Set up out of the box is superb!  Turned it on, connected WiFi, it ran its updates and I logged into Netflix and Amazon Prime immediately.  Was watching movies inside of 30 minutes!  Good picture and sound.  A good size and quality tv for not alot of $$.  Will use the e-manual to learn more over the next few days, but I am satisfied thus far.  Very user friendly remote and screens.

Reviews.Title: Great Small Room TV
Reviews.Author: Eville Pete
Reviews.Content: Nice set for a small room. Easy set up. another reviewer mentioned an occasional jumpy picture. Mine does that at times. 99.9% of the time it doesn't. For the money, it is a good value

Reviews.Title: Good so far (revised)
Reviews.Author: North Texas Girl
Reviews.Content: Updated April 23, 2014The TV itself is not the problem, it can work well under certain conditions. The problem is with the SmartHub.Works great with ROKU. The sound is better, the picture is better, the internet connection has NO problems. If you buy this TV you will find the Samsung SmartHub is poorly designed, clumsy to operate, very slow, loses the internet connection for no reason, and updates without warning you. You can turn on your TV expecting to watch a show you just purchased on Amazon (or other app like Netflix) and wait for 30 minutes while Samsung hijacks your TV to update the SmartHub.Original Review:I've had my new TV an hour and managed to setup the two things I wanted 1) Amazon Instant Video 2) Pandora with very little difficulty. My latest episode of Bones played fine : ) A keyboard would be nice, but not required.I'll revise things if I have problems, but right now I'm quite happy.Revised 12/31/2013 - downgraded from 5 stars to 3.Cons:1. Slow response.  Turning the TV on and getting to the SmartTV Hub takes forever - regardless of internet speed.2. Since I don't have cable I have constant snow in the upper left hand corner and there is no way to turn that window off.3. Samsung determines what apps you are FORCED to have installed. You are not allowed to re-arrange or uninstall certain apps like Netflix (I'll never use).  They moved it to the front of the line and put my Amazon app in another place.Newsflash Samsung: I paid for this TV with my money. I own it yet Samsung believes they have the right to tell me what will be on my "desktop." I don't like having Netflix as the first thing in my line of FORCED apps.For my next TV I will shop carefully to find one that allows me to have what I want in the way of apps instead of what I consider BLOATWARE. I don't like being told what I must see on something I own. I doubt I will consider another Samsung unless they upgrade their firmware and allow me to remove the bloatware apps from my TV.01/21/2014This TV just keeps getting worse. Now it won't stay connected to the internet - just all of a sudden.  It's useless at this point since I only watch TV from Amazon.This purchase has gone from 5 stars to 1 star in 2 months.01/24/2014Tonight the thing just started updating without any prompting.  So much for me and my friends wanting to watch a movie. The screen is locked up in update mode.DO NOT buy a Samsung TV with Smart Hub.  It's wholly unreliable.

Reviews.Title: This is a 120 Hz TV not a 60 Hz as advertised (that's great)
Reviews.Author: B. Smith
Reviews.Content: This is advertised as a 60 Hz TV but showed up as a 120 Hz TV, that made me very happy. This was bought for my children so they'd leave my 46 LED Samsung alone and due to the size/smart tv/DLNA/built in wireless/price this was the BEST TV and deal I could find. Sure there are a FEW TV's out there that could give you the same size with smart TV function but they would be 60 Hz, no DLNA and a bit cheaper. If you don't know what the DLNA is I have a networked NAS (Network Attached Storage) that has a ton of MKV/MP4 video's and this TV can browse and play any of them. Basically it allowed me to ditch my physical media for digital media, no more broken/scratched/lost/stolen DVD, Blu Ray's, etc. Also you can look at pictures  or listen to music you have on it.

Reviews.Title: Great TV, but watch the price and whom you buy from
Reviews.Author: The Count
Reviews.Content: If you never had a smart tv (like me), prepare to be impressed. In many ways you are not just getting a great full HD TV, but also a giant tablet computer. Many apps already installed (FB, Youtube) and many more that can be downloaded. To fully enjoy the smart tv/video on demand part you need a speedy internet connection. VUDU has 1080p previews of most of their movies on demand and they look awesome.Regarding the actual purchase. The prices for this (got the 40") TV swings more than the pendulum of my grandfather clock. Within 10 days I saw $450, $599 and even over $600. Generally when the seller is NOT Amazon the price is higher but no guarantee on that either. I seem to have been lucky getting it for $449 with free ship via Prime.

Reviews.Title: Terrible software. Do not buy if you wish to stream from your own network
Reviews.Author: Tom Deep "T Deep"
Reviews.Content: The only positive thing I have to say about this TV is that the picture quality is decent for the price. My 2 year old Panasonic plasma still blows this think out of the water though when it comes to picture quality.Onto the bad. Samsung link is a joke. It's crappy software that works 50% of the time. I waned to stream movies from my network storage and computer. IT HAS NEVER WORKED! I get it to stream via 5ghz wireless n but halfway through a movie (if I'm lucky, sometimes after a minute) it looses connection. I do not get this problem if i stream a movie from the web so I know it's not the wireless connection, it's Samsung's junk software!

Reviews.Title: Good for use with HD home Run box by Silicon Dust this is e series (2012 model)  UN46EH5300
Reviews.Author: Thomas P Whalen
Reviews.Content: I purchased this TV exclusively for the HD HomeRun App by Silicondust.  I have a HD Home Run Prime with the March 2013 firmware and am able to use this app. I am posting this as I did not see anyone else mention this app for this model UN46EH5300 and I wanted to confirm for anyone searching that it is available.You will need to use a wired Ethernet connection for it to work.  Once in the app I am able to use the remote to change channels up and down and directly via the numberpad.  I read some other reviews on picture setup and followed their instructions  (below) and the picture is great!  This is a perfect TV for use with a HD Home Run!Mode: DynamicBacklight: 18Contrast: 85Brightness: 50Sharpness: 80Color: 70TInt: G/R 50/50Standard color tone with screen fit in the additional options, with HDMI black level set to low.

Reviews.Title: Great HD tv for dorms and bedroom
Reviews.Author: Erica Langford
Reviews.Content: I've had this tv for about a month now and it is fantastic. It's my first HD tv that I bought for myself so I am very satisfied. The picture is great, smart hub is a plus and the size is perfect a bedroom.The reason I gave the TV four stars and not five is because of the following.-the built in speakers aren't the best. I live in the city by a busy street and I find myself cranking the volume to hear movies.- no VGA input in back. That would be helpful for some devices that aren't brand new and come fully hdmi equipped.That's pretty much it. I would strongly recommend this tv to anyone who wants an HD tv that's not too big or too small and comes fully equipped with built in wifi and the samsung smart hub. The price is great for all of the features.Also don't be weary of the 60hz refresh rate. The tv is a larger size but not big enough for you to notice and lag at all.

Reviews.Title: The Samsung smart HDTV has a few bugs, but overall is pretty cool
Reviews.Author: Mark A. Chavez
Reviews.Content: Four major faults with this set which I'm returning 1) The "motion lighting" feature was totally faulty on the set I purchased.  I didn't even know my set had this feature (I rarely read through owners manuals - just "plug & play"). Was watching a DVD and the screen kept lightening and darkening within seconds over and over - this was at night with the room almost totally dark.  I turned off this feature.  2)  Streaming was frustrating until I increased my internet speed with our local provider. (I tried streaming Hulu and Amazon). 3) the Netflix app will not bring up your on-line queue and to go back, you have to exit the app (frustrating); 4) Even with a wired keyboard plugged in the USB, it is extremely frustrating to get the TV to "recognize" the keyboard. And the user manual is no use.Gave up on Hulu - it locks up within minutes - had to back out and restart only to have it lock up repeatedly.  Amazon Prime was better, but it still locks up after about 15-20 minutes.  You have to back out and re-start Amazon - a hassle, but it re-loads quickly.  Amazon also offers TV programs like Hulu, so it's a good trade-off. Surfing the web is pretty cool, but use a keyboard, ideally a wireless (there is a USB port).  Trying to use the remote to enter the router's PW was very frustrating.  Another reader suggested a Roku device but the reviews are dismal & Roku won't surf the web.  I checked other smart TVs and Samsung still comes out on top; but they have bugs to fix!

Reviews.Title: Awesome!!!
Reviews.Author: Eric B. Andersen "Quality Assurance Consumer"
Reviews.Content: I am 5-star happy with this purchase!  The only thing that was annoying was that it updates itself over the internet slowly and took some time for it to add in the icons for Hulu, Netflix, etc.  I wished there was a selection to do this, but it seems that it just does it automatically at some point during use or when I did something.  So, when you get this unit, be sure to use the system and wait for it to add in all the apps to access Netflix and Hulu and the like.Using the Browser on the TV to access the web is painfully slow!!!Connect your PC or Mac (I have successfully connect my Mac with the use of a "Premium Mini DisplayPort to HDMI Adapter Cable with Audio Support - APPLE, MacBook, MacBook Pro, MacBook Air, iMac, Mac mini, Mac Pro, and Xserve ---" and "BlueRigger HDMI Cable 50 feet - CL3 Rated for In-wall Installation") to do any web surfing.  Both products I got here at Amazon.  Read my review for the Mini DisplayPort to get instructions for hooking up and configuring the Mac to use on this TV.

Reviews.Title: Excellent TV only if you are lucky enough to have one without any issue
Reviews.Author: Shikha
Reviews.Content: This TV is really goo in terms of Picture Quality, clarity, contrast, colors etc. Don't have any complaints with this model. The problems i observed with this series of TV's are the same as experienced by other users and after few exchange of TV via samsung i observed that these issues are quality control related.....1. In first set i got dead pixels which were only visible from 6 to 10 inch of the screen, ofcourse no one watch from that closer but hey i paid for perfect condition brand new TV then why should i take one with defect. Best way to check dead pixel is to connect laptop, open browser in fullscreen by pressing F11 and then notice pixels closely throughout the screen by having background color as BLACK, WHITE, RED, BLUE and GREEN. reason of trying with all colors is sometimes these dead pixels only visible on specific color background2. After warrenty repair still dead pixels were there as instead of changing screen they replace the complete motherboard/circuit of the TV. No issues as i can again send it for repair under warranty :( and wait for 2 to 3 weeks to receive the repaired TV back with issue still exists. Don't lough its true'the repaired TV i got was now not having the dead pixel but one more defect.....Connect coaxial cable from your TV box to TV open any channel and go to the menu of TV under settings theres option called caption ON/OFF (Menu of the TV remote not the cable box) and then see the creen it will be filled with some special characters running on whole screen they looks like something which i can't even type but they are computer coding characters which won't allow you to have glimpse of picture you are intended to watch.one more defect :-( it was when you play Netflix it wont play any movie and keep displaying error message we are having trouble connecting please try again later untill you keep pressing OK button for at least 10 times.3. So here come's my replacement TV from Samsung with at least the dead pixel was not there as it was replacement not repair and also Netflix working fast (i compared using netflix on both TVs together in hand before returning older one) but still with Caption issue i told in step 2 above still existsAfter having so much trouble and wait time for TV and then headache to send TV by dropping to UPS as they don't do home repair for 32 inch TV, i decided to keep it with caption issue existing as it only happens while watching cable box and then too by using samsung TV's caption option. I can still use cable box caption option enable and watch everything perfectly.Overall this TV is best in its class in terms of features it provide, really cheap as compare to other brands,, Also Its the smart TV which support applications to watch VUDU or HULU or facebook etc. As i said in review heading TV is good if you are lucky enough to have one without these quality control related Samsung issues otherwise all the very best with Samsung warranty support.I went through this lengthy cycle/hassle as i just crossed the amazon return period before i discovered first issue in my TV and i ended up going through warranty.Samsung - If you are reading this, please improve your quality control methods before delivering the products to consumer. I know you are the largest LCD/LED panel manufacturer in the market and first in the market to introduce next generation panels for the TV. I also know dead pixels are common in TV's and most manufacturer even don't cover them under warranty until they are large enough in number to bother your watching experience. but I'll still suggest to have better customer feedback and quality product manufacturer brand in your bucket, you need to be little ahead in the mkt trends. why to deliver the panel to consumer if you know its faulty and just wait for the complain until customer discovers and if not then you saved small bucks as customer don't even know he has dead pixel.Buyers - Please check your screen Panel thoroughly within return period of Amazon to have screen without dead pixels. there are plenty of googled articles to explain how to check them easy enough.

Reviews.Title: Fast Shipping, Great Product!
Reviews.Author: Jason H. Lemkowitz "Jay Harlem"
Reviews.Content: It's a Samsung, it carries the quality and features that make it the best HD TV avalible. If your in the market for new TV this line won't let you down, it has the best contrasts and color depths I've seen to date.

Reviews.Title: Great Television; bad software
Reviews.Author: Steven Rinck
Reviews.Content: Purely as a television, this device is great.  Good Picture, Good Sound (as far as built-in speakers go).  Samsung is definitely in the top tier of display makers.  This replaced an older 32" Samsung I'd had since 2005 (which was still 100% functional, but I wanted something bigger)One of the bigger selling points though is the "Smart" aspect.  And here...it's bad.  The idea is great.  I'd love not needing an external device to connect to Netflix, etc.  However, in the 6+ months I've had it, I don't think it's ever gone more than 3 days without requiring a software update.  The software updates go like this:- Press "Smart Hub" button.  You expect to be taken to the smart hub, but instead nothing happens for 5+ minutes.  You have to take it on faith that you actually pressed the button, because pressing it multiple times will freeze your television (requiring you to actually press the button on the television to turn it off; it won't accept remote signals anymore).- Assuming you were confident and patient, it *might* tell you it was updating.  If not, it's best to leave the TV on for an hour or so and try again to avoid the freezing issue above.- You may or may not get a progress bar on the update.  Sometimes it will update without one.- Once you are notified of the update, it may anywhere from 5 minutes to 5 hours to perform the update.  My internet is fast enough to stream 1080p video and play an online videogame with <40 ping simultaneously; I assume the slowdown is on Samsung's end...which sort of makes sense if they need to update the TV's software every 72 hrs. (I also have the TV hardwired to my router; I'm not relying on wireless)- Once the update is done, you will sometimes (maybe once/month) find that some of your programs are missing and need to be re-downloaded.- Even if they are not missing, you will almost always have to re-log into them, or re-sync them with whatever account it is associated with.  The Amazon ones are the biggest offenders; I seriously have to re-sync them every 2-3 days if I want to use them.  This is not very convenient.Even when everything is updated, streaming on the TV will frequently skip...requiring 30-40 seconds of buffering to play 5 seconds of video, and then requriing another half-minute+ of buffering...again, and again, again... A quick flip over to streaming from the PS3 to the TV shows it's not the internet connection as it streams just fine from my PS3.Bottom line: This is a great television as long as you ignore the "smart" aspect of it.  Samsung makes gorgeous displays, but has no clue on how to make properly-functioning software.

Reviews.Title: Still Going Strong; Amazon Video on Demand Works
Reviews.Author: NyReckDiver
Reviews.Content: THIS IS A 2012 PRODUCTION MODELI purchased this television in September of 2012 and it is still going strong as the first day I intsalled it.  It is an extremely well priced tv in what I consider the mid-range. Amazon offers the absolute best-price on this tv compared to any local or online retailers.The television arrived packaged very well (a constant concern I have with these types of purchases).  removing the television from the box is straightforward.  There was absolutely no damage to the tv.  Instructions are straightforward as well.  Keep them, you will need to make adjustments as indicated below.  The design of the tv is typical of what you would expect from any similiar televsion with perhaps a notable exception of a joystick control located on the right side-underneath.  The build quality, despite the thinness and light weight, is very good. Unlike some tv's in this price range, the Samsung comes with 3 HDMI connections- not 2.  This could prove critical for some.  There are also 2 USB Ports (one powered), wi-fi, and mouse/keyboard support via USB.The display is great with rich and vibrant colors and deep blacks. The set operates at 60hz and is not an issue. Refresh was incredible with no artifacting, even after close to two years.  Out of th ebox, I use the settings recommended by "Gordons" review and produced an even better image.  They are:Mode: DynamicBacklight: 18Contrast: 85Brightness: 50Sharpness: 80Color: 70Tint: G/R 50/50I found these settings also minimized glare from windows due to the semi-gloss screen.Sound from this television leaves a lot to be desired as with any tv of this type. I was forced to get a Boston Acoustics soundbar to achieve my desired level and type of sound.  However, the television is located in a very large room with very high cathdral ceilings and a cat-walk that runs parallell.  Very demanding conditions.Connectivity with this televsion is great.  Amazon video on demand is flawless (there were a few TV software upgrades).  At one time, the software interface was clumsy.  That has changed. I also found a sufficient number of smart apps including Netflix and YouTube.Either way, after close to 2 years, this TV is going strong and has performed flawlessly.  Given the current (2014) pricing, the TV is a deal.

Reviews.Title: Doesn't work after 1 yr 3 mths
Reviews.Author: MariaO
Reviews.Content: This TV died after just 1 year and 3 months of use - mainly viewed on weekends only. Extremely disappointed, especially with Samsung for not standing behind their product. I am on my own to either pay for it to be fixed, or simply purchase a new TV.  I will go with the latter, and will never buy a Samsung product again. Coincidentally, it stopped working on the same weekend that there was an update. Samsung insists their update has nothing to do with why the TV is not functioning. They suggested that it might be the power supply, but I ask why? Why would a TV that was bought new, has only been used for just over a year, mainly on the weekends, suddenly stop working - if not made with faulty parts in the first place? The Samsung rep just chuckled at me.  Never again - I will never buy another Samsung product again. Over $600 out the window. Don't waste your money, because I am almost certain if you do, it's only a matter of time before your TV stops working also.  I have filled a complaint with BBB, and suggest you do as well when yours stops working.

Reviews.Title: Why im sending my third one back.
Reviews.Author: Tom S.
Reviews.Content: This Tv is decent, but for the money i wouldnt bother. Definitely not for gaming. The Response time is decent? but if you have to use vsync to avoid screen tearing and that pushes the response up to just too high to deal with.This TV also suffers terrible from "smearing", especially true black. (sometimes white also.) If you try to watch a show like Archer on this in 1080p, you can see a ghosted image of the black outlines of the characters. Its terribly noticeable. Samsung customer support said this tv shouldnt do that, and offered to send a tech out, but i just had it replaced twice. Each tv came with its own quirks like, dark corners, and v shaped dark spots in the center of the backlight.If youre buying this for a parent or someone to just watch television on and they dont care about all this? Then yeah, its a good little tv and the interface is nice. but if you're a gamer or even an all around tech enthusiast? you wont be happy with this.Im going to try the 40 in Vizio M series, and if im not happy with that im just going to go back to my 720p LG plasma until something better comes out.

Reviews.Title: went black on the 29th day
Reviews.Author: Daria
Reviews.Content: first the HDMI 1 went out and then on the 29th day, the screen went black> It was a waste of time- trying to find a ups and get the tv returned within the 30 days of coverage!

Reviews.Title: YouTube App no longer compatible
Reviews.Author: Matthew Davis
Reviews.Content: Great TV for the price, but the YouTube app no longer functions.  The FCC recently rolled out new closed caption requirements.  Unfortunately, YouTube & Google aren't doing the work to make their YouTube app compliant with these rulings.  As a result, they have pulled the YouTube app from the slightly older TV's.  Here is the official response from the Samsung support team:  Youtube team in Google does not want to apply IP Closed Caption to Youtube app in X10 Plus chip set model.

Reviews.Title: Not smart, but stupid
Reviews.Author: Ralph Myers
Reviews.Content: This is a terrible product. I only use the internet to watch TV and despite it being called a Smart TV with WIFI, it's anything but, the installed apps fail to work, Netflix app cannot run and you can't re-install it, you watch a video from one of the apps and once it's finished playing the first video it switches it off. I called the help line and got a lady who was eating through out my call who could not figure it out and then put me on hold for 15 mins so i hung up. The entire user experience of this product is a disaster, clunky, and badly designed  Samsung need to get it together if they're going to try and compete in Smart TVs. I'm just going to plug in my Roku device. So don't bother with a Samsung Smart TV, just buy a normal TV and do the same if you rely on internet TV

Reviews.Title: Great.....When it works.....
Reviews.Author: Ganette Araya
Reviews.Content: When I first set this TV up I was very impressed.  Great picture, easy to use, looks great on my tv mount.  Unfortunately,  since I got this as a Christmas gift, I haven't even used it 3 months and it started power cycling.  I had one repair through the Samsung warranty and 2 days later it started again.  Per the warranty reps at least 2 repairs have to be attempted before they exchange.  This is incredibly inconvenient given the technicians they contract with don't work weekends,  so I have to get someone to wait around my house for them.  This wouldn't be so awful, if the technicians were more customer oriented, and arrived on time.  I couldn't recommend this TV or any Samsung television to anyone.

Reviews.Title: Great until Netflix and Amazon streaming stopped working
Reviews.Author: Quincy
Reviews.Content: I loved the "Smart" feature of this TV, I didn't even mind the constant Smart Hub updates, but then a little over a month ago, Netflix and Amazon streaming stopped working.  I have been in contact with Samsung over the month via email, chat and now phone (which takes about an hour to actually talk to someone) and still no Netflix or Amazon.  When I talked with them last week, they said that they were aware of the problem and that they would send an update in the next couple of days.  Nothing happened so I called again.  They told me that they were backed up and it may take up to five more days.  That's where I am right now.  Here's the thing that really gets me, if they know exactly what the problem is, why have me jump through all the "re-sets", "re-boots", "re-installes" etc. etc over and over again?  I'd like to add up all the time I have spent on this problem "so far", and send them a bill.

Reviews.Title: Perfect for bedroom... Truly SMART buy!
Reviews.Author: J Ponder
Reviews.Content: I purchased this to replace a similar Samsung I bought from HHG for my bedroom.  My son's old cmt tv died so I figured I'd put our previous Samsung (720p version) in my son's room.  I picked this one up and the Cheetah Mounts ALAMLB Articulating Arm (20" Extension) TV Wall Mount to put in my bedroom.  Both TV and mount are great.What makes this TV great?1.  LED is by far the best picture2.  Slim size (not super flat, but maybe 2.5-3" thick) and lightweight3.  It's Smart (basically has capabilities of a computer or tablet)  - Internet capable  - Wi-Fi capable  - Can stream movies and TV shows from Netflix, Amazon, Hulu Plus, and many more  - Can watch movie files that are on your networked computer  - Can surf internet and more4.  Plenty of analog and digital audio and video inputs as well as USB inputs5.  The remote buttons can light up for easy visibility in dark roomWhat could be better?1.  Could be super slim (like 1" thickness) - would prob cost more2.  Could have built-in Blu-Ray - would definitely cost more3.  Could be touchscreen - would seriously cost substantially more4.  Could sing you too sleep -  wait, it can..  You can get Pandora on it!5.  Could laugh at all my jokes - Sorry! I'm getting silly nowThe point is that the TV is great and is packed with numerous features.  The mount is also a perfect fit.

Reviews.Title: Superior smart TV compared to VIZIO
Reviews.Author: Tad
Reviews.Content: I bought a VIzio smart tv, and now realize it doesn't update itself, freezes up occasionally, and the apps are all SO SLOW.This Samsung is always updating itself, and has a faster/smooth processor. AWESOME, GREAT TV!

Reviews.Title: Smart Hub Defective
Reviews.Author: Professor
Reviews.Content: The picture and sound are adequate.SMART HUB FAULTY / DEFECTIVE!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!I am not a technical expert so I will share our experience.  We have two Samsung TV's in the house with the exact same problem - inability to access the Smarthub.TV#1 - After a call to Samsung they did send a representative to our house to replace a component.  However, the issue returned on this same television within 6 months.  TV#2: is a year old and on random days we have Smarthub failures as well.  We are unable to log into Netflix or other applications.  (No, it is not a Netflix issue because we were able to log in with our laptops)3/1/14 Update: the issue with the television continues. On some days the Smarthub is functional in the AM and will fail to connect later in the day.3/27/14 Update: To be fair I am updating my original review of this SmartHub.  There have not been any additional disruptions in connectivity with Netflix since the modifications to service were made on 3/24/14. ***not sure if this effects all Samsung televisions with SmartHub - but there was an announcement that scrolled across the screen that Samsung SmartHub was not supporting some of the applications after 3/24/14 - (paid subscriptions like Netflix not effected). Free services like Crackle etc. were impacted.These televisions were disappointing given that they were purchased for the Smarthub.

Reviews.Title: Save your money, buy the non-"smart" version.
Reviews.Author: J. Canada "C. Brittain"
Reviews.Content: The actual screen is AMAZING. Very clear, great resolution.BUT the "smart" tv is essentially an extremely crappy computer running your tv. It runs SOOOOOO slow. It feels like a computer cirica 1992.If I could do it again, I'd buy the same TV but without the "smart" features...they tack on about 100 dollars to the price for "smart" tvs. Save the 100 and spend it on screen size.

Reviews.Title: Save your money, get a regular TV and a Roku
Reviews.Author: D. Mazurek
Reviews.Content: I was excited to get this TV since I don't bother with cable - everything I watch is online. However, its software is horrifically buggy. Let's walk through trying to watch an episode of Dexter:1. Turn on the TV.2. Hit the Smart TV button.3. Wait. Anywhere between 20-45 seconds.4. Choose Netflix.5. Get error message that says Netflix can't be started and needs to be reinstalled.6. Go back to the Smart TV menu.7. Try Netflix again.8. Get same error message.9. Try Netflix again. (There's also a variation on this where I do reinstall Netflix. Same results.)10. It works this time. Pick Dexter.11. Error: Netflix can't load the video. Try again later.12. Try again.13. Error again.14. Turn off the TV, start over. (I've tried returning to the SmartTV menu here. Doesn't fix things.)15.
