Maybe it works this time, maybe it doesn't.From turning the TV on to watching a Netflix movie ranges anywhere from 90 seconds if I'm lucky to 7 or 8 minutes if I'm not. Average is probably closer to 3-5 minutes. Big waste of time.Save yourself the money and hassle. Buy the model without SmartTV and tack on a Roku.

Reviews.Title: Do NOT buy this TV for the “Smart” Software
Reviews.Author: PFGhost "Just the facts please"
Reviews.Content: The so called “smart” software on the UN40EH5300 is the slowest, buggiest software I have ever used.  Virtually EVERY time I launch Smarthub to use Netflix, it does not work. Either Netflix does not load at all or the content won’t launch displaying some error about content not available or the need to reinstall the app (which you can’t do because it is preinstalled – i.e. you can’t uninstall it to reinstall it).  In some cases I cannot even get Smarthub to load.It is not my connection because the TV is connected to my excellent TrendNET 733 via an Ethernet cable (not wirelessly).  As it is, I’m getting 24-30 Mbps down on over the wireless connection on my laptop which is in the other room.  Definitely not the connection speed.In fairness, the biggest problem seems to be specifically with the Samsung Netflix app.  The interface/UI for the app is quite nice, when it actually works.  Much like Android fragmentation, Samsung puts its own spin on the Netflix app which, in this case, is to the app’s detriment.Furthermore, the YouTube app seems to work just fine the few times I’ve tried it.  In fact, the YouTube app for this TV is easily the most elegant version I have ever come across.  HD content from YouTube is stunning.  Apparently, Google and Samsung play together much better than Netflix and Samsung.  This is really frustrating as Netflix is easily the streaming service we use most and contains all of the shows my four year-old enjoys.The TV itself is excellent (which is why it gets 4 stars from me).  I paid very little for this TV and I did not buy it for the “Smart” features.  I bought it for its excellent picture quality (Blu Ray looks phenomenal) and its three HDMI inputs (rare on a TV at this price).  Still, one expects that all the features toted on a product will work as advertised regardless of what you pay for something.Would I recommend this TV?  If all you want is a 40” 1080p LED TV with a great price and a brand name, then yes.Do I think that “smart” TVs need a lot of work and support?  Absolutely.  There is nothing smart about this TV.Other considerations:  The picture is not great out of the box, however there are numerous postings about tweaking (calibrating) the settings to maximize the picture quality.  Like I said, Blue Ray (Despicable Me) looks incredible.

Reviews.Title: The worst "Smart DUMB TV"
Reviews.Author: Pas. ball
Reviews.Content: my remote only works on the TV for 2 minutes on a single day and then it stop working + the power numb on the TV is not working so the "SMART TV" is stuck on one station and I have to unplug it and plug it back in to turn it on and OFF!!! I try cleaning the remote, same problem. I try cleaning the TV same problem and this happened to me on the second time I put on the TV to now and this day 23/01/2014 and the remote and TV has never fallen!

Reviews.Title: Enjoying our T.V.
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: We did research on this SMART T.V. before purchasing. We are very happy!Having EVERYTHING right at our fingertips is wonderful. We can switch from the news, to reviewing spreadsheets on our 40 inch screen, to catching a film on netflix.I even stopped a film to order a quick Birthday gift I had forgotten with the SHOP feature and was back to our movie in minutes!Yes, it DOES do it all.We especially enjoy Skypeing on the big screen with our family!Only con I can think of? I wish the screen swiveled for perfect viewing from any point in the room.

Reviews.Title: Its my first WiFi SMART? TV.
Reviews.Author: Michael Thompson
Reviews.Content: I like the TV,  but its not as flexible at steaming WiFi content as I thought it would be.First If you thought you were going to just join your new Lap top to the NEW TV via WiFi, NO.You can buy a device from jut about anyone that will PUSH the PC to the TV in real time.They do connect (Wifi) using Samsung software called Smart HUB.  but when they Say connect all of your Devices they do not mean Push The Active display,  My new Lap Top has every conceivable media Software hard ware ect.  But I still need to go buy a little box and a little USB to accomplish this,  (It a scam its being disallowed n purpose so you will pay to downloads APPS (On the TV) to pay for content.OK I cannot drive the BIG TV with the content I watch on my Computer : Example I have been watching Person of Interest and Blue Bloods on the CBS sir for some time,  (On my Lap Top, using internet and WiFi)  I cannot push this to the big TV.So!  I have the Inter net browser in the smart TV.  I just went to the Website for CBS from the TV and started the show just like I do it on the lap Top.WRONG!!  They somehow manage to always have a problem, it will play the commercial at the beginning and then reset the and default to the home screen.  Not enough Memory in the TV?  or?  they are just not going to let you stream stuff of the WEB.So,  I ordered some package's Hulu +  Netflix  and AMAZON for y pay to play movies. The is allot to see for the money. But its not everything,  I am going to buy the /second BIGGER TV soon and a WiFi BlueRay player, to get me to the next level.Just keeping mind that delivering content to the pretty TV over the internet,  and WiFi in the home.  They do what they can to make sure you pay for the content.I think its almost like smart phones,  they will practically give you the TV so they can sell you content.It going to be an interesting ride.EDIT,  I see a bunch of Dyslexia and spelling errors.I am not going to bother.If your not a technology person who spends a great deal of time on computers,do not waste the money on the newest Wifi smart TV's  Buy the 4 year old 50 Inch that is Not smart,  and a Roku or Smart WiFi Blue-ray player.  You will have the same set up as the rest of us,  but for hundreds less and no aggravation.

Reviews.Title: Great at Being a TV (Not So Great at Being a Smart TV)
Reviews.Author: Sacha Potter
Reviews.Content: I had a modest budget for a new TV and wanted something that would offer good picture and sound without a lot of features. After reading reviews and researching the competition I decided on the 40" version. I've been using it for about a month now and here are my impressions so far:The Good:-Picture quality is very good.-3 HDMI ports plus a component input.-Price seems very fair considering the performance (although it has gone up recently).-Built-in speakers are perfectly adequate, not great but by no mean terrible.-Bezels are thin and unobtrusive.-Remote/menus are more responsive than some TVs I've used.The Bad:-The built in SmartHub is horrible. Slow, awkward to use, constantly updating, not customizable, ugly, unreliable).-No dedicated buttons for power/channel/volume/source (there is a multipurpose button/toggle though).Overall I am pleased with this TV because it works well as a TV. The picture quality is great, sound is decent, and it has a fair amount of inputs when compared to other TVs in the price range. I did decide to purchase a Roku since the SmartHub is so bad.If you are looking for a great TV go for this. If you think this will also fulfill your internet video streaming needs, I honestly think you will be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: Great TV, setup was a breeze and easy to follow
Reviews.Author: M. Khodari
Reviews.Content: Ordered on blackfriday this year, shipping was fine. Smart TV setup was a breeze and easy to follow. Picture quality was fine but after following steps mentioned in another review, picture looks better.Mode: DynamicBacklight: 18Contrast: 85Brightness: 50Sharpness: 80Color: 70TInt: G/R 50/50Standard color tone with screen fit in the additional options, with HDMI black level set to low.

Reviews.Title: Samsung 46in smart tv
Reviews.Author: Mishieru
Reviews.Content: Received this a few days ago. Arrived quickly, in great condition and delivery was excellent. The tv was very easy to set up and get running. About 30 mins from out of box, to up and running. For all the fun extras it would be easier to have a full keyboard to select letters and numbers instead of pushing arrows to select them, But once everything is set up it's not that big of a deal. I read another review on here complaining it didn't have Netflix, but it indeed does! So no worries there. We have been enjoying our new purchase and are very happy with it. I love that i can also use my phone as a tv remote (download the free app). It's also been fun that Google on my phone tells me what shows are on tv, and it can listen to the tv and tell me what show I'm watching. Good purchase!

Reviews.Title: Want to love, but just like.
Reviews.Author: J. Burgart "Julie B."
Reviews.Content: I want to LOVE this TV but just can't fully. I bought this for my husband for his man cave (aka the garage). He loves to watch games out there while he works out. But this TV does NOT support flash! There is nowhere to download flash. I called the company and they said that it was "in the works" but couldn't tell me when it would be (which I'm told they've been saying for a long time).The sound and display are both great. We haven't had any of the problems that anyone has talked about with the sound being lackluster as well as the picture. Both are great to us. We really like the TV but NEED it to support flash!

Reviews.Title: Samsung UN32EH5300
Reviews.Author: Robert D Fulton
Reviews.Content: Nice TV; very crisp picture and reasonable audio. The Wi Fi connection software from Samsung is a little clunky, but it seems to work. This is a very good choice of TV in this size for the price.

Reviews.Title: Outstanding Product
Reviews.Author: RUTH N.
Reviews.Content: Samsung UN32EH5300 32-Inch 1080p 60 Hz Smart LED HDTV (Black)The features this SMART TV offers is just unbelievable. It has all the gadgets you could ever want: Wireless LAN built right in; 120 clear motion rate;LED technology; and a whole lot more. I chose this particular model because of the low cost and no shipping. It also holds a vehttp://www.amazon.com/review/edit-review#ry high rating in customer reviews and now I know why. I highly recommend buying it!12/1/13 My SECOND SUBMIT:I have had this product for one-week and wanted to up date any potential buyers that this Smart TV is easy to use, fun to work with, allows you FREE applications and FREE trials. Everyone in my townhouse community (even the EXPERT WHO CLAIMS TO KNOW all about electronics) commented on the  technology!  He was amazed at the availability of so many personal options which allow me to do just about everything right on the TV! I have e-mail, yellow pages, U Tube and lots more!I have only written this up-date because many of us will buy a new product and express the product's excellence ONLY to find out that after we actually begin working with it our experiences and opinions might change. I assure you that it's is a great product and Amazon customer service is always available to help! I have no regrets about this purchase.

Reviews.Title: Great!
Reviews.Author: Serious Shopper in CA "lp"
Reviews.Content: It has been a week since I recieved and installed the TV.  So far so good!  It was easy to put together and hook up to cable and dvd.  I do not have wireless so I am planning to hardline the internet. - just like it shows in the manual.  I just need to get the right cable.  Amazon bumped my purchased up to 2 day shipping - thank you!  it was delivered in great shape!The Samsung manual does suggest purchasing a TV Holder Kit - through them.  But I could find on on there site or Amazon.  This TV ( if using the bottom base) is a bit top heavy and as a precaution should be secured to the wall or table.

Reviews.Title: Smallish TV with large number of features you want
Reviews.Author: R. T. Shafer "Ofra Haza Fan"
Reviews.Content: Just been using this for a week or so. Great sound and picture. Decided not to hook it to my cable service as it has its own WiFi with which you can launch built in apps like Netflix. Nice thing is you can ADD more applications to the TV.This TV is so nice when the time comes to replace my large TV, I will be replacing it a larger version of this Samsung Smart TV.Really an exceptional TV for its size.

Reviews.Title: Go ahead, take the plunge if you are looking at getting a smart flat screen TV!
Reviews.Author: Live Green Mom
Reviews.Content: OK, I have to say we really hesitated before ordering a TV off of Amazon. I mean, who wants to deal sending it back it something went wrong during shipping?This item came very well packaged. Easy to set up. And OH MY is that picture awesome! We were so glad we went with a smart TV over an add on like Apple TV for our Netflix, Amazon Video or HBO GO streaming. It is easy to manage right there on the screen. We comparison shopped the prices at Wal-Mart, Best Buy, Target. We comparisoned between getting a flat screen TV and the apple add on as opposed to getting a smart tv. We consulted Consumer Reports. It all came back to this TV being the best bang for the bucks we were willing to spend. We love it!

Reviews.Title: Wow! Excellent TV!
Reviews.Author: Mark
Reviews.Content: This is a great TV. The picture is crisp and clear. You can view it easily from all angles. Set up is very easy. I love the way it works with Netflix. The instructions are easy to read and easy to follow. We were watching it in just a couple of minutes. This TV is quite light for its size. It is well constructed. Even though the screen is semi-glossy there is no glare from our windows. I can't say enough good about this unit really, I would recommend it to friends and family. I will buy another. The shipper got it to us in good condition. Thanks again Amazon!

Reviews.Title: Buy Extended Warranty - Dumb TV is better
Reviews.Author: D. Johnson
Reviews.Content: Samsung Model UN40EH5300F 40" Led TV.  Resetting the unit didn't work for long, started cycling off and on again.  Wasted about 6 more hours over a month with Sam. Tech Support.  They sent me down all kinds of rabbit holes upgrading the firmware, etc., didn't want to send a serviceman.  They finally sent a serviceman.  I learned quite a few good things.1. The wifi talks to the main board, so when that is bad, tv will cycle off and on ... even if the wifi isn't hooked up, has never been used, etc.  2.  The wifi can break even if you're not using it, so don't buy a smart tv for anybody you don't live with that isn't a techie, and even that won't help much.  The only thing that will fix it is, a, replacing he wifi module, or b, removing the module if it's bad.  This will stop the on/off cycling. You have to remove the back.  Maybe YouTube has a video for it.  3. Don't believe them if you  call about wifi not working and they tell you to fix your firewall on your router, internet provider, etc., as long as your other wifi equipment works such as your laptop and Kindle there is no reason TV wifi shouldn't work.  4. The best picture size setting is screen fit.  Comcast users, if you're watching sports and the score is cut off on the edges, check your remote.  There is a HD Zoom button that is very easy to bump accidentally, so your TV is on a zoom setting forever until you push it again.  5. For closed captioning you have to set it up on your Comcast box:  Menu button > menu > setup > OK > subtitle setup > OK > subtitles > right arrow for on, left arrow later to turn off.I got a 2 yr warranty from Costco and glad I bought the 3 year extended Four Square warranty.  I'll probably need it.  Consumers Reports recommends not getting the smart TVs if you have a Blu-Ray player or other device toconnect to the internet.  Cheaper and easier to replace.  These smart TVs remind me of the TV stereo record player combos they sold way back.  Everybody had one and were thrilled until the TV died and they had this monstrosity in the LR with no place to put the new TV.  These smart TVs are poor now and will feel much worse as the other devices are improved while we're still stuck with the primitive features.I just bought a dumb Vizio for the bedroom.  Picture is just as good, more reliable, less money.Good luck.------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------Bought my TV in the summer of 2013.  Setup was easy and wireless worked fine for four months, then wireless crashed.  The TV also started rebooting itself, turning off after a few minutes when first starting with cold tv.  Called Samsung tech support, got the run-around, asked for a supervisor, got sent to an answering machine.  Left a phone number and they never called me back.  Called Costco concierge services and they told me they get this complaint all the time and she has a Samsung herself with the same problem.  They have a weak receiver in the TV for internet, and the best way to fix it is having a wifi booster or a direct connection.  Their software is buggy and they haven't been on the market that long.  Samsung denies they have a problem, that it's your problem, service provider, wireless firewall, etc., etc.  I'm not playing that game, so I reset the TV back to the way it came out of the box and it's working fine now as a "dumb" tv, the best kind, IMHO.  My IT pro friend says a dumb box is best and just hook up your own internet device to it.  You can Google that and get many ways to do it.Here is how I reset the TV:  Manu > support > self diagnosis > reset > code 0000 > yes.  Then you have to go through the setup again after it boots.Hope this helps.

Reviews.Title: Arrived 10-20 mins ago.
Reviews.Author: Skeletonkey IFOR
Reviews.Content: As the titles states, this TV landed on my porch 20 mins ago tops. Longest part was unboxing (Seriously) connected to an Xbox, PS3, and PC in a matter of seconds, i am using the PC as i type this. Updated in 5 mins, signed on to my video programs and She's all set up, I highly recommend this for the price, its great.

Reviews.Title: Solid Value Set
Reviews.Author: J. Leard
Reviews.Content: In replacing an aging off-brand LCD TV, I was looking for a bump in quality and size both. I originally purchased a 32" Samsung that I have also reviewed, but there was a bright spot in the corner and the sound was awful. I immediately sent it back to the retailer I purchased it from.A few weeks later I dipped my toe back in the Samsung waters. This TV won't blow anyone away, but it does a good job, the sound is serviceable (I'd still recommend a sound bar or speaker solution, but you don't HAVE to), and the lighting fairly uniform.The default color settings are reasonably solid, which was a nice surprise. Higher-contrast live-action viewing (like newer Food Network shows) is best served by "Movie"; it's not as crisp and colorful as I might prefer, and the black levels aren't ideal, almost looking like a filter has been placed on the TV, but it looks realistic, and bright colors still stand out. Most of the rest of what you'll watch, and especially cartoons, are greatly enhanced with normal, which really shows off what the set can do with color while also maintaining solid black levels.I don't intend to use the Samsung Smart TV features all that much, but I will be using HBO Go, Amazon VOD, and Netflix at least, and they work very well. Being able to operate without using a Roku or Apple TV is very nice, and the way it still displays the incoming video in a PIP field is pretty neat, too. Setting it up on my local wireless network was very easy, and wireless playback was generally smooth and high quality.The aforementioned 32" TV also came with a dearth of inputs and outputs, and this TV remedies that with more options as to how I can plug in and what I can output.I did notice some banding on solid color screens. Nothing major, and I can't notice it 95% of the time, but when watching, say, an Apple product commercial, you'll probably pick it up. Research on this issue has led me to believe that this is "business as usual" for value TVs' the uniformity of the lighting array just isn't as gooas a more expensive unit, and you have to decide if you can live with that. Most of the time, however, the set works quite well, and at less than $700, it's a reasonable deal for a budget-minded purchase. After a poor experience with a smaller Samsung TV I was apprehensive, but this one does the job well, balancing cost with performance in a manner I found acceptable.

Reviews.Title: Arrived timely and in great shape
Reviews.Author: short of time
Reviews.Content: This is our first flat panel TV and we love it.  The size is perfect for our space; it is light weight so it's easy to move.  Having a smart TV adds many features to the TV experience; it takes some time to figure out how it all works. I wouldn't hesitate to order online again.

Reviews.Title: It works perfectly
Reviews.Author: DE STAERKE
Reviews.Content: I love my new TV. It is very convenient to use Netflix and enable as well to listen to internet radios.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic TV!  Ok so-so sound.
Reviews.Author: F.Faulkner "F.F."
Reviews.Content: Update 3 months later:  Downgraded review from 5-stars to 4.  The sound is awful, we are always turning it WAY up, and the volume control drives us BATTY making a click click click sound (on purpose!) everytime you adjust the volume.  UGH!  Hate these two things. Otherwise, it's great.This TV is awesome.  We've had it three weeks and are thrilled with it.  It does everything without need for wii or x-box, and it can surf the net, and stream any service from amazon prime to netflix to hulu etc.  Screen resolution is wonderful.  Very happy buyers.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: Colby Dollens
Reviews.Content: Great picture quality, good sound, amazing features with it being a smart TV. The functionality is unparalleled. Prefer this tv much more than any of my others.

Reviews.Title: Awesome TV
Reviews.Author: Amanda
Reviews.Content: This is my first review, but I must say that I have had this TV since October and I have been more than impressed by the TV's capabilities and picture quality.  I do not watch much TV, but I do now--especially the HD channels that have a very crisp picture.  I love the Smart TV function and the ability to use my tablet as the remote with little to no hassle.  The only thing that bothers me about the TV is that there is no VGA hookup or buttons...so if you lose the remote, you are out of luck.  Other than that I am in love with this TV!

Reviews.Title: Very happy with this TV
Reviews.Author: KwQd
Reviews.Content: I have had this TV for a few months now and like it a lot. I used the tuning parameters found in another review for this TV to set up the picture and that works very well. For some reason the settings reverted to the default settings a few times and I had redo the settings several times. Finally, they "took". I restrict access to my home network by MAC address and this TV makes it very easy to determine the MAC address.This TV fits nicely in my TV cabinet, whereas my old 32" LCD set fit in at an angle. The set is very responsive to the remote control from anyplace in the room. Not true with my last TV. The viewing angle is very good from anywhere in the room. The sound is not good, very weak and tinny, but I purchased a ZVOX 220 sound system that fits under the TV and solved that problem. I highly recommend the ZVOX 220 as a complement to this TV.I like the Smart TV feature. I have the same problem with YouTube that other folks mention, but I now access YouTube via the browser and that works fine. I use the browser a lot. To facilitate that, I purchased the Logitech K400 keyboard that works perfectly with this TV. I am a CSPAN junkie and the browser allowed me to ditch Comcast. Yay! I haven't used the other Smart TV options much, as the browser meets all of my needs, so far, and I access Amazon, Netflix, etc., via my Roku. It does potentially give me a backup option for accessing those sites, if my Roku dies. My initial impression is that the Roku is easier to use for these functions.I use a hard wired connection to my router, so can't comment on the wireless performance of the TV. I also use a hardwired Roku XS and that works very well, too.In the process of setting up an antenna to get OTA TV. My initial setup gave me a few channels and the TV works very well for OTA broadcasts.My only negative is the remote control. The layout is poor. The keys are so closely packed and similar in size that I have to look at the remote every time I use it. Good thing the keys light up briefly on it, or it would be completely unbearable. Worst remote control I have ever used.This is really too small a TV for 1080P resolution to be noticeable, at least I have found this to be true, so I tend to just watch programs in 720P which means I can purchase lower bandwidth Internet service. I have Netflix and Amazon Prime, so save a dollar every time I watch something using those services. They charge extra for HD, which is apparently 1080P. This also allows me to stay well within my monthly bandwidth allowance.Great TV. Highly recommended.UPDATE:After writing my review, I decided to return to tinkering with the Smart TV features and discovered something interesting. Image quality is much better when playing back programs on Amazon Prime and Netflix using Smart TV than when playing back via my Roku. Unfortunately, the Smart TV feature does not recognize my ZVOX 220, or any external speakers, so when using Smart TV, I get great image quality and crappy sound, and when playing via Roku I get middling image quality and great sound. Going to poke Samsung about this and may they can fix this in a software update...Upated update: 29 July 2013. My ZVOX mysteriously started working with the Smart TV. I did send an email to Samsung, but did not get a response. Coincidence? Not sure...

Reviews.Title: Great video quality, dissapointing Smart Suite and audio
Reviews.Author: Josh
Reviews.Content: I was impressed with the video quality after I applied these settings:Mode: DynamicBacklight: 18Contrast: 85Brightness: 50Sharpness: 80Color: 70TInt: G/R 50/50Not so impressed with the audio, but then again, this is for my bedroom. Another negative is the Samsung Smart ecosystem, its extremely laggy and honestly you're better off buying an Apple TV or Roku. Besides, Netflix was unusable and it had a terrible user interface.

Reviews.Title: Price and Option make this a winner
Reviews.Author: Angelo
Reviews.Content: I took me around 5 months to decide on the unit i wanted, I mulledover the bigger "nicer" looking units but finally settled on this unit. The picture is great. The Smarthub option was so OVER-DUE on TV's. The WI-Fi works flawless-, BTW you can use is a a wifi router. I could go on forever...to keep it simple, I'm glad I chose this unit

Reviews.Title: flat screens are NOT all the same
Reviews.Author: Richard D. Cox
Reviews.Content: Straight outa the box and into superb HD mode ...the web feature is something I didn't think I would need but it turns out to be really useful.....however, I think I may need a tutorial to completely utilize all the web features. This model (Samsung in general) are always on the top of the Consumer Reports guides. Without the added cost of a local tax on Amazon purchases this is really a great deal.

Reviews.Title: Mostly Great
Reviews.Author: Karin
Reviews.Content: This TV was my first flat screen TV purchase. I love that it is a Smart TV, so it connects to the wireless internet without any cords or hassle. Also, it is very nice to be able to stream Netflix, Youtube, or other videos directly on the TV. The color and sound are really nice, but other people who are more conscious of these things might think differently. I'm just not really that picky. The only reason that I didn't give this TV five stars is that the web browser installed on the TV does not support flash, which many online videos require. That wouldn't be so bad, but it is impossible to download Adobe Flash Player or a different web browser on the TV. So the only option to watch Flash videos is to buy a cord to stream your computer on the TV. This can be particularly tricky because the only ports on the TV are HDMI or USB. It would be helpful if the TV had a VGA port, since computers will often have this, but many computers don't have HDMI. If you want a TV that can stream Netfix, Hulu, or other sites like that, then this TV will be a great purchase for you. But if you watch a lot of videos that need flash, you definitely should see if your computer has an HDMI port before you buy this TV.Overall, this was a great purchase, and I got a great price on it during Black Friday week. I would recommend this TV to those who watch a lot of Netflix, Hulu, Youtube, etc.

Reviews.Title: 3rd Samsung Monitor/TV and still happy
Reviews.Author: M. Kovacs "mmk"
Reviews.Content: I already have a regular Samsung monitor and a 19 inch monitor/HDTV. I love them both and decided to come back to this same brand to buy our main TV. I been browsing for an HDTV for our living room for a long time now and I always found that Samsung has the crispiest nicest colors from all the brands currently out there. While I looked up the suggested config of the picture settings, I ended up changing those.After reading the reviews I decided to go for this Smart TV, vs the regular TV, since I am subscribed to Hulu, Netflix and Prime. I am setting up our old TV in the kids room with the Roku we have. Setting up the apps are a breeze with the exception of Netflix. I made the mistake of setting the tv's internal clock to Automatic, which prevents the TV to link to Netflix. So when you set up the TV make sure to leave the clock on Manual mode if you will use Netflix.While this is not the TV's issue (though this is a 32 inch), but the design of the app, I found that browsing on Netflix and reading the minuscule text of movie summaries is pretty impossible, unless I am sitting right in front of the TV. Everyone in our family noted this same problem.The integration with Twitter and Facebook is simple but it is kind of nice that I can share updates and movies right from the tv. Having the PIP while browsing FB and TW is nice.I set up the Fitness app, unless I am missing something, unless I constantly log out and someone else logs in to the TV there is no other way to set up a second profile and switch easily between them. It has nice tracking features, though I did not start using it yet. Also nice that i can log into my Flickr account and set up a slideshow of my photos. I have not had a chance to test Family Story yet.I love the fact that I can plug in a keyboard and use that for typing in most username and passwords, searching as well as browsing. That is a huge plus in my opinion. :)There rest of the available apps are nice. I was especially happy to find the Digital Theater app to watch british theather performances. There is so much to choose from just between Hulu, Netflix, Prime, Pandora and the rest of the apps, who needs cable or dish? I downgraded to local basic, goodbye crappy channel selection. :-)

Reviews.Title: WOW!
Reviews.Author: Joseph Albanese "The Joe Show"
Reviews.Content: I wish I could title this something a bit more creative but after the set up (a painless operation, by the way) was complete, and I saw a cable channel movie, all I could do was sit down and say, "WOW!"Slim, lightweight and stylish, the Samsung UN32EH5300 fits the bill for whatever your viewing needs are.  The picture is crisp, no distortion, and the colors are realistic. I happen to have it set up in a very small studio so it is like having my own private movie theater.  Everything (even classic black and white programs) pop out.  The speakers are fine but note:  if you play the set at lower volumes (welcome to city living folks), you lose a lot of tonal quality.But for the excellent picture, that is a relatively small obstacle.  I heartily endorse this product.

Reviews.Title: Great TV for price and features. Value for money. Go for it.
Reviews.Author: drdkgupta
Reviews.Content: Bought it for 597.99 USD on Oct 25, 2012. Very well priced for features, namely Smart TV. Good picture quality. Frequently updated firmware. Samsung Skype Camera works great with it.

Reviews.Title: AMAZING TV
Reviews.Author: Sara
Reviews.Content: LOVE THIS TV.I browsed through hundreds of HDTVs and eventually picked this Samsung SmartTv. The picture quality is perfect. Sounds is great. The Apps are what sets this Tv apart from others. I use Netflix a lot and it is nice to not need any other devices. I ordered this Tv on a Sunday night and it was here by Tuesday. I am very pleased with my purchase.

Reviews.Title: So far So good
Reviews.Author: Paul K
Reviews.Content: Television has only been operational for two weeks  but so far so good. I have not had one glitch. picture quality is perfect everything seems to be operational.  there are no problems whatsoever.

Reviews.Title: A++
Reviews.Author: Jay S
Reviews.Content: I love this TV. Did plenty of research before buying this particular one and am glad I went with this one. The wireless works great(little slow, but still awesome). And the TV has a great picture along with all the SMART TV features. Overall I would suggest this TV to others. I own another Samsung TV but unfortunately it is not a SMART TV, but it is the reason I decided to buy this TV for another room in my house. I am very please with the products I have received from Samsung.

Reviews.Title: Buy This TV On Amazon
Reviews.Author: Micki333
Reviews.Content: Buy your tv through Amazon.The big box stores say they will match pricing but only on exact model numbers.I saw this tv, but it had slightly different model #,at Best Buy. It had the same features that I was looking for. Their price was $1000.00. They would not match this price because the model #'s were slightly different.I left and came home and ordered this tv on Amazon and paid $798.00. Free delivery and no tax. I have Amazon Prime so I got the tv in 2 days.I set it up myself when it arrived and everything went flawlessly!You DON'T need anyone to set it up and you don't need any additional services.I had one question during the install so I phoned Samsung. I spoke with someone who was actually in this country and within 5 minutes, everything was resolved.The tv is awesome. I am still playing with it.The days are now over for when we needed additional support with electronics.

Reviews.Title: Incredible Product!
Reviews.Author: Mike M
Reviews.Content: This is by far the best television I have ever owned. The number of features is mind-boggling and the image is crisp and clean. The blacks on Samsung TVs are unmatched on any other brand of televisions I've seen. Fantastic product.

Reviews.Title: Exactly What I was Waiting For!!
Reviews.Author: Too Far Away
Reviews.Content: Excellent solution for someone who does not want to pay for cable TV and uses the web to watch shows and movies. Looks great and easy to set up.  The apps are few but very useful and they are adding more all the time.  The sound is pretty good for internal speakers. It's nice having a USB port. The Wifi works great with my Apple Airport.  Only complaint is that the remote can be clunky while entering text for URL's or entering logins and passwords.Side note:  The first shipment arrived with a cracked screen - result of poor packaging in my opinion.  Amazon handled it beautifully - they had a new one out to me the next day while having UPS picking up the damaged one at the same time.

Reviews.Title: So far so good.
Reviews.Author: TW
Reviews.Content: I am a Samsung fan, at least the televisions, and so far have found this set as good as the two others I have. Would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: Excellent HD TV with Internet Access
Reviews.Author: Guy H. Loucks
Reviews.Content: I'm very pleased, overall, with this TV - though since it replaces a 12 year old SONY CRT which looks shabby by comparison. Only suggestion for improvement would be a remote control with a keyboard. Entering search terms with the remote is very time consuming. Overall, though, I'm vey pleased.

Reviews.Title: Great price for an awesome TV
Reviews.Author: Walla-Walla
Reviews.Content: Me and my husband bought this TV early this year and have been very happy with our purchase. The picture and sound quality is very sharp and clear. I would recommend it as a buy.

Reviews.Title: smart or stupid TV
Reviews.Author: B. Weber
Reviews.Content: I bought this, otherwise excellent, TV so I would have a TV with access to the internet.  Many pre-configured Apps like Netflix, Pandora, and HuluTV+ are available but navigation of the internet for connections that do not have Apps is painfully slow using the remote control...a keyboard is clearly necessary.But the killer for me is that the TV does not permit viewing internet sites that stream video via Flash or Silverlight.  This I confirmed by speaking with Samsung tech-support.  Such sites are almost always free and so Samsung like Sony with their PS3 will not permit consumers to access the free streaming of video on their devices.  This is wrong and consumers should complain.An example follows:Using my home computer I have been viewing free, live performances of opera and ballet from Europe on the internet.  Alas I cannot do this on my Samsung "Smart" TV via its internal internet connection.  Ths Samsung does not support the type of streamed video (mentioned above) provided by the European broadcasts.If I connect the video out from my home computer to the Samsung I have no problem since the computer is using the free streaming software to access the material and provide the video signal compatible with the Samsung or most stupid TVs.One such company, ParaClassics.com streams such free performances.  Their site is at [...]. If you like ballet and opera you will like paraclassics.Shame on Samsung...time for a Samsung update in support of Consumers rights!

Reviews.Title: Do NOT buy this TV to watch Netflix as there is a Firmware issue Samsung will not warranty repair
Reviews.Author: Nancy Hines
Reviews.Content: I loved the TV for 9 months and enjoyed my Netflix account until one day Netflix quit working. It was unab le to play any titles and said to try again later. I went through a month of calls to Samsung, called Netflix, called my ISP. I have chatted with support and done everything they said to try. Nothing worked to fix Netflix, it kept saying it was unable to play any titles right now, to try again later. Netflix support had me Deactivate and reactivate it and still no joy. Finally, Samsung sent a tech out and he had Support connect remotely and they determined my network was too slow. Which I knew was incorrect as nothing had changed with it and it worked fine for 9 months. My ISP was barely providing 3 Mbps download so I changed ISP and now get 30 Mbps download. I called Samsung back and tried to get a tech to come back out as I am convenience the Motherboard has failed after finding a Samsung forum where a Samsung tech stated he replaced the motherboard and it fixed this problem. I called Samsung numerous times and they argued and argued and I have a computer hardware background as well as Cisco certification CCNA and CCNA Security. I know about hardware and this could be fixed in warranty but Samsung refuses to own up and perform the repair. So I advised -DO NOT BUY THIS TV FOR NETFLIX.  After 6 weeks of chats, calls, the executive team saying the TV is fine I went and bought a second one, same model. It plays Netflix FINE, as it has updated chips on its motherboard and it has an updated Firmware version that is not available to the public at this time. I had to argue and insist they repair the TV so they finally sent out a USB device that was to have the 1039 version of the firmware - it didn't. After waiting two weeks for a USB drive ( ever heard of FTP Samsung?) they USB had the same version of firmware that doesn't work - 1037. So I call and argue some more and get placed on hold, disconnected twice and now they say I get to wait two more weeks fior another USB drive with the right Firmware version. Last night the tech FINALLY admitted after 20 calls, chats and a home visit where they ALL DENIED an issue existed - FINALLY I am told - YES there is a Firmware issue right now with Netflix and Samsung WILL NOT REPAIR the TV as they say it is NOT broken. WHAT? It worked fine for 9 months and then failed to function properly and its not the TV that's broken? I know for a fact that replacing the motherboard would fix my faulty TV but Samsung has refused the repair under Warranty. They will however be glad to have a tech come out and replace the motherboard at my expense. Yes, I am expected to pay for a Warranty repair?!! A product that has Netflix as a partner is refusing to admit the product failure? Best Buy can't help me out as I did not get a warranty from them so I have a faulty TV and no Netflix so consumer beware. Samsung will not stand behind the Warranty on this TV if its related to faulty firmware. Color me very disappointed and NEVER but a Samsung product without purchasing Best Buys coverage as the Geek squad would have fixed this under warranty with no questions. The second TV I bought has a 5 yr warranty from Best Buy and they will come out and repair that one, no extra charge.UPDATE: 2/4 - After waiting another 10 days to get a USB drive with the updated firmware version 1039, I received the USB with the same version of the 1st USB - both were WRONG. The Exec team finally admitted there is NO VERSION 1039 available to the public!! Another run around and lies to boot. Great! They opened a second service request. This should be interesting...more to come.

Reviews.Title: Worst TV Ever...Smart TV Never Works
Reviews.Author: Julie M Raborn
Reviews.Content: I purchased this TV with the hopes of streamlining my media devices.  Instead I ended up having to buy a Roku to go with this TV because the Smart TV app often either does not work, or streams so slow that it makes watching unbearable.Now, let me be clear.  I have blazing fast internet in my house (almost 40mps) and yet streaming even non-HD quality videos often buffer every few minutes.  When I contacted Samsung to inquire she informed me that their SmartHub that controls the streaming on this TV needs to connect to Samsung's server to operate, and that their server is overloaded due to them selling an influx of TVs and telephones.  When I asked when this would be resolved, she stated that buffering was likely a problem I would always encounter during peak viewing hours.  Geez, thanks Samsung.  I guess I'll just set my alarm clock and start watching Netflix at 3am so I won't overload your server.Additionally, the SmartHub is constantly updating.  So when I finally am able to sign on and start watching a show, sometimes right in the middle of it, the show will cut out so the SmartHub can update. No thanks Samsung.  If I could do it over again, I'D BUY ANY TV BUT A SAMSUNG SMART TV!

Reviews.Title: Do Not Buy - SmartTV Features Stopped Working - Terrible Software Updates and Support
Reviews.Author: David Burch "DavidBurch(dot)com"
Reviews.Content: Google Samsung SmartHub is not retaining my Netflix login credentials to see how many people are having this problem.1) Samsung SmartHub is not retaining my Netflix login credentials since the last software update. I am forced to log in to Netflix every time I open the app. (2) EVERY time I try to play a Netflix title I get an error saying that Netflix is having trouble playing this title; pick another or try again later - up to 10 times in a row before it will play. This, also, since the last update. And (3) the Samsung SmartView remote control for my iPhone has also stopped working entirely."I just bought this TV in November 2013 and it worked fine until I did a software update after a couple of weeks. Samsung support either denies the problem exists or states that it is a problem with a router, network, or something else. Again, google to see how many people are having this problem. I have Netflix through the Roku and Wii working, so I know it is the TV.After seeing the way Samsung operates, it is apparent that they have very little quality control, testing, or competency when it comes to rolling out new software updates. A software update is bound to break something. I would not buy this again.I paid extra for SmartTV features that are now useless and take me an extra step to get through to my services through input devices.

Reviews.Title: Samsung 32" Smart TV
Reviews.Author: Glenn White
Reviews.Content: It was lightly used (advertised as possibly having minor imperfections or blemishes) but everything was packaged nicely.  All of the hardware was there.  A really nice product for a super price.  The Samsung LED has a great picture.  Had a little problem setting up the SMART features but I called the helpline and they helped me out.  Shipped quickly even with standard shipping.  The Amazon crew seems like they are really on the ball.  Thanks.

Reviews.Title: Damaged Screen
Reviews.Author: MMD78
Reviews.Content: I received the monitor in what appeared to be good condition. There was no impact damage on either the shipping carton or the actual monitor. And yet, the screen has a two inch long and a half inch wide distortion in the lower left quadrant. It's almost imperceptible with a light background, but when the background is dark, it becomes annoyingly prominent. I can only assume that this is a factory defect that was not caught during the QC process.Unfortunately, I have not received a return shipping authorization to date, and its been a few days since my request was acknowledged.

Reviews.Title: Doing an Outstanding Job
Reviews.Author: David Bower
Reviews.Content: There were several features this TV had that made it the one I wanted. We were looking for a TV for our bedroom and didn't want one too large so the 32 inch size seemed like a good choice. Knowing how virtually all of the newer equipment wants an internet connection and in view of the fact that I didn't have an Ethernet cable run to our bedroom, I knew I would want the built-in Wi-fi feature which this one has. Also I liked the idea of a built-in internet browser that would permit access to the internet without any other equipment being needed. I also wanted the 1080P HDTV and liked the idea of the LED feature. All told this TV had all of the features I wanted in the right size for our room.When the TV came in I was excited to start setting up the TV and getting it all hooked up to the cable service and the internet. The stand was easy to assemble and required 8 screws (supplied) and a Phillips head screwdriver (not supplied). We have a wireless network in our house and the TV found the network and when I entered the password it connected and immediately wanted to update its software which, of course, I permitted it to do. After that was done I set up our Netflix account and got that working too. The only thing I couldn't find was Amazon streaming and I was disappointed about that.One of the things that pleased me about the TV was the quality of the built-in speakers; they sound just fine for most purposes and simplify life for my wife who doesn't like to push buttons and change things around. The TV permitted the direct attachment of a cable box using HDMI and a Pioneer Universal Player using the component inputs. I've used both now and the picture quality is excellent on both and I have absolutely no complaints. I've connected the audio out to external speakers so if I want to get really big dramatic sound I can play back the TV through my new Audioengine A5+ speakers. I've tried that and it works great.The setup was relatively easy although I did have to tweak the color to get the balance I like; the picture right now looks perfect to both of us and we look forward to a new era in watching TV in our bedroom.

Reviews.Title: Awesome picture--Great value
Reviews.Author: Gift Card Recipient "Jack"
Reviews.Content: Awesome picture and a great value.  Lots of flexibility in fine tuning the picture to suit your preferences.  Simple to use but the internet capability is slow and clunky.  Basically worthless.  Web site input via remote is tedious.  Not as thin as larger models but I'd recommend it to anyone who wants a 32 LED TV with a great picture.

Reviews.Title: Very good 32" TV
Reviews.Author: Carter Hall "DVD guy"
Reviews.Content: I have had this TV for about a week now. This is a very good 32" HDTV. The picture quality is excellent. The sound quality is also very good.One complaint I have about this TV is that the base stand is very light weight. Previous Samsung TVs I have owned have had much heavier stands. This one is very light and when you touch the TV it will actually jiggle a little back and forth like it's on a spring.I'm also a little worried that if it is nudged too hard it could easily fall over due to the light weight base. Also, my other 32" Samsung (model LN32B550) had a swivel stand that was quite nice, whereas this stand does not swivel, which is a bit disappointing.I assume Samsung decided to cut costs and the quality of the stand has suffered pretty dramatically from just 3 years ago. Other than the cheap stand issues, I am very pleased with this TV.Update (8/3/13): Since purchasing this TV, I have used it extensively with both Netflix and Amazon Prime and it has worked very well with both. My big complaint is that it won't work with ESPN3. Overall, I give this TV 4.5 stars.

Reviews.Title: Good picture- could be great, but this is NOT a smart TV!
Reviews.Author: TAB, Raleigh
Reviews.Content: First of all, this review is not about Amazon- we LOVE Amazon Prime! I first ordered the TV from a local retailer because it was listed as "in stock", but that wasn't true. In the end I decided to avoid the hassle of driving all over town and standing in line, and after clicking one button, Amazon had this TV sitting safely on my doorstep in two days, even though it was right before Christmas. Thanks Amazon- you rule!!I had the TV setup quickly and we were thrilled with the big beautiful picture, and even more excited to see what it seemed to be able to do in terms of streaming Netflix, Amazon Prime, YouTube, and media from our in-house PCs. It was pretty obvious how one should set these things up, and it went petty quickly. From there things started to go downhill. I'll omit all the details, but let me just say that the "Smart TV" part of this is the buggiest piece of crap I gave EVER encountered. I'm a career electrical engineer in the networking space, and if I was ever responsible for having developed something like this, I would be blackballed for the rest of my life.Youtube doesn't work, at all. Netflix is GREAT, when it works, but count on having to spend 30 minutes reloading the app, power cycling the TV, etc. to get your movie to play just as you're sitting down to enjoy your first date night in two weeks.All of the apps for this TV fed by the Samsung servers, and for several weeks they were either completely down or flakey. Customer support is nonexistent. Repeated software updates will give you hope just before they crash and break your heart.My recommendation: if you're looking for a basic TV with a decent picture and ths price makes sense, this is an OK dumb TV. if you want multimedia or streaming content, invest in a dedicated multimedia PC or the rock-solid Roku3. Forget about the "Smart TV" apps. They'll just piss you off...Update 6/2/2014: I guess I'm pretty stubborn- even though I had done this before, and even though the menu told me that I had the latest available software, I performed a complete factore reset and reinstalled EVERYTHING. Surprise- there IS a new firmware version available, as well as a new Version of Netflix. After spending several hours resetting everything, things are working MUCH better, so I upgraded this rating from one to three stars. It was really nice being able to relax with my wife, punch a few buttons, and having a good movie playing on demand.If things continue to work this well (YouTube now seems to work better too), I may upgrade another star. But man- this thing should never have shipped in its original condition...

Reviews.Title: Good TV
Reviews.Author: Darrell W.
Reviews.Content: I don’t know what everyone is complaining about, but as a home theatre TV, this is working pretty great. The screen looks clear, the sound is good even without plugging in my speaker and the size is just right for our living room.I didn’t even pay attention to the other features, but my kids managed to figure them out. I have to say, I’m surprised at what these people manage to make. I’m impressed.

Reviews.Title: Not as advertised
Reviews.Author: chaitu
Reviews.Content: I got this TV to mainly stream YouTube. The image shows a YouTube app in smart center but the app is no longer available in the app store. Something called linktoyoutube is there and it opens in the browser. The browser goes out of memory when I play 1080p movie.

Reviews.Title: Lived up to others reviews
Reviews.Author: Brenda Meyer
Reviews.Content: I purchased this TV because of other peoples reviews. It was very easy to set up, however it would not have been so easy if other people had not put the correct settings in their comments. Once I used these settings picture was great.

Reviews.Title: Good TV with a fair price
Reviews.Author: Will
Reviews.Content: After using this TV for about a week and discerning a fair amount of it's features; including it's MHL compatibility, it's customizable app screen,  and wifi streaming,  I feel content with my purchase. The definition of the screen is great along with bright colors. It really adds that extra pop to my favorite movies. The one downside I will say is the lower refresh rate,  it causes colors to faintly trail across the screen and taints the picture quality. I rate the user friendliness 8/10, picture quality 6/10, overall 7/10.

Reviews.Title: I LOVE IT!
Reviews.Author: Celeste Hollenbeck
Reviews.Content: I am so excited to have this TV in my home! I got a great deal and the quality is amazing! The best advice I can give to anyone looking to purchase this TV is to research the best settings. The setting I researched that I found I love is...Mode: DynamicBacklight: 18Contrast: 85Brightness: 50Sharpness: 80Color: 70Tint: G/R 50/50Standard Color tone with Screen fit in the additional options, with HDMI Black level set to low.Good luck on your TV purchase!

Reviews.Title: Love my new Smart TV
Reviews.Author: Leslie A. Loo
Reviews.Content: It's everything I expected and more, I'm having a blast exploring all the possibilities available with it.  Highly recommended for the frugally-minded.

Reviews.Title: love it love it love it
Reviews.Author: steve mccollum
Reviews.Content: I absolutely love this tv. I purchased it for my daughters room and it is the perfect size and the image is amazing. as good as my 3k one in the living room.

Reviews.Title: Not real happy with the quality of this product...
Reviews.Author: Jon Bernard "jonb"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this TV at the end of December 2013.  3 months later I have dead pixels and dark lines across the screen.  I've also had issues with the sound cutting out consistently.  The only way to restore the sound is to completely power down the TV and restart.  That works - but on some days only for a short while.  I've opened an Service Request with Samsung since the TV comes with a 12 month parts and labor warranty.  I'll update again with my service experience.Update: Samsung sent a contractor to replace the Screen (picture fix) and computer board (sound fix).  It took about 5 days for the first visit - where they brought the wrong size replacement screen.  They came back one business day later and replaced both components.  So far, the service experience is fine.  However, I would still rate the product as inferior.

Reviews.Title: This  is so great
Reviews.Author: Barb I.
Reviews.Content: Bought this TV based on the ratings from other customers and reading their comments. I am more than happy with the  purchase. It took a while to get connected and many phone calls to my cable company and Samsung. Main purpose to having this TV is for the Amazon Instant Video. Hope the following information will save someone else a lot of time and effort. I must say Samsung was easy to get a hold of and very helpful even for a Saturday.  I had to "enter" my "network password", not the WEP key number. It is case sensitive as well. Other point here is if that doesn't work, you have to manually enter the IP address, subnet address, default gateway and  DNS server address as well as the Network Password . This information is all  on your computer. Once all of that was completed - I was connected and followed the instructions to add Amazon Instant Video. It was great.

Reviews.Title: It's too slow...
Reviews.Author: Shailendra Gupta
Reviews.Content: There is nothing smart about this TV, if you play any youTube video which is more than 20 min, it's browser crashes. It starts crying for memory. I had issue with its cursor also. It doesn't move for a while then it moves suddenly. So I returned it to Amazon. Other than this picture quality and everything is very good.

Reviews.Title: Youtube app is not compatible with this model
Reviews.Author: sasori "bikeguy"
Reviews.Content: I spoke to a Samsung support agent and confirmed that the YouTube app is not compatible with this particular model.I admit that I didn't check this before I bought this TV, but cum on..., most people think YouTube would be automatic. So, if you are looking to play YouTube videos, look for another model or you'll need a Google Chromecast or Apple TV.I do like everything else about this TV though.

Reviews.Title: good as a tv, but not really smart
Reviews.Author: frank lindemann
Reviews.Content: The picture is good, so as a tv, this is more than acceptable. But the "smart" part is really a toy. There are apps for amazon prime and netflix (haven't tried the netflix yet, don't really use it). The problem is that I want to watch streaming video that has no app (rifftrax). This won't do it. Just doesn't work with flash from its browser.

Reviews.Title: Great picture quality, OK software
Reviews.Author: Jeff Wright
Reviews.Content: Title says it all. You can't really beat the Samsung TV for the quality and price. Only issue I have is the software update setting on the smart tv. We don't use our tv everyday, and when we do, it is usually at the end of the day. At least once every two months we'll turn the device on, go to use the Smart tv function and it will say "upgrading" or "updating". Basically you can't use the smart tv software until it is done. Since that is all we use it for (PLEX, Amazon Prime and Netflix), it is really irritating for us. Still, it only happens once every couple of months. If we had cable or turned it on more frequently, we probably would not notice the issue. Otherwise great tv.

Reviews.Title: Software FAIL
Reviews.Author: Kindle Customer
Reviews.Content: I want to like this TV. I mean, I really, really, really do. The problem isn't the TV itself... it's the software with it. Samsung's "Smart Hub" has to be connected for things like Netflix and Amazon Prime to work. When their servers are down, it's too bad - so sad. We don't have cable or satellite or even real broadcast (we live in the sticks) so we bought this TV SPECIFICALLY for it's Netflix and Amazon video capabilities... and now we go DAYS without because their stupid software needs their own stupid servers to be up.

Reviews.Title: pictures good...
Reviews.Author: Rene
Reviews.Content: Its a Samsung so good picture quality as usual. Smart hub for internet browsing and apps is slow and glitchy. A high quality tv, good price but its smart tv that's acts dumb

Reviews.Title: Great set and looks good on the wall as my PC Monitor
Reviews.Author: kevin P thomas
Reviews.Content: Did a lot of research on a TV that would suit our needs as a PC Monitor. Kept coming back to the Samsung. The price was right and of course prime shipping for free.If you are thinking of this as a PC Monitor, do not hesitate to purchase this 1080P unit. The most important thing when setting up is that you go in and set it correctly. Amazon user - G.Peck, wrote this set up for your screen, and it works great.Mode: DynamicBacklight: 18Contrast: 85Brightness: 50Sharpness: 80Color: 70TInt: G/R 50/50Standard color tone with screen fit in the additional options, with HDMI black level set to low.Then you must make sure (If setting as a PC Monitor) you do the following (Tip by Phoney, Amazon User)  hit SOURCE on the remote, followed by TOOLS and then EDIT NAME on the menu. Change the name to either "PC" or "PC-DVI" and the picture instantly clears up. You get 1:1 pixel mapping and everything looks great!Using these helpful tips from the Amazon users mentioned above (Thank You), I cannot be happier.Brought the extended warranty from Amazon and its cheap for 5 Years (Unlike Worst Buy, oh sorry Best Buy). Years of happy surfing and gaming.

Reviews.Title: Great for plain viewing, bad for wi-fi!
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: This unit has great picture quality and sound.  It is the perfect size for a kid's room.  The Wi-Fi is slow, Samsung even admitted this when I called customer support.  Freezes up when on the internet, especially any interactive program, like for kids.  Even the Samsung Apps already installed.  I will keep it but would not have paid the extra for a Smart TV if I had known.  The Samsung tech support team was great once I got to an agent that was fluent in English.

Reviews.Title: TV
Reviews.Author: Aminata sy
Reviews.Content: I did order this tv for my friendShe told me she loves I everything about itShe said she would  definetely recommand it

Reviews.Title: If you're looking for a wireless tv, don't buy a Samsung
Reviews.Author: Bob Urell
Reviews.Content: Through their "Smart Hub" feature, Samsung claims to have gathered together all the apps and functionality you'd need for a great multimedia experience, but they're lying.  While you can surf the web, you can't watch video on sites, the browser is slow and clunky, and the service is incredibly glitchy.  Samsung funnels all its Smart TV Internet traffic through its servers, which means when the Smart Hub servers are down (often and without any warning or explanation), your Smart TV is just a TV.  For those of us who watch most of our television on Netflix or Amazon, this is maddening.  And the customer service is so bad, there's really no point in calling them.  DO NOT buy this product.

Reviews.Title: Been getting customer support for over 3 hours and counting to get set up...
Reviews.Author: kourtney finnerty
Reviews.Content: The TV itself is nice however, I keep getting a notice that despite the TV stating I am connected to my wireless network I cannot actually connect or use any of the smart TV options.  I have talked to my internet provider and Samsung and still haven't figured it out. I feel like I paid the extra money for nothing..

Reviews.Title: not so smart TV
Reviews.Author: Kevin S. Luthy
Reviews.Content: I think you might as well buy a regular TV and get a roku or use an xbox to stream shows ....the streaming is terrible and freezes up every 30 seconds ....if you download the update onto a flash drive when you stick it in the TV's USB port it says there is no update on the flash drive ....tried the online customer support and they kept closing my chat window and running me around in circles

Reviews.Title: Awesome choice!
Reviews.Author: Jason Marketti
Reviews.Content: I give this five stars for the fast shipping, easy set up and perfect television. I read some people had problems with their color, but I didn't have this trouble. I did, however, take the Eco and energy saving settings off to prevent the TV from dimming repeatedly. I am more than satisfied with this product and would buy another. You won't be sorry with this choice.

Reviews.Title: We finally came out of the stone age
Reviews.Author: Shannan James
Reviews.Content: This is our first hdtv flat screen, we finally have come out of the stone age.  It arrived earlier than expected, easy to follow instructions, and the wifi is awesome, it discovered my network with ease and within seconds we were connected to the internet from the TV.  The samsung apps are awesome, downloaded a few educational ones for my 9 year old.  For the price it's an awesome TV.

Reviews.Title: Nice picture, user friendly.
Reviews.Author: Lauretta H.Mims
Reviews.Content: Nice picture user friendly. I would recommend for family room or any area for family viewing enjoying my new TV

Reviews.Title: "Smart" option has to update almost every time I use this. Also, does not allow me to remove unwanted icons from the main screen
Reviews.Author: Jeremy S.
Reviews.Content: Just about the only redeeming feature of this TV is that it has a web browser, though the interface is not so great.  The main menu has many unwanted large icons that can't be removed. This tv will not stream 720p resolution, even with a 55mbps connection. It seems to run out of memory. Almost every time I turn it on, it needs to update. I should have purchased a regular tv and a roku.

Reviews.Title: Not as expected.
Reviews.Author: I. B. LLC "IB LLC"
Reviews.Content: I have 5year old Samsung that has made me fan of Samsung.  This unit is not that great. in its software part.  Picture quality is great, but it freezes a lot while playing youtube.  I have Verizon fios, so I believe Internet speed is not the issue.  TV itself is freezing even while switching from one app to another.

Reviews.Title: Product Broke two months after bought!
Reviews.Author: Karin Kirby
Reviews.Content: TV was great up until two months in. Then product began shutting itself off and on every minute. It is a defective device!

Reviews.Title: Extremely happy with the TV
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "Cool C"
Reviews.Content: My last LCD TV by Sharp lasted almost 6 years and it cost me $2,500.  It still works by the screen started to show vertical lines and noises.  Finally decide to spend $600 and get this SmartTV by Samsung.  I can say that I am extremely happy with the TV.  However, I am unable to give this 5 starts for a few reason.First are a few pros.  The TV is very easy to setup and it is quite heavy for its size.  The TV stand is strong and compact to hold its weight.  It comes with 3 HDMI ports, and a few USB ports.  There is a PC port and regular analog port.  I attached Xbox 1 to the TV and it worked flawlessly.  I tried to play Blue Ray movie on my XBox 1 and only HDMI 1 allows the move to play.The remote that came with the TV works fine but trying to navigate and type on the SmartTV is futile at best.  I suggest that you get a USB keyboard (about $35) and it works well with the TV.If you have a Samsung smartphone, you will enjoy the way the phone interact with the TV.  You can easily share photos and videos from your Samsung smartphone by beaming it to the TV.  My family love this feature.Now, on to the negatives.  On initial boot up, Samsung requires updates on the SmartHub.  That takes a while if you use wireless network.  Once all the updates are done everything works fine.  One of the thing I noticed about SmartTV is the internal memory is quite small.  You cannot install a lot of apps on the TV.Another negative is using the internet to watch web videos will work for the first 10 minutes until the internal memory is full and the internet app will shut down.  I also tried using the Vevo app.  The SmartTV can play the app videos for the first 20 minutes until the videos start to stutter.  If I am not mistaken, this TV is unable to clear its cache quick enough to continue with the videos.

Reviews.Title: Love it once you have the right settings
Reviews.Author: Maureen
Reviews.Content: When the TV was first set up I was disappointed in the picture quality.  One of my friends checked the reviews and noted that someone else pointed out that you needed to adjust the settings to get the optimal picture.  The settings that were suggested were: Mode - Dynamic, Backlight - 18, Contrast - 85, Brightness - 50, Sharpness - 80, Color - 70, Tint G/R - 50/50.  Standard color tone with screed fit in the additional options, with HDMI black level set to low.  Once I changed the settings to these the picture was FANTASTIC!!

Reviews.Title: horiible TV
Reviews.Author: OG
Reviews.Content: First, I wish there was a O star.The TV stand has a tilt and does not stand straight I have to place folder paper underneath to keep it from tilting back. And the TV usually shuts off itself while playing and restarts, but most times it doesn't. You have to turn it on yourself. And the smart TV would be blank somethings so I have to shut on and off and I guess it kicks in when it feels like.

Reviews.Title: May not work as well as a PC monitor for Mac as you would expect! (Macbook Air Sleep issues)
Reviews.Author: Wadood Chaudhary
Reviews.Content: This HDTV is also ranked high for those trying to make use of it as a PC-Monitor but I found it otherwise. The text never looked as thin, crisp and sharp as on a regular monitor, so if you intend to use it as a monitor also, you may want to take a second look.I had planned to use it 50% as a monitor. After tinkering several days with the setting (changing the source name to PC, lowering the sharpness and brightness and also running high-end calibration tools), there was appreciable improvement but after I compared to a real monitor I realized that it can never come close to a real monitor. No matter what I did, the text will always be a little jagged, faded or fuzzy, regardless.For Windows the text smoothing was passable but on MacBook Air it was decidedly worse. If you are to use it as desktop monitor occasionally, less than 20% of the time, as a multi-media monitor in your living room, or for occasional browsing, then it may just be fine but otherwise as a full time desktop monitor it is not just good enough. You will mess up your eyes. After a while it will seem stupid to work on it, especially if the idea in the first place of having a big monitor was to improve clarity.Also, from my MacBook Air, I routinely ran into Sleep/wakeup issues. If Mac went to sleep, I would have to reboot it for it to connect to the TV. Now it could be something with my HDMI cable or adapter that is messing up the handshake, so I cannot say for sure if it was also the problem with this HDTV.

Reviews.Title: Perfect bedroom tv! Great picture and all the features you could want!
Reviews.Author: Robert J. Furman "Tech and Sci Guy"
Reviews.Content: 5 stars for:It's Smart, yes, a Smart tv that connects wirelessly! No cables other than your HDMI and your power cable if need be.It has a great picture. Adjust it as necessary and off you go!I works with all my other Samsung products like my Samsung Blu-Ray player and my Galaxy phone!Did I say it has a great picture?Very good sound-wise for any television. Works with headphones. Use the jack in the back and just switch to external speakers and no more annoying your sleepmate when you want to watch Jimmy Kimmel late at night.Works with almost all my files via USB flash drive unlike almost every other television I know of.No cons to think of.

Reviews.Title: wow
Reviews.Author: Loretta Pirozzi
Reviews.Content: TV's sure do  a lot these days.  This one is attached to my wireless network and I've been watching old Downton Abbey episodes free from Amazon Prime.  And am catching up to rest of the world.  There's so much more this toy can do that I've barely scratched the surface. It's also attached to my TiVo box which is also on the wireless network.

Reviews.Title: Great TV for the price
Reviews.Author: Robby
Reviews.Content: I was upgrading from and ancient 32" CRT, so pretty much anything I decided to buy would have been an upgrade. HOWEVER, I am  a gamer so I wanted something that could handle some long and intense gaming sessions, having multiple HDMI ports, and not break the bank.I decided to get this model because of the 3 HDMI ports, it lets me use my Xbox 360, PS3, and Wii U with dedicated ports each, while having my cable go in through the component ports. I also plug in my laptop occasionally when I want to use a larger display. The audio for me is fine, but I am not an Audiophile by any means so if you're really picky maybe get a separate sound system.The SMART TV functionality is not really used by my, as my gaming systems are my primary methods of streaming entertainment. HOWEVER I will say this, the powered USB port and the included video software are an excellent feature I didn't know I needed, it lets me plug in my External media hard-drive and play things directly, which is great since I no longer have to stream from my computer to my Xbox or transfer to smaller flash drive when I want to watch my digital media collection.Games I have used with this:TES V - SkyrimFallout 3Fallout New VegasAssassin's Creed Black FlagDark SoulsFinal Fantasy (pretty much all of them)Injustice: Gods Among UsMortal KombatUltimate Marvel vs Capcom 3MinecraftGTA 5Legend of Zelda Wind Waker HDMass Effect 1, 2, and 3Haloand too many other games for me to mention right now. As I said before, it works excellently with all of them and I don't have any problems to mention with it.It is a huge upgrade for me, and the price was too good to beat, especially since I'm currently paying my way through college.

Reviews.Title: overall good tv with terrible streaming capiblities
Reviews.Author: Damon J. Lebeouf "Damon & Kelli"
Reviews.Content: the tv is a tv... good picture and decent sound.  nothing remarkable in todays market place.the problem we have is that the "apps" on the tv actually stream through samsung servers between our home network and the source (netflix, amazing prime).  thats one more link in the chain that can break, and its a so-so link.  on more than one occasion we have not had service, and the error codes were problems with samsungs servers.had i known this i probably would have went with a setup like we have in our other rooms... a smallish tv with a streaming media appliance (apple tv or roku box).***update as of march '14***the streaming has gotten so bad on the tv (constant log outs from services, constant updates on the tv that cripples the tv, constant errors in audio and video from streaming services) i bought a roku box.  the roku box is infinitely superior to samsungs built in "smart" capabilities.the tv picture quality is fantastic, which is to be expected from a samsung set.  however i personally would steer clear of any of their tvs that have built in streaming... you are going to pay for it up front in price and get a subpar service.

Reviews.Title: Good TV with a very poor wireless capability
Reviews.Author: Lucy M Brown
Reviews.Content: When we first set this TV up, it worked fine. TV was about 50 feet from a top of the line, dual band Netgear N900 wireless router. After about a week, it started constantly losing the Internet connection, and failing to detect it. Samsung customer service had us reset the smart hub, after which it held the signal for a day or so, then resumed its problems. Next call to Samsung had us talking to a very grumpy rep insisting that the TV had to be within 20 feet of the router.  If that was acceptable, I would not have gotten a wireless capable TV -- 20' and I can just wire the darn thing. We got a top of the line Netgear wireless dual band extender (WN2500RP), and it showed a great signal right beside the TV. Yet the TV couldn't even detect the extended network or the main network.  Wiring the extender to the TV solved all the TV's problems -- so essentially the TV required a $79 glorified antenna.Besides that, we like the TV and can't be bothered to return it -- not worth our time and it works fine with the new setup. Just mad that Samsung cheaped out on the wireless receiver and they know they did (just do an internet search of "Samsung Smart TV wireless problem"), yet instead of admitting as much they put grumpy customer relations reps on the phone to lie to you. They're probably grumpy because they're fielding so many calls on this very issue.

Reviews.Title: Post update glitches
Reviews.Author: lothar
Reviews.Content: Everything else said about the unit, colour, simplicity, are true. Catch though. To use the USB, ensure that it is FAT formatted (not exFAT).CALIBRATION: as pr earlier forum input, followed the Dynamic option.NETFLIX: looks superb on it, hands down.JITTER: Not that noticeable, or very very minor vs what you would expect from a 60Hz. CMR 120 does a fantastic job.The ratio of image quality to functionality warrants a 5 star, perhaps as much as VIERA TCP55ST60, and why these are the first flat panels I bought for my house, ever, they are that good vs my being that picky.HOWEVER, ONE DAY LATERAm back to one star after realizing that CMR 120 does not work in one picture mode, being 'Greyed out.' When turned on in the rest, it dimms the screen too much to be even passably good contrast.The user Manual does not call it 120CMR but Auto Motion Plus. However, in the Menu, Auto Motion Plus DOES NOT EXIST. It is called LED MOTION PLUS.PRESENTLY:-PICTURE MODE: DYNAMIC  Advanced Setting are Greyed out  Picture Options > LED works but dims the light far too low- PICTURE MODE:STANDARD  ADV Settings Work  Pic Options, > LED Motion works though also dim.- PICTURE MODE: NATURAL  ADV Settings = Greyed out  Picture Options, LED Motion is greyed out- PICTURE MODE: MODE  ADV Settings Work  Pic Options, > LED Motion works though also dim.Samsung could not help and a 32 inch has to be brought to their the center, 89 miles round trip (it is nearly 40 miles outside Montreal.) In addition, they spoke a different language than their own manual or my menu, making things more difficult. What they followed as procedure did not match my onscreen wording....Suspect the issues began with the update the unit did on 31 Jan 14.

Reviews.Title: Does not work with Microsoft Media Center
Reviews.Author: Jim Dodd
Reviews.Content: What is not advertised here or anywhere in the literature about this TV is that it does NOT support the .wtv format which is used by Windows Media Center for recording TV.  So, you cannot stream this content.  I find this really perplexing since other TVs do support this.  Also, Windows Media Center is the single most common software for recording TV on your PC...in the world.  It seems almost arbitrary.  A detailed investigation on-line dug up the fact that Samsung only implements the bare minimum of DLNA on it's "Smart" TV's.  While it provides LOTS of Apps to stream movies and TV via Netflix and other pay sites, it doesn't seem too interested in supporting anyone recording TV shows and watching them on their TV.  Annoying...and disappointing.  Will be returning this TV.

Reviews.Title: smart hub is a joke
Reviews.Author: Matthew
Reviews.Content: while the tv is nice as far as picture quality, not a day goes by that there isnt some issue with smart hub.
