With constant error messages, apps not working properly, server being down. This technology was put out before they had all the kinks worked out. Shame on Samsung. Save yourself the headache, dont buy this tv.

Reviews.Title: The TV is very nice but
Reviews.Author: John W Holverson
Reviews.Content: if you use the smart TV portion of the setup for You Tube there is a problem.  The sound gets ahead of the picture and then the picture will catch up and will play OK for a couple of minutes and then the problem.repeats.  I have talked to Samsung twice and they have been very polite but have not solved the problem.  I thing their is a fix for some of their TV's but I have not been able to find any help for my model.  I am not that technically competent, so I could very well be part of the problem.  But easy to fix has not been my experience.

Reviews.Title: Quite impressed!
Reviews.Author: R. Hunt
Reviews.Content: When I needed a new TV, it had to be a Samsung. Sure, other units have good picture quality too, or offer similar "smart tv" features, etc. But Samsung TVs are just better -- and that's a really hard thing for me to say as a person who otherwise doesn't like their products.Here's why it has to be a Samsung: I live in immediately downtown in a major city, and that means tv signals are bouncing around buildings and doing all sorts of strange things. In other words, tuning in a broadcast channel can at times be far more difficult than seems reasonable. The Sony I replaced in my living room couldn't tune in CBS, and was super picky about NBC, and for everything else I had to constantly adjust the antenna. This Samsung gets all the channels I wanted, plus a few more that I didn't know I could get, and I never touch my antenna any more. I also replaced the LG in my bedroom with a Samsung and got similar results.You wouldn't think the TV itself would have anything to do with the signal, but it does. Samsung TVs have superior tuners.This is my first smart-tv. I only even decided to try it because I saw that it supported Netflix, Hulu, and Amazon -- the three that I use -- so I thought maybe I could get rid of the Roku and cut down to just one remote control. These SmartTV apps are a bit slower to start up, but they otherwise work great.All in all, I'm extremely satisfied with this television.

Reviews.Title: Smart TV my ass!
Reviews.Author: Scott McGrew
Reviews.Content: The networking capability for this unit is severely lacking. It doesn't hold a connection via cable or wifi. I'm constantly having to reboot my router just to get a new connection. And it's not my internet service because neither my phone nor laptop ever have trouble connecting. The tv itself is decent, but this "smart hub" bs is ridiculous. Wish I hadn't bought it. First time I've said that about a Samsung product.

Reviews.Title: Run away from this "smart" tv!
Reviews.Author: AwfulSamsung
Reviews.Content: I have had this tv for a week and it simply does not function as a smart tv. Samsung's alleged smart hub either fails to launch entirely or fails to run even the simplest and most common of apps (netflix etc.) on the rare occasions that it does launch. The picture is average and certainly does not make up for the failure of any semblance of the advertised smart tv features. In summary, this product is awful. I will be returning this and never buying a samsung tv again.

Reviews.Title: stay away
Reviews.Author: real review 716
Reviews.Content: TV hasn't been able to connect for whole day bc proprietary smarthub server is down. No info provided as to when it might work again. Big inconvenience. Taking back to store and looking into chromecast or appletv.

Reviews.Title: my first flatscreen tv
Reviews.Author: S. Schulz
Reviews.Content: I wanted a TV with WiFi since my husband and I have WiFi (no need to buy additional equipment) and since we wanted a TV primarily to watch movies and TV shows from Netflix.  I also wanted a brand with a good reputation.I was concerned by reading reviews that indicate that this TV's picture does not look good out of the box.  I can only conclude that like fine wine, it takes experience to dislike the picture.  It looked great right out of the box to me.The advice someone gave in a review to plug in a keyboard via the USB port was great!  It didn't work with the Netflix app, but it works for putting in the WiFi password, and that password is long...

Reviews.Title: Very nice TV.
Reviews.Author: JB
Reviews.Content: I got this TV for $579. I love the Smarthub menu and the color on this TV are very bright and vibrant.

Reviews.Title: Samsung UN40EH5300 40-Inch 1080p 60Hz LED HDTV, Black
Reviews.Author: norreim
Reviews.Content: My review is short and sweet!!  This is a quality name-brand TV, and based on my personal and many years experience with Samsung products, they have always proven to be consistently reliable and provided outstanding craftsmanship that offers excellent output!  I presently own three Samsung TVs in different rooms of my home and continually receive excellent TV experience myself and guests alike.  I have NEVER had any viewing problems with the quality of Samsung TVs but I ALWAYS experience reception issues with the cable company!!  I purchased this TV as a gift and purposely waited to write this review after receiving feedback from my friend for whom I purchased it for.  She is just as happy with her Samsung TV as I am and have been with mine.

Reviews.Title: Great budget smart HDTV
Reviews.Author: W. Dormann
Reviews.Content: My dad got this TV for Christmas.  It's a perfect sweet spot between being affordable and having good features.  The main problem with the "doorbuster" TVs is that they are lacking in some way, such as having only 2 HDMI inputs.The Smart Hub aspect provides Netflix and other capabilities in a way that's just about as good as the Roku.  So we ended up unplugging their Roku and moving it to another set.When you first get the TV and hook it up to the internet, be sure to allow it to install *all* of the updates before judging the Smart Hub.  It will be unnecessarily slow, and in those first moments of using the TV, it's not even totally clear that it's slow because it's performing updates.  Just be patient, and make sure that everything is updated before you attempt to use it.  It seemed to take several iterations in our case, but that could have been because we interrupted it.This isn't a high-end TV, so you won't get high refresh rates with frame interpolation or gimmicky 3D.  But other than that, I'm having a hard time thinking of what might be missing.*edit* Also note that several useful settings (auto brightness setting, auto clock setting, enhanced audio, etc. are *not* enabled by default).  Be sure to go through all of the settings in the menu to make sure you've got the features you want enabled!

Reviews.Title: Nice screen, software poor
Reviews.Author: James T. Gill
Reviews.Content: The smart software for this TV is just not good.  It always tries to update, even after it has just been updated.  Wastes a lot of time.  Also, it won't stay logged into Netflix sometimes, I have to keep manually putting in my email and password.  Probably on average I must do this 3 times a week.  This is particularly bad when the little kids try to use it, they can't put in the password by themselves.  If you are looking at a smart TV, my recommendation is to just see if a dumb TV + a Roku box is similarly priced.  I like my Roku box much better than the software here.

Reviews.Title: Great picture, fantastic value, "good enough" smart TV funtionality
Reviews.Author: davepy
Reviews.Content: So first off, the picture is stunning.  Yes, it's only 60Hz, but that's all I want at the moment.  I'm sure you get used to the higher refresh rate, but everything at 120Hz or 240Hz has that "soap opera" effect that I find somewhat glaring.  I was happy to pay less (just under $500 during the Black Friday week) for a great looking HDTV.It's not terribly heavy (just over 30lbs) in case you're mounting it.  Easy enough for one decently fit person to pick up and manipulate.  LED-LCD so it's also pretty energy efficient as well.  Looks very good in bright light, and from all different angles, not just directly in front of you.The smart functionality is... good enough.  Which is to say I can watch Amazon Prime, Netflix, YouTube, etc.  The UI isn't terribly user friendly, and I'll eventually hook it up to a media server or a dedicated PC/laptop to better stream my own content, but if you just want to watch the more popular streaming services, it's... good enough.It also works well with your own content over the USB ports.  I pluged in a variety of formats (mkv, mp4, avi, etc.) on a flash drive and the TV handled them all, and even knew to advance to the next episode of a show when the current one was done, and another was available on the drive.  I did have problems with a Microsoft USB keyboard, but it was a gaming KB, so there may have been driver issues.  Haven't tried a mouse yet.  The included browser is terrible to try to use with the included remote.I have been disappointed with integration with my Samsung Galaxy S3 phone--I expected better control over the TV with a remote app, and I haven't really played with Allshare yet, mostly because I don't want to stream content from my phone, just use it as a remote, and I have yet to find any decent app in the Android store.Bottom line, it's a solid TV, especially for the price, with "good enough" smart features, though the UI is lacking.  If you find one on sale near or under $500, it'd be criminal not to pick one up.

Reviews.Title: Samsung Smart TV UN32EH5300
Reviews.Author: Scorpun@aol.com
Reviews.Content: easy set up. price was $70 cheaper than other places. great picture. would suggest purchasing the Logitech K400 wireless keyboard to use sometimes rather than the tv remote when inputting information.

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: Heeled
Reviews.Content: The only downside of that model is that it does not have analog audio output to connect with analog receivers like mine. Easy way around it is an adapter (20$ from amazon) or new audio receiver (a lot more than 20$). Also I hope the apps like netflix, youtube and other will soon be updated by their developers, to allow using external keyboards. The tv hub itself lets you use them, but once you go into an app, you can only use tv remote. Generally great tv, and no soap opera effect. Love it.

Reviews.Title: Works great as a computer monitor
Reviews.Author: H. Goeller
Reviews.Content: I have this TV connected to my Windows 7 computer which has a Ceton Infinitv4 installed.  This install allows me to view all the cable channels I subscribe to via Windows Media Center and also work as a computer monitor.  It takes some fooling around with all the picture settings to get a good picture for TV watching and also computer viewing.  I have also connected my Android and Windows tablets to it just for kicks.  Also, works great for viewing photos and videos from my DSLR.The TV has a nice set of smart features, is easy to install, and looks very nice on my computer desk.  The internal speakers are adequate but I use my external computer speakers for TV viewing.I have not encountered any problems with it.

Reviews.Title: Great bedroom tv.
Reviews.Author: Michael
Reviews.Content: After having an old school tube TV in my bedroom, I decided that it was time for me to upgrade.  I got this 32 inch smart TV at a great price, and it was installed and connected to my network in a matter of 10 minutes.  It downloaded the latest software and it was good to go.  The picture quality is fantastic.

Reviews.Title: Samsung LED
Reviews.Author: Gianni Perez
Reviews.Content: Came in a fast a timely manner. TV works great. Samsung brand is simply amazing and the clarity of the tv is phenomenal. Would definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: Great smart TV
Reviews.Author: M. Saphir
Reviews.Content: When I read some of the other reviews of this TV, I wonder if we (the owners) are all in the same universe. It seems that folks can get really picky and very subjective when it comes to their TV's. Bottom line (for me..) it's a great TV, and has done all it's advertised to do with little or no annoyances. I had absolutely no trouble linking it to my Wi-Fi network. Sure it's a tad slower than my main computer, but that's got a much faster processor and way more RAM. Some people complained about Amazon Prime problems with streaming media--that has been fixed. No problem. All the other apps that I have tried work very well. My problem is that I am on wireless and have a 5GB cap. I load movies at free wi-fi and put them on USB as a work around. I use a Logitech K-400 wireless keyboard, and it works fine. One person asked if the virtual keyboard can be disabled. I have not been able to do that either. It seems to only way you can use the K-400 is when the virtual keyboard is also displayed. Kind of awkward, but no big deal. The software IS kind of klunky, but everything else about this TV is an incredible bargain. I got it new for less than $400.

Reviews.Title: Wonderful Product Brings Joy for Home Entertainment
Reviews.Author: Bijan Kumar
Reviews.Content: This TV is a shear joy to my family. The picture quality is amazing. Sound is also good for a normal homely environment. It does not have a home theatre sound effect but can be achieved by putting soundboard in it. The only problem is that, the TV does not provide a keyboard with it but amazon does have wireless keyboard for this TV set. If I look at the price point, the product except all expectation and probably the best one in its segment. It's a good buy and I will recommend for it.

Reviews.Title: Keeps freezing...
Reviews.Author: Ani Elmaoglu
Reviews.Content: I'm not sure how I feel about this TV.  I bought it for my bedroom to be able to watch stuff on mainly youtube.  I've had it for less than a week and the interface keeps freezing already.  In order to recover, I actually have to turn the TV off and then back on.  Sometimes the screen goes completely black.  I'm going to give it a few more days, but I may end up returning it.

Reviews.Title: My very first wide screen
Reviews.Author: Irene
Reviews.Content: I just bought this last week to replace a very old 19 inch analog magnavox in my bedroom that I have had for 14 years. I was originally just looking at various roku models to hook up to my magnavox so that I could stream netflix and you tube movies in bed at night on a bigger screen than my little 10.5 inch Asus Tablet. As usual I glanced at the "what other people bought after viewing this item" section which led me to tvs, and then from there I found this particular TV and it was on sale at the time for an excellent price, and BAM came the impulse buy just as amazon intended by showing that section LOL.I was shocked at how light it is and that I could carry the box upstairs by myself. It was easy to set up and the picture is gorgeous. I'm enjoying being able to stream video from netflix, amazon, and several other apps. I was able to easily connect both my DVR and my region free dvd player within seconds. The sound is a little tinny, not as rich and full and I had hoped.The smart hub is a little glitchy and will not always open when I want it to. Sometimes it just says "starting" but then disappears without opening. If I leave it alone and come back to it an hour or so later it works fine. I don't know why this is and  I have contacted the "free tech support" that I am supposed to have for 30 days but not gotten a response. All in all, considering that with the sale price I paid less for this 32 inch smart tv than I paid years ago for my 19 inch magnavox I am satisfied, though I doubt it will last me 14 years.

Reviews.Title: worth every penny
Reviews.Author: Chatty Kathy
Reviews.Content: awesome and easy to use! I like that it has a broad spectrum of uses and can display my computer better than my computer monitor! Samsung really nailed it on this one!!

Reviews.Title: Smart TV is great and the picture is fantstic.
Reviews.Author: seniorcitz "Dick"
Reviews.Content: The picture on this smart LED TV  is terrific I only have an HD antenna hooked up to it because it's up in my den and I have Direct/TV on my 55 inch 3D Panasonic Plasma and my 46 inch Samsung LCD..

Reviews.Title: Great College Dorm TV
Reviews.Author: ILIKETURTLES
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV for my college dorm.  We use it to watch movies using netflix, school cable and SNES using the coaxial input, and xbox and input from my laptop using HDMI cords.  The HD channels look pretty good even being input with the coaxial cable, the movies also look good, even though we use the guest wifi network, the slowest internet connection available to us.  The only useful feature of the "smart" part of the TV is the netflix ability.  The TV sits well on top our mini fridge.  The only very minor problem with it was that the included remote batteries only lasted a few months before dying.

Reviews.Title: great tv, less than great remote for a smart tv
Reviews.Author: Mike T. Mckeown
Reviews.Content: The TV and the smart features are great.  It only needs a better remote )with full keyboard) to be perfect.

Reviews.Title: Great television at a very good price.
Reviews.Author: Harold R. Hite
Reviews.Content: This tv is providing me with exactly what I wanted: availability of offerings that truly interest me and at a reasonable price. I wanted to get out from under my cable tv service which gave me mostly things I wasn't interested in. For local tv I use a Mohu antenna and get what I want as well.

Reviews.Title: Great quality, Great TV
Reviews.Author: Moose
Reviews.Content: Pros:Great picture qualityAffordable priceExcellent sound, nice and loudQuick startupCons:Headphone jack doesn't have adjustable volumeYou have to adjust the TV settings to get the best picture

Reviews.Title: Excellent purchase, very good picture, with excellent wifi connection, I recommend it.
Reviews.Author: Fabricio Mero
Reviews.Content: Excellent purchase, very good picture, excellent wifi connection to the internet browser natured and social networking, I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: SAMSUNG.... PERIOD!!!
Reviews.Author: Barbara Miller
Reviews.Content: I own another 32" flatscreen Samsung TV.  I didn't know it then, but later realized it was a parting gift from my late husband who died 4 years ago from cancer.  I am so satisfied with this TV, that Samsung was my only option.  With the SmartTV, I am so totally satisfied, and can't say a bad word about this TV.  If you are considering a 32" SmartTV, then Samsung is the one for you!!!

Reviews.Title: Nice TV
Reviews.Author: suzanne newman
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV for my guest bedroom.  The picture quality is fantastic.  Sound is just OK, but this is typical for TV speakers.

Reviews.Title: Love this TV!!
Reviews.Author: Johanne Corker
Reviews.Content: This is my first Smart TV and my first Samsung.  I researched my purchase for months so I was pretty sold on this brand. Set up was easy and I haven't experienced any problems in the two months I've used it.  The picture quality is beautiful and the reviews really helped with my settings.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: Allison "The Book Wheel"
Reviews.Content: We bought this tv for the spare bedroom and it's fantastic. The quality is great, the size is perfect for a bedroom, and it's light enough for me to have carried up the stairs.

Reviews.Title: love it
Reviews.Author: adg6283
Reviews.Content: Great price, easy to set up, love all the features. I am not good with electronics and I did it all by myself.

Reviews.Title: Samsung Smart TV
Reviews.Author: Linda Moore
Reviews.Content: We love this TV.  Picture is excellent, features easy to use and the sound pretty good without a sound bar.  We couldn't be happier.  We ordered it and in 3 days had it at our door.  We do this again in a heart beat.

Reviews.Title: Love!!
Reviews.Author: Tricia N Udovich
Reviews.Content: This is my first Smart TV....and I'm glad I waited for this one.  The price was unbeatable and the set-up/functionality is a piece of cake.

Reviews.Title: Great TV, Some of the Smart Features...Not So Much!  Still an Excellent Value
Reviews.Author: James M.
Reviews.Content: So why not 5 stars?The TV has the capability for picture in picture (PIP).  However, the second input must be coax.  It has 3 HDMI inputs.  I don't know why it can't support  a second HDMI in the PIP window, but it can't.  I'm hoping this is a software matter.  It would be 5 stars in my book if Samsung could fix it.  Are you listening Samsung?The Samsung Hub features are adequate.  I wouldn't recommend ditching your computer or phone for browsing however:  the link-or-text methods for surfing are clunky at best.  The You Tube link to a Samsung smart phone takes some diddling, but it is workable.  As more of my viewing time shifts away from standard broadcast TV, it's a technology worth the time it takes to get used to.The Samsung Link feature is something else that has escaped my mastery.  The TV sees my phone and computers, however I've yet to be able to access videos, photos or music stored on them.  There is a help line that is accessible if you call during off hours and I'm hoping they can tune me up for that.Overall, it is a tidy package that fits neatly into the confined space that i put it.  Regardless of the foregoing, I bought it primarily for a second TV and in that regard it vastly exceeded my expectations.  It would just be nice if the additional goodies were improved.

Reviews.Title: Great TV for a great price
Reviews.Author: Todd Brehm
Reviews.Content: I have to be honest up front.  This is my 4th Samsung TV, and I did relatively no research into other brands or compared brands.  That being said, this review is just on the tv-not a comparison.  This TV was relatively easy to set up out of the box.  One of the swaying features was the built in WIFI.  And that feature has worked great!  This is my first LED TV and the picture on this is wonderful.  There is a review on this tv that has suggested picture settings which I have used and love.  I have had a couple of issues with Netflix not being available-but I don't get too stressed as I just switch over to my Apple TV.  Overall, for the price and feature content, I think this is a great TV.

Reviews.Title: Problems with Speakers
Reviews.Author: John C. Briggs
Reviews.Content: This is the second time we purchased this monitor within the last year.  We liked the large screen and the clear image. But we have had a problem with the sound on both monitors. The first one conked out after about six months. We thought it was our fault and get external speakers. The second one conked out after three  months.  We contacted the manufacturer and found out that the fault is actually theirs. After more than ten days of correspondence, including waits of 3-5 days for their responses, we do still not have a clear idea of the warranty process. By our best estimates, with us paying for the shipping out and the box and insurance and waiting for up to 14 days for the refurbishment, the warranty for this kind of repair is worthless. In our case, it ends up costing twice as much as buying new external speakers.  We strongly recommend that you factor in the cost of external speakers when buying this product.

Reviews.Title: Upgraded from a CRT
Reviews.Author: Jason Rivera
Reviews.Content: Granted, I'm no connoisseur, I recently bought this to upgrade from my CRT of the past 10 years.  So I'm a bit biased, but this is a great TV for my personal needs.  Make sure and change the settings to what the top-rated commenter has and it'll be great.

Reviews.Title: Great TV, but VERY poor delivery!!
Reviews.Author: W.I.C.J.
Reviews.Content: So far this has been a fantastic TV.  Beautiful, great picture, great sound and thankfully for me my brother in law set it up for us!  The ONLY negative I could site (and it was a big one in my eyes) was that it was shipped in it's own box by FedEx, who dropped it at my front door with nothing more than a quick knock at the door and then they bolted back to the truck.  That might be fine if I had ordered a small package under a hundred dollars, packed in a generic brown box, but to have a $450.00 TV sitting outside my front door in it's own box is just advertising for it to be stolen!  I was ticked.  Very fortunately, I was home at the time and pulled it inside within a minute or two, but buyer beware!  If you're at work or out while this arrives, it will be just waiting for anyone who happens to stroll by that might want a nice, new TV!

Reviews.Title: Really clunky interface/ terrible screen quality
Reviews.Author: marie
Reviews.Content: I've just finished boxing this TV up for return. I've had it out of the box for less than 24 hours.Smart Functions:Although the initial setup was very easy and user friendly, the "smart hub" took me HOURS to set up. Between going back and forth with the "e-manual" and trying to navigate various menus - this thing is overly complicated. Samsung now has a Smart TV 2.0, and now I have learned why, The original (on this tv) is ridiculous. long story short - There are pre-installed apps and hubs that you are not able to delete, including a huge "KIDS" hub- I don't have kids so I tried to get rid of it. Not possible. I went to Best Buy and played with the F6300 which has the 2.0 Smart.. way easier to navigate and easier on the eyes.Screen Display:Meh. Not impressed, even after adjusting to suggested calibration settings. I experienced the "ghosting" on my black screen that some people have complained about and there was also on pixel out. One single white dot in the middle of your screen gets really annoying. There was also a light coming from behind the TV, maybe through the vents, which was obnoxious in low lighting.All in all, this was better than the tv I had, but not nearly the tv I wanted.

Reviews.Title: IR Sensor Location for this TV
Reviews.Author: Richard N. Richards
Reviews.Content: For my application this television is attached to a TV lift system inside a cabinet.  Accordingly I needed to know the location of the IR sensor.  With that location known, I was going to attach one of those sticky-backed IR repeater heads.  As most TV's sit out in the open, I suppose most folks don't to know where the sensor is, as I could find no information on the web about this specific model.  And it appears Samsung moves the sensor around from model-to model, so you can't assume much.Eventually I concluded it was somewhere in the lower right corner.  Even with that information,  I had a LOT of trouble locating it.  Through trial-and-error, I located it just to the left of the center of the red light on the bottom right of the TV.  The sensor shares the same plastic window as the light.  For me it was extremely finicky.  If the repeater head was moved even slightly, you could not control the TV.  Hope this helps anyone who needs to to locate this sensor

Reviews.Title: Super image, good sound and a lot of apps.
Reviews.Author: Richard Keller
Reviews.Content: I bought this thru QVC as it was on sale with free shipping and 6 payments, but wanted to write a review here.  I bought the 40" for my bedroom.I have a Panasonic, Zenith and Mitsubishi HDTV's and this Samsung has by far the best image IMO and the Mitsubishi 73" was considered top of the line when I bought it.  I don't know what it is, but this sets image is amazing after you do some tweaking of the settings.  A couple times I was just looking at it thinking wow.  I don't know a lot about the 60/120/240 refresh stuff that makes other sets cost a lot more, but this is more than fine so save your $$$$.The sound from a thin HDTV is not bad.  This is used in a bedroom and setting it to about 25-30 is fine and sounds good.I connected to the internet and was using apps quickly and all I tried worked well.  They do load slower than a computer, however the speed was OK.  There are almost 700 apps available for this model so you can find a little bit of everything.There is a Samsung program you can download to your computer that lets you access all your pictures, videos and music from the TV.  I installed it and it only took a few minutes to setup and my home videos and pics look great on the TV.  I would do this if you can.  Really fun.

Reviews.Title: Great TV ..
Reviews.Author: Bryan J Heasty
Reviews.Content: Samsung TV, Blue Ray player and Sound Bar work flawlessly together. This TV replaces another name brand and I can now see why Samsung is number one in electronics!

Reviews.Title: Wow!  What a television...and smart too!
Reviews.Author: Housemouse
Reviews.Content: I am in love with this tv, from the moment FedEx dropped it off until it was all hooked up.  First of all, it weighs practically nothing.  It is replacing a 2006 32" Sharp Aquos flat tv that weighs at least 40 lbs!  This Samsung weighs about 12 lbs.  It made putting it up on the mount very, very easy for me.  When installing it, I ran into a strange problem that was easily fixed...I needed to enter the code for my wireless internet, and it had dashes in it and there are no dashes on the onscreen keyboard provided, but while waiting for someone at Samsung to figure it out, I did!  I remembered seeing USB ports, grabbed a real keyboard that uses USB ports, plugged it in, and viola!  I could enter the complete code for my internet!The real wow-moment was when I got it hooked up (very quickly) to my Dish Network DVR.  OMG, what an amazing and gorgeous screen!!!!  It made my 720p Sharp Aquos look like garbage by comparison!  I was lucky that the day I got it hooked up, the Syfy Channel ran all the Star Trek movies in full HD and it made me appreciate those movies all over again.  It was hard to look away!The Smart TV is impressive too.  I'm coming from a Roku, which has now been put in my son's room.  I can continue watching whatever I've got going on the TV until I settle in on whatever app I'm using.  It's a  simple 2 step system that keeps me watching TV until I've found what I want through the apps.  But with Roku, you leave the TV program, switch whatever system you are in to go to the Roku, search through a ton of stuff to find what you want, and there is no You Tube in it.  But there IS You Tube in the Smart TV apps, and it's great!  I subscribe to some public access channels and can keep myself laughing for hours watching some of them.  And I'm an Amazon Prime member, and I love having that access.  It works beautifully!  And a  lot more easily too.I received this TV the 3rd week of September and the TV is listed as being made on 8/31/13!  So it was fresh off the manufacturing line and there were very few updates at all as it was installed.I signed up my TV online and was given an additional 3 months of warranty for a total of 15 mos. warranty.Everything about this set has impressed me so very much.  I have one small thing that bothers me, and that is the sleep timer.  When my Aquos had its sleep timer turned on, it stayed on.  But for the sleep timer to work on this TV, it has to be turned on each and every time.  I simply forget.  It needs to be set so when it's on, it stays on until it is turned off.  That would  be a software update, I guess.  And if that is my only problem,  I feel like I've got a really amazing product!Overall, I totally love this TV!  Lightweight, gorgeous picture, fantasic internet apps, etc, etc.  I couldn't be more pleased.

Reviews.Title: Amazing TV at this price
Reviews.Author: Wild Bill
Reviews.Content: I have always been a Sony fan, but after trying one of their LED TVs at home for a week I had to return it.  Technically, I have the Samsung UN40EH6000 - the 6030 is a slight update to my 2012 model.  Beautiful picture with logical controls. One important tip is to turn off the "Auto Motion" or some similar name in the settings.  With that setting on, everything has a "Soap Opera" look to it - kind of jumpy. Some people must like it because it is on by default, but I thought it was going to be another return until I discovered this is an optional setting.  Audio quality is only so-so but again for the price range, this TV is incredible!  For only slightly more than several of the no-name brands at the big box stores you can purchase a quality TV. This review is based on 10 months of use.

Reviews.Title: not bad for the price
Reviews.Author: S. Wettimuny
Reviews.Content: NOt the BEST TV I've every bought, but decent for the price.  I got this for my dad to use and so far he's had problems with the operating system locking up when watching long streams.  So far we've hooked up a computer to it so he can watch streams better.  I really don't like the Samsung interface.  It lags and always wants to update.  Plus with out a keyboard its quite a hassle to navigate the net or even youtube.  If your buying it as a smart TV you could probably find better options.  If your using it for TV it seems good  enough and if your like me and your using it also as a monitor then it's fine.

Reviews.Title: Excellent
Reviews.Author: Morris M.
Reviews.Content: I'm sold on Samsung since I bought a Samsung Galaxy S2 phone and Samsung Tab 7 tablet. This television exceeds my expectations. The picture is big and bright, the sound perfect and it fit the wall mount I already had up. Lots of nice features too.

Reviews.Title: very nice tv better then my older model
Reviews.Author: marina
Reviews.Content: first thing first my older modell of the same brand smart tv but just has a bigger screen. this one has built in wifi unlike the other one (which u needed a usb to catch connection) it has all the nice features along with extras. u shud give it a try and buy it off amazon if u dnt like it just return it.

Reviews.Title: Questioned the Smartness Capabilities of the Set- Was Really Surprised
Reviews.Author: Clinton Biddle
Reviews.Content: Purchased the set as a second for the bedroom. Was surprised to find  that through the Wi-Fi connection I could pick up most of my cable channels. This was a savings to me since I didn't have to rent an additional cable box! Found Set Up and channel programming to be a bit challenging.Still working it out. It would have been helpful to have better  access through telephone land lines for tech support.Considering everything, Purchasing this unit was a very good idea. I'd give it a 9 out of 10 for Consumer Satisfaction.

Reviews.Title: I Love This Television
Reviews.Author: P. Bivens "Quietfire"
Reviews.Content: Recently moved and bought this.  It was very easy to set up, connect to the internet and to WI-Fi.  It took less than 5 minutes to obtain the Wi-Fi connection.  The apps are useful; however, HuluPlus is a pay service as are a couple of the others.  I have Amazon Prime and it is very easy to download movies although sometimes difficult navigating what I'd like to see.  The picture quality is clear and I plan on buying another smart television in the future.

Reviews.Title: Great TV Good Price
Reviews.Author: Nor'easter
Reviews.Content: This TV is NOT the newest one with all of the smart features,it was the first edition. It works fine ,my only concern was when I registered it on samsungs web site the year that this TV was made was 2011?????.the serial number automatically shows you the date is was made. Where has it been for two plus years?

Reviews.Title: First new tv in 20 years
Reviews.Author: Daniel R Bell
Reviews.Content: I got this TV because I got tired of trying to see small print on an old GE 27".After doing a lot of research and reading reviews I decided to buy the Samsung smart tv & I am not disappointed.I'm still learning how to use it, but so far I love it. It was easy to set up and I'm using wifi to use with my computer & my smart phone.The picture is great & I think I got a great deal from Amazon.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: Will Skinner
Reviews.Content: I read reviews and researched this for a couple of weeks looking for the best picture, price and it had to be a smart TV. I already have a 55" Samsung smart TV and love it so when this was out there at a very reasonable price for all it offered it was a no brainer. I have had it for a few months now and still loving it.

Reviews.Title: Excellent TV only if you are lucky enough to have one without any issue
Reviews.Author: Addison Paul
Reviews.Content: This TV is really goo in terms of Picture Quality, clarity, contrast, colors etc. Don't have any complaints with this model. The problems i observed with this series of TV's are the same as experienced by other users and after few exchange of TV via samsung i observed that these issues are quality control related.....1. In first set i got dead pixels which were only visible from 6 to 10 inch of the screen, ofcourse no one watch from that closer but hey i paid for perfect condition brand new TV then why should i take one with defect. Best way to check dead pixel is to connect laptop, open browser in fullscreen by pressing F11 and then notice pixels closely throughout the screen by having background color as BLACK, WHITE, RED, BLUE and GREEN. reason of trying with all colors is sometimes these dead pixels only visible on specific color background2. After warrenty repair still dead pixels were there as instead of changing screen they replace the complete motherboard/circuit of the TV. No issues as i can again send it for repair under warranty :( and wait for 2 to 3 weeks to receive the repaired TV back with issue still exists. Don't lough its true'the repaired TV i got was now not having the dead pixel but one more defect.....Connect coaxial cable from your TV box to TV open any channel and go to the menu of TV under settings theres option called caption ON/OFF (Menu of the TV remote not the cable box) and then see the creen it will be filled with some special characters running on whole screen they looks like something which i can't even type but they are computer coding characters which won't allow you to have glimpse of picture you are intended to watch.one more defect :-( it was when you play Netflix it wont play any movie and keep displaying error message we are having trouble connecting please try again later untill you keep pressing OK button for at least 10 times.3. So here come's my replacement TV from Samsung with at least the dead pixel was not there as it was replacement not repair and also Netflix working fast (i compared using netflix on both TVs together in hand before returning older one) but still with Caption issue i told in step 2 above still existsAfter having so much trouble and wait time for TV and then headache to send TV by dropping to UPS as they don't do home repair for 32 inch TV, i decided to keep it with caption issue existing as it only happens while watching cable box and then too by using samsung TV's caption option. I can still use cable box caption option enable and watch everything perfectly.Overall this TV is best in its class in terms of features it provide, really cheap as compare to other brands,, Also Its the smart TV which support applications to watch VUDU or HULU or facebook etc. As i said in review heading TV is good if you are lucky enough to have one without these quality control related Samsung issues otherwise all the very best with Samsung warranty support.I went through this lengthy cycle/hassle as i just crossed the amazon return period before i discovered first issue in my TV and i ended up going through warranty.Samsung - If you are reading this, please improve your quality control methods before delivering the products to consumer. I know you are the largest LCD/LED panel manufacturer in the market and first in the market to introduce next generation panels for the TV. I also know dead pixels are common in TV's and most manufacturer even don't cover them under warranty until they are large enough in number to bother your watching experience. but I'll still suggest to have better customer feedback and quality product manufacturer brand in your bucket, you need to be little ahead in the mkt trends. why to deliver the panel to consumer if you know its faulty and just wait for the complain until customer discovers and if not then you saved small bucks as customer don't even know he has dead pixel.Buyers - Please check your screen Panel thoroughly within return period of Amazon to have screen without dead pixels. there are plenty of googled articles to explain how to check them easy enough.

Reviews.Title: Great TV for the price
Reviews.Author: Brian P Henry
Reviews.Content: Great picture quality, good sound, software probably the best of whats out there (Amazon Prime, Netflix; much better than similar software from Sony, etc).

Reviews.Title: Great Product
Reviews.Author: Max
Reviews.Content: This was everything that I wanted. Great picture. Great sound. Smart TV. Great PriceYou can't go wrong with this.

Reviews.Title: A VERY smart TV!
Reviews.Author: KWS
Reviews.Content: It was a challenge finding a smaller TV with the higher dpi and smart features.  This one fills the bill perfectly, and Amazon had the best price.  I set it up myself in 10 minutes and was streaming Netflix shows shortly thereafter.  The sound is outstanding for the price.  I was so inspired that I even joined Amazon Prime to increase the video library available to me.  (Hmmm.  I guess there IS a method to their madness!).

Reviews.Title: Small Sized Smart TV
Reviews.Author: Nazmi Can Anik "finishim"
Reviews.Content: If you can get this on sale, it is a very good product. High quality TV with smaller size. The SMART functions are pretty good. Easy access to Netflix, Youtube, Hulu Plus are very convenient. You can attach a keyboard/mouse to use with these functions as well. Somehow the keyboard did not work within the apps. The TV does support Audio Return Channel, which helps out as it does not have so many inputs and outputs.Pros:*Good quality TV.*Supports Audio Return Channel*Supports keyboard and mouse usage for SMART functions*SMART features are nice*3 HDMI inputsCons:*By itself the sound quality is what you would expect from a TV. Connect some speakers.*Has only 1 old type of input for Video/Audio. Might be a con if you have older hardware.*Keyboard and mouse do not work within the applications themselves.

Reviews.Title: Horray for Smart TV
Reviews.Author: Tria Maria "Curious, modern unique shopper"
Reviews.Content: The picture quality is good. This TV is for my parents and they find the smart features easy to use. They are older and not the most tech savvy people on the planet. They love the quick access to Amazon Instant Video and Netflix.

Reviews.Title: Second times a charm.
Reviews.Author: Anthony C. Sivadge "Tony S."
Reviews.Content: Picked up this TV after doing tons of research. The first one I got was a big disappointment. I bought it to replace a LG 720i, 37in. I was expecting to be blown away and the picture was nowhere close to the old one. I tried adjusting it for 2 weeks and never got an acceptable picture. Colors were off, skin tones not even close and any bright light on the screen washed everything out. I exchanged the set and got another one. Wow, amazing picture and colors. My only complaint is that I can't seem to get true Dolby 5.1 sound when viewing TV (not a big deal, I use the sound through the sat. box if I want home theater) it does deliver true Dolby when streaming. If I would have simply returned the set I would be giving it maybe 1 star, but the new set is beautiful. So I guess the bottom line is, if you aren't happy with the picture quality, you got a lemon, but if you get a good one it's heaven.

Reviews.Title: The Best
Reviews.Author: Dwayne James
Reviews.Content: Great price for an excellent tv, nothing beats samsung when it comes to picture quality, the colors are very vibrant, the wifi feature is easy to setup

Reviews.Title: Excellent picture quality
Reviews.Author: Carlos Hernandez
Reviews.Content: No problems whatsoever with this tv, I read people complaining about connection issues with the apps and the internet, check your internet connection is not the tv, This Samsung UN40EH5300 is beautiful, picture quality is excellent, the colors are outstanding, blacks, contrast and video processing are excellent, Your best setting will be in Dynamic mode, right out of the box the picture is excellent, I left it in Dynamic mode and did not even touch anything else except for the sound which I made some changes, but other than that this tv is great.

Reviews.Title: It's a good TV with some issues
Reviews.Author: iloggedonforthis "iloggedonforthis"
Reviews.Content: THe picture is very good. As a TV it works well and sounds good. My issues are with some of the add-ons. For example the Smarthub has a  web browser and you are supposed to be able to use the remote to move a pointer like a mouse.  The issue is the pointer part doesn't work when you get it. The pointer will appear, but you can't make it move. That's a bug.Another issue is connections to an external speaker. When I tried to use a Y connector (recommended) I get a loud ground load hum from the external speakers. That added additional cost to buy a Ground Load Isolator and extra cables to fix the problem. Unexpected costs added for no good reason.

Reviews.Title: Samsung UN32EH5300!!!
Reviews.Author: Zacarias
Reviews.Content: I spend almost 4 months of getting information about the perfect TV!! sadly I never found it, but then I thought why? because I was expecting too much of this devices, I can conclude that Samsung UNEH5300 works very well, even the Smart TV feature, I was so impress because this is my first HDTV, also a very important thing is "it depends YOUR internet connection to really appreciate Smart TV" My friends I was very scared about it, my first HDTV, buying for Amazon and the whole shipping, but everything was wonderful and fast. I can fully express that my first reaction was WOW!!!!Greatness is the word to describe this TV.P.S I will update with photos and more about this article, soon.

Reviews.Title: Great 'smart' TV
Reviews.Author: Peter Reque "Pete"
Reviews.Content: Great picture and easy internet connection (if you have your passwords handy). No problems with set-up, though there's got to be a better design for the stand. Minus one star for less than stellar manual, too shiny surfaces, awkward stand and unhelpful online support. Using add-on speakers means volume control on remote does not work. Samsung says wireless keyboard and mouse can be used, but does not say anything more. Which work, which don't? I'd buy it again.

Reviews.Title: Samsung UN32EH5300 32" 1080p LED HDTV
Reviews.Author: Don W. Jackson
Reviews.Content: Everything works fine. Murphy's Law dictates that I found same TV for $100 less just after I purchased this one.This is a low end Smart TV but it has everything most users would need.CONS: only 2 HDMI Ports

Reviews.Title: Should have bought a Vizio
Reviews.Author: Sweets
Reviews.Content: Poor customer service, constantly having to update smart hub to use the only 2 apps I use on the TV, Netflix and Hulu, but hey, the picture is great when it isn't updating or losing connection. Wish I could delete the 20 other apps I NEVER use so when I accidentally click on them they don't update for another 10 minutes or freeze the TV. Such a hassle every day. Man I hope this thing sells on ebay.

Reviews.Title: Smart tv that wont function...
Reviews.Author: Kayla Manning
Reviews.Content: We bought a smart tv because we wanted to use the netflix on it. We have had nothing but problems since we bought the tv. The netflix is always saying that an error has occured and sometimes wont even turn on. We called customer service and spent an hour updating the tv and have continued to have nothing but issues. I looked up the issue and found tons of reviews of people with the same issues have never had any resolve. Will never buy from Samsung again. Not impressed at all with the product I recieved.

Reviews.Title: Great tv at a great price
Reviews.Author: DoctorRock
Reviews.Content: 46 smart, wireless,led tv for under 500? What a world we live in. It has all the outputs you could need, including optical audio. The App Store is very easy to use and set up. Wireless internet actually works great, no lag. Has mounting screws built in so getting it to the wall is easy with a basic mount kit. USB and hdmi profs on the side make for easy access.My only issue, and this is me being picky, is that the remote is not typing friendly, so if you want to really take advantage of all the features this tv has. You can stream all kinds of whatever with the browser or just use apps for Hulu, YouTube, and Netflix. The good news is that it will  work with many wireless keyboards/mice. Browsing the web on the tv is pretty fun like this.Overall, the smart feature functionality make this tv almost like a large tablet. That combined with great picture quality and easy USB access make this a fantastic deal. 5 stars.

Reviews.Title: Great set with minor Samsung issues
Reviews.Author: Justin G.
Reviews.Content: This is my second Samsung TV in the house but first LED.  Like others reviewers have said, the picture out of the box is terrible but easily fixable with  tweaking the settings and some patience.  The Smart TV features with built in Wi-Fi are worth the slight increased price over the exact base model, also this one has a few additional USB and HDMI ports than the next step down.My one downside has nothing really to do with the TV exactly, but more with the change from Samsung AllShare of Samsung Link (sharing app for watching files across Samsung devices).  This app is also responsible for playing files from a HDD.  This has been a crap shoot for me.  My WD 1TB HDD works perfectly fine on my larger Samsung TV with older firmware, detects the drive and plays away.  This model will see the HDD, but will just sit on the Samsung Link screen with "loading" displayed forever.  I first thought it was a size issue (even though 1TB is rather small these days), but I plugged in a Seagate 3TB drive and it loaded instantly and allowed streaming from the drive.  No rhyme or reason for the difference.  Samsung Link also doesn't stream per se, rather makes files available to other devices and makes you download them (unless I'm using it wrong but this is how it behaves on my GS III phone, input is welcome if someone know differently).  Thankfully I kept an old installer for the AllShare app to continue streaming between all my Samsung devices.The rest of the Smart TV features are awesome as expected, Netflix, Amazon, YouTube and all the other staple apps are included and easy to configure.I'm typically not a brand loyal person, but this model is replacing a 32" LG LCD TV that had issues from day one (cheap panels in those folks, you've been warned) and I couldn't be happier with Samsung overall.  Would recommend this TV to anyone, it's a bit more expensive than similar 32" models from other brands but to me it is worth it to bite the bullet and get a quality unit.

Reviews.Title: Samsung is dropping the ball  !!!!!
Reviews.Author: Daniel
Reviews.Content: I must say it is a good deal; and for some people it may be a super deal. In my case I was disappointed. I bought this Samsung product to double as HDTV and Extended Monitor. I got my new 23" HP envy all-in-one 3 days before I got this HDTV; The Monitor of the HP is just amazing, the calibration is second to none. I was just blown away by the accuracy of the colors and the tones of the HP monitor. Then I got my 32" inches Samsung, I was so excited because according to the reviews this is one of the best 32" LED HDTV that you can get around $380. After I installed the Samsung TV; I noticed that the colors looked washed and really dimed. I read in the reviews that you need to re-calibrate the Samsung HDTV; because the stock settings are just really bad. For me; that I have the HP monitor just next to the Samsung HDTV it was super noticeable. So I started calibrating the Samsung HDTV with set ups that I found in reviews and sites. Neither of them came close to my HP monitor image quality. After checking different cables, softwares, set-ups, modes  and advanced settings for a whole afternoon I accomplished to get a set up that made the Samsung HDTV to look acceptable; However it is still far from the perfect image quality of the HP monitor. I compared my 3 year old 26" LED VIZIO HDTV with the Samsung and I must tell you that the VIZIO looks great with the default settings. Samsung instead of putting all that crap of software in your "SMART TV" you should calibrate in factory your TVs; some people may not have a second TV or monitor to compare; hence they are stock with a really bad configuration. I must say that the wireless feature in the Samsung HDTV is really amazing.

Reviews.Title: One significant drawback...
Reviews.Author: juanita kiteless
Reviews.Content: The TV itself is great. Great picture, great sound, great value. However. The "Smart Hub", which was a significant selling point of the device for me (hey, you mean I don't have to buy a peripheral device to stream media content? Awesome!), has a huge drawback. The apps on your TV require communicating with Samsung's servers. If the servers are down or undergoing maintenance, guess what? You don't get to watch Netflix, or Hulu Plus, or anything you have an app for.I set up my TV on Sunday and had no problems, although the constant software updating every time I turned on the TV was a bit annoying. On Monday night, I fell asleep with Netflix on and woke up to shut it off. I ended up not being able to go back to sleep right away, so I decided to watch something else. This time Smart Hub took a significantly longer time to load, and I could not open any of the apps at all. Instead I got a message reading "ERROR_MODEL_BIND" and was told to check my network settings. Which were fine. Every other device in my house was picking up the wifi signal, no sweat. I checked it a couple more times. Same message. I shut it off in defeat. This morning it worked fine again.After Googling the error message, this seems to be a frequently occurring problem for a lot of Smart TV owners. I wish I'd bothered to look it up before I bought the TV or I wouldn't have bothered getting this model.

Reviews.Title: Price Good, TV Not so SMART
Reviews.Author: AFRED "Allyka"
Reviews.Content: At its discounted price, this TV was a good deal.  Much thinner and lighter (12 lbs) than old TV sets, though not as thin as newest sets.  The picture is not as good as plasma in terms of clarity when looking a people's faces, but it is a fine picture.  Using installed apps to access netflix, hulu, etc is terrific.  However,  there  is a discrepancy between what I thought internet access means and what the set actually offers.  If you had planned to catch up on PBS programs or latest missed network TV shows by accessing their sites online or using comcast infinity online, forget it.  During setup you find you cannot update the adobe flash player.  That update is necessary to continue to play those online archives.  Curiously, the content of the network players ran just fine the first time I accessed them until the update notice popped up. After several flash player update failures, the browser refused to run any flash enabled ABC network content except for the introductory ads.  Other folks have had problems accessing any internet content requiring latest flash player.  What is odd is that I had access until I attempted to update.  As mention by others, the web browser is clunky and manipulating a TV remote to access its features is frustrating.  We simply attach an old wireless capable laptop with an HDMI cable to play internet content.  For us, the netflix and other apps offer minimal increase in internet functionality over our old setup with our old TV and a laptop.

Reviews.Title: Really good TV
Reviews.Author: A. Garcia
Reviews.Content: I have had this TV for over a month. It has a very good picture. Watching Netflix in HD is awesome and I haven't had a single issue with the wireless connection (the router is two rooms away). One thing to have in mind is that the Eco mode can made the colors fade and darken the screen in the middle of a movie, particularly when you are watching wireless internet content or a movie through HDMI cable. However, the solution is simple ---turn the Eco mode off. Since I didn't bought the TV for the auto-adjust function and I prefer to calibrate color and brightness myself, I give it 5 stars. It has everything I wanted for an affordable price.

Reviews.Title: No Amazon Prime
Reviews.Author: Luz
Reviews.Content: Nice picture and features but I was very dissappointed that I could not get Amazon Prime software for movies and television thru the Internet with this TV.  Samsung does not support this feature, even with TV's purchased thru Amazon.

Reviews.Title: love this TV
Reviews.Author: K. Horne
Reviews.Content: update: I took off a star after using the TV awhile, I noticed that the internet related features run slow because the TV is just underpowered by a single cpu core making the cpu the bottleneck and NOT the internet speed (besides I even tried direct ethernet cable approach with a normal average speed of 50Mbps).  The UN40EH5000 is the exact same TV without the internet and it is usually about $50 cheaper, wish I got it.  The internet features can be added to this TV by simply adding an intenet capable blu ray player for less than $100 and it will run FAST.  Also the speakers ARE underpowered, even for my not picky audio requirements. You can fix this easily by addng external speakers but they aren't free.  Also I turn off alot of the power saving features to improve the picture quality, try it, you will see what i mean.version TH01 is great, version HH02 not so much, different settings and rumored to have different panels.  I have two TH01 versions now so I really like them.The remote can also be used to control your Samsung Blu ray player and they link together nicely and automatically. I use a Logitech K400 keyboard with it sometimes, works great.rumor: versions starting with H use Sharp brand panels, versions starting with T use Samsung panels, ie TH01 = excellent, HH02 = goodIf you see one on display in a store check the version# on the back.  A store I went to had TH01 on display but only HH02 in stock.

Reviews.Title: No HBO GO, No Amazon
Reviews.Author: OG
Reviews.Content: I thought I would be able to watch HBO GO and Amazon video on this television.For some reason this model does not have either of these apps and when I spoke to customer service, they indicated that they had no idea when/if these would become available on this model.It's a nice looking television, but obviously it is severely limited in the app department.Other models of Samsung tv's have these apps.Updated - now has hbo go. no amazon still.

Reviews.Title: Great Picture and price
Reviews.Author: Jared "jc"
Reviews.Content: This TV has a very nice, crisp picture. We all should know by now that the speakers on these TVs are very limited so let's not even go there. The TV looks great mounted on the wall (Cheetah Mounts on Amazon you just can't beat!).The internet functions are a little slow to respond. Get a phone app for remote control so when you need to type in stuff for apps or browsing internet you can use a keyboard because trying to point the arrow at letters and select them is tedious and aggravating.All in all it's a very good TV for the price (around $600).

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: Andrew Golomb "The G"
Reviews.Content: For the price this TV is fantastic.  I purchased it for my bedroom a few months ago and I am very pleased with it.  It is my second Smart TV and I really like the interface, very easy to use.  The TV is also very light weight, it weighs less than my 20" computer monitor.  Picture looks extremely clear, colors look vibrant and darks look great.

Reviews.Title: I am SO HAPPY that I bought this Smart TV
Reviews.Author: Silvia Carry
Reviews.Content: By the time bought this for my bedroom, we already had 3 flatscreen TVs in the house. And I had a 22 inch in my bedroom, which was too small.Anyway, I wanted a smart TV and after a great deal of thought and research I bought his one.I never watched much TV before, and I'm really selective as to what I watch. But now my choices are endless, with Netflix, and Amazon Videos ( I have Prime) and all the other choices available that  I'm glued to the TV. It has built in WI-FI, and a huge variety of options. It's truly fantastic.I can't wait for the large TV in the family room to die so we can buy one of these, the largest we can find!...LOL

Reviews.Title: I love it!
Reviews.Author: Back to schooler
Reviews.Content: The picture is fantastic in all lighting of the room.  The applications were easy to access and the sound is great!  I love being able to access the online content without any other equipment.

Reviews.Title: Beautiful screen, but could not get Smart TV functions to work
Reviews.Author: Dariushd "sirlee"
Reviews.Content: I bought this at a local big box retailer for my mom, and after spending 3 hours trying to get it working, I had to return it for a simpler TV from a different maker. In short, the TV looked beautiful with a fantastic screen and a great look to it. But when it came to setting it up for Smart apps (like Netflix), it would not work. It connected to the Internet and acknowledged the connection, but not a single Smart app worked. An hour call into Samsung tech support, who was very accommodating, proved completely fruitless, as they wound up suggesting getting someone out there to service the unit. It was 3 hours after I bought it, so I took it back and bought a different make TV. I could only imagine how complicated the TV would have been for mom had it crashed without me around, and so in the end, it was better for her to have a non-smart TV hooked up to a simple Roku box instead, which is what I did, costing about the same in the end. I will now be very skeptical of Samsung Smart TV features, and would need to see a fully functioning unit in person before ever considering it again. For me set-top boxes seem the better way to go after this encounter.

Reviews.Title: pros and cons
Reviews.Author: SurfnCA
Reviews.Content: this TV is fast on regular antenna TV use , has an excellent picture and the price is fantastic but.....no youtube app option and absolutely no reliability on apps the processor is way too weak ( dont even think about using the regular web as you ll be seating for the page to load for hours)...if you buy it you must get apple TV then in combination with it it becomes an amazing deal

Reviews.Title: Not a good as the reviews said
Reviews.Author: Claire Pirie
Reviews.Content: I got this thinking I was upgrading my tv.  It was notI found the picture to be grainy, sound tinny and the closed captioning was in the middle of the picture.As a hearing impaired person I rely on closed captioning,  it is not good if it interfers with viewing the picture.So I sent it back.  That was very easy although I did have to pay for return postage.

Reviews.Title: Why ruin a good TV with a bunch of junk apps?
Reviews.Author: Discerning consumer "R. Coughlin"
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV due to Samsung's good reputation. The set-up with Time Warner's cable box was a bit cumbersome but that might be true with other TVs. The picture on cable was excellent but then I tried switching to Netflix and noticed a significant decrease in picture quality. Thinking that this might simply be a function of less resolution on an Internet connection I tried hooking up my "old" Roku XD box (which has a max resolution of 720) and noticed that the same Netflix program looked somewhat sharper than through the set's built-in wifi. The fact that the built-in wifi performs worse (or at least no better than) a two-year old Roku gave me pause to reconsider the wisdom of my purchase The picture degradation may be a function of having Netflix routed through Samsung's servers rather than through a direct connection to Netflix. I'm not enough of a techie to comment on the details here, but I know what I see and what I see doesn't impress me at all. In addition, the apps screen came clogged with various Samsung-sponsored programs in which I have zero interest. I don't want these things much less have them pre-installed on my set and forced to look at them every time I go to Netflix or Hulu. Maybe Samsung thinks that it's "smart" to herd customers into their proprietary offerings. I disagree, so back to the store with this set.

Reviews.Title: GREAT BUY
Reviews.Author: Kadiesha
Reviews.Content: This TV looks great in my living room. The picture quality was a little off at first, but I followed one of the reviews settings, and it looks superb. Great price, even greater TV. Very pleased with this purchase.

Reviews.Title: great picture
Reviews.Author: Sandra
Reviews.Content: This is my first smart tv and although I am a tech novice, I have found this to be fairly easy to set up

Reviews.Title: Really Great So Far
Reviews.Author: Mark
Reviews.Content: Just to clarify, this review is for the Samsung UN46EH4300 46 Inch 60Hz (2013 model) LED television.  It just arrived yesterday and I got it set up last night.The packaging it arrived in was done very well and offered alot of protection for the TV which I was very happy to see (double boxed with a cool packing material I hadnt seen before, really nice).I have looked at the other reviews and I saw some that had me all worried before my TV arrived, they talked about how the version affects the panel you get and some have really bad angle viewing, etc.  The version code on mine didn't match any of the ones they mentioned (mine is showing UF03); let me cover the pros and cons that I see so far:Pros:Excellent side viewing, I put my head at the side of the TV so I could barely see the screen at all and there was no image blurring or fading that I could see at all.TV was fairly light and was easy to set up, has a nice automatic setup feature it walks you through, network setup and everything, was very quick and simple.Image is bright and very crisp, I am very pleased with this.The Smart TV stuff is pretty neat in my opinion (saw some people say it was clunky, etc), it seems very well done and polished overall.This TV automatically saw the media server I have on my network and I was able to stream movies from that to the TV very easily which was just awesome as I had expected that to be more complicated.The remote is much nicer than my old televisions was, laid out pretty nicely and has some unique colored buttons that make their function much easier to locate and use, overall its laid out pretty smartly.Neutral:  The sound from the TV itself is just ok but really not bad, better than my last TV thats for sure; dont really care as I use a home theatre setup anyway.Cons:  The screen is kinda glossy so it picks up reflections easily and I hate that, this is my biggest downer with the set so far. I really really hate glossy TV screens, very bad decision on Samsungs part in that regard.The stand is not very substantial and when the TV is mounted it has a slightly flimsy feel to it but not horrible.Thats really about it, overall an amazing TV I got for a killer price.  If there are any problems over time I will come back and update this review.  Hope this helps!

Reviews.Title: Awesome TV
Reviews.Author: Daniel Flores
Reviews.Content: This tv is awesome. It has great picture quality, even when it's not in HD. It's so simple to use and has a ton of apps. You have to adjust the settings at first to optimize your viewing pleasure but once that's done, it's a breeze to do anything you want, including watching stuff on amazon prime, netflix, youtube, sports (all from a simple click of an app icon). I also play a lot of games, so this tv is perfect because it has great graphics and I can play mulit-player online games with friends without additional gadgets hooked up to the tv.

Reviews.Title: Looks great
Reviews.Author: Jason Head
Reviews.Content: Easy to set up. Picture looks great. Sound is not that great but didn't expect much from tv speakers. Love the network connectivity and being able to watch movies on demand. I also listen to music stored on my network through the tv.

Reviews.Title: Great TV Good Value
Reviews.Author: Adam A Wells
Reviews.Content: Great TV for the money. Used others guides for setting up the picture settings and it worked great. No real complaints at all. For the money I feel there was a lot of value.

Reviews.Title: Looks great and the streaming apps are convenient
Reviews.Author: Joe C.
Reviews.Content: The streaming apps (Netflix, Amazon Instant Video, HBO Go) work flawlessly over WiFi and are so convenient to use through the TV itself rather than plugging in a computer or other device. Match that with the picture quality, size, and reasonable price making this TV a great buy for anyone looking to upgrade.

Reviews.Title: Samsung UN32EH5300 32 inch smart tv.
Reviews.Author: gailann "gailann"
Reviews.Content: I love this Tv. I had some reservations as to whether or not wifi would pick up as the router is on the other side of the house. No problem.. Not at all difficult to set the tv up. Picture was beautiful. The sound is great.  I would highly recommend this tv.

Reviews.Title: Meh on the so called Smart Hub
Reviews.Author: Benjamin T Terrusa
Reviews.Content: The TV is great. Good size, resolution. Super thin and light, so mounting it on the wall or placing it on a less-than-sturdy table is easy.The "Smart Hub" on this so-called smart TV is terrible. It lags, for minutes not seconds, and updates constantly, so every other day that I want to watch Netflix, Hulu, and the like (since I am one of those increasingly more common people that disconnected their cable) require lots and lots of waiting time. Not conducive to adjectives like "easy," "fast," and "smart."I actually chose this model over a larger 3D model of the same price due to it's smart component. Won't be doing that again... obviously.

Reviews.Title: Perfect Bedroom TV!!!
Reviews.Author: Eric
Reviews.Content: While I can't speak to the "smart" dynamic of this TV because I'm not online yet --and also a recent "cable-cutter'-- I can say however, that this TV is the perfect size for a standard bedroom -especially apartment sized- and offers a great viewing experience. The picture is very clear and the colors do pop with a little tweeking here and there. I am using Amazon's High Performance Indoor HDTV Antenna and get around 50 channels with a couple of duplicate channels and a few foreign language ones.The volume is okay, but that's not a big deal for me because I don't engage in serious viewing while in the bed. Comparing this 5300 series with my 6300 series in the living room, of course the latter stands out a bit more because it's 120 Hz. So, the picture is more crisp, refreshing, and life like. But the 5300 is still worthy enough to be mounted in the living room, make no mistake about it. After some pretty exhausting research and talking with a few TV-buff friends, this set turns out to be the best bang for your buck. I bought this smack brand new --mnfc date March 2014!!! The shipping was great as well as shipping speed --good luck if it comes UPS as they can sometimes handle without care.

Reviews.Title: Great TV, Marginal Smart TV Software
Reviews.Author: S. Kelly "sk55408"
Reviews.Content: As an output device for a Roku player or a RasberryPi this works wonderfully. The picture is crisp and very adjustable (see other reviews for suggestions on settings.) The shiny screen is no where near as objectionable as I had first feared.The smart TV software is marginal at best. Many other reviews winge about about it so I won't be redundant here. If I wasn't using a set top box for all my streaming viewing I'd be very disappointed with the lack of software stability and wimpy processor/memory that this TV has for the software.If you are shopping for this for the picture, grab one. If you are looking for a smart TV, get a Roku and whatever TV's picture pleases you best.

Reviews.Title: Great TV horrible smart TV
Reviews.Author: D. Miao
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough good things about samsung as a TV. But they Really need to work on their user interface and load up speed for their smart apps and smart tv section. Its so slow, glitchy, randomly resets and sometimes just unusable. Your so much better off just buying it with out a smart TV option if it still comes that way and just getting a Roku player attached to it. The UI being an update just still feels like its 5 years behind to what all the other set tops are doing. Its like samsung just threw us a bone with having the tv be "smart" but knows everyone else will just by a apple tv or chromecast.

Reviews.Title: Allright, I Think?
Reviews.Author: Islander
Reviews.Content: After owning this SMART TV for over two months I have found  it's a pretty good TV at a great price.  But I don't think SMART TVs are a smart buy.. There are many products out there  such as ROKU or the new amazon fire TV that do the same thing job but do it much better, much faster with a lot less aggravation. The old adage applies "anything that does everything doesn't do anything well...P.S. there is no youtube app for this model.

Reviews.Title: Awesome TV
Reviews.Author: Phillymark
Reviews.Content: This is really a fantastic TV.  It functions as a regular TV which interacts with my cable service and then in smart mode, giving me internet access, facebook,  Amazon Prime, Netflix, special shows for children, and plays my photos and videos.  I am really pleased with the easy to use instructions.  I had it functioning within 10 minutes of opening the box.

Reviews.Title: Not worth your time.
Reviews.Author: Matt Carpenter
Reviews.Content: I didn't like the user interface on this model. It's old and very much not customizable. I returned it for the UN32EH5500, which I love. I strongly recommend the 5500 !

Reviews.Title: Excellent... I like very much
Reviews.Author: Rene C
Reviews.Content: Very happy with the purchase of the TV as I had always wanted my Samsung Smart TV and now comes the world what we really enjoy family ... Thanks

Reviews.Title: Enjoying
Reviews.Author: Leslie Bathery
Reviews.Content: I choose this tv because I read the reviews and ratings.I am very happy with the picture.Disappointed in the volume. When I am watching a good movie like the volume high. Not so on this TV.

Reviews.Title: Image not as clear or vivid as I expected even after Gordon's Magical set up.
Reviews.Author: J. Carvajal "jay105"
Reviews.Content: I read the reviews of this T.V. and also did some research out of Amazon before I made a buying decision. I tend to trust amazon reviews, The reviews of this TV  are so great &  almost all reviewers thank Gordon (a gentle user with a magic potion that helped us to set the T.V right) so  I was inclined to buy it. I needed this T.V for a small media room to watch sports, action movies, explosions, people fighting, man stuff.Well I got the T.V and just opening the Box and connecting it to the source like too many have mentioned this TV does not win any awards. The native image like so many had commented in other reviews does not blow anybody's away that's  until you use Gordon's magical set up, that is a common theme for this set.So armed with Pen and paper and with lots of anticipation and like those Japanese cartoons I follow step by step Gordon's Magical recipe reciting the settings; Color 80!, contrast 70!, etc like so many others have done in the past.  I had so much faith on Gordon's set up that I had not doubt that the image will to come to life and finally blew me away.Well I have to say that I am still waiting for the image to come to life. Even after the tweaking the image to me looks flat, dull and lifeless. I have Verizon FIOS and while some channels come in 720p not 1080p the image on my other TV's are far better looking and vivid than the images on this T.V when comparing  same channels.(ok, ok,  just ESPN)My old Samsung Plasma TV looks much clear and the Vizio TV that we have in another room both had much more vivid images. I am not so sure if it is the 60 Hz refreshing speed (the standard nowadays seem to be 120 HZ) that is not fast enough to watch sports, high speed chases, people getting hurt in senseless action movies etc  but this TV does not seem to refresh as fast as you needed. People with dark skins look greenish, people with fair skins look purple...and by the way I am not watching Zombie movies.I thought in returning the set but I already had a mounting wall in place, paid for the mounting job etc  it is an annoyance to return the set and have to wait to buy another one.In a rebellious act of desperation I dared to change Gordon's magical settings with not better results to report, land of the dead with people looking like zombies, green and purple skins.I am not so sure if I had too great of an expectation based on the good reviews but for me this TV does not deserve more than three starts. Remember that I am just reporting my personal experience so please if you have a good experience good for you, I just want to help other possible buyers or to set expectations a little bit lower. that's the reason why we have reviews right?I am sorry Gordon.... I tried......really, really, hard.

Reviews.Title: The best LED-lit television at a budget price
Reviews.Author: Jose Luis Carrizo B.
Reviews.Content: Fantastic price, does everything I need to, I enjoy this cool tv, beautiful picture view, audio sound great, the channels are great, best of all, nice tv

Reviews.Title: Love this TV!
Reviews.Author: Patricia J. Schnell
Reviews.Content: We love our new TV!  It is in our office/workout room!Great picture and sound!  Sleek lines.Samsung is awesome once again!

Reviews.Title: not very "smart"...
Reviews.Author: Shabnam Salek
