Reviews.Content: (writing this review after several months of use, and results have been pretty consistent since i got it)the TV hardware is awesome - sound and picture quality were way better than i expected.that said, the software...not so much. the "smart" part of this smart TV, smarthub, has a host of problems:* on some days, it starts performing mysterious "updates" every single time you attempt to open it, causing you to have to wait ten or fifteen minutes before each use. repeatedly. what on earth is it updating so frequently??* on other days, it simply refuses to open at all. it will say "starting..." in the corner of the screen for 15 minutes or so, and then just give up.* if you do finally get smarthub to open, you'll often find that half your apps aren't working, with no explanation or error code given. they just won't load at all, or will ask you to "reinstall" the app, which is (surprise) not possible for any of the baked-in apps (netflix, youtube, etc) because they can't be removed (to solve this, you either wait it out, or attempt to speed up the process by reinstalling smarthub entirely, which is a whole new looooong wait).*on the rare occasion that everything is functioning properly though, it's a pretty good TV...and i know that this isn't just my particular unit, as i've googled all of these problems and come up with many other people experiencing the same difficulties (dating back quite awhile as well), which means it's entirely the fault of samsung's network, and given the circumstances, it doesn't seem like that's ever going to get any better.so basically, if you're looking for a smart TV, LOOK ELSEWHERE (i used to have a panasonic viera whose "smart" capabilities were top-notch, for a start).

Reviews.Title: liking my new TV
Reviews.Author: susan hagen
Reviews.Content: I love the quality of the color and the clarity.  Seems a bit slow to start up but that is not really important and may have to do with location. I've only used the TV for a month and just downloaded netflix. Looking forward to learning more about available apps.

Reviews.Title: AMAZING
Reviews.Author: Liz Hart
Reviews.Content: Fantastic price, does everything I need to. I haven't had a television for a year so this was a big deal for me. I live in the middle of nowhere and guess what? I set it up all myself. Never had a tv so easy to connect to the internet, comcast and it's just fabulous. I can't thank you enough!

Reviews.Title: Good TV but Can't Connect to internet1
Reviews.Author: SEEJAYKAY
Reviews.Content: Above title explains it all. Liked it overall. Good picture. I really don't have any additional comments. It works fine but won't connect to my WIFi at home.

Reviews.Title: Hulk Smash
Reviews.Author: Mike Hansen
Reviews.Content: I did get this item on time so Amazon gets 5 stars. Unfortunately, UPS did a hulk smash and the TV was delivered shattered.As this was our date night plan to mount our new smart TV, I went to Best Buy that same night and bought the same exact model. I can say without a doubt this TV works great so Samsung gets 5 stars as well. I have it directly connected to the Ethernet Port and things load much faster than they do with the wireless.Too bad the original showed up damaged but true to their word, Amazon started the refund process right away. Kuddos for that!

Reviews.Title: Cool TV
Reviews.Author: Michael Tisdale Jr
Reviews.Content: I enjoy this cool tv, beautiful picture view, audio sound great, the channels are great, best of all, nice tv.

Reviews.Title: Memory not sufficient and difficult to interface with remote
Reviews.Author: Sravan Kumar
Reviews.Content: You cannot watch a movie in interner continiously. it will stop in between saying memory not sufficient. UI with remote is difficult. We might need a good touch based remote for moving your cursor.Otherwise its good for picture quality and value for money. You can watch movies with netflix without any prob. You can watch videos continiously using iphone and share the videos

Reviews.Title: Great PC Monitor
Reviews.Author: No Hassle Guy "No Hassle Guy"
Reviews.Content: I use this only as PC monitor. This review based on my use as PC monitor for the last 6 weeks.Great color and brightness as expected of most sammy TVs. Sharp and clear for both text and graphics.It has no VGA input. I connected it to my windows 8 PC with HDMI cable. PC recognized the monitor and set to 1080p output automatically. Picture was blurry at first but quality become optimal when the input source name was to "PC". The difference between "PC" and "PC-DVI" is if you choose "PC-DVI" audio does not come through. In "PC" you can also use the TV speakers as audio output.Eco mode is turned on as default. It is a nice feature to increase and decrease brightness depending on the level of light and saves energy. However, it some low light levels, it can not decide which brightness level to stay with and goes back and forth between different levels of brightness. After a few hrs of working in the dusk and monitor going in and out of dimming frequently, I turned off the Eco mode and problem was fixed.There is auto turn off feature even though it is not described in manual. I could not find out about this until I started using it. It takes 15 minutes for the monitor to turn off after the PC goes to sleep or turn off. There is no option to adjust this time in settings that I can find. It turns off completely rather than goes to sleep. After it turns off, it will not wake up automatically when you turn the PC back on. You have to manually turn the monitor on. No big deal for me. Now I turn the monitor off when I turn the PC off. If I forget, it will still turn off automatically rather than stay on all night long. Not a deal breaker, but not as convenient as dedicated PC monitors with DVI inputs.All in all I am very happy with this as my PC monitor.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: Matthew A. Schroeder
Reviews.Content: After looking at LCD/LED Tvs between 36"-43" I mounted this a couple of days ago and I am totally satisfied with my purchase.  I spend countless hours of research on Amazon and Consumer Reports looking for the right smart TV and I am really glad I selected this product.  It has a great picture and there are no issues with the sound.  Amazon Instant Video and Netflix work great.  I haven't tried the other apps yet. The TV was easy to set up as well.

Reviews.Title: Great Purchase!
Reviews.Author: KDM
Reviews.Content: This thing is great. I didn't buy this type for any special reason. I just needed a new TV and this one had the best bang for my buck. I was so pleasantly surprised. Over time I eventually caught on to more and more of what it had to offer and it's essentially one of the best purchases I've ever made.

Reviews.Title: THIS SMART TV IS A GREAT ADDITION TO MY GRANDSON'S ROOM
Reviews.Author: shopinful
Reviews.Content: This TV works like you would expect for a Samsung.  We have three Samsung TV's in our house and they have been well worth the money.  Perfect size for my grandson's bedroom and it is really smart!  He loves to watch shows on Netflix, Hulu and it works flawless.  Of course I scored so many points with a TV in his bedroom when visiting.  The picture is very clear, sound great and clarity perfect.  It was a great price as well!!  Can't beat it…...

Reviews.Title: like this - good price
Reviews.Author: Sanjaya
Reviews.Content: this is a good buy for the price offered - Thanks to Amazon. Like the appostore as well , you need to add more memory if you wish to use lots of apps

Reviews.Title: Does exactly what it says on the tin
Reviews.Author: Robin William
Reviews.Content: Does exactly what it says on the tin - it works and does best when you hook up to HD, and download the various apps available

Reviews.Title: excellent functional wi tv
Reviews.Author: randy
Reviews.Content: I am amazed at how well this tv integrates itself on my wireless network. I can look at videos and pictures that are on my laptop wireless. I bought it mainly for use as a computer monitor and it fits the bill there as well with usb and hdmi. The sound is not the best but connected to sound on computer it works just fine. I would recommend it to anyone looking for an inexpensive second tv/monitor.

Reviews.Title: Love getting MLB and Netflix, but...
Reviews.Author: Bo
Reviews.Content: but the Samsung apps are limited and I don't use them. It doesn't seem to allow free Hulu, only the paid version. The worst things -- and I'm considering returning it because of these -- is that it won't play Flash, so I didn't get to watch the NCAA tournament on it, and it seems to crash whenever I try to go online with it. It says it doesn't have enough memory. It's stock -- I haven't added much except for the MLB app.  So the browser is pretty much useless. Plus, since it won't support a wireless keyboard or mouse, using the remote to "browse" on a web screen is a lesson in futility, and tired fingers.

Reviews.Title: Cut that cable!
Reviews.Author: Mark townsend
Reviews.Content: Finally, I have a tv that will let me go to any web-site!  With a USB mouse attached, I can zip across the virtual keyboard (in pointer mode).  With web-sites like live station.com and tv14.com (free streaming from all over the world!), my roku for "almost" live coverage of everything plus 24/7 music of my choice from Pandora, and my mohu 50 antenna (see antennaweb.org for your area, I get about 10 channels this way), we will now CANCEL cable tv.  (Still need their fast internet connection,but that is relatively cheap.)  If my tentative plan to switch to Ooma phones (see Consumer Reports)works out,  our communication expenses will be MUCH smaller than they were a year ago.  I hope pbx with Ooma is available, so we can have 2 cell phones on one account.  Not sure about pbx, though.

Reviews.Title: LOVE IT.
Reviews.Author: lynnster "lynnster"
Reviews.Content: That's really all I can say. I love everything about it. I don't have cable, and it hooks up easily to my hulu, netflix, amazon and pandora accounts. Great picture. I bought an old school antenna for regular network channels and that works perfectly. I don't have a single complaint. Best tv I've ever had.

Reviews.Title: Entertaining Stepped Up!
Reviews.Author: Raleigh Gurl
Reviews.Content: This TV has great picture quality (after making the adjustments suggested by Gordon's review) I was able to connect effortless my Amazon Prime and the Samsung apps.  Still setting up apps, but I love the quality of the product I received.  No complaints from me.  Great TV...PERIOD!!!  This is my second Samsung tv and my first smart TV...love it!!!

Reviews.Title: no joke, no brainer!!!
Reviews.Author: WestSideSmitty
Reviews.Content: Great value and love the features. This TV works great, built in Wi-Fi works great- I am so happy with this TV, will consider used and refurbished from now-on!!!

Reviews.Title: great
Reviews.Author: jason
Reviews.Content: Great TV no problems and cool stuff to do on it love it love it love it love it ...

Reviews.Title: Best TV Made
Reviews.Author: Jim Price
Reviews.Content: I researched many different televisions before I made this purchase.  I observed several different brands operating side by side playing the same programming in multiple retail locations and every single time the picture quality of this product was obviously superior.  Unless some manufacturer comes up with a significantly better product than now is apparent, I will never purchase anything but Samsung.  I've purchased three (3) so far for varying purposes.  They all were more than satisfactory.

Reviews.Title: Good Choice
Reviews.Author: Deadeye
Reviews.Content: I have a big screen Samsung HD TV in my living room but we wanted to replace the clunky floor model in our bedroom with a wall mount.  This one works as good as the bigger Samsung.  We use it for internet TV and had no trouble mounting it.  It appears compatible with a wide variety of wall brackets.  We chose an inexpensive bracket, due to the light weight of this TV.  I am totally satisfied.

Reviews.Title: Good TV
Reviews.Author: AndreyA
Reviews.Content: Good TV, shipped by Amazon, was easy to assemble and easy to set up. No problems after 2.5 month of use, great colors and good sound, use it with my ROKU and Xbox 360.

Reviews.Title: Samsung TV 46 Inch
Reviews.Author: Sunny
Reviews.Content: I loved it. Awesome picture quality. Great sound system. Really cool features. I have given this as a gift to my wife.

Reviews.Title: LOVE IT!
Reviews.Author: LizNYC
Reviews.Content: Was packed securely and was very easy to assemble. Looks great. Picture is really great. Very sharp and sounds excellent too. Awesome purchase.

Reviews.Title: Why does everything have to be smart?
Reviews.Author: Paula M. Pollock
Reviews.Content: I do enjoy the samsung model of the smart tv. It is easy to use and the instructions are easy. It also does a great job of streaming my movies and tv shoes from my Amazon Prime. It is moderately priced and just the right size for a smaller room or den.

Reviews.Title: Get Smart
Reviews.Author: lisa lawson
Reviews.Content: Great product that more than meets my expectations. Samsung smart TV-a wise choice! Reliability and long lasting Samsung electronics and great Price,

Reviews.Title: A splurge, but love it.
Reviews.Author: fellsue
Reviews.Content: I finally upgraded my television set after 15 years!  I jumped right in to a Smart TV and love it! It was well worth the money spent.

Reviews.Title: Semi-Smart...
Reviews.Author: Tamara Brown
Reviews.Content: Overall, great tv with the exception that a flash player cannot be downloaded. What is the point, if you can't watch certain videos that require this feature?!?!

Reviews.Title: should have listened to the reviews
Reviews.Author: kristine
Reviews.Content: Most of the reviews I read stated they had issues with netflix. I have issues with the " smart hub" in general. when you try and get to the smart hub the tv freezes. it gets into this cycle of restarting itself and turning off. i usually have to unplug it and wait 5 min. It also sometimes loses picture and will be just audio while watching netflix. then you also have to unplug it or else the tv will restart and turn off again and again. I am really mad at myself for buying this and will never buy another smart tv.

Reviews.Title: Great Screen. Low Memory
Reviews.Author: Anubhav
Reviews.Content: When it comes to Samsung products, I'm a fan. Some 4 years back I bought the very first original Galaxy S which redefined Samsung Mobile Devices. In terms of TV, this is a great product. The body is slim and looks good in black. The bezel is also very less giving more space to screen. Mainly I have been using internet to access apps like "Amazon Prime" and "Dish world" to watch serials and movies and they do look good. Sound quality is Ok. Not very loud even at 100, but I guess that should be fine for a small room/living room. Unless you want a boom box, this still will work for most of you.Another quality that I like is I can watch pictures, videos stored on my PC(Dell) or Mobile (Samsung Note 3) wirelessly via samsung link. Most of the formats are playable and it really makes it easy for a cluterless viewing.One problem I found is that over the time, the memory gets full after buffering when using app to watch videos. So after 1 month, now I'm experiencing issues - such as voice will go on mute if I reverse/forward/pause any video and then play again.App will close on it's own after some time (not always). This seems to be an issue with the low memory for this model.A memory refresh every month might solve the issue.Might be

Reviews.Title: Excellent tv, especially for the price
Reviews.Author: Leigh Decker "Long Live Alice!"
Reviews.Content: It's worth it to get a tv with 3 HDMI ports and 2 USB ports, and an outlet  (spot?...in plug...?) for incoming cable, and it still has 2 available inputs from older machines like we have that connect with the red, white, and yellow wires.Picture quality is excellent. Price at $299 was excellent for this high quality! Incredibly easy to set up, just follow on screen instructions

Reviews.Title: Good but needs a fix sometimes
Reviews.Author: Frederick E. Hutchings
Reviews.Content: I purchased the set locally, but since I am an Amazon customer, thought I would pass this along. When I first tried to go online, I had trouble with netflix and web access; the TV kept dropping my wireless network.  Web search indicated that this is a problem sometimes with Samsung.  Went to the Samsung web site and selected the CHAT feature for customer support.  Agent came right on and quickly, diagnosed my problem as a software update needed.  He gave me a download link on the chat screen to my laptop. Then another link to the PDF file download instructions for installing the upgrade.Started this process at 10:15 p.m. By 11 p.m. everything was installed and netflix/web came right up.  At this point Netflix came in with an upgrade message and this went in automatically.  This is pretty good tech support at any time of the day.  All I needed was a thumb drive to move the software from the laptop to the television, and the ability to read.  Went from Uh-Ohhh to O-My in less than an hour.

Reviews.Title: Would be great but SmartHub is junk
Reviews.Author: C. Frank
Reviews.Content: I bought this "smart" TV for watching Netflix and Amazon Prime videos. When this TV works for that purpose it's great except for the lousy speaker which you have to turn up absurdly high to hear anything. I'm giving it a single star rating though for the endless time I (and many others) have spent fiddling with network settings trying to get Netflix to work. I don't know if there's something wrong with Samsung's SmartHub software or with the internal wifi receiver on the set but if you buy this, be prepared to spend all your time trouble shooting.Buyer beware!

Reviews.Title: Great tv
Reviews.Author: Adriana
Reviews.Content: I love the tv. All the apps and the easy way to use it . I will recommend it to anybody.

Reviews.Title: TV Great. Hub not so much
Reviews.Author: A. Lindsey
Reviews.Content: The TV is great with an excellent picture.  The media hub is a pain and it keeps loosing connection with our wifi. We have tested other devices and it seems to only happen to this tv and to our very old Roku. I would think this tv would preform better than a 6-7 year old Roku. Love Samsung, but frustrated and disappointed in this item. Our other Samsung products have been awesome, so bummed this one isn't as good.

Reviews.Title: great. tv for a great price
Reviews.Author: Mercedes
Reviews.Content: love this tv, love the smart features. easy to put together. color, sound, programming to cable remote control, total breeze

Reviews.Title: Great TV, poor computer / smart tv
Reviews.Author: J. Wolf
Reviews.Content: I was okay with this TV until the recent loss of service, samsung smarthub servers down so you can't use anything.  I won't buy a smart tv again.  I came from an windows based HTPC setup that was leaps and bounds more powerful and versatile and that's what's going to happen to this TV - it's going to be a monitor for a real computer.Samsung appears to need to route everything through their own servers for every aspect of the TV so when servers go down, guess what, nothing works.  Samsung link or what ever it's called today is a terrible way to connect to windows network / windows computers.  XBMC is soooooooo much easier and better, more flexible and has nothing to do with samsung or it's servers.  I wish I'd have saved the money and bought a dumb tv - that's what I have in the end.

Reviews.Title: One of the worst TVs ever
Reviews.Author: Nitin Jagga
Reviews.Content: This is not a smart TV. It is just an LED TV. Please do not buy this TV if you are looking to buy a smart TV. The smart TV hub from Samsung takes ages to load, there software is impossible to use, and no one, no one in this sane world can operate the built in web browser samsung provided. I am going to ask Samsung for money back. The TV does work, but its smart hub, the web browser, nothing works at all. I am ruing the fact that at the arrival of this TV, i sold my apple TV for half the price. Now, I want my old TV and apple TV back. And I want samsung to refund me the money.

Reviews.Title: Best tv for a bedroom
Reviews.Author: C. Maunz "duelling carl"
Reviews.Content: After having a Samsung 55" 3D LED and loving it I decided on another Samsung LED for my bedroom once that crt blew. I absolutely love it. The sounds is perfect and the picture, well you cannot go wrong with a Samsung LED. Smarthub is awesome and Netflix is fast and streams flawlessly through a wired connection. 10 years ago I would have bought a Sony and wouldn't have looked at anything else. Samsung is where it's at!

Reviews.Title: Smart TV vs Chromcast
Reviews.Author: Jordan
Reviews.Content: I had a regular tv with chrome cast before, still got a smart tv since it has more apps than the chromecast. I  still use my chromcast for netflix since its quicker but I use the tv's other apps happily.

Reviews.Title: A Great buy for a monitor that aids the visually challenged.
Reviews.Author: Robert H. Hansen "Tired Taxpayer"
Reviews.Content: Makes it possible for me to see the screen well. It makes a class A monior for my computer. Welll worththe cost.

Reviews.Title: best tv
Reviews.Author: happy customer
Reviews.Content: I'm usually not into electronics.but I'm like a kid with a new toy.buy this tv.its does much more.I love the yoga/Pilates features. Bye to the gym n dvds.No more going through video games to view Netflix.I love this tv!

Reviews.Title: Great TV for the Bedroom or smaller room.
Reviews.Author: Lindsay Hurley
Reviews.Content: Excellent TV for bedroom.  Easy process to assemble and quick and easy setup process.  Very pleased with Samsung and purchasing experience!

Reviews.Title: Outstanding choice for our first flat-screen. Wireless mouse & keyboard do not work on this model.
Reviews.Author: Clay W
Reviews.Content: Samsung support very responsive. After downloading a large PDF user manual from Samsung which said it would use a keyboard and mouse for Internet browsing, I plugged my Logitech unified USB gizmo into the side of the TV, and hoped it would use my Logitech keyboard and mouse (all from Amazon, of course!). Screen pop-up said Logitech device(s) recognized, but neither mouse or keyboard would work. Samsung tech support said this Samsung TV model does not support keyboards & mice. Drat.The TV loads Netflix and Amazon Video much faster than my TiVo does. A big complaint about TiVo is that it will *not* recognize Amazon *Prime* videos, just Amazon pay videos that TiVo probably gets a percentage of $. I've called TiVo and griped at them; they say they hear that often about Prime. Therefore for Prime videos, we've been using a Roku. However this TV may eliminate need for Roku, since Netlfix and Prime are all we use on the Roku.

Reviews.Title: Awesome TV
Reviews.Author: Jordan Hopper
Reviews.Content: Everything from the quality, sound, and the smart portion of the Samsung, I enjoy it really well.  Many choices from the app store to what you get out of the Samsung.  I like way better then Vizio and that is a fact. Excellent Job Samsung!

Reviews.Title: great TV
Reviews.Author: Charles J. Horsley "Chuck Horsley"
Reviews.Content: Great price, Great TV. Nice to have it connected to the internet for Netflix and others. Excellent color and clarity

Reviews.Title: BEWARE BEWARE!! - No YouTube present if bought in 2014
Reviews.Author: Jitendra R.
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV just today with aim of using apps like Netflix and YouTube. But Bam, YouTube app is no longer supported by Samsung on this TV and few others too. Instead there is one 'LinkToYouTube' app which just opens YouTube in browser. And playing YouTube in browser is like playing Counter strike on 90's computer where it takes 5 minutes to move cursor and play one video.Disappointed!!

Reviews.Title: Don't buy any Samsung with Smart Hub
Reviews.Author: J. Barton
Reviews.Content: There is a years old problem with Samsung TVs with smart hub.  Samsung TVs connect to their server and then you can reach the internet.  Unfortunately, their servers are down so much that their service is next to worthless.When their servers are down, you get an error message: Error_Model_Bind.  If you search for this error online, you will find an ongoing history where Samsung chooses to not address the issue.  They say things like, set your time on the TV manually.  Been there, done than, no help.  The interesting thing is the internet connection works because you can update the software, you just cannot get to anything on Smarthub.  This problem has been going on for years, and Samsung chooses to not address it.  Maybe they lost to much money to Apple in their court battles.I would give this TV a five except things ont he TV should work.  If you expect to use SmartHub for internet access, choose another brand where they actually allow direct internet connection.

Reviews.Title: What an awful TV. So disappointing.
Reviews.Author: raman
Reviews.Content: I purchased this TV so that I can enjoy my Xbox One and HD Cable box at the same time.When I put it in " Game Mode " To decrease Input Lag so that there isn't a 5 second delay between me pressing a button and the TV, the screen is so awful! Worst picture I have ever seen on any TV. Seriously my 5 year old Insignia 1080p has better picture than this TV.Are you serious? this is what samsung makes and gets away with? Awful picture.Plus when I pressed the " Smart " button to watch netflix. My netflix sound keeps cutting in and out. I have 40MBPS internet and I tried contacting Samsung support who weren't able to help me. I've given up on this TV and will return it.

Reviews.Title: Samsung 40' 60hZ led HDTV Black
Reviews.Author: A. Broomfield
Reviews.Content: I would recommend the purchase of this TV to everyone.  I checked the ratings given by other purchasers. and I also purchased the  surround sound as I wanted clarity when watching my favorite movies and shows.It has lived up to everything I hoped for and the price I could afford. My previous TV was an LG, which I put in the Living Room andput the Samsung in my bedroom.

Reviews.Title: Not that bad
Reviews.Author: Justin
Reviews.Content: A lot of problems with updates, and using browser. But nothing samsung support couldn't fix. Not that bad of a TV.

Reviews.Title: Great TV!!
Reviews.Author: deluxequill
Reviews.Content: Purchased this recently. I had an LG 40" smart Tv before this and the difference in picture quality is amazing!! The Samsung's picture quality is far superior. The Smart apps work really good and there's no need to subscribe to my cable provider now for additional movie channels.....I get them on the TV internet bowser for free now!! woo hoo!! This TV also syncs with my smart phone, so videos on my phone can now be view on my nice new 40" screen!! I loooove this feature!! In summary i'd highly recommend this TV. The price is good and picture quality is great. Great Value!!

Reviews.Title: TV for ME
Reviews.Author: kitkat
Reviews.Content: I love my new TV.  Only delivery problem was it was dropped on my porch during a snow storm.  I answered the door in less than 2 minutes but the delivery truck was nowhere is sight and I had to drag the box in myself (76 yrs old, bad shoulder).  As the truck drove by the delivery person waved!!!  Box was awkward but not overly heavy but I would have appreciated a lift over the threshold!

Reviews.Title: Well worth the $$$
Reviews.Author: Georgezap
Reviews.Content: Can't beat the bang for the buck with this TV!  After 30 hours of viewing and tweaking the screen and sound adjustments along the way, this is as good as it gets for a terrific bedroom TV.I'll be cutting the cable soon.  Thank you Amazon, Samsung, Netflix, and yes, Time-Warner for your reliable high speed internet connections the past 10 years here in my area.

Reviews.Title: love it
Reviews.Author: Pamela G Potter
Reviews.Content: Great TV, has not giving me a problem, set up was super easy and have been enjoying it ever since

Reviews.Title: AMAZING for Hardcore Gamers
Reviews.Author: Craig Vanwagoner
Reviews.Content: This TV has been the best gaming big screen that I have played, quite frankly, ever.  Most big screens, you'll notice a few milliseconds of lag, and for those that play twitch games (Call of Duty, Halo, Titanfall, etc), this big screen is the way to go.  Tested and works well with NES, SNES, Genesis, Nintendo 64, Playstation, Gamecube, Dreamcast, Playstation 2, Xbox, Nintendo Wii, Xbox 360, Nintendo WiiU, Xbox One, and PS4 have all been personally tested on this TV and play perfectly with low latency to ensure the best reaction time for you.Low latency TV's are a rare find in big screens up until now, and this is one that you can count on for gamers.For those that are not gamers, this TV does very well, but you will find TV's for cheaper that will give you better picture.  I know that might not be a five star for you, but allowing you to play on a low latency TV is everything in the world for gamers.

Reviews.Title: Great Product By Far!
Reviews.Author: James
Reviews.Content: This product is a steal at this price!No complaints at all, but I wish the smart hub was updated like Samsung's most recent Smart Tvs.

Reviews.Title: An excellent purchase!
Reviews.Author: John Keegan
Reviews.Content: The Samsung television is a near perfect picture and the sound and features are awesome.  The Smart Hub is user friendly.

Reviews.Title: I love it
Reviews.Author: Leslie Kromphardt
Reviews.Content: I got this television at a great discount during the holidays as well as due to some amazon credit I had.  I have never owned an HDTV, or a smartTV for that matter, so I wasn't sure what to expect.  What I got was a television that I'm in absolute love with.  While the other ratings are true, the graphics did need some tweaking (follow the guide in the top comment, adjust to taste) and the software is sometimes a bit of a pain, for the price I paid it's the best thing I could have purchased.  I have had the television for a few months now and have had no problems.  I've bought my first Blueray player to go with it and had no problems with the two of them working together.Would suggest this television to anyone who had this price range.

Reviews.Title: AWESOME!
Reviews.Author: josh
Reviews.Content: What a great little TV! Bought the 32" for my 5 year old's room. He absolutely LOVES it! Gets him off of all my TV's, and he watches Netflix in his room. A lot of reviews have been bad for this TV, stating Netflix and Amazon Instant Video stops, or buffers a lot... Simple solution.... Get better internet! I've had this TV for over a month now, and my son adores it. I'm thinking about getting a 40" model to replace my 'dumb' flat screen in my bedroom. This is a GREAT buy!!

Reviews.Title: Samsung UN40EH5300 SmarTV
Reviews.Author: Y. C. Garnett-singleton
Reviews.Content: "Well, I just received my new Samsung SmarTV last evening and I must say that I am thoroughly pleased with the easy set up and internet connections. I have read reviews on this website stating that there were a lot of issues with the Smart Hub, however, I did not experience any problems whatsoever. I would recommend that before you do any tv watching that you run all you updates once you have established an internet connects. Out of the box, you will more than likely have to adjust your picture settings as the pictures appear pretty dark without any tweaking. Per previous Amazon poster, I used the setting suggested which were the following dynamic mode: Mode: Dynamic. Backlight: 18, Contrast: 85, Brightness: 50,Sharpness: 80, Color: 70,TInt: G/R 50/50Standard color tone with screen fit in the additional options, with HDMI black level set to low. The sound is great for me as it almost sounds like theatre sound. The picture is super awesome." I would recommend this tv and if you set it up right, you can't go wrong.

Reviews.Title: It's just ok
Reviews.Author: Lauren "Lauren"
Reviews.Content: The picture quality is good but the Smart TV options are VERY slow. I tried to play movies through Amazon prime and it has to reload the movie every 2 minutes or so. Really annoying! Even if the TV is right next to the internet router, it has extreme difficulty staying connected. Don't bother with the Smart TV, just get a regular TV.

Reviews.Title: NOT User-Friendly!
Reviews.Author: Amy
Reviews.Content: I purchased this TV and used it for about a month before returning it. The sound and color were great, but the interface is horrible. I bought this "smart" TV primarily for Netflix use. At first Netflix would fire up with no problems. Then for a while it would need two tries, and by the end it took 20 minutes of repeat errors to get it to work. I looked it up on CNET and other electronics blogs, etc., and this is a very common problem with this TV. There were all sorts of suggestions on fixing it, but all were technical and involved changing your TV's IP address, which sounds like it works, but you can only have one app from another country at a time, so it isn't convenient and requires a lot of tweeking. The home screen and remote are really quirky, and I realized that most of the time I spent trying to "relax" watching TV, was spent being frustrated and eventually giving up. It may be worth it for the very tech-savy person who likes mess with it, but not for the average person who just wants to turn it on and have it work. The endless forums regarding the Netflix issue on this TV all ended by giving rave reviews for Roku. Samsung makes a great product, but Samsung software just can't compete. I returned my TV and bought the same, but non-smart, model and the Roku 3. Works absolutely perfect! So glad I did!

Reviews.Title: An Okay TV
Reviews.Author: stephany
Reviews.Content: The speakers on this tv aren't good at all. I have to buy my own speakers to connect them to the TV to hear it clear. The smart hub tends to freeze or don't load up the apps. I only had this tv for a few month and had problems. Within 2 months of having this TV I had to call for a replacement. The HD is good on this tv.

Reviews.Title: Good looking lower end TV
Reviews.Author: Shaun M. Huseman
Reviews.Content: Basically I was just looking for a TV to put in my spare room just to have as an incase kind of deal or to have in my bedroom to watch as I fall asleep. For a 32 inch television, I don't really think you could do much better picture quality wise. Colors are vibrant and the screen is clear. Satisfied with this purchase.

Reviews.Title: Perfect upgrade TV!
Reviews.Author: C. M. Huter
Reviews.Content: A great TV, at a great price, for anyone looking for this size TV. I bought this TV for my parents to bring them into the 21st Century. The setup is incredibly easy and they couldn't be happier. Highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Word of mouth
Reviews.Author: John Tucker
Reviews.Content: I've been told the Samsung looks and sounds great. I've seen the picture and there wright but what I noticed is that it's smaller and lighter than my 32-inch. For my opinion, it's worth it.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic.
Reviews.Author: Ken
Reviews.Content: Easy to set up, fantastic picture, easy to use and a realbargain on Amazon. I scoured the internet and stores fora lower price and could not find anything to the savingsI got at Amazon. Highly recommended !!!

Reviews.Title: Great Performance
Reviews.Author: Sundararajan
Reviews.Content: It works good. Great value for money. very much satisfied with it. The streaming is much better compared to my Blu-Ray smart player.

Reviews.Title: Awesome tv.
Reviews.Author: irene
Reviews.Content: Great television. Just as expected. Thanks. Rear clear picture. And the sound. Can not go wrong by buying this object.

Reviews.Title: nice
Reviews.Author: Charline Stover
Reviews.Content: nice picture and sound but I still cant get the TV on line so I haven't been able to use face book or anything else I work nights and have very little time to spend trying to figure out this TV  I have tried several time to hook my internet up and it just wont. I have Comcast so it shouldn't be this hard.

Reviews.Title: Nice little TV software sucks
Reviews.Author: Anthony
Reviews.Content: This little TV is affordable and we use in it our kitchen for recipes. But the software is sucky. It is certainly not something you would find on an Apple operating system and even makes Windows 8 look good. But I did not buy it for that. I bought it to watch mindless television in the kitchen. Like Marta and cooking shows.

Reviews.Title: Great for the price
Reviews.Author: Weiss
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my mother-in-law and it was really easy to set up and its really easy to use.  No complaints whatsoever.

Reviews.Title: love my new tv
Reviews.Author: Paola Párraga
Reviews.Content: It is a awesome tv. It was very cheap and is very good quality. I use just internet to watch my favorite series and movies, and it works perfectly.  No need of cable at all.

Reviews.Title: Wonderful picture!
Reviews.Author: K Walters
Reviews.Content: We decided to upgrade to a Smart LED television and this Samsung did not disappoint.  The tv is light and thin.  The picture is amazing - it's clear and crisp.  The television is easy to set-up and the Smart feature works well, too.  We are able to watch Netflix, Amazon and Vudu with ease.  The only downside is the sound.  Most of the time there is not a problem with the sound but many times it can be difficult to hear the people's voices.  The speakers are not mounted on the front like our other tv's but instead behind the screen.  This could be corrected with a soundbar or surround sound speakers.  Overall, we love this tv!

Reviews.Title: Well worth the price
Reviews.Author: Dragon Queen
Reviews.Content: I bought this set about a month ago to replace the 32 inch Vizio in the family room. The color and clarity are amazing, and no long wait for the set to load settings, like it was with the Vizio. Setting up the WiFi was easy. The Smart TV features are easy to navigate, and the sound is much better than the Vizio. I have come to expect high quality from Samsung, and this set does does not disappoint. I am more than satisfied with this purchase, and would recommend it to anyone who wants maximum value for their dollar.

Reviews.Title: Great TV!
Reviews.Author: Optos Books "Specialize in selling rare, unus...
Reviews.Content: I love this television. Easy to set up and use. Though not their most recent model, unless you are a gamer or care about 3D (I do not) or require ginormous screens, this model is the best bang for the buck. Perfect for this new binge-watcher. Highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: a real shame since the screen is beautiful
Reviews.Author: B. Ye "Brian"
Reviews.Content: Got the new TV today and then connected it to home Wifi w/o any issues. TV says the connection is fine, but I just couldn't connect to the web or any of the Samsung services. Spent hours trying different settings both on the TV and the router to no avail. I researched on the web and tried many of the tips and suggestions, again to no avail. Tried setting DNS server manually to some stupid magic number. That didn't work either. Do the search and you'll find that the web is full of complaints and workarounds. This is a joke. It's amazing that my iphone, ipad and even Nintendo Wii has no problem getting on the web via the same wifi router. This latest 2014 "smart tv". couldn't. Got a lot of nonsense error codes such as "EXE_001" and "EXE_003". Samsung got my money this time but never again. I give up. It's a real shame since the screen is beautiful.

Reviews.Title: Not sold on this yet...
Reviews.Author: RobRoy
Reviews.Content: I may end up returning it. The HD with blue ray and streaming is there, but some over the air broadcasts. Dish uses this method for the second TV and are out of focus.  This weekend I am going to try some trouble shooting with a new cable.

Reviews.Title: Great buy
Reviews.Author: peter beaulieu
Reviews.Content: This tv is great hooks up easy and plays right from my hard drives only draw back is there is no VGA/DVI inputs

Reviews.Title: GREAT TV AT A GREAT PRICE
Reviews.Author: John R. Willis "TB"
Reviews.Content: The only thing I would remind everyone using this TV is something I forget now and then, and that is EACH INPUT HAS ITS OWN SETTINGS, so one must tinker each source to do what you want as far as brightness, contrast, color, etc.  When you exit the changes will be saved as these are rolling updates.

Reviews.Title: So far so good!
Reviews.Author: Stephanie Foote
Reviews.Content: I've been very pleased with this TV so far!  The picture is great, and the sound is very good.  I love being able to use the TV to connect to things like Netflix and Amazon Prime without having to have something like an Apple TV or Roku. I think it's a fantastic price for such a nice TV.  Highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: four stars
Reviews.Author: Will Maltby
Reviews.Content: The Samsung UN46EH5300 is an excellent television set, although it is not without its drawbacks.Picture —The picture quality is excellent; it is clean and crisp, even when viewing in standard definition. The colors are rich, and the blacks are deep. Out of the box, however, the picture is lacking and is less-than-appealing. You will need to tweak the settings before the set performs as it should. There are also several preset video modes, although they are not as good as creating your own settings. Experiment, and you will find that this set looks amazing when it has been set up properly.Audio —The audio quality is lacking. This set seems to require a home theater system in order to experience sound properly. There are two extremes when using this set: either dialogue is much too loud and the action and music are audible but muffled; or the action and music are much too loud and the dialogue is drowned out. You might find a setting that you like, but I have yet to find one myself.Connectivity —This set can connect to the internet wirelessly via Wi-Fi or through a wired ethernet connection. I use its connectivity to stream movies from my computer through my Xbox 360 to the set, and there is no noticeable drop in quality. There are three HDMI ports, although there is no S-Video port. There are also two USB ports, with one being labeled as being a "hard drive" port because it supplies extra power for external hard drives or Samsung HomeSync. The set is also capable of using a keyboard and a mouse, which makes surfing the internet a bit easier.Interface —The overall interface is extremely clunky and inconsistent. It is also slow in that it seems to lag occasionally, especially if you press a button on the remote several times in a row. A lot of the screens seem to take an abnormally long time to load as well.Apps —The apps are nice, although I have only used Netflix thus far (which was the main driving point in my purchase of this television). The set can connect to Facebook and twitter (allowing you to live-tweet what you are watching, although I am not sure why anyone would want to do that). It would be nice if there was a central location you could visit on your desktop to select what apps you want to download (or have on your set) that would then be downloaded (or deleted) by your set the next time you used it; alas, there is not, and going through the "app store" is extremely tedious, and the selection is lacking.Overall, this is an excellent set for the price. (As of this writing, it is listed by Amazon at almost half-off its list price.)

Reviews.Title: T.V. is public school smart
Reviews.Author: Galin
Reviews.Content: We chose this T.V. because it's "smart" and because it's a Samsung.  The picture is great and the stock audio isn't horrible.  I'm going to focus mostly on the smart part.TELEVISIONWe are unplugged...no cable or satellite.  We use Netflix and Hulu almost exclusively for our viewing needs.  Apparently this is completely unheard of in South Korea (where Samsung is made) because this T.V. insists on only booting up to the television signal which, for us, is static.  Not the best thing to see every time we turn on.  To make matters even better, the static window always appears on the "Smart Hub" which is the home screen for the apps as is seen on the picture of the T.V. here on Amazon.APPSThere is a decent selection of apps including Netflix and Hulu.  Mysteriously absent is a YouTube app.  There is a link/app but that just takes you to their website (see more on this below).  The thing I dislike is that on the Smart Hub, there are several unwanted apps plus 6 large app shortcuts that are totally irrelevant to what I want (Fitness, Kids, Media Hub, etc.)WEB BROWSINGWe made sure we got a T.V. with web browsing so we could watch shows on Spike, AMC, ABC, etc.  Well...remember the old WebTV back in the AOL days?  That probably provided better web browsing than this T.V. does.  The pages are not at all optimized for T.V. so the text is unreadable due to its small size.  There is an apparent lack of memory because almost every time I click a link on the home page that was installed at the factory, I get an error message that says it's out of memory and needs to close.  Unacceptable.  Navigation is impossible with the slow-to-respond remote arrows.  And forget about trying to type in a web address.  Supposedly you can set up a mouse and keyboard but this isn't my office, it's my bedroom.  With all of the smarts in the Galaxy phone, I can't see why there's not an apparent way to set up bookmarks on your phone or laptop that you can easily open on the T.V.  I say 'apparent' because....MENU SYSTEMThe menus are missing several obvious functions.  Not that they weren't necessarily thought of but they're simply greyed out.  Screen adjustment, System Setup, Menu Language, PIP on/off, e-Manual (and it didn't come with a paper one either?!?), Software Update and even Smart Hub are all greyed out and unavailable.  The lack of an e-Manual is just stunning to me.  I am confident that it very well could solve many of the issues I am having with the smart part of this T.V.  Frankly, I don't really want to spend hours upon hours tinkering around to find ways to save minutes upon minutes.  These things should be completely intuitive in a T.V. made by the top manufacturer in this day and age.SMART HUBAgain, this is the home base for the apps and what makes this T.V. smart.  In the product image you can see the water wallpaper.  It is one wallpaper out of a whopping two wallpapers.  The other one is black with grey lines on the bottom.  Way to go out on a limb there, Samsung.  What I really dislike about the Smart Hub though is its constant need to download updates.  In the week or so that we've had the T.V., it has stopped us to wait for it to do its thing twice not counting initial setup.  Not a huge investment of time or anything but I just want to watch some dang T.V., not sit around waiting for it to download more useless apps that I don't want and didn't ask for.  Further, Smart Hub itself also frequently updates which means you have to sit around and wait for it to do its thing.STREAMINGThis T.V. does do streaming extremely well.  The new Netflix app is amazing although, again, the text on the browsing page is way too small.  Unlike our old junky smart DVD player, this Netflix app will usually keep going when the signal slows down (we are maxed out at 5MB where we live) and has a slow frame rate for a few seconds.  I very much prefer this over the stop and go method.  Hulu, our other provider, doesn't do so well.  It quite often stops frequently even while Netflix is rip roaring.  This, of course, is not the T.V.'s fault but never the less is part of the experience.REMOTENice huge volume and power buttons.  Backlit buttons but unfortunately you have to find the back light button to light the buttons.  It's opposite the power button so it's a crap shoot which one you hit until you become very familiar with the remote.  Our living room T.V. remote lights up automatically when it's moved.  Take a cue on this one, Sammy.  Generally it's a decent remote though.SUMMARYExcellent picture at a good price.  The smart part is almost more of an annoyance than a convenience, particularly with the constant updates that don't add any value.  It is very nice having Wi-Fi built into the T.V. but unfortunately because of the negatives I would not recommend this T.V. to a friend.

Reviews.Title: smart with a glitch
Reviews.Author: S. P. McClung "Awesomeness"
Reviews.Content: When the smart hub is not updating or connecting this is good and very nice to use. When it tells you on a daily basis thatit is updating you grow weary of it. Usually I use my PS3 to stream movies and its okay that way, but shouldnt require a bandaid. The sound is very low, but I bought a philips sound bar... cheap but good. The image is really nice, not sure why people complain there. For the price its still a good deal, cheaper than a dumb tv I bought 4 years ago.

Reviews.Title: Works Great, Love the internet function
Reviews.Author: Joe Hartmann
Reviews.Content: Overall great, with the common quirks.  Picture is excellent.  Love the SmartTV function except that it seems to add plenty of free shopping apps all by itself.  I would definitely password protect if you have small children around.  My one biggest gripe actually really bugs me, and that is that the manual on off, channel, volume buttons are the poorest located and identified television buttons I have ever seen.  I had the TV for over a week before stumbling across the buttons because something didn't quite look right.  My wife literally put her hands on the "button" while looking for it without being able to identify it as the "button".  In the end just don't lose the remote and the TV should work great.

Reviews.Title: Best Price on Amazon
Reviews.Author: Festeroso
Reviews.Content: Still learning about the tv....So far many nice things, but the speakers are little weak and the color needs some adjusting. Could be more vibrant.... on blu ray you can see it in full glory on reg cable its decent not outstanding.

Reviews.Title: Smart Hub Complete Dud; Amazon Customer Service Fantastic
Reviews.Author: Merideth Bentley
Reviews.Content: The TV setting worked fine (with antenna), but the Smart Hub frequently froze (even after unplugging the TV, it would turn on right back to the frozen screen) and even when the Smart Hub "worked," it took anywhere from 3-15 minutes to load an app.  Amazon customer service quickly recognized that I had a faulty TV and sent a replacement.  Now just have the hassle of returning the old one and setting up the new one.  Hope it works better than the first one ...

Reviews.Title: Awesome TV for the price
Reviews.Author: Stephanie Baillargeon
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my boyfriend for his birthday, and I really had to do some research as he is a total audio/videophile. The TV speakers aren't great (you're not going to get awesome speakers on a TV for this price, unfortunately) but the TV itself is great. We don't use the Netflix app much since we have a PS3, but we use the Spotify app, which works really smoothly.  The picture was not that great out of the the box, but with some tweaking, it looks awesome.  I love that it's full-array instead of edge lit; makes all the difference in the world when dark scenes occur.  The USB option works really well, and it has autoplay which is a plus. All-around, just an awesome TV for the price.

Reviews.Title: Outstanding value! Great performance!
Reviews.Author: Jeff McConnell
Reviews.Content: My new smart TV is everything I hoped for and MORE. Samsung really came through on this model. I recommend a closer look!

Reviews.Title: What a great TV
Reviews.Author: zildel
Reviews.Content: This TV met all my expectations. So easy to set up and the picture and Apps are great. Highly recommed it.

Reviews.Title: We Love it!
Reviews.Author: Maria Harbert
Reviews.Content: My husband's TV in his cave went out and we already have the same TV but smaller in the living room.  Amazon offered such a great deal with price and shipping-it was a no brainer.  Set up was easy, it is a smart TV.  If you run into problems or are just confused Samsung has wonderful customer service.  My family is so happy with our purchase.

Reviews.Title: Amazon gets an 'A' --  Samsung Does Not...
Reviews.Author: Matthew Gersuk
Reviews.Content: I'll save all of the gory details of what went wrong with our new Samsung.  So for those who aren't particularly interested in TCON controllers and the red vertical lines that magically appear on your TV screen -- let's just say that Samsung doesn't build a good product -- and its service and follow-up protocol is maddening.  One of those lovely processes where the manufacturers makes YOU feel like the bad guy.Amazon though, is officially the good guy.  It took one phone call to a live customer service agent to explain the situation (problematic TV barely 90-days old), and to get an OK to return the TV for a refund.I've already ordered and received another set -- another brand naturally !

Reviews.Title: TV is great
Reviews.Author: Erica Armstrong
Reviews.Content: Love it...  Takes a while to get the coloring just right but keep messing with the settings you will get it to the right setting...  I googled the tv settings and came up with some good ideas...  Love the movies on it... I have it for 2 months now and no complaints.

Reviews.Title: Was smart only first year!
Reviews.Author: wr
Reviews.Content: After the first year Dumb TV name is more appropriate.  This TV didn't received any support from Samsung even it was still on guarantee period. The wireless is working randomly and the TV restart or shutdown itself several times on day with no reason. Seems that the issues are intentionally caused by the manufacturer!!!

Reviews.Title: Better and better!
Reviews.Author: Cody Wilcox
Reviews.Content: I have bought a few things from this website and I just keep getting better and better results!Bought this tv on Amazon used......looks brand new and acts brand new!  Have had this for over a month now and its great!!!

Reviews.Title: Samsung UN32EH5300 32-inch 1080p 60 Hz Smart LED HDTV (Black)
Reviews.Author: Audrey H.
Reviews.Content: Great picture. Has many options to select from on all the apps.  Like it a lot. Would recommend it highly.

Reviews.Title: Samsung UN32EH5300 32-Inch 1080p 60 Hz Smart LED HDTV (Black)
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "FOTOWAG"
Reviews.Content: The Samsung UN32EH5300 32-Inch 1080p 60 Hz Smart LED HDTV is an excellent product.  I am a Samsung fan and have a 55 inch TV that is great as well.  THe 32 inch set up in less then 10 minutes after assembly of the Pedestal.  The Samsung electronics is exceptional.  I had WiFi running and was connected to my Amazon Prime in short order.  Picture Quality is excellent. You can't go wrong with this TV, another great Samsung Product.  I should mention that the Amazon Prime delivery was right on time as usual.  Product  came undamaged just like if i had picked up at a local store.  You can't get better than Amazon merchandizing.

Reviews.Title: 5300 does not support YouTube app
Reviews.Author: Vicky
Reviews.Content: Learned this in a hard way. While the TV performance is so good, this series of Samsung TVs do not support YouTube apps. Instead Samsung provided an app called LinkToYouTube, which is not an app itself, instead it is a shortcut to link to the browser version of YouTube. It was not posted anywhere in the reviews and even Amazon and Samsung tech support do not know this clearly. Finally one gentleman from Samsung confirmed that Samsung 5300 series smart TVs do not support YouTube. The support people from Amazon were so amazing and they were helpful all the way trying to help fix this problem, finally accepting to my TV back.

Reviews.Title: Pros and Cons
Reviews.Author: swat team
Reviews.Content: Pros--Samsung has one of the best displays crisp clean clean and colorful, beautiful.-Adding the Samsung dongle you can mirror your Samsung Galaxy screen to your TV (in720p) and use your phone and a music hub for the party.-Internet TV (almost) .- You can control Youtube from you smart phone. Pair your phone with the TV though the Youtube app and use your phone to search and select titles the TV will then play from Youtube.-Pop a USB in the side and watch a movie. (It will chop a few seconds off the beginning before it starts playing but overall its quite good via USB)Cons--Youtube App is impossible, it stops and starts when there’s plenty of buffer. I recently purchased the Netgear Nighthawk AC1900 router and get 20Gb to my laptop but this app can not play a simple youtube video. Try playing a GoPro video, g go a, ah,head. Very frustrating and unusable experience.-Smart hub updates frequently and just as you turn it on and sit down for dinner. You will finish your dinner in the quiet suspense waiting to watch Netflix as it finishes. Ironically it instructs you to go watch TV while it updates. If I wanted to watch over the air broadcasts I would have not spent the money to get a 'Smart' TV with internet.- App selection is very small. If you have used the ROKU3 dongle you know you can access a huge array of channel apps, even custom channels you find on the internet. The Smart TV is a limited and controlled Samsung universe. It needs to open a channel option to display more creative content if Samsung wants to sell more TV's.and adapt to the future.The bottom line its a great TV with some really annoying faults for the internet age. This product says Samsung does not seem to understand the internet is replacing broadcast TV. The Smart Hub is a small play in a big game and they need to make some serious changes or get swept aside in the rush to the internet. Right now I would be happy if they youtube app worked. I wish I could rate Samsung SMART TV's higher as I have loved my other Samsung devices.

Reviews.Title: Love this TV
Reviews.Author: griffithtandg
Reviews.Content: I am sure I will love it even more when my husband sets up the WiFi that's he has been promising to do.  I can't wait to access the internet on this TV.

Reviews.Title: My first large-screen LCD TV, and I love it.
Reviews.Author: Matt F.
Reviews.Content: I spent a long time researching my purchase and I believe for the price-point you really can't go wrong. Don't expect features that are found in TVs that are twice the price, but for what you get this TV definitely delivers. Features I like the best: 1080p video, HDMI inputs, WiFi capability, SmartTV features.You can use a USB mouse and keyboard with this TV.Display lag on the Samsung UN46EH5300F is about 29 milliseconds. Anything under 20 is considered excellent, while 21-41 is still considered great. I have not noticed any input lag on this TV while playing games on my PS3, nor while using an HDMI connection.I use the TV as an external monitor a lot, most often connecting my laptop to it. A long HDMI cable is a cost-effective solution without any of the problems of wireless. If you don't have an HDMI-output on your PC you can buy an adapter, either VGA-to-HDMI or DVI-to-HDMI depending on your PC connection. The sharpness of items like text is excellent via HDMI, though I can't comment about a DVI or VGA adapter connection.I use Dynamic picture mode for TV channels with the following settings: Backlight 18, Contrast 85, Brightness 50, Sharpness 80, Color 70, Tint 50/50. I use Standard mode with Netflix.As far as apps go, I use Netflix the most and find it useful being integrated in the TV instead of through an outside box like my PS3. I like dealing with fewer controllers.Overall I really like my purchase and would definitely recommend it!

Reviews.Title: Not what I expected from Samsung... Or is it?!?
Reviews.Author: Christopher C. Dissler
Reviews.Content: The TV itself works fine, I had no trouble setting it up and making it work. However, the internet readiness of the product is subject to Samsung not working out some bug. I received the TV about a month ago, and I can honestly tell you that 60% of the time I cannot access any of the apps.I wish I did a little more research and bought a more reliable TV, this thing sucks if you want to watch netflix, most of the time.{EDIT} After writing this review, I realized that the problem with the internet readiness of this product is a bigger deal that I had rated, so this now gets a one. Based on information from Samsung, the problem with streaming media not working is on their end, and it happens too often.

Reviews.Title: Replacement TV
Reviews.Author: Charlotte Mckenzie
Reviews.Content: Good quality TV.  Disappointed in remote control controls could be more intuitive. Smart TV updates are very annoying, they have up to three updates a week sometimes taking 10 to 20 minutes per update.  the Roku box nor the PlayStation have this type of delays or frustrating tendencies.

Reviews.Title: great picture and sound. but really should be listed as a  "dumb tv"....
Reviews.Author: zank
Reviews.Content: constantly displays popups about updating "smart tv" even when watching DVD, cable or xbox. popups stay up for about 15 seconds, if you cant find the sammy remote to hit cancel. slow performance, even on fiber isp.TV is great, software is utter junk.

Reviews.Title: Great picture quality
Reviews.Author: K. Keim
Reviews.Content: This TV has great picture quality after using recommended settings in another review below, and the sound is decent.However, there is one minor issue, and one big issue with this TV.The minor issue is that there are different picture settings for TV, AV, and Smart TV.  Thus you have to set the recommended settings three different times.  Not that big of deal.  The big issue is that the Search feature on the Smart TV locks up the TV.  It shows a progress icon like something is happening, but it just sits there forever.  You have to turn the TV off and back on to get rid of it.  You would think they would have fixed this via a software update by now.  Instead of using this, I go to the Movies and TV app and search from there.

Reviews.Title: The TV is fine, the smart TV is dumb.
Reviews.Author: Lazlomatic
Reviews.Content: First of all, I think this is be all related to the crummy software on this TV.- I get random reboots all the time when accessing the smart hub, often enough to be annoying, but I cannot reproduce them on demand.- The apps (Netflix & Youtube) seem to work fine.  But when trying to stream media from my computer all hell breaks loose.  Both oth Samsung's Allshare and Plex media server will not reliably show up on the connections.  I have to turn the TV on and off, or hit refresh, and things will sort of randomly appear.  Sometimes one of my two windows user accounts, sometimes both, my NAS drive, Plex and Samsung's own Allshare.  Annoying, but after a few tries I can usually get Plex or Allshare and when I select somtimes I can get to the point where I can star a movie this is where it gets wierd.- When I stream from the computer, after about 5-10 minutes the connection drops and I get an informative message, something like: "you are disconnected"  If I immediately select my player again it starts the film over again, like nothing was wrong.  This happens both on the Ethernet or WiFi.  The only way I can get it to work is if I setup the TV on my Ethernet and then for some reason disable my WiFI on my computer.  Don't ask me how I figured that one out.  I thought It might be a DHCP issue at first, but I'm more comfortable blaming the TV.I contacted Samsung's tech support several times and they never seemed to understand the issues.  They finally told me to ship my TV to them and they would have a look, but I never felt that they were documenting things properly.  I work in this field and I know how the tech support goons operate.  Give the nature of my issues which were largely intermittent, someone would likely be given my TV and a ticket that says "Network Connection Problems", hook it up to a network and turn youtube on for 30 seconds and send it back saying everything works fine now.  Oh well I hooked up a cheap Sony Blu-ray player and everything works great.  Sort of defeats the purpose of having a smart TV.

Reviews.Title: Samsung UN32EH5300 32-Inch TV
Reviews.Author: spddm0n "sandman"
Reviews.Content: I really like this TV, its bright crisp and clear pictures are very pleasing to look at. Smart TV, and LED is the way to go. This is my first smart TV, so I cannot compare it to others, but Samsung's smart hub is pretty good and intuitive; you don't need to be a tech guru to figure things out.

Reviews.Title: The Best- easy setup, great pic and loud enough for those with hearing problems!
Reviews.Author: Linda Smiles "Shopper"
Reviews.Content: This is one of the best things I ever purchased! The price was fabulous too- check CamelCamel to see Amazon's lowest price.I am not a tech person and i was able to set this TV up in a few minutes- it's connected to an antenna that was installed in my attic over 30 years ago and gets a fabulous picture with great sound quality. The wireless WiFi connection is a plus and I'm enjoying Netflix and Amazon Prime videos.I've read a lot of the positive and negative reviews on Amazon but I have no problems whatever with this TV and it is absolutely perfect- great picture, great sound and easy to use. I would prefer a dedicated on/off button instead of the toggle switch - that is the only thing that I would change. This TV has really made me happy -buy one and enjoy!

Reviews.Title: Excellent TV
Reviews.Author: S. Phillips "SP"
Reviews.Content: Love this smart TV! Easy to connect to wifi, easy to navigate menus and install additional apps. Beautiful picture. I may buy another one!

Reviews.Title: Samsung 32 inch Smart TV
Reviews.Author: Patricia Van Vactor
Reviews.Content: Wonderful color sharpness Easy to put together Light weight I had trouble setting up . Amazon helped me with that

Reviews.Title: great buy
Reviews.Author: anne
Reviews.Content: i love my tv, clean and clear picture, sound wonderful, buy buy buy Samsung is a really great buy, i just love it

Reviews.Title: Smart TV???
Reviews.Author: Chameleonhouse
Reviews.Content: This may be a "Smart" TV, but it sure does take a while to come to a conclusion and then it has to rethink its conclusion.I ordered this TV because I liked the idea that it was wireless and it had Amazon Prime, Hulu Plus, and You Tube built in. However....what is the good of having built ins if it can take up 10 minutes to load and then continually refreshes? It can get so confused it restarts a show to the beginning.I thought it might be a wireless issue, so I set it up wired...same problem.I am disappointed with this model. Surprising for Samsung. They have wonderful products and I've never been disappointed until now.The picture quality of this TV is its saving grace. The picture is crystal clear; otherwise I would have returned it by now.If you absolutely, positively must buy this television, I highly recommend you purchase the protection plan. I will be contacting Square Trade shortly.In the mean time, I'll hook up a wireless Roku box. Never had any issues with that.

Reviews.Title: NO LONGER SUPPORTS YOUTUBE APP!!
Reviews.Author: A. Ohu
Reviews.Content: I spent a good deal of time on the phone with Samsung today, and eventually got to a product specialist who said that there is no longer a YouTube app for Samsung smart tvs. The only way to access it is through the web browser. They do give you a "link to YouTube" shortcut, but basically you have to use the arrow keys on your remote to move the mouse, there is no integration whatsoever (you can't click up and down between selectable items, you just mosey around the screen until you manage to settle over what you want to click).  So it basically completely sucks... I thought Samsung and Google were besties but no more I suppose!  She said that even the new models will have this deficiency.  Although she didn't call it that of course.Also the smart hub is really slow in general, and I'm hardwired to my 50/35 internet so it isn't me.Well priced, picture is good, smart features are poor.

Reviews.Title: Perfect for me
Reviews.Author: Jim
Reviews.Content: Got this (elsewhere than Amazon) to finally replace a 13 year old 32" Samsung box TV in a recreation room, and I'm loving it. Hookup was easy, albeit with my tech savvy son-in-law's help (actually, he pretty much did everything :-), and after he explained to me how to operate it (and I took a few notes), getting the hang of it went pretty fast and smooth. I mostly use it for streaming Netflix and watching DVD's, etc., as I do not subscribe to any type of TV service (it's so nice to never ever see TV commercials in my home anymore). Images are clear and sharp, blacks are really black and rich, but to prevent glare from the semi-glossy screen I have to close blinds if it's light outside, and I had to fiddle with the lighting in the room so I wouldn't get glare. This didn't cost me a heck of a lot more than the old Samsung box TV it replaced cost me 13 years ago, and there's really no comparison between them.

Reviews.Title: great choice love it kids love it great price
Reviews.Author: freddie cook
Reviews.Content: i love this smart tv ...just wish it came with the watch espn app..the wifi work great couldn't stop watching it

Reviews.Title: Perfect TV for me.
Reviews.Author: J. An
Reviews.Content: Everything works great, playing the movie, music and photo from my shared folder thru Wi-Fi.Many interesting channel from the app.

Reviews.Title: Good looking, but needs frequent re-registration
Reviews.Author: Julie C.
Reviews.Content: I don't know why, but it drops my router off the list quite frequently and I have to re-register the router, password, etc. I shouldn't really know these numbers by heart, but I must be inputting them frequently enough for the numbers to make deep grooves in my brain.

Reviews.Title: Samsung never fails to produce a great product
Reviews.Author: Jo Ann M. Whiteman
Reviews.Content: Up on the wall and truly a great product.  One of the previous reviewers outlined a picture set up; however, ours came in looking just right.  Samsung never fails to produce a great product.

Reviews.Title: Nice pricepoint for a great picture
Reviews.Author: HeloMech "Cinny"
Reviews.Content: I have had this TV a little less than a month, but long enough to give it my initial review.  After some serious studying, I settled on this model to replace an aged Sharp Aquos CFL.  One of the most important features that I was looking for was adjustments.  I am very particular about my picture, and having a full array of adjustments to fine tune the picture is a must.  This model has ample means for fine adjustment, and paired with AVSHD calibration screens I was able to get it dialed right in.  The picture and contrast are impressive for this price point. Don't let the 60hz fool you, it is nice and smooth, even gaming. I also use a Samsung blue ray player, and the auto resolution and frame rate work very well together.  I don't use the built in speakers, so I can't really comment on the sound.  I have the TV mounted to the wall, but I did use the factory mount until it got here.  I was not too impressed with the factory base, but I know that it would probably work ok.  I just get nervous having such a large panel on such a flimsy base.  We live pretty far from town in the mountains, and use Dish and DishNet for our services.  I didn't really need a smart tv, as my limited download quota from satellite does not allow for much streaming.  But it seems to be intuitive, all be it slow. Don't expect computer browser speed, and seems to have limited RAM.  I bet Netflix and Pandora work well, but can't really say.  However,  pairing with our Samsung phones is very painless, and watching video/pictures from the phones is very easy and clear. Also, the USB port is super handy for Calibration, as you can download your calibration software, and run it right off the USB.  All in all, I am very pleased with the picture, which is ultimately what the purpose of the TV.  It is all dialed in, just waiting for Superbowl!

Reviews.Title: 32 inch screen
Reviews.Author: sherrill given
Reviews.Content: everything GOOD about this TV. i like samsung products and ,so far, have never been dissapointed. perfect size for any room!

Reviews.Title: Delivery fail
Reviews.Author: Julia Adams
Reviews.Content: The product was perfect - very nice TV with many great features.  However productwas not delivered when they scheduled it - when I had arranged to have someone hereto receive.  It was delivered to an empty house - a day early - with no wrapping whatsoever- in the original box proudly informing anyone "Free TV".  Thank God for the Amazontext system which let me know it had been delivered - and I could leave work and racehome to pull it off my front porch.  Luckily I did not have an accident/heart attack/strokeon the way home - but it was extremely traumatic none the less.

Reviews.Title: A very good TV
Reviews.Author: William Looft
Reviews.Content: 1080p is a good step up from 720p. Samsung is highly rated by Consumer Reports. The TV has a very clear picture.

Reviews.Title: Wow what a buy
Reviews.Author: Leonard Kaplan
Reviews.Content: This is one of the best TV I have. Would recommend to anyone. Love watching this have a good pic and easy to use.

Reviews.Title: Great TV for the price
Reviews.Author: M. Marlowe
Reviews.Content: I picked this up for a really good price over Thanksgiving.  The first one I ordered was lost by UPS so Amazon sent a second one.  The second one was misdelivered by UPS and temporarily lost, but once I got it (by Christmas), it worked great.It suit my needs perfectly, cheap TV, big enough screen, replaced an old CRT TV.  I set the color settings to the ones suggested in a review below and it looks great.  Amazon customer service was great to deal with during the UPS fiasco.I like the SmartTV function.  It connected to my WiFi with very little effort on my part.  Watching YouTube videos in HD on a huge screen is awesome.Overall great TV and I would recommend it to a friend.

Reviews.Title: It takes forever to start smart contents
Reviews.Author: Farah
Reviews.Content: it is OK for viewing regular TV but not amazon or other smart TV contents, always says "starting" and takes forever! most of the times it does updating, not a good smart TV.

Reviews.Title: Samsung TV
Reviews.Author: mary mcclearn
Reviews.Content: The Samsung UN46EH5300 46 inch 1080 60 Hz LED HDTV has  a great Picture and the sound is wonderful. Samsung has easy setup.

Reviews.Title: Works Great
Reviews.Author: JXP
Reviews.Content: Pandora, Netflix, Facebook, Amazon Prime, Hulu Plus, Internet Browser  Need I say more? LED is the best, lowest energy consumption great picture

Reviews.Title: Smart and simple TV
Reviews.Author: J. R. Black "quizkid"
Reviews.Content: This was a Christmas gift and we love it.The setup was a snap (attach base and attach cables) and the unit easily found our wireless connection. Great picture and lots of viedeo service choices  and apps. The hardest thing to do is to decide what you'll watch.

Reviews.Title: Nice TV
Reviews.Author: Arthur R Stark
Reviews.Content: Of course it replaced an ancient Sony monster but still out of the box setup was simple and although I am not to good at rating screen resolution it looked great to me right out of the box. I'll stick with Samsung, this is my third purchase of the Samsung and ni una problema!

Reviews.Title: Good picture, s***ty software.
Reviews.Author: Ashlyn E Renfro
Reviews.Content: The picture on this TV is great, but the Smart Hub is not worth using. It's slow and extremely buggy.If you want to use this TV for more than TV or console games you pretty much need to have it hooked up to a PC.

Reviews.Title: WOW!
Reviews.Author: LA-Lawyer
Reviews.Content: This SmarTV practically comes with its own Juris Doctor!  I have priced all brands, sizes and options until the statistics are coming out of my ears and can honestly say this is the PRODUCT WITH THE MOST BANG!  Unless you are a Sony junkie and simply "have to have" Sony...(I am not making fun because I used to be that way about Sony and Hewlett Packard...and do not even START me into talking about how much I presently despise HP...  I understand brand loyalty, but this Samsung is every bit as great as any Sony I have seen or owned.  For a quarter of the price, you cannot go wrong.  Buy your Sony for the more visible parts of your home, if you must and hide your Samsung in the master or in your library.  I hung mine, proudly, in my main den / salon.  (I am hiding my Sanyo flat screen DCL in my master...LOL!)

Reviews.Title: Good TV, Bad Smart TV
Reviews.Author: Ben
Reviews.Content: The picture quality is great and sound is better than I expected.However I purchased this mainly for use with online streaming video services and the "Smart TV" functions are very disappointing.  Apparently the TV has a "phone home" function where it needs to connect to Samsung servers before allowing you to access netflix, etc. through the TV itself.  On an average day this means it can take 30 seconds to over a minute to open netflix.  On a bad day the service is down and you cannot access online services at all.3 stars because as a normal TV this works great, if you plan on using this for online services look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: Samsung HDTV 50"
Reviews.Author: Heather Dean
Reviews.Content: Really an awesome TV.  The picture is the best I have ever seen.  I would definitely buy another one.  The price was very good.

Reviews.Title: No Adobe Flash.
Reviews.Author: Robert J. Miller
Reviews.Content: Great picture; Smart Hub works  well; Better input with USB keyboard and mouse since Samsung remote cumbersome.BUT...browser is Linux based. Adobe Flash 11 will not work so any web site such as [...] will not be accessible.Samsung knows about the issue -- Maybe not doing enough to fix it.

Reviews.Title: Good Buy!
Reviews.Author: Barbara Daum
Reviews.Content: Great look, perfect size, clear picture, good for playing games.  A very good replacement for my old clunky television. Recommended!

Reviews.Title: Sweet arse TV
Reviews.Author: Curtis Irvine
Reviews.Content: I walk by this TV every day, its dead sexy. Everything about it functions real well, good sound, beautiful picture. It didn't take a PAL signal from my Wii I brought back from Europe, but I didn't really expect it to. All in all, Samsung rocks my socks off.

Reviews.Title: It's my first flat screen TV - I think it's great!
Reviews.Author: Jay DeWolfe
Reviews.Content: This is the first flat-screen TV I've owned, and I think it's awesome! Had a bit of trouble initially setting it up to receive my wi-fi router, but after that everything went smoothly. Great screen resolution, great colors, and the sound is very good. Very pleased with this TV all around.

Reviews.Title: Extremely happy!
Reviews.Author: Dianne In NC "WNC shopper"
Reviews.Content: This is my first Samsung, and first Smart TV, and I couldn't be more pleased.  I've always owned Sony Bravia TVs in the past, but my last one burned out over such a short time, and with very little use in that room, that I swore "never again!" and switched, after reading many reviews.
