For our situation I prefer not to use a VESA wall mount, but a solid aftermarket desktop stand that  uses the VESA mount connectors on the TV is something I'm seriously considering.- The native sound volume adjustment is accompanied by a very irritating clicking noise. Be sure to select menu, then system, scroll down to general, then sound feedback, then select off.- HORRIBLE audio quality, regardless of control setting.  Lots of plastic-y resonance in the lower frequencies and distortion at higher frequencies.  Limited volume range magnifies the inherent problems.  This TV ***absolutely begs*** for an aftermarket sound solution, whether it's a sound bar or home theater package.  Right now I'm favoring the ZVox 555 as a one-solution-does-all as the best bet for me.  Lord, anything but the lousy internal speakers! BTW, I demo'ed the Bose Solo in the Bose store and could not detect the difference between the internal Samsung speakers and the Solo.I'll be a happy customer if I can solve the unstable base and audio quality issues, but until then I can't give this HDTV any more than three stars. Caveat emptor!

Reviews.Title: Happy I bought it
Reviews.Author: Betty A.
Reviews.Content: This was a major purchase for me but I'm glad I did it.  Easy to set up, great picture and sound.  I like that I can connect to Netflix without another box.

Reviews.Title: WiFi is Great, Picture is Great, Sound is Horrible.......
Reviews.Author: Robs
Reviews.Content: The Picture is Awesome, the Sound is AWEFUL....Almost Unacceptable....The speakers are on the back on the bottom, it actually sounds better if you stand behind the display.....I'm getting a sound bar so this will no longer be a problem but if you'r expecting to use this TV without some sort of External Sound System your in for a surprise....WiFi is Great, Picture is Great, Sound is Horrible.......

Reviews.Title: Excellent TV
Reviews.Author: Paul J Jackson
Reviews.Content: Great TV. Get online right away and do the updates before you do anything else. Easy to setup. I love the "Smart TV" features.

Reviews.Title: great TV, but, youtube pairing does not work
Reviews.Author: K. Huang
Reviews.Content: Great TV.But, YouTube pairing only works for few minutes, you need to repeat setup again and again.Next time, I prefer to get the Google TV and LCD/LED TV separately.

Reviews.Title: Solid tv
Reviews.Author: jon
Reviews.Content: Very good picture.... easy to use UI....using the browser without a plug in keyboard is painful. Browser sometimes lags playing HD video, but overall pretty good. Especially for normal webpages or lower quality video streams. It can read many different formats of video and audio files straight off of a flash drive or external HDD... DLNA synces with galaxy s3 through allshare  easily.Speakers are surprisingly good, very loud and no distortion when played loudly.

Reviews.Title: I love this TV !!!
Reviews.Author: E. Corcoran "elaine210"
Reviews.Content: This is my first smart TV and let me tell you I am in love . Pictures great ,sounds great and the apps are great !!!. Best investment I ever made in a TV !!

Reviews.Title: i was impressed with the ease of installation
Reviews.Author: R. Reiber "bob"
Reviews.Content: after reading some of the reviews that bad mouthed this product i was a bit worried but took a chance thinking that since it has been on the market for a while, samsung will have gotten most of the bugs out and so far, my hunch has been proved correct. i plugged it in, it walked me through the setup and then did some firmware upgrades and has been working great. if you don't plan to connect the tv to the internet, then don't buy it. it turely is a computer masquerading as a tv. it even detected that we have cable and automatically went to channel 3. Netflix and other apps are downloadable from the samsung store for free. an added bonus that we did not expect was an exercise app, that has a large number of exercise programs to choose from. So far this tv has been everything we expected. We have not yet connected it to a home theater, if you use this as your primary tv, you might want to consider some sort of sound system. the speakers are not bad for a flat screen tv, but if you are used to booming bass and surround sound, then the built in speakers will not do it for you.

Reviews.Title: Excellent T.v. but continue reading...
Reviews.Author: Kace Khamm
Reviews.Content: It's a great t.v. it's got a lot of settings so you can customize the picture to your taste.  The 46 is big and honestly (in general) I wouldn't go bigger than a 46 because thats the line where 1080p starts to look kind of bad.The stand was installed easily but even with the stand, the T.V. is very wobbly if you touch it. I'm a very paranoid person.The internal USB functionality is somewhat limited. It reads Flash Drives and all that stuff fine. But I have a 750gb external hard drive with over 500gb of content on it and it takes FOREVER to read. I didn't have this problem with my 2 other Samsung T.V.s that have the same internal usb function with the same external hard drive. But with other devices it works flawlessly and fast. It reads MKV files and MP4 files flawlessly and beautifully and I've been enjoying the shows on my hard drive so far.It's a beautiful t.v. to look at and I don't care if it's not an ultra slim Television, because it's still light weight and small.I chose this T.V. because this one was the cheapest out of all the LED t.v.s right now and even the more expensive ones only have 2 HDMI and only one Usb. This one has 3 HDMI and 2 USB plus a shared component/composite and digital audio out.I think this is/was a great investment. I got it for 597.99 (41% off) and I feel bad for anyone that buys it for more than 700 dollars. And this t.v. sold out pretty fast and is still sold out so I got lucky.UPDATE: The internal USB Function works fine, I just had applications and games that were preventing the tv from reading the video files on my hard drive. Plays all my videos fine. Still love this T.V. It looks beautiful and works well!As for the smart hub I forgot to mention, It works decently. It's not the best or the fastest but it's not really aggravatingly slow.I don't even use the t.v. for it's smart tv features so it doesn't really matter to me.

Reviews.Title: Recommended, especially if you are looking for value-for-money
Reviews.Author: SP
Reviews.Content: What i like about this TV:1. I was looking for a good deal on a 40 inch LED TV. I was not necessarily interested in a Smart TV, but this TV was right within my budget.2. I have been using the Smart features, since I don't have a cable yet. With YouTube, Netflix and Hulu, I have enough content.3. Picture quality is good. Side note: I am 'upgrading' from an LG LCD TV, and frankly don't find any difference in quality of pictureCouple of things that could be improved:1. Sound quality is poor and you would immediately notice it2. For a Smart TV, remote needs to be better. I am thinking of buying a wireless keyboard that can work with this TVIf you are looking for a LED TV and don't plan to spend too many dollars on a product that keeps getting outdated every 12 months, I would highly recommend this product.

Reviews.Title: So versatile.
Reviews.Author: MARY LYNN JONES
Reviews.Content: It is so easy to move from venue to venue. My grand children love to play the Wii on it and I like a lot of the apps. Very user friendly.

Reviews.Title: Great choice
Reviews.Author: Timothy
Reviews.Content: I did a little bit of research on the tv before purchasing. I did not purchase it from amazon but I did get it at a local store for under 600 and it is quite the tv I must say. It does more than a tv should! Perfect! Thats all.

Reviews.Title: Wonderful Smart TV
Reviews.Author: R. Sablan "Palm Pre"
Reviews.Content: I have owned this product for a month now and I love it. My Samsung Galaxey S III connected immediately and the wireless connection to my Router was seemless. I do not have a single problem with any of the content and options available to this TV. I will be getting another larger screen since 40 inches nowadays just seems small. This will make the perfect master bedroom TV.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I have no complaints with the TV other than the screen calibration is pretty poor when you receive it and I'm not a huge fan of the Smart features due to lag.  Even though there tends to be quite a bit of lag in the Smart Hub, it does the job in the end.  If you have another smart device like a Roku, Apple TV, Blue Ray player, or gaming system, etc, you will be better off using those devices instead.  As far as the calibration goes, there are several preset options that look pretty good, but you can also manually set them yourself using many guides available in other reviews or on the internet.  After calibration, it has an amazing picture and works great with Directv.  The user interface is one of the best I've ever seen on a TV and easy to navigate.  The sound is pretty decent for a flatscreen TV.  The remote works well and is very well built.  The USB slots on the side of the TV really bring a lot of extra functionality with videos and external devices.  I tried attaching my wireless Logitech keyboard and it picked it right up.  I thought this was awesome that I could use a keyboard with the smart functions of the TV.  One thing I disliked is the keyboard is not supported in the Youtube app and doesn't add to it.  Overall, the TV does its main job perfectly and looks great.  If you are buying this TV solely for it's Smart features, it could be pretty awesome, but it's not quite there yet because of the lag.  It does work, but it can be pretty slow to get from one menu to another.  It does play Youtube, Amazon Prime, Netflix, and Hulu Plus very well, but I wouldn't expect much more out of the Smart Hub besides that.  I also don't like that you cannot uninstall the preinstalled apps.  This makes organization poor in my opinion.  Overall, a great buy and I recommend it highly.

Reviews.Title: Great HDTV
Reviews.Author: John Torres "JTorres23"
Reviews.Content: When looking to purchase an LED HDTV Samsung was one of the recommended manufacturers. I also looked at Vizio and LG. From the comparison of features, functionality, and price I decided on the Samsung. The Samsung received multiple 4 and 5 star reviews. The HDTV has been working great, excellent picture and easy to use Smart features. I would recommend purchase of this HDTV.

Reviews.Title: really bright
Reviews.Author: Are
Reviews.Content: It's ok, I'd have given it 3.5 stars, 3 seemed too harsh.The image is very sharp but the colors require a lot of tweaking, the factory presets are not very good ... to my eye, anyhow. After a month I'm still trying out combinations. What I'm starting to suspect is that the main issue seems to be that it's just too bright - it makes for nice bright whites, but I'm still trying to balance it all out so that you get a nice rich picture without dimming it too much. They'll have earned the last half of that fourth star if I ever get it to my liking.The sound is also ok but not great. Very acceptable, but less than stellar ... as should be expected - get separate speakers if you want fantastic sound. It would be nice if the bass mid and treble controls (five Hz sliders actually) were available in the presets other than standard mode. This happens a lot - some settings are not always accessible in different presets, why?The remote control also could use some redesign. Most of the the buttons seem the same to the touch and are quite close to one another, you have to look at it to use it.Otherwise, works as expected. I wouldn't say I'm disappointed, but I wish the picture would be more balanced and that it would be a bit more flexible in the software settings.

Reviews.Title: very satisfied
Reviews.Author: GRM
Reviews.Content: Almost everything is fine with this product. The quality of the picture and sound is excellent. The only disappointment I have, but this has been corrected in later versions, is that the Web browser cannot be manipulated with a bluetooth keyboard or, for that matter, with any keyboard. Trying to move through the alphabet with the onscreen keyboard is slow, cumbersome, and a disincentive. But I bought the product for the quality of the picture and the other Smart TV applications so I am satisfied.GRM

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: afool "~Pass the wine~"
Reviews.Content: I was amazed how fast this was shipped and at my door. Hooked up and it's a very nice tv. For the network thing, don't use the program you get from Samsung. it's buggy. I got the free program called SERVIO and it works with this tv great. The USB with attached external HD works just fine too. Nice tv to watch in the bedroom and access all your downloaded movies on an external or from other things on the network. Would give it more stars if I could. The sound is very decent for a bedroom as well. It'll stream everything well except HD movies using the wireless.  Now.. It does stream HD every so often it has to buffer. I'm using a G router though, and have an N router just not hooked up yet.. this might make all the difference.  Using the G router though, on HD movies streaming a few buffers in there. All others play well.  Hooked up a CAT5 cable to it from the switch, and HD plays perfect.

Reviews.Title: i just bought this TV thru Dell...
Reviews.Author: scopin4u2
Reviews.Content: i wanted to write a review on this TV. and it's not that i'm biased to Samsung TV's, but this is a really nice TV! but it doesn't surprise me. I have 2 other Samsung Smart TV's that are 3D, besides this one. and they all deliver the same elements that i expected and got from the very first Samsung i ever owned. these are really superior TV's. the picture is really exceptional, compared to others i've seen and watched side by side in the various stores. the features of the TV, setup and general usage are really good and easy compared to others. it definitely leaves NO ISSUES AT HAND like i've been reading about with the people complaining about the Vizio line of products, Sony (and i used to buy ONLY SONY PRODUCTS at one time) and my experience with Panasonic as well (i didn't like that Viera at all, because of the lack of features for the price you pay).  but my switch in product line,  is only indicative of the overall quality for which you seek. i don't think you have to pay an absolute FORTUNE to get something of HIGH aspects to your specific liking. just because something costs more, doesn't mean you're getting MORE. but when you get something with a REASONABLE FIT it leaves a more lasting impression, and keeps you coming back for MORE. and these Samsung TV's do just that! they do the job and do it WELL! while i LOVE Amazon very much..(i got my TV at DELL because i bought a computer and was given 2 gift cards that equalled half the price of the TV. And when i bought the TV, they gave me YET ANOTHER $50 gift card. so now, DELL is keeping me coming back FOR MORE as well.)

Reviews.Title: Nice TV with just about everything
Reviews.Author: Michael S. Bull
Reviews.Content: I am extremely happy with my purchase. The TV is the first HDTV I have purchased but I did own one other Insignia that wa given to me. I'm not an expert but this TV had great picture quality and I love all the new wifi and smart app features, even though the apps are not as easy to use as IPhone apps. Hopefully these bugs will be worked out with future software upgrades and if they do I would give it five stars. Otherwise it is still a wonderful TV for under $900. You will enjoy it!!

Reviews.Title: Good value for great TV
Reviews.Author: Carl
Reviews.Content: TV has great picture.  The Samsung App's are terrific.  Use the wireless to connect to Netflix and can watch a movie with no buffering.Setup was very easy.  Smart TV is the way to go, and Samsung did it right.  Volume could be louder, but thats a preference, not a complaint.

Reviews.Title: great tv
Reviews.Author: Jan Turri
Reviews.Content: very happy with this tv. it was our first HD tv and our first smart tv. we bought 3 of them...didn't want to learn too many devices. this tv is EASY to use...i love the internet connection...we've yet to scratch the surface of everything it does but we will eventually. In the mean time, we're very pleased.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: Garret Q Seevers
Reviews.Content: Great TV.  We installed it on an outdoor porch with wireless box from ATT and it has worked great.  The SmartTV features are good, but not the reason to buy.  Picture quality and sound are great.

Reviews.Title: Really like this tv!
Reviews.Author: Mr Dana K. DeMaine
Reviews.Content: I ordered this tv on a Monday afternoon and recieved it at 10am Tuesday, using my Amazon Prime and $3.99 next day shipping. I love this tv, it was very easy to set up and found my wifi with no problems.I bought this tv for my bedroom, and it is a perfect fit.  I searched the air stations and found almost all of them for my area, even without an antenna.  I have Dish network and have not made the switch to hdtv as of yet. I love watching Hulu and Amazon instant Prime streaming content.This tv has great features, even after a few days I know that I will enjoy this tv.Samsung UN32EH5300 32-Inch 1080p 60 Hz LED HDTV (Black)

Reviews.Title: Samsung Smart TV
Reviews.Author: Neil
Reviews.Content: Everything has been great except for one incident a few days after it arrived.It suddenly said there was no internet connection!After a few minutes on google I found I had to manually designate a DNS server, 8.8.4.4.Since then It's worked flawlessly and I'm completely satisfied.I only use it for internet streaming and an occasional dvd.

Reviews.Title: Not what I thought it would be
Reviews.Author: Charles "Wonderchuck"
Reviews.Content: My husband wouldn't let me get a TV for years (all our shows are viewed online).  He used to be a cable guy and has sworn off networks.  For this reason, I did TONS of research, including consumer reports.  I really thought this TV would be just what we needed.  It has a web-browser and makes it look like you can watch online shows. Things like nbc.com or hulu.com (for free, not plus).  However, the memory these streaming videos take, the TV cannot handle.  Anything more than a short youtube clip is too much for it to do.  I solved this, mostly, with a chromecast and a laptop we already had. It's a grainy picture, but not too bad.  The second way we watch TV is with amazon prime.  This TV says you can do that, but it is RIDICULOUSLY slow.  It takes forever to load the app.  You cannot watch HD amazon movies without it pausing to load at least 20 times.  It makes watching a movie a very big headache.  So I called Samsung. They had me reset everything and start the updating process (which honestly takes DAYS to complete) again.  The service agent was very friendly, but she admitted that Samsung designed the TV to not have enough memory for streaming online shows.  They "want you to use the apps" (and pay for them).  The reset sped up amazon for about a day until the TV updated again. Then it was back to pausing and loading 20 times.My husband thought it must be our internet or our router. We even had the phone company come check. Finally, today, I decided to hook a ROKU up to it.  If the ROKU will play amazon fine, then you know it is just the TV.  Sure enough, ROKU plays it great.Long story short:  I don't use any of the "smart" features on this TV.  Instead I use it with a chromecast and roku to watch the things I like.  Picture and sound quality is excellent.  I would be raving about the TV if I had bought it for 10 dollars less as a not-smart TV. But since I spent a month of headaches trying to make it work the way it claims it should, it gets docked two stars.

Reviews.Title: Buyer Beware
Reviews.Author: B. Jesus
Reviews.Content: I should have listened to more of the 1 and 2-star reviews for this TV.  If you are considering this TV for its "smart" features, do yourself a favor and go ahead and factor in the cost of Roku or Amazon Fire TV.  I have owned several Samsung TVs in the past and they have become my go-to brand, but no more.  I cannot believe they released it with such buggy software.  It takes FOREVER to launch the smart hub software and it thinks it needs to update every other day but the version numbers never change in spite of a "update successful" notification.  In addition, sometimes it cannot find my network and forces me to the network configuration wizard where it finds my router, perfect signal strength, gives me a successful connection message before telling me I don't have a network connection when I go back to launch an application (recently moved to wired, we'll see).  Power off, power on, it is a delicate dance.  I've been through firmware updates and software updates and nothing seems to have helped.  This thing is junk.I can't believe I am going to say this but I more recently bought a Vizio Smart TV and it looks, works, and sounds great.  Samsung really dropped the ball on this one and I've lost confidence.  The only reason I am not completely irate is that the non-smart version of this TV cost more money at the time of purchase (about the price of a cheap Roku).Oh yeah, the picture is great (hence, two stars and not one) but the sound is just meh... but that is what I expected.  The remote could be better.  You'll see what I'm talking about if you don't heed my warning.  If I can save one person the hassle then this review has been worth it.  Don't make me say I told you so.  Buyer beware!

Reviews.Title: Breaking my heart, starting to hate this TV
Reviews.Author: sonicfruit
Reviews.Content: Bought this at Costco 4 months ago and really starting to hate this TV..I have a 32" Samsung LCD I LOVE LOVE LOVE (Model LN32D450G1D)  It was on the strength of that TV I bought this new one and man.....I am so disappointed thus far!The picture has issues,  I don't know the difference between LCD and LED and if that is part of why I am disappointed?  My Samsung LED is on point, perfectly clear and vibrant...you literally see every detail on the screen (sometimes shockingly clear..able to see the pores on a person face clear, saliva in their mouth, wiggling uvula clear). Not this LED, the main issue is flesh tones and fast movement on the screen. I have set this new tv the same as my old one, I have set it per the couple of popular reviews here on Amazon..I can get everything looking fairly sharp except people, everything else (plants, furniture, clothes etc) looks good, I will agree with another reviewer who was complaining about black and white colors....Often the flesh tones are wishy washy and not clear. Also, often when there is fast moment on the screen people/faces/things get blurry and or grainy. Another issue is this tv really varies station to station, some stations are crystal clear but others  are not at all..obviously those bad stations are not in HD BUT I do not have that issue with my LCD model..both are 1080 HD 32"...I am shocked at the difference and consistency in pictures. Oh the remote and features...my 2 yo old  Samsung is just right, very user friendly but this newer one there is too much and the remote is not as intuitive..plus the search feature just is in the wrong spot and when you hit it by mistake which happens often at night in bed, it starts search  feature which frequently freezes everything. Oh the one thing I do like, you can press a button to light the keys of remote but it only stays on briefly.I have been over looking the above problems as a minor annoyances but the final straw is the flaky smarthub and software...this TV often freezes and or takes forever in smarthub and or while updating software. Some of the tv functions do not work while in smart hub mode..tonight it will not access internet, it accesses network but not internet, claims I need to call internet provider but everything else wireless in house is working fine...The only thing that has worked well with this has been Amazon Prime but now that is gone tonight..oh Samsung website has been down all evening so I can not get support...(Checked this morning TV/smarthub worked fine, so once again it was the buggy software and issues on Samsungs end, which happens all to often). Thankfully this is in my bedroom because if this was my main tv in living room and I had to deal with this nonsense everyday I would throw it through a window...actually I would have just returned it...and wishing now that I had.The smart hub is maddening, clunky, buggy and slow, so is the wifi connectivity! It often loses wifi connection for no reason. The picture is disappointing, maybe I got a lemon but the difference in my two Samsung's is like night and day!!!Got curious and after reading other reviews I see I am not alone. Had  I to do it all over again I would get a regular Samsung and use Chromecast or now the Amazon Fire. My two year old LCD is the perfect marriage of tech and quality, this model is the opposite and very frustrating to use.I will attempt to contact Samsung support and see how that goes...kinda dreading that but maybe they will surprise me lol. Actually I may also call Costco tech suppport as that comes free too...

Reviews.Title: Will not play NETFLIX and support attempts have been terrible
Reviews.Author: JAIME A VANHOUTEN
Reviews.Content: We purchased this tv with only two purposes in mind:  playing blu-rays/DVDs and Netflix.  It worked fine for about a month and then after an update Netflix quit working.  We have called Samsung support 7 times with remote access assistance twice.  They have been unable to fix it.  They sent a USB that supposedly contained a firmware update.  The tv could not find an update on it.  So we called again and we're told that is because our tv already has the latest firmware.  She admitted many people were complaining about Netflix not working on their TVs and the solution would be in an automatic update soon.  Many weeks later there has not been an update that resolved the issue.  So we called back and were told we had to go through the remote access process again and that department's wait time was 1 hour 45 minutes.  We agreed to wait but after being on hold a bit the call was disconnected.  We are extremely frustrated and out of ideas.  Sorry, Amazon...I am a long time frequent shopper but right now I really wish I had purchased this tv from a local store I could just carry it right back into and stand there until they offered a solution.

Reviews.Title: Dont get a samsung tv !!!
Reviews.Author: kris
Reviews.Content: The Samsung smart hub stopped working !!!It's been a week and there is no way to fix it !!

Reviews.Title: would give 0 if I could worst customer service and technical support ever
Reviews.Author: C. M. Schmidt
Reviews.Content: TV is fine if, and that is a big IF, everything is working fine. First time you have a technical issue (and you will because there is a known DNS server issue which Samsung still has not fixed) you will spend a significant amount of your time over the next few weeks on the phone, via chat and/ or email trying to resolve it. If you finally get someone who speaks moderately decent English they will treat you like a second grader that has trouble grasping simple concepts. Their goal is to get off the phone as quickly as possible and move on to the next poor schmuck who purchased a Samsung product and is having problems. After spending a collective 6 to 7 hours on the phone and on hold and speaking to people in the Philippines and being promised call backs and never receiving them and FINALLY getting someone in the US only to be transfered yet again to a remote support "specialist" who condescendingly directed me to their support dowloads page to download a firmware update that only TEMPORARILY fixes the problem I was finally able to access my SMART, and I use the term loosely,  applications. The call center staff at Samsung, whether in the US, Philippines or India couldn't care LESS about resolving your issue. Their goal is to log as many support calls as possible in their work day. Needless to say, I will not be purchasing Samsung in the future and will tell everyone I get the chance to avoid them like the plague.

Reviews.Title: no regrets!!
Reviews.Author: Yessica Ruiz
Reviews.Content: I love my Tv its been two yrs with it, and it works perfectly well!!! clear picture, clear sound. I was worried about other peoples comments about not working well and reading about the sound being so unclear but all i got to say it works perfectly well.

Reviews.Title: Don't Plan to Watch Netflix
Reviews.Author: Amy Mayer "friEdTechnology"
Reviews.Content: If the Samsung Smart TV came with a Chromecast, I'd give it 5 stars, but as is, Netflix will not load on my set. Google the issue and you'll see hundreds of others have the same problem. The solution is grueling hours on the phone with Samsung trying different settings, but I'd rather spend another $35 on a second Chromecast. My advice is to buy a cheaper TV and a Chromecast; you'll get the same thing as with this TV . . . only it will work.

Reviews.Title: If you're buying this tv for Netflix, think twice before buying
Reviews.Author: Russell A Smith
Reviews.Content: Great price, and the picture is really good once you get it dialed in using helpful settings from reviews here. however once you try to use the Smart Hub you will see the problem. It will update 11 apps and then when you try to use Netflix it won't work, and will again say it needs to update and do the same 11. The Netflix App had a picture of HBO2Go instead. In Samsung Apps it finally told me I had to create a Smart Hub account, did that, then it said I had to download the Netflix App, but when i went to it said it was already there did I want to uninstall it. Then it tried to connect, 30 minutes later while on hold with Samsung and reading the hundreds of online comments, I got through. And Samsung suggested the EXACT things I'd been reading in the complaints. set the DNS to 8888, Uninstall and reinstall the app, reset the defaults and start over, do this do that. When the guy finally told me the problem was either the Netflix App or the Netflix server, I gave up. The tv is going back to Amazon today. Many people buying Smart tv's do so to use Netflix, if the app doesn't work, don't sell it. I have a bigger LG tv, the Netflix works perfectly. So I'm sending this back and buying an LG.Buy at your own risk, eventually they may fix the app, but right now it does not work for thousands of Samsung owners.

Reviews.Title: Netflix doesn't work TVP-805
Reviews.Author: Spork "not a dog"
Reviews.Content: Netflix app on this TV is broken. Many people report error TVP-805 when they try to watch a movie. It's definitely broken, Samsung is definitely not fixing it in a timely fashion. This is the primary thing I do with this TV, so it really sucks for the Netflix app not to work.

Reviews.Title: Used it for 2 months and wish I could get my money back
Reviews.Author: Zoe
Reviews.Content: I agree with Chris B's review. The "Smart" is anything but, and I've wasted more time trying to navigate around this TV than I ever did with my old Vista OS computer. When I've tried to go onto the web and stream directly from a network, I'm told the flash player is out of date. When I try to download an update, it's  blocked. When I've tried streaming LiveStream, it works for about 10 minutes and either crashes or tells me there's not enough memory. There's no way to delete some of the software, such as "Shopping Network" which I'll never use. Netflix and Amazon constantly buffer to the extent I use my old (1st generation) Roku to stream movies and never have the buffering problem.I expect much much more from Samsung. This product is so bad I've changed my mind about upgrading my Galaxy phone to the newest model and am switching to an iPhone.If anyone has figured out how to root this TV, I'd like to know, and I don't care if I destroy it in the process.

Reviews.Title: 1)Lacking basic features. 2)Tech support pitiful
Reviews.Author: Lucy
Reviews.Content: What' is good about it: pictureWhat's not so great:  1) Remote layout awkward. 2) No operational buttons on the TV. 3) Tech support is outsourced & tunnel-visionedThis is my first Samsung TV. I am a huge Sony fan however reviews and price made me consider the EH5300.1)  This set does not have any control buttons on the actual unit. Not even the basics such as ON/OFF, volume, channel. If you misplace or damage the remote control you are totally out of luck. Should the remote drop under a cushion or hide under the dog then you are screwed until it surfaces. Not certain how easy it would be to find a universal remote that would have enough features to cover the Samsung original.2) My household is still using the standard rooftop antenna. Occasionally we have to manually put the TV on a channel we know to be capable of pulling in a signal but which requires some time to lock onto it.When you set up this TV the initial autoscan to program available channels overlooks these weaker signals. When you attempt to manually enter one of these weak channels via the remote, the TV defaults back to last channel found in your "autoscan" list.For us this means losing three public stations and ABC.3) Called tech support. Sounded like it was somewhere in Asia. They were useless. These were not technicians in any sense of the true meaning. After way-too-many-minutes of pitiful "help" I finally asked for the phone number to Samsung corprate office in the US. Was told they were not permitted to give this out.4) When you adjust volume control, change channels, etc the remote gives off a "beep" noise.  Using the manual and surfing through "Tools" , "Menu", and "Support" keys I could not find a way to turn it off.Most likely there is a way, however finding out how is certainly not apparent. Which leads me to.....5) Setup is not friendly, especially for those still using antennas.Daily use is a pain with (for us at least) a poorly laid out remote.This product has been a disappointment. Has soured our household on future samsung purchases.About us...Our family does not require super fancy/high tech gizmos. We have a computer connected to our TV to double as a monitor. This allows us to independently stream so added Smart feature to the EH5300 is not a "must have".We would not recommend this TV or Samsung customer service and tech support.

Reviews.Title: Samsung Smart hub technology is bad!
Reviews.Author: LilaFleur
Reviews.Content: It works great as a tv. However, I bought this for my parents to watch Netflix on, and the Netflix app does not work! Every time I try to click on the Netflix app error message "error_model_bind" appears and says it can not connect to the servers. I googled that term and found that many other Samsung smart tv users have had the same problem. It means that the Samsung smart hub servers are down, which means the apps will not work. Also, the remote sucks. I have a Sony smart tv and the remote that came with it has a keyboard and a little touch mouse for using the internet. Overall, I would not recommend this.

Reviews.Title: Meh
Reviews.Author: John L.
Reviews.Content: The SMART TV feature is real disappointment. The standard remote that comes with the TV makes it very difficult to navigate and type, which is basically Samsung's way of saying "You need to buy our keyboard to fully utilize our product."It feels like the EA equivalent of a DLC.I purchased this TV as a gift for my parents, who are Korean. You would assume that a Samsung TV would be compatible with the Korean language but no, apparently it's not according to their online customer service (who took an uncomfortably long time to reach and were rude to top it off).Summary - If the SMART TV feature is important to you, I would advise against making this purchase. If you're thinking of buying this as a gift, I would also strongly suggest looking elsewhere. Samsung's customer service won't do your recipients any favors.

Reviews.Title: Great purchase
Reviews.Author: RNBSN725
Reviews.Content: I bought this smart tv for my bedroom and I love it.  I can browse netflix, hulu, youtube and watch all my videos and movies.  The only negative part about this tv its hard to navigate the internet.  I have been told that I can add a wireless keyboard which I have yet to buy.  The other thing is that I wish it came with a camera cause you can skype on it as well.  Which is another add on cost...so for now, I just use my phone or my laptop for the camera component.

Reviews.Title: Excellent value for price, but a few things you should consider
Reviews.Author: Cabbit
Reviews.Content: All the apps depend on Samsung servers. If they are down (there was an unplanned outage late October, not mid-Oct when they had maintenance) you can't access Amazon Video, Hulu or anything.There are no other free backgrounds to download and it comes with a lot of bulkware. The play controls on the remote DO NOT WORK for video you are streaming from your computer, which is extremely annoying cause you can't pause. You have to go to the menu and choose the timestamp you last left off on. Definitely not a perfect solution, but it works as intended so I can't complain.The video quality is very good, but no one mentioned sound on this Samsung very much--the sound is superb. Unlike other Samsungs which are meant to be purchased because you already have a home theater system, you can get away with just using the TV speakers. Excellent purchase, I'm very happy with it. I am not on a budget but I do try to be frugal, so I didn't just buy this for the excellent price. I enjoyed the value. I think the tech level required for this purchase is also very low, as a computer technician who teaches, I would recommend for slightly non-tech savvy people who would utilize the apps such as Netflix.

Reviews.Title: Love it!!
Reviews.Author: Cynthia Dariela
Reviews.Content: Since I plugged this TV everything went silky smooth, no problems understanding the setup (even without having read the instructions).I love that it changs automatically the brigtness fuction depending on how much light is in the room, how many different times os sound and picture mode you can choose, the easy way you can use facebook, skype and everything using the browser (I pugged in a wireless mouse and I get to do everything sitting on my couch without needing to buy an expensive remote)So, if I could give a 6 or a 10th start to this tv I would.It's super easy to use, it has every thing you may (and even may not) need.I would recommend it to everyone, its really cheap for all that is worth

Reviews.Title: Good TV for its price
Reviews.Author: anonymously154
Reviews.Content: This is my second Samsung TV. Since I loved the first Samsung, I decided to but a Samsung once again.My old Samsung was a LCD from the 6 series, 2010 model (which I unfortunately could not bring over while I moved).This TV is a LED from the 5 series. That means, its a small step down.There is noticeable difference in picture quality (duh...). The off axis viewing angle is not so good. If you watch from the sides of from above, the colors seem to be a bit over-saturated. Since the TV has a fixed stand/foot, you have to turn the entire unit. Once you sit in front of the TV, the colors are fine and the image is sharp.I'd describe the speakers as 'Okay'. Don't crank the volume up too much when you watch a Metallica concert though. Perhaps get some extra speakers if audio is important for you. It'll do for a movie of your favorite show.The smarthub work goods. I only use Netflix, which runs very smoot. The WI-FI also works great. Router is standing only a couple of feet away though.I don't have cable TV, so no idea how an analog signal looks. I guess, it will be crappy. But who want cable anyway these days.Base line is: If you are looking for 'just' a TV, then get it! It will not disappoint you for its price.

Reviews.Title: easy to set up, but not as "SMART" as it should be
Reviews.Author: Sam Katz
Reviews.Content: Some pleasant and unpleasant surprises compared to the reviews I read before I bought it1. Picture quality- I'm having a hard time "calibrating" it. Maybe I was very used to the color and brightness of my 5 year old Toshiba.  I think I have it where I want it now, but I can say that out of the box, the picture suffered from blown out highlights, lack of detail, etc2. Design/Form.  Beautiful, compared to my "antique" Toshiba. Thin frame, stand is minimalist but does the job.  Nice feature: the little joystick hidden under the right bottom in case you lose your remote3. Sound - Pretty good for the price.  I did hook it up to a Panasonic Soundbar which helps me boost the dialog and get better soundstage.4. Set up:  Some folks complained.  I found it very easy to get it working with my FIOS Network..I chose to use ethernet cable because it's close to my router and I don't want it competing with my other wireless devices for bandwidth.  Learning the menus was pretty easy too.OK, now the frustrating part: "SMART HUB" is clearly not a mature product/service, and Sammsung does not provide what should be the minimal level of user friendliness.  First, I don't care how much the TV costs, if it offers web browsing and other apps requiring text entry, it needs to have a way to do it besides pecking away with a standard remote on a "virtual keyboard". It is literally and figuratively painful to do any text entry with the options available.  I don't believe you can use a wireless keyboard even if you buy one(I know there is no Bluetooth, I may try a Logitech and see if it worksThe "HOME SCREEN" is cluttered with absurd Samsung apps that many users will have no use for(such as children's programing) They take up huge real estate and cannot be removed or moved.  Moving from app to app is difficult.  I have a SMART PHONE by Samsung and all of it is user friendly. Sure, it uses Android.  But if Samsung is going to market this as "Smart" it should be.  The apps themselves all have different interfaces once you get inside,,,again, no standardization like you get with Android, IOS, etcFinally, a postive surprise. The quality of the streaming I'm getting eg with MLB TV app, Amazon Prime is superb. I can barely see any difference compared with my cable picture.  It's far superior to what I was getting with my ROKU attached to my old TV.Overall, a mixed bag.  I believe that the SMART TV concept is still in its infancy and it will take APPLE or GOOGLE to finally come up with something that works easily and seamlessly to deliver internet content on a TV platform

Reviews.Title: Samsung UN32EH5300 32" is rocking my bedroom!
Reviews.Author: D. Lucas
Reviews.Content: Well its only been in use for six hours, but I am loving this HDTV.  Setup was easy, even screwing in the base.  Measurements were exactly what they said it was so this 32" replaced my old TV in the same cabinet.  Hooking up the HDMI cable to my Uverse Cable box was easy, the WIFI hookup was easy, connecting up to my Amazon Prime account - easy.  TV picture is fantastic, sound is great.  The picture was great just turning it on.  I watched Pride and Prejuidice (Keira Knightly one) to check out the picture - that's one of the most visually stunning movies I know of - and I was just blown away by how great the picture was.  I did turn it to movie instead of standard.  I also adjusted the setting on the cable box for 1080i.  Other than that, no changes.  I might play with the settings that someone else posted on here, but honestly I don't need to.  This is the best birthday present I could have given myself!  I'll check back in and let you all know how things are going in a few months - but so far - great deal for a great TV.

Reviews.Title: It is about what I expected...
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "ZundapMan"
Reviews.Content: I've long been a fan of Samsung, with big exception of an early DLP Console TV which I spent thousands for and which failed miserably due to an engineering problem jointly created by Samsung and the DLP chip maker (Texas Instruments) in a conflict over proper cooling requirements.  I ended up sending a huge "Darth Vader" DLP TV to the junkyard via Best Buy when it was clear that the needed replacement chip was not going to be manufactured or provided by anyone.  IMHO our government regulators should have taken on both Samsung and the now defunct chip maker.This set represents the fifth purchase of Samsung TFT/LED technology I've made in the past few years.  I purposefully did not purchase the most sophisticated (3D) capable unit for my bedroom, but up-sized from 32" to 40" when a small CRT based TV finally failed in our guest bedroom.  The 32" unit which is the oldest Samsung TV I own has now migrated to the guest room, and the new 40" "Smart" TV has replaced it.When I finally had professionals pull Ethernet where I wanted it and built a little "router shelf" for my cable modem, router, and patch panel, etc., I pulled Ethernet to my bedroom, so when the new set came out of the box, I plugged in the Ethernet and it immediately began installing "Patches" from Samsung to its' built-in out of the box software that was shipped from Mexico a few weeks ago.  I'm still exploring the available apps and options the "Smart TV" provides.  I'm able to see photos and listen to MP3 tracks stored on a NAS hard drive connected via USB to my router.  The Samsung provided UI for the NAS file system sucks, but it works, slowly...in part due to the USB connection between the NAS drive and my router.  I'm still not quite sure whether the TV is tracking my network via Ethernet and logging in wirelessly to my wireless network, but with 24 mbps download speed from my cable provider, the internet video and sound features I've tried so far all work without the annoying waits typical of slower internet hookups, regardless of whether the path to the TV from the internet is via my 1000 mbps Ethernet or the 56 mbps wireless network in my house.I immediately set up some of the Apps, like TED for example, and my Pandora One account.  The built in speakers, as expected, are not what I'm prepared to live with long term.  I'm still debating spending under $200 for a widely available Samsung 5.1 surround sound unit with DVD which would seriously clutter up the dresser tops or require me to mount several speakers on walls, or getting one of those Zvox pedestal analog sound systems which would sit under the TV and connect to the TosLink output from the on board sound chipset and allow me to use my cable provider's remote for everything except the "smart TV" features.I also immediately set the picture controls for the usually darkened viewing room where the TV sits.  Both my wife and I are beginning to have issues with cataracts, so the larger screen and more intense color settings help.  I'm still not sure about the so-called 120 scan speed of this set which acts more like an interpolated 60 cycle scan than a true 120, which for me would be more than adequate.  The phosphors need a week or two to "burn in" before I can really tweak the picture, but so far it is satisfactory.  I plan to update this a little when some time has passed.

Reviews.Title: not really a smart tv
Reviews.Author: Paul H. Donley "phdsd"
Reviews.Content: I got this TV a couple of days ago so I could watch movies without HDMI cable going from PC to TV.  Guess what, this TV doesn't support flash so I can't stream most movies.  Not so smart.The picture is great (use the settings recommended in the Amazon review section) and you can use a Logitech K400 wireless keyboard so you don't have to type using remote.It just doesn't make sense that you can't see Flash content.  If I have to buy WIDI connection, I should have just kept my old TV and saved the money.

Reviews.Title: Great TV, bad smart.
Reviews.Author: Wolfe
Reviews.Content: I love the TV part, but very disappointed on 'Smart' part.1. Stupid Apps: Most them have troubles while you play something, they always work 'sometimes'.2. The virtual keyboard is terrible. As it's a 'smart' TV, why don't you put a small keyboard on remote control? Like the old cellphone?3. The size of the disk is less than 1 G I remember.4. Allshare play, it doesn't work on 64bit laptop. Do something Samsung. Should I buy a new laptop for this TV?5. Allshare doesn't play RMVB vedio.6. If you play vedio in MKV format, you can not speed, you can not reverse, you can not control the subtitle.So I would say, I like my TV, but it's not a smart TV, give the 'smart' part money back to me!(You Wish)

Reviews.Title: Perfect
Reviews.Author: Editor-in-waiting
Reviews.Content: I purchased this as my primary TV as I moved into a new apartment.  It has good color and sound, is very light and easy to handle.  There's no unnecessary bulk and it has a very sleek appearance. It would also be a good TV for a bedroom.

Reviews.Title: In my opinion, Samsung has the the best picture
Reviews.Author: XELAR007 "XELAR007"
Reviews.Content: Great TV and price from Amazon. I would only buy large items from Amazon because of their guarantee and. Return/Exchange policy. I usually don't recommends buying an extended warranty, but on flat panel TV I would strongly recommend it for 3-4 years from Square. Talking from experience.

Reviews.Title: Highly recommended LED TV at a great price
Reviews.Author: ROM
Reviews.Content: Samsung UN46EH5300 46-Inch 1080p 60Hz LED HDTV (Black)Highly rated by Consumer Reports & CNET and available at a price of less than $800. The image is sharp and the internet applications run smoothly and amazingly fast, giving you the ability to download dozens of applications such as Netflix, Pandora, Hulu Plus, Vudu, YouTube, Facebook, Skype, ESPN,  USA Today, etc. (It feels like a giant tablet). No need for separate internet adapters. I am very pleased with this purchase.

Reviews.Title: Best TV I have ever owned
Reviews.Author: MusicMan
Reviews.Content: I have used many different types of tv's in my lifetime, but this one takes the cake.  The picture quality is amazing, the price is unbeatable and the sound is crazy!!  I would recommend this to anyone looking for the perfect t.v.  Oh, did I mention you can do all your internet surfing on this?

Reviews.Title: Netflix. Doesn't. Work. > updated with good news
Reviews.Author: Marionette
Reviews.Content: UPDATE:May 1 2014, I have raised the star rating tentatively to 3 as they seem to have fixed the Netflix function. I no longer have to jump through hoops to make it run. I will update later if it continues to work as advertised. --------------------------------------January 2014Seems like it might be a nice TV. Too bad I hate it so much I want to throw it in the alley.About 90% of my use is with Netflix. I am now used to the ritual of about 10 minutes of coaxing the TV to talk to Netflix, restarting the program or cutting power to the TV or any of the other hoops tech support has me jump through.I'm pretty certain that the problem is with the TV and not Netflix, primarily because Netflix has always worked on my other devices. Unfortunately, Sony abandoned a 15 month old Blu-Ray player and isn't updating the software any more so I can't use it to watch Netflix on (Subtitles don't work any more on the Sony and I watch a lot of foreign films). A netflix tech quietly told me that LG and Vizio products work fine, so this Samsung POS is to blame.Take note of the Amazon return policy. I missed the window by about 2 weeks. I guess I'll have to buy a new Blu-Ray player from LG or Vizio just to get my Netflix working again even though I have a pile of money into two products which claimed to offer the service.Buy something else if you want streaming video.

Reviews.Title: Surprised! After 6 months of use Samsung UN40EH5300 stopped working!!
Reviews.Author: Sajan Gopinath
Reviews.Content: The smart TV was good, the TV worked great untill last month, it started showing distorted images. Now it is worse. Really got a waste of my $547.00.

Reviews.Title: Smart TV in the slow class
Reviews.Author: Gary Norton
Reviews.Content: This is a good TV, but the so-called "Smart TV" feature is slower than a computer.25 seconds: elapsed time between pressing the "Smart" button on the remote, and seeing the menu13 seconds: elapsed time between selecting the Netflix icon and seeing the Netflix screen25 seconds: additional time till the Netflix screen finishes populatingCompare this to an HP computer, in the same room, connecting through the same wireless device to the same 6 Mbps internet service.1 second: elapsed time between hitting enter on the browser, and seeing a fully populated Netflix screen

Reviews.Title: Great as a TV, don't care about the other features
Reviews.Author: Kevin Major
Reviews.Content: I just purchased this TV to replace my old, dead LG 32" 720p/1080i TV.  I wasn't interested in the SmartTV features as I have both an XBox 360 and PlayStation 3, which makes those features incredibly redundant.  In fact, the two features I was looking forward to the most were this unit's three HDMI ports, which allowed me to dispose of my Belkin HDMI switch/splitter, and the fact that it's native 1080p, which meant my non-game XBox apps would finally look right.So, as a TV, this unit shines.  It's a no-frills unit from a physical standpoint.  It lacks the thick LG plastic border I had grown accustomed to, and I actually double-checked that it was indeed the right size.  With this television, the screen is paramount, and after spending some time with it, I have to say I prefer it that way.The picture itself is crisp, clear, smooth, and colorful, but like with any TV, getting it to that point takes a fair amount of tweaking.  Unfortunately, most of the settings Samsung has on by default hinder the picture.  The Eco settings are, by and large, useless.  They dim the picture in the presence of any light, and there's an auto turn-off setting as well.  More subtle are the picture and MPEG noise reduction filters.  These filters are designed to combat against lines/distortion present in the signal.  The problem is that it attempts to do so by blurring everything.  So what appears to be blurriness and/or ghosting is actually the noise filters doing their job.  The effect is really noticeable whenever a person is doing something, anything (talking, playing sports, walking, blinking, etc.) on screen.  Turn them off.The unit is also great as a game console monitor, but, again, it requires tweaking to get it to look just so.  I've found that, in addition to fiddling with the normal color/brightness/contrast settings, turning off the HDMI black and dynamic contrast help a lot.So, in conclusion, I find this unit to be a fine TV.  I can't speak to the apps as I don't have an interest in them, and will likely never use them.  If you do buy it, just be prepared to spend a fair amount of time tweaking the picture settings.  You'll be well rewarded for your patience.

Reviews.Title: Poor Quality.  Failed after 1 month
Reviews.Author: Herbstreet
Reviews.Content: Received the TV 31 August.  Installed a week later.  On 4 November it started turning itself on and off continuously.  The only way to break the cycle is to unplug it from the wall.  The picture quality was decent for the price. But it's a pretty expensive purchase to only last a little over a month.  I won't be buying Samsung again any time soon.**UpdateTV has failed again after only 7-10 hours of viewing after the repair.

Reviews.Title: Love Samsung, but Amazons filters need some work apparently.
Reviews.Author: Mathew Parrish
Reviews.Content: I love Samsung but this T-V. is not 120 Hz . Samsung 120 Clear motion with 60Hz does not count and Amazon has it listed as 120Hz on all filters. There is a pretty large difference , but apparently the didnt care enough to list it separately.

Reviews.Title: Solid choice but not perfect
Reviews.Author: E. Bowles
Reviews.Content: I have been holding out for a TV with built in Wi-Fi.  This Samsung arrived yesterday so while I have limited experience with it, it is performing well.  I have a 2 month old Sony Bravia that I'll reference for comparison.During setup, the base of the Samsung was made of cheap plastic - it's okay but nothing special.  Assembly of the base requires putting in 8 screws - easy and no problem.  But in comparison, my Sony only required 2 screws and the fittings were more solid.Wi-fi was a bit of a problem.  I set up this unit in the kitchen about 15 feet from my Sony in another room.  I am using a laptop in the kitchen all the time.  But the Samsung had a difficult time receiving the signal and took three tries before it paired with my WiFi signal.  The signal remained weak in setting up the internet services - I got an error message that it did not have a network connection (even though it was just connected) and had to go through setup a second time.  Overall I was glad to have built in Wi-Fi but thought the issues with the implementation were a problem.  We'll see if it continues to be an issue.  For comparison, my Sony Bravia with built in Wi-Fi and my Sony Blue Ray both did a much better job of receiving the Wi-Fi signal and as a result, setup was easier.I did see one comment on the internet about a problem with the TV turning off after 30-40 minutes. That issue is related to user error - there are instructions included with the TV that specify that this issue is from setting up the TV in Store Demo mode rather than Home Use.  If you make the mistake it's an easy fix.I found the picture quality to be good but not great.  The blacks are not quite dark enough for my taste.  all other settings are just fine.PROSGood pictureRelatively easy setupCONSConstruction quality of the plastic base is just okay - inferior to my Sony Bravia8 screws required for assembly - compared to 2 on my SonyWi-Fi reception is poorOverall, the Samsung UN32EH5300 is a good choice for a secondary TV if you are not too demanding.

Reviews.Title: Web access and video design problems
Reviews.Author: tvguy
Reviews.Content: We purchased the Samsung 1080 LED "smart" TV specifically to get the live coverage of the Olympics.  NBC offered 2,000+ hours of live video coverage from their website.  "Smart" TV's have the added benefit of being able to access the internet directly from the TV so theoretically you could sit in your favorite comfy chair and surf the web, watch live streaming Olympic coverage without sitting in front of a tiny computer monitor.  Wrong.The TV when attached to Comcast cable produces excellent picture quality.  When you access the internet and try to watch video streamed from a website like YouTube, NBC, CNN etc, the image quality is bad, pixelated, halting and just plain lousy!Logically, in order to provide this technology, smart TV's need much of the guts of a computer to access the web.  Therefore as long as the feed is good, the processing capability in the TV controls the quality of the image.  On their site Samsung advertises core 2 duo processing for fast web browsing but apparently they skimped on the video card.  The TV's ability to show video from the web is like 5 year old weak laptop capability using a 56k modem.I called Samsung support and after talking to a few people one finally confirmed that the image quality while web browsing is poor compared with the quality of the TV when being used as a TV.Next logical step is to use the TV like a giant monitor and connect to a laptop or desktop with a vga cable.  That way you're able to bypass the TV's limitations and use the compute capability of your desk or laptop and not depend on the TV's lame brain.  Bad news.  Samsung discontinued vga connectors in this new generation of "smart" TV's!  Why?  To save a buck?The only solution they offer is to use hdmi connection but the vast majority of desk and laptops in circulation today don't have hdmi connections.Pretty doggone frustrating.  The TV side of the device get an "A" grade.  The web side gets a "C-" grade yet that is supposed to be a large part of the justification of getting a "smart" TV in the first place.Samsung should have been more forthcoming about the real limitation in their technology, they could have easily included a better video processor and/or not eliminated the vga connection which is the most viable workaround option for most consumers.

Reviews.Title: Samsung Smart Hub NOT so smart
Reviews.Author: Evangheline
Reviews.Content: This is the worst television I have EVER owned.  I specifically purchased this TV because we don't have cable and I enjoy watching Amazon Instant Video and Netflix.  I loved the fact that it advertised that I could connect to WiFi and watch on both these apps.  I purchased it in Nov 2013, it worked great and I was extremely happy with it until the beginning of February 2014.  Then both of the apps stopped working.  I had called Samsung to get this resolved and the first call they tried to pass the buck and blame it on Amazon and Netflix.  Future calls revealed that it was in fact a Samsung firmware issue because on their platform they have both of these apps run off of the same server (or so they said).  Well it is now March 9 2014 and the issue is still not resolved.  Up until a few days ago they have refused to authorize a return (not Amazon but Samsung) until I filed a complaint with the BBB, now supposedly I will get a call from them in 2 business days regarding a refund (though I have been promised call backs multiple times and so far it has never happened).  My opinion is that they are a big company and there is no excuse for a firmware update to take over a month to fix and so if they have problems in the future (even if they ever fix this problem...which is still not fixed as of yet), if there are future problems they will take just as long.  Very very very disappointed.  I hate placing complaints but this is one I will continue to make and hopefully keep other from being as frustrated as I am.

Reviews.Title: Feature rich and great screen but add a wireless headset...
Reviews.Author: lmc
Reviews.Content: Samsung make such great TVs but sometimes audio is not as great as it could be. I added Sennheiser wireless headphones to take my TV experience to the ultimate level. Now I have a fantastic audio experience and late at night I can have it "turned-up" without bothering anyone else in the house.I use the Sennheiser RS120 headphones as they have super sound and the charging cradle makes them very convenient.B0001FTVEK

Reviews.Title: Update to previous review
Reviews.Author: Rachel Johnson
Reviews.Content: Have had numerous problems since purchasing tv.  Both Netflix and Amazon Prime don't work.  Samsung support is so s***ty to work with, they don't do squat to hep me.  They just direct me to the Neflix and Amazon ppl who aren't able to fix my problem, so everyone blames everyone else and nothing gets done.  It's very fursterating.  I just feel like $300 down the tube after purchasing.

Reviews.Title: This TV was great until SmartHub stopped working properly.
Reviews.Author: MissB
Reviews.Content: This TV was easy to set up and has great picture quality. However, the reason we bought this TV and not another one was the SmartHub capability to connect to Netflix and Amazon Prime Streaming Video.This particular function - the ability to stream video through SmarHub - stopped working after a month. We've spent hours on the phone with Samsung and all of their attempts to fix it have been useless so far. About to try to get a refund.Don't buy this TV if what you're interested in is streaming video!

Reviews.Title: screen dead after one week
Reviews.Author: Brooks
Reviews.Content: Purchased this 32 inch smart LET TV on Black Friday. Set it up (easily) and started watching. Changed the picture settings (following the settings another reviewer suggested) and liked the picture quality. Today, the TV screen is black, but has some life to the TV. In a totally black room with the tv on, if I shine a flashlight onto the screen I can (barely) see the menu screen items and scroll through the items using the remote.Contacted Samsung customer service and had to go through dead-ends: online chat, "something seems to be wrong with your TV"; online service request, "you must do the trouble shooting first or we can charge you $55 for the service"; and the call that I was told to make to contact about service, "we are closed. call between 8am and midnight eastern standard time".For a new TV to die in the first weeks of use makes me less than impressed with the quality of the components and/or quality of production. The TV may work well when it works, but a black screen is simply a zero on functionality.If the problem is resolved and a new TV is shipped or this one is fixed with no cost to me, and if the new/fixed TV works for at least six months without any problems, I can change my review, but for now, with my experience, it's a dead item with the lowest rating.12/18/13 update: Called Samsung service. They say I have to take the 32 inch tv into a service center myself for service. They gave me an address which is the closest to me, an hour and a half drive from my home on the other side of the island (Hawaii). They couldn't issue a shipping label to have the TV sent to a service center, so now I'm stuck with an extremely inconvenient trip to make to get this dead TV fixed. The Samsung service rep said I could call again after the service was all done to ask for some kind of compensation for the expense to get the TV to the place, but that is after the trouble of going will be had and will never repay for the lost time and costs related to that.Advice: If buying a TV, buy a 40 inch or larger. The service will be in home, not at a service center. (They will come to you instead of you're being stuck like I am with frustration and trouble getting a tv to a repair center on the other side of the island.)

Reviews.Title: Do not buy if you want a "smart tv"
Reviews.Author: Rodney Tweten
Reviews.Content: The one thing that you should know that if you want to watch your netflix, hulu plus or amazon tv shows or movies this is not the tv for you. Their "smart hub" technology relies on Samsung servers for these services, which go down often (I have had it 3 days and already have this message) and make the smart hub useless. Just google "error model bind" and you will see a multitude of complaints about how useless smart hub is when the samsung servers go down.

Reviews.Title: Great value for the money
Reviews.Author: Tony "SergeantPope"
Reviews.Content: This TV isn't the best on the market, but it is one of the best for the price.I had an older 720p LCD TV before this. The Samsung has two very nice advantages over those old HDTVs. First, 1080p is really a must right now. Especially if you're a gamer and plan on getting the PS4 or Xbox One, 720p just won't cut it anymore. On top of that, this TV is LED backlit, which means it's far more energy efficient than old regular LCD TVs. (As a result, it also doesn't get as hot)But the advantages of upgrading don't stop there. This Samsung is a Smart TV, which means apps like Netflix and Amazon Instant Video are built into the unit. Better yet, since this TV is has a resolution of 1080p, the video looks beautiful (if your internet is fast enough, of course).The ports on this TV are basically what you'd expect. 3 HDMI, one component/composite, two USB, one coaxial, and then some audio in and out ports. There is also an ethernet port, but this TV also includes built in Wifi (which some other TVs don't offer).I do have one or two complaints about this TV. The Smart applications aren't as fast as they could be (i.e. They're faster on PS3). This TV is also only 60 Hz, instead of 120 Hz that many other TVs have these days. But both of those small issues root back to one thing, price. Considering the very respectable price of this TV, I'm willing to deal with those small hindrances.I'm very impressed with this TV and would definitely recommend Samsung as your TV choice.Update: I noticed after a month or so that this TV's Smart Hub and apps don't always work perfectly. Especially whenever you first turn on the TV, the Smart Hub is really slow and apps will fail to load occasionally. You can bypass these issues by closing the Smart Hub and relaunching it, so it's not a deal breaker, but still annoying.

Reviews.Title: Awesome TV once I got over the learning curve with the built in Directv feature.
Reviews.Author: Spydergtcv
Reviews.Content: I purchased this TV as a guest room TV with the option to move it to the back patio for Football games and special events.  I have Directv and later found that this TV is DTV capable using the RVU feature which was an unexpected bonus.  More on this feature later in the review.  TV arrived in 2 days via Amazon Prime.  Although this unit was listed as used, it was in fact, brand new, in perfect condition with a few blemishes on the box.  Wifi is Wireless N 5gh capable which is a huge plus.  Absolutely no issues with the Smart TV feature as other reviewers have complained about.  I can only assume that they're using a Wireless G 2.5 gh connection which would explain why they would have issues with that feature.  TV picture was fine out of the box as I haven't had much time to tweak the picture.  The only reason that I gave this TV 4 stars rather than 5 was the very steep learning curve using the RVU feature with Directv.  There is no mention of this capability in the user's guide and Directv will insist on sending out a service tech for a fee.  After multiple phone calls with Directv and speaking to reps that didn't seem to know what I was talking about, I spent hours researching DTV blogs and finally came to the conclusion that I needed a DECA (Directv Ethernet to Coax Adapter) or the whole home DVR service.  You also cannot use this feature with the wireless adapter on the TV which kind of defeats the purpose of going wireless in the first place.  You can use this with a wireless video bridge and an ethernet cable (cat 5 or 6 only) or plugged directly into your router which isn't convenient for my purposes.  I bought a DTV wireless Cinema Kit and used my existing video bridge for a "Hard Wired" connection over wireless and the RVU service works flawlessly.  (No thanks to Directv) If you're not very tech savvy then I highly recommend leaving the install to a professional.  I didn't want to spend the cash for a service call and didn't want anyone drilling holes in my walls to add the additional coax cables.  To save other owners of this TV the time and energy, I have a recommended process for setting up Directv RVU services for the do it yourselfer.1.) You must subscribe to Directv and have an HR 34-44 Receiver and a robust home network.2.) You must either have Whole Home service already setup OR have a DECA that you connect to your coax feed coming from the dish to the receiver.3.) You must call DTV and add the Samsung Smart TV to your account as a Genie Client for a $6.00/month charge.  If the CSR doesn't know what you're talking about ask for Advanced Tech support.4.) Select the input as RVU and go to setup on your receiver for Whole Home-Add Client.  Take down the pin#5,) Once you select Directv RVU from the input menu on your TV, enter the pin# and name the location.  You can either use the TV remote or purchase a Genie Mini remote and program it for Samsung TV.UPDATE: I ended up returning the Cinema Connection kit and getting a Directv Wireless Video Bridge and a Wireless Genie Client (through Amazon)due to the limitation of the RVU feature of the TV.  You have to create a MOCA network using DTV DECA and it's a wired setup.  I needed a wireless solution due to not having coax to the area that I needed to use the TV.  It cost about $200.00 for the wireless solution whether you order directly through DTV or purchase separately through Amazon.  I have come to the conclusion that although the feature works well it's not for the do it your self networker unless your willing to run coax cable and you understand how the Directv system is wired.  For what I spent on the hardware I could have had a tech come out and set it up.

Reviews.Title: DO  NOT BUY.
Reviews.Author: J. Jason Burford "jjb"
Reviews.Content: This TV worked fine for a few weeks and then it just started restarting randomly. Now it does it every 5min.Garbage now I guess.

Reviews.Title: Nice TV, but nothing "Smart" about the Smart Hub.
Reviews.Author: Mr. H
Reviews.Content: Others have already reviewed the picture on this TV. I concur it is very nice even in a bright room. But the damn Smart Hub -- it pretty much sucks. We have a Roku in the house. The Roku is the Gold Standard as far as I'm concerned for media hub / media center. It's smooth, fast, full featured. In contrast the Samsung is slow, clunky, unreliable, and seems like it's in a constant state of "Updating your Smart Hub... Please wait." Samsung likes to randomly rearrange the icons on the screen to replace your favorites with really craptacular on demand shopping apps.Apps are slow, freeze up, and there's not nearly as many of them as on the Roku. The kicker is that you can get the "non smart" version of this TV for less than the Smart TV version, and use your savings to get a Roku. It's totally worth it to just skip the Smart Hub thing on this. Whether you use the Google TV thing, the Amazon TV thing, or a Roku, don't buy this TV and expect Smart Hub to work very well.

Reviews.Title: Youtube app cannot be installed on the TV
Reviews.Author: Soumyadip Mitra
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV by reading that it has Youtube app. But when it arrived, it does not have Youtube app installed. The app was also not available in Samsung Apps - the only source to install apps in your TV. I called up the Samsung Customer Care, but they were not able to install the Youtube app in the TV. It is now useless.Though it plays streaming Videos and Music from my Samsung phones and tabs vis AllShare but how many Videos or songs will there be stored in my phones or tabs? Not much right. So without the Youtube App the Smart TV is not useful.And now if you have to buy Chromecast, Roku or AppleTV again for streaming Youtube videos from tablets or phones, then why buy a Smart TV? We can buy a normal TV of any brand. Right?

Reviews.Title: Seemed like a good idea
Reviews.Author: John C Bonfield
Reviews.Content: Picture and sound are fine, but the actual usage of this is a horrible experience. If you plan on watching TV at 7:00, you better start turning it on at 6:00. First, it "updates" the software nearly every day, which requires from one to several reboots. It is constantly losing the apps that you already have, so you need to "reinstall"  them.  I want to use Netflix and Amazon prime, mostly, both of which have horrible interfaces. You are supposed to be able to use a mouse and install a keyboard, but neither app actually supports a keyboard or mouse in any meaningful fashion. This means that you are using the onscreen keyboard, using the remote to click around a qwerty keyboard image, to tediously enter your searches, program names or whatever one character at a time.  At least 1/3 of the time, Netflix crashes while loading, requiring you to turn the thing off and start again, whereupon it will need to "update" again, or "reload" your app, or both.  Amazon prime is a bit better in this regard. It will sometimes remember your user name and password, but when it doesn't, back to the onscreen keyboard and clicking a cursor around the image.The updates just seem like ways to load more advertising onto your TV, that you need to wade through to find what you want to do.I am very concerned about getting a virus on the thing, but there does not seem to be any way to install anti-malware software.I wish I had not bought this thing. Hardware fine, software is abysmal, practicality is very low. Perhaps it would work better for just watching cable TV, but I bought this and subscribed to Netflix and Amazon Prime to be able to drop my cable.I am very disappointed in the product.

Reviews.Title: Not a 'Smart' tv
Reviews.Author: B. Healy
Reviews.Content: Update- Sold TV for $150 on Craigslist.  Glad I got something back for this piece of crap. Netflix quit functioning, tv would not recognize other samsung anynet device, and it was updating smarthub every night (takes at least 30 minutes). Worst thing I have ever purchased.  Glad it is finally gone, will never buy another samsung.The Samsung Smart Hub (the biggest selling point for me) is a very poorly constructed piece of work.The layout is fixed, and there are numerous apps which you cannot delete or move, despite the fact that you will never use them.These apps are in the center, default location of the screen...Obviously Samsung is getting paid by those companies to put  their product in your face every time you turn on your set.Apps routinely take 2 or 3 attempts before they load.Loading any kind of stream is extraordinarily slow, Will make you think of the old dial-up days.....The picture is OK, not anything better than what I have seen from other manufacturers.The sound is pure crap.No low end or high end, just an evil mid range sound.If that wasn't bad enough, if you are watching something with dynamic audio (like just about any movie made after the 30's) the speaker will eventually make a nasty vibration noise. This noise can be caused by explosions, or vehicle noise, or sometimes just by an actor with the right timbre to their voice.All in all, it is considerably less than what I had hoped for, and will purchase an LG next time.

Reviews.Title: Great picture and features,  but the automatic updates are way too often w/o any notice or control of.
Reviews.Author: Sheldon denst
Reviews.Content: I choose this TV because of the great picture, and WiFi features.  I primarily use it for amazon prime.Pros:Crystal clear pictureNice exterior designFlips through channels faster than previous TVs I've ownedUSB portsGood sound for a modern TVEasy to set up the WiFiInternet capable, but you'll need a wireless keyboard to get any practical use out of it.Cons:Remote poorly layed out, hard to find function keys for smart TV featuresWhy I'm returning it for something else:I use it primarily for amazon prime, but when it is updating the smart TV features amazon prime is unavailable.  It automatically updates 3 to 5 times a week, updating starts when it is turn on, and there is no way to turn off automatic updates.  Its just plain annoying having to wait 10 minutes for it to update every other time I want to watch TV.Review update:Okay, that is three days in a row it has forced its updates. I look forward to returning this piece of junk.

Reviews.Title: not crazy about it
Reviews.Author: Randall Carlson
Reviews.Content: Samsung colors are animation bright. I couldn't tone down the colors. It's like watching a bright animation. Very hard on the eyes. Like Vizio much better.

Reviews.Title: TV Picture great, smart TV software not so much
Reviews.Author: Michael Holodnak "low-level java guru"
