Reviews.Author: Edward Brown
Reviews.Content: I think this is a very good TV for my purposes. The setup was easy and after readjusting to the values previously reported by another reviewer, the picture is very good.

Reviews.Title: Samsung UN32EH5300 32-Inch 1080p 60 Hz LED HDTV (Black)
Reviews.Author: G. Heil
Reviews.Content: I like it. It was very easy to setup. But it's a little quirky in is operation, and sometimes ignores commands from the remote until the exit button is pressed, but the picture and sound quality are excellent. Samsung support (Online) is quite good and I have submitted some upgrades for some of the remote features that were oddly lacking, but I use over the air reception and not cable, so they were overlooked in the design of the remote.The ability to stream Netflix and other providers without a Roku device is very good and the quality is excellent even with my DSL wireless connection.Update March 2014: I have disabled the "smart" part of the TV. It's just annoying, and seems to be active for every button pushed on the remote. Don't purchase a smart TV unless the "smart" part can be physically updated. I now question my sanity of purchasing a smart TV at all. A larger dumb TV display and a Roku would have been a better solution, and will be what I do next time.  The built in smart part is kinda a waste of money. It is just another device that needs updating and continued support until the company discontinues that support, and then you are stuck, or maybe even out looking for yet another smart TV?In this case for me my smart TV was a dumb choice. Live and learn.

Reviews.Title: Really nice tv, but really annoying firmware issues...
Reviews.Author: Brandon N. Headrick
Reviews.Content: Ok, so, let me preface this with saying that I really like this t.v.  Since I don't care about the "smart" part of the smart t.v., the issue that came up didn't really bother me, but it would certainly bother someone else.Anyway, I'll just get right to the problem.  My t.v. appears to have a bug where, after the initial update, it pops up a big message on the screen (about every 30 mins or so, I think) that says "new update found please turn off the power and then back on to perform the update."  Keep in mind that restarting the t.v. doesn't actually fix the message, and it will continue to pop up in the MIDDLE OF THE SCREEN BLOCKING A HUGE PORTION OF WHATEVER I'M WATCHING!But my review is still overall positive, so how did I fix this?  Well, I turned off the wifi (well, I made it try to connect to a fake network).  See, I use apple t.v. for my internet viewing anyway, so I don't even NEED the internet stuff inside the t.v..  It's likely 90% of the people who are going out of their way to get a smart t.v. would care a lot more than I do about this bug, but hey, it's not affecting me that much now that I found a way around that annoying message.Couple that with my first Samsung UN32EH5300 coming in broken (that was UPS's fault though, not Samsung or Amazon), and I really should be more upset; but it's a really nice t.v. overall.I'd say, if you're not afraid of debugging your t.v. (I never thought I'd say that...) then hey, go for it!  This is a really great looking t.v., especially for the price.  Maybe you wont have the problems I had, but just in case, please be wary that you might have to do some internet digging to fix the issue if you care about the t.v. being connected to the internet and not bugging the crap out of you constantly.

Reviews.Title: Samsung UN32Eh500
Reviews.Author: Harold R. Aylworth
Reviews.Content: The TV worked flawless out of the box.Before I powered it on, I read reviews which made me expect updating problems. I experienced none of those problems. I did experience a shipping problem, however. The original TV was shipped through USPS, packaging had a dent in the shipping (box) container but I did not think anything about the dent initially. I remove the TV from the container all seemed well with the product but later I realized I was careful to examine the TV from the back but not so much from the front. I notice eventually the left side of the frame and the LCD were cracked on the same side and position of the dent in the shipping container.I followed the return policies of Amazon and had another Samsung TV within a week this time shipped UPS. The container dent free. I also examined the TV more thoroughly than the first time before mounting. I was surprisingly please with the easy, no fuss, no muss of the return policy and that Amazon did not make the same mistake twice IE. us USPS the second time.

Reviews.Title: SS UN40 5300 review
Reviews.Author: movie raider
Reviews.Content: I selected this tv for my mother in law and she really likes it.  The picture quality is good and it is simple enough to use.  she needed an upgrade from a much older model and this one fit the billWhile I think a 4 star is a little strong, I do like it; it(the tv) is above average however.

Reviews.Title: GREAT GREAT GREAT!!
Reviews.Author: Loren
Reviews.Content: GREAT, GREAT, GREAT, Love my TV! GREAT Picture, easy to program. Now I can't wait for FOOTBALL to start, GOOOO DAWGS!!!!!

Reviews.Title: Good value..
Reviews.Author: Steven C. Jerkins "I do work all over the cou...
Reviews.Content: It is a good value as a television.  But, the allshare application just does not work as Samsung advertises.  The client application you download to your computer just plain does not work as it should.  It will not share directories nor update if changes are made.  So, don't expect to stream from your computer to the television with any reliability.

Reviews.Title: A Good TV
Reviews.Author: Neo Sharpe
Reviews.Content: I looked around online for a while before I decided on this TV. I like pretty much everything about it EXCEPT that the picture display was far too orange (in my opinion, at least). I tried the settings one woman posted on here, but still wasn't totally pleased with it. But after fussing with it for a while, I think I've found what works for me.Other than that, it's great. SUPER EASY SETUP! You don't have to go through a ton of BS to set up your wireless internet with the TV. It takes just a couple minutes and then you're connected.

Reviews.Title: Smart TV not so smart
Reviews.Author: joyce ann ames
Reviews.Content: Unable to use apps very difficult to get account setup so the apps  could be used .Help center no. Help center no help.Tv will not take credit card numbers.Tv otherwise great picture.Just Smart TV problems.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Product
Reviews.Author: Donald Szerlip
Reviews.Content: The performance is up to Samsung standards though, as expected, the sound quality leaves much to be desired.  That's why soundbars and home theater systems exist.

Reviews.Title: excellent quality and reliable seller
Reviews.Author: Raymund lorenzo
Reviews.Content: the service was good,i live in singapore and i purchase as a gift to my mother and my mom is happy with the service and the purchase that i give thanksfor making my mom happy. thanks also for being reliable seller more power. will purchase more in future.

Reviews.Title: beautiful picture, but smart TV is lame.
Reviews.Author: Ben
Reviews.Content: This Tv is gorgeous, I like the thin bezel around the screen and the actual picture is beautiful, a vast improvement over my old HDTV. But I would not recomend the smart tv version. The few apps it has are just not very well made, they all seem like they are after thoughts or side projects. They are also rather redundant and awkward to use, If your going to be buying this kind of tv, you probably already have a home entertainment system that can play netflix or hulu. The built in Internet is a joke, and who needs a texas hold em game for their TV?Still go out and get a Samsung HDTV, just save your self some money and avoid the smart TV gimmick.

Reviews.Title: Works very well. Clear picture plus lots of internet application
Reviews.Author: Nimit Kumar
Reviews.Content: Works very well. Clear picture plus lots of internet application.  Remote is easy to use. Wifi connectivity is easy to configure and use.

Reviews.Title: Nice HDTV but out of the box it needs work
Reviews.Author: Babs
Reviews.Content: I have had this for 1 week so here are my commentsPro: when you change the setting seen in these reviews, it looks greatCon: Out of the box, there are many setting you need to do, the only easy one was setting up the wi-fiI tried a Philips webcam model spc1000nc that works just fine on my PC, and the set does not see it at all. Then it tells me to buy a SAMSUNG web cam, go figure, so my skype on this TV does not work except in voice only.There are pre loaded apps that you need a SAMSUNG phone, as I could not find their aps on my droid.There are pre loaded apps, that you can't delete to clean up the menu, but you can move them to the second screen, thus hiding them.They don't let you access much of the operating ststem at all, so do not even think you can add something to it.

Reviews.Title: Best TV Ever!
Reviews.Author: Penny Michel
Reviews.Content: Love this TV.  Love all the functions on the TV.  Great remote, easy to use.  Purchased at a good price.

Reviews.Title: Great TV, great deal, poorly functioning web browser.
Reviews.Author: Lesley Gustafson
Reviews.Content: I love my TV and its hard to find a better deal than on Amazon.  Some of the Apps are kind of buggy, but nothing too disturbing.  I don't suggest buying this TV based on the web browser.  The user interface is nearly useless.

Reviews.Title: Good
Reviews.Author: Dileepkumar S R
Reviews.Content: It is a Good TV. I like it very much and i got it on time. I so am happy.

Reviews.Title: Nice TV
Reviews.Author: RAYMOND J.
Reviews.Content: Nice TV.  Can not beat a Samsung.  Looked at a lot of tv's before I bought. Cant go wrong. I

Reviews.Title: Best Computer Monitor yet
Reviews.Author: Robert L. Kaes
Reviews.Content: Put this on the wall for a 2nd monitor and everyone can read it very easily.  It is working very well

Reviews.Title: The Dreaded LED Viewing Angle Bugaboo!
Reviews.Author: Scroogey
Reviews.Content: Have had a plasma set for a while and thought I'd test the waters with an LED, since my 14-month old Panasonic recently suffered the "7 flashes of death." But that's a different story.Well, after one day with this 40" LED it's clear to me that technology has yet to address the viewing angle issue of LEDs. There is not much else to say here, because I'm not much interested on how "smart" a TV is; I simply want a great picture. And this TV does deliver a GREAT picture--BUT ONLY if you're sitting directly in front of the TV and you don't lean over to either side. I was shocked at how drastically the colors and contrast are mangled when you're watching just a few degrees off-center axis,  both horizontally as well as vertically! I can't tell you exactly how many degrees it takes to notice integrity loss of the picture but it seems like it's as little as about 15 degrees off center at a viewing distance of about 6-7 feet. At about 45 degrees, forget about it! Not sure if viewing distance is a factor.So, unless you're a hermit and or a complete loner who always watches TV alone, or only plays games on this TV alone, you will often notice the quality of the picture take a serious nose-dive as soon as you stand up to go to the kitchen or lean over to whisper sweet nothings into your girlfriend's ear.I'm giving it a generous 3 stars because, like I said, if you're watching head-on it's easily a 5 star rating from me.I will be returning this LED set once my Panasonic is fixed. There seem to be no other choices out there right now other than a plasma, I'm discovering, if picture is your #1 priority.

Reviews.Title: Great picture. Sound isn't the greatest.
Reviews.Author: Victor A. Thonn
Reviews.Content: The smart tv is cumbersome.  Most of the streaming videos on youtube aren't available and have to use computer which is easy to hook up.  Need to find out how to get non HD channels to show full screen picture.

Reviews.Title: It is perfect
Reviews.Author: Anita Kelleher
Reviews.Content: We have it in our bedroom and it has a great picture which we enjoy.  It allows us to have internet access on the TV and provides many options for our viewing pleasure.

Reviews.Title: Glad I choosed this one
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Great tv its thin, light, 1080p and cheap.What are you waiting for?You wont regret, the apps are a plus!

Reviews.Title: Review of Samsung UN32EH5300 32-Inch
Reviews.Author: Chuck H
Reviews.Content: Overall experience has been great.  I chose this set because of the Samsung reputation and it was the right size for my bedroom.  I don't yet have an HD receiver so the picture is not as good as it could be but it still is a very good picture.  Easily connected to my wireless and has worked perfectly for the past month.  I would highly recommend this set to others.

Reviews.Title: Fine for the price
Reviews.Author: JG
Reviews.Content: I selected this TV based on the reviews, the price and the size (ie, the height)I have had the TV for ~5 weeks.The picture is fine after some tweeking.  I use Dynamic mode during the day and Movie at night and adjusted several of the other parameters which I haven't needed to change once they were set.The one issue I would caution about (that has been previously noted) its that the screen is very reflective.  I have windows opposite and to the side of the TV which I close to get the best picture.The stand is pretty flimsy and does not swivel but it is ok.The sound is fine for the price. When I listen to music I use the Music setting, otherwise Clear Voice.Setting it up to my cable box and DVD was easy. I was able to hook up to the internet, Netflix easily and I am far from a tecky.The first set I received from Amazon had a cracked screen.  Within 2 days they sent me a new one (which is fine) and picked up the old via UPS.

Reviews.Title: It is not smart at all
Reviews.Author: Zhou Dawei "Dawei"
Reviews.Content: It is not as smart as it is described. It takes over two hours to keep downloading the upgrade files and seek the wireless. Finally, I can use it to surf web, but the remote controller is really hard to use to key in an URL. And, because it is a Linux operation system, the video driver is out of date to support the Adobe video playing software!!! Can I add a wireless keyboard or mouse on this TV? Samsung does not tell us on the manual!

Reviews.Title: 5 stars are self explanatory!
Reviews.Author: RAJO5471
Reviews.Content: great product but as all this stuff is over priced, so is this. not 3d but who cares about that?very enjoyable to play with.recommended yes.

Reviews.Title: Having issues with this product
Reviews.Author: Vineet Tyagi "Viny2cool"
Reviews.Content: I am not a tech newbie. I know my technology and whole reason why I bought this was because of the Smart features. I has the Vizio E series before this. When this TV arrived I still had the vizio one, which was LCD. Somehow Vizio LCD was better then this LED TV. Anyways, I kept this TV as i love the Samsung smart tv features.Pros:All share is fantastic feature. Also if you have Samsung phone/tablet you can control the whole TV with an appPicture quality is actually very good if you set it up correctlySamsung Smart Hub and exclusive appsCons:Sound is very low. The second set I got has some sound issue, it resonate on high volume and it's very annoying.Whole smart TV features takes like 30 seconds to a minute to open up.Netflix takes like 30 seconds to connect.Thanks to Amazon, I could get a refund on this TV as I cannot live without the good sound.

Reviews.Title: Great
Reviews.Author: Cesar
Reviews.Content: Great TV and perfect size and quality,Smart hub works great and the internet browser works seamlessly with my keyboard!

Reviews.Title: The Best Deal on Amazon - The Best HDTV on the market!
Reviews.Author: Sandy Jones
Reviews.Content: First,Amazon's price was great ($150-$225 less than anywhere else I'd seen this model (5300 Series Samsung).  It also didn't hurt that there was no tax and no shipping charge.  That saved me another $70-$80!!!Secondly,the TV is the newest Samsung "SMART" TV.  It was easy to put together (just follow the manual).  The TV measured 36.5" width, but what I didn't know until I opened the manual is ..."recommend you have 4" of space on all sides".  As luck would have it the cabinet I have has about 5" left and right.  So make sure YOUR CABINET ALLOWS FOR THE EXTRA SPACE OTHERWISE (according to the manual) THE TV IS SUBJECT TO OVERHEAT AND BE DAMAGED.Everything else is perfect...the when my cable guys (BrightHouse) came to connect the TV to the cable, they showed me how to operate the features of my new TV.  They put in registration data for my Wi- Fi, and showed my how to pull up all my Apps (Netflix, etc.), and other features the TV had.And most importantly...when to use the remote for the cable and the remote for the TV.Picture and sound are fantastic.  I couldn't be happier!!!

Reviews.Title: really its too good
Reviews.Author: Tariq
Reviews.Content: TV with all features... it acts as router too.... :)i am very much happy with this tv, i got it for good price from Amezon

Reviews.Title: Tweaking required
Reviews.Author: TimAnderson "Designing_mind"
Reviews.Content: GREAT!  Once I tweaked the video, which took awhile, as the "default" settings produced a fair picture.Internet Smart TVs are slower to boot and browse, than if I had my laptop.Good price for fair value

Reviews.Title: Product is good
Reviews.Author: K. Balasundaram
Reviews.Content: This product is good and works great. We preferred Samsung over others because our previous Television was also Samsung and lasted longer. However the shipping is very average from Amazon. I was expecting manual set up as part of shipping (which was the case with my previous Television purchase) but the shipping was dropped at the door step.

Reviews.Title: This was the best price anywhere.
Reviews.Author: Benjamin C  Taylor
Reviews.Content: This TV is great and has fantastic quality. We love it. The smart hub and the controls are easy to setup and easy to use.

Reviews.Title: Picture quality and sound quality are superb.
Reviews.Author: Jeff Wignall "Photographer, Author and Radio ...
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV for the simplest of reasons: to watch DVDs (I am canceling cable and using the $50 a month cable bill savings to pay for this) in my bedroom. I was watching a 15" CRT--seriously. I saw this in use in a restaurant and asked the bartender for the model number. The TV looked incredible in the darkened restaurant and it looks just as great in my bedroom. I can't talk at all about things like the wireless capability or the lack of Skype on this model, I simply don't care. This TV's picture is fantastic, the sound is great (but I'm adding a set of speakers anyway) and the set up (I hate setting up TVs) was relatively painless.If you are buying this, shop around for price and do what I did: tell the manager you'll buy it immediately and pay cash if he'll knock off 15% off the price--he countered with 10% and I bought it on the spot.Who knows how long it will last, but for the price, a great 40" TV. And I'm using it with a $29 Philips dvd player :)

Reviews.Title: love it
Reviews.Author: Bernie Murray
Reviews.Content: This tv is great. The internet connect tv is great. I use all of the streaming services that subscribe to on the tv. NetFlix, Amazon instant, Hulu Plus and hbo go. Its great to have all of these services on the tv instead of a set top box.

Reviews.Title: just what i expected
Reviews.Author: ed m
Reviews.Content: this is my second Samsung led lcd, great pic, have not used the apps yet but set up was easy, highly recomend

Reviews.Title: Love it ditched my vizio!
Reviews.Author: CyberGypsy "Sandy"
Reviews.Content: I bought a Vizio Smart TV to watch Netflix on, Paid 299.00 for it new in box, the TV was nice but the sound was tinny and the remote buttons were a PITA, and a week later it would not connect to my wifi. Returned it and bought this open box warehouse deal TV was delivered in 2 days, was like new in the box, everything was included, picture is perfect ,wifi connects perfect, and the remote is a jot to use, this was about 50.00 more than the vizio, and well worth the price.oh also you can get redbox steaming app which is very nice.UPDATE ditched my Samsung too, went for a white Panasonic and glad I did

Reviews.Title: Unfriendly remote for internet use.
Reviews.Author: Jeff
Reviews.Content: This TV  has a great picture and you are able to gain internet acces through it, however the remote is very difficult to us with internet.

Reviews.Title: Would have been a five.......
Reviews.Author: NiNi
Reviews.Content: The packaging was horrible as it seems the box got wet! Therefore i fear that the tv was damaged. Then to open the box and see a long scratch on the screen was worst. However, after setting up the tv to make sure it was actually working........I immediately fell in love. The quality is to die for and the pictures are awesome!

Reviews.Title: Like the TV; but should have researched more
Reviews.Author: Debbie Beauchamp
Reviews.Content: I like the TV overall.  One thing that I feel is missing is a remote keyboard option for using the 'smart' tv.  There is not an accessory keyboard/remote available for this TV.  The only way to move the curser/arrow while connected to the internet is via the "dumb" tv remote.  You have to push the arrow buttons on the remote to navigate the internet features. The tv has a great picture and was easy to connect to everything we had.

Reviews.Title: nice tv
Reviews.Author: ceehawk7
Reviews.Content: I am jnpressed with tv still no cable yet but nexflix rocks. I would buy a biggger one in the future

Reviews.Title: pretty nice but no flash
Reviews.Author: marceau verdiere
Reviews.Content: Nice Tv, great picture and sound. The issues are with the apps. First you will need a keyboard unless you don't mind trying to type with the remote ( and I promise you, you will mind...)if you want to browse the web. Then you'll discover that the TV does not support flash..The apps are not yet very good. If you are used to Netflix on your computer you'll be badly disappointed with the navigation system through the app. I run all online stuff through my laptop now, so much easier. And as I said, pic quality is really good.

Reviews.Title: The Perfect TV !!!!!
Reviews.Author: mosi jupiter
Reviews.Content: its good for me when am playing my PS3 and my wireless net for me to watch my live streaming EPL soccer !!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: Great TV for the price!
Reviews.Author: P. Schuler
Reviews.Content: This is my first smart TV so I am still in the "wow" stage with it, although I don't get much time to watch TV.  The picture quality is good and there are four different selections to choose from to tweak it to your liking, including an automatic setting to accomodate the light in the room.  It lacks what larger TV's can do - which is really make the viewing experience great - so it is best in a smaller room (the 32").  I bought it for my living room and since I don't watch that much tv as I'm out of the house most days, it's good for me.I did find out that if you try watching at an angle from about ten feet away, you could be disappointed.  The smart features work for the most part but sometimes they don't - maybe because it is still new - but it can get stuck and not connect.  I am hoping this goes away.  Most of the time, though it works fine and connects via Wi-fi.Setting up was pretty simple and intuitive.  I still have not been able to use my phone to do the remote because i have an iphone - but if you have a samsung phone you probably can.  Using the onscreen keyboard is a little annoying at first as you have to use the arrow buttons to move around the keyboard instead of being able to press the letter you want (the remote does not have a keyboard built in).  Also - I was disappointed that in order to watch Hulu on the Tv, I had to have a Hulu Plus subscription.  It's not a big deal at $7.99 a month but the free version offers just as much but can only be watched on my pc, not the TV.There are lots of great apps that I haven't had the chance to check out yet - but think this will last many years in which i have to use them.  Some great apps for kids, too!

Reviews.Title: Samsung UN40EH5300 40-Inch 1080p 60Hz LED HDTV (Black)
Reviews.Author: Anu Rajan
Reviews.Content: It is really awesome..!! No words to define.. But I cant find the Remote Samsung app for iphone..  Enjoying the Samsung UN40EH5300 40-Inch 1080p 60Hz LED HDTV (Black)

Reviews.Title: Love this product
Reviews.Author: Rekha Leelaraman
Reviews.Content: Product was great. It met my expectation. The cost of the product is also great. Overall it is a very good product

Reviews.Title: Smart 40 inch EH 5300 TV by Samsung
Reviews.Author: Ronnie Hammer
Reviews.Content: Sharp, clear, great picture. Sound is fabulous.  Placed it in my bedroom.  Samsung is supposed to have a wireless keyboard and a skype web cam for this model as I was led to believe.  However, they only have the skype web cam for it.  I was truly looking forward to using my new Smart TV as a computer for emails, as advertised. Now  was advised by Samsung after 27 phone calls over a two week period trying to get answers to my questions that no one seemed to know.  Finally found out that they do not manufacture a wireless keyboard for this Smart TV model although it is advertised on their Samsung sight. Samsung offered to sell me the skype web cam when it was offered FREE with wireless keyboard on their sight if you purchased this SMART model and other Smart models before December 10, 2012.  I purchased this model late February from Amazon. Having problems getting the Samsung Freebies.as advertised by Samsung on their site.

Reviews.Title: Solid TV, Skip Apps
Reviews.Author: Booked "booked2"
Reviews.Content: The TV is great as you would expect. Great quality and features at a good price. I did make the mistake of paying extra for the "apps" and that was a mistake. There are really only a few worthwhile and I already have those ALL on other devices - on several devices actually. The quality of the Netflix app is fine, but its really not too much effort to start my PS3. Pandora is great, but its easy to airplay my phone, computer, or ipad to the receiver. Navigation in the app OS is clunky and odd and I cant get the clutter out of the way by deleting stuff off the "desktop". Want simple? Why not use the savings to get an apple tv instead? I should of taken that route for sure.

Reviews.Title: very nice loving it .
Reviews.Author: Khushi nagpal
Reviews.Content: i like to in one that why i got it . it have computer and TV both . unless it don't get problems later. but it nice

Reviews.Title: Great TV needs a little tweeking though
Reviews.Author: Pen Name
Reviews.Content: I bought the eh5300 40" for black Friday from Walmart for $400 after they gave me a $50 credit for their store giving me a hard time. I love the tv and the price I paid for it even better. The only complaint I have is I can't get the picture just right. If anyone has any ideas on what settings to use in a dark bedroom please let me know.

Reviews.Title: Wish I had picked up this "SMART" TV earlier. Amazing features!
Reviews.Author: R. Oden
Reviews.Content: There are already some great reviews on this TV which I agree with 100% so I am going to focus on what us "Tech" nerds will love.Pros:*So easy to use the SMART options that even my Senior-citizen mother in law was able to figure it out without my help.*Connecting to the home wifi was dead simple. Samsung simply made the interface the same as if you were to connect your laptop to your wifi. I've setup other units that connect to Wifi in the past that are made "user-friendly" which are normally anything but. TV was connected to Wifi and installing updates within 2 minutes*Media sharing. Once again this was dead simple. I have a couple PC's that I have setup for photo sharing as well as my NAS (Network Attached Storage) that I use to host my DLNA content for movies, TV shows, photos, etc. and once again, I was able to access my media with just a few clicks. So easy that the rest of the family can access media when needed.Cons:The only con I have is shipping. Yes it did arrive on time (early actually) but the box it arrived in was the standard "HDTV" packaged box you would pick the TV up in from a local store. Being the holiday season there has been a LOT of theft lately where people have been driving behind the UPS trucks in our area stealing packages after delivery leaves it on the door stop. Being a huge box with a TV pictured on the front of it would be a no-brainer for any thief that they would be getting something good. I would have liked to see some kind of not-so-flashy packaging.

Reviews.Title: Samsung TV
Reviews.Author: Judith A Shahenian
Reviews.Content: I have a larger version of this brand and like it. I like this one and have recommended it to some friends.

Reviews.Title: Great Television
Reviews.Author: J. Leinen "~J~"
Reviews.Content: Samsung has always been good at the little things.  Connections are far away from mounting bolts, power cord is slim mount, menus are intuitive.  Smart TV is a little over rated, but software can be improved post-purchase.  Overall, a great buy.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: Sequin
Reviews.Content: Had it for a month or two and no complaints!  Great TV and a good price.  Based on some of the other reviews, since it is rather technologically advanced, you have assign the settings the way you want them.

Reviews.Title: QWERTY Remote or Keyboard or Mouse? ( too difficult to navigate )
Reviews.Author: Hemanth
Reviews.Content: Hi,Received my Samsung 5300 SMART TV. But, its too annoying and frustrating to navigate while operating in a browser or while searching and typing movie titles or so in Netflix or youtube using the current standard remote.Is there a wireless keyboard which supports the TV?Is there a wireless Mouse supporting this TV?Any other options you would recommend to use this smart TV  than just relying on the standard remote?Basically, i dont want to spend 3-4 mins to type a  3-4 sentence in the browser.Btw, Picture quality and sound is just amazingThanks in Advance.

Reviews.Title: Great picture- Smart features need use
Reviews.Author: Craig Finley
Reviews.Content: Got this for all the 'Smart' features, but honestly, don't really see the use. Internet browsing is awkward, MTV music is confusing. For a TV I always praise Samsung for the picture quality and this is the same!

Reviews.Title: Samsung 40" LED Smart TV
Reviews.Author: catbacker23
Reviews.Content: This tv is exactly what I was looking for! Great picture quality, awesome features through the internet, and the sound is good too. You can't beat this tv for the price, and with the samsung name, you know you're getting a quality product.

Reviews.Title: Awesome tv!
Reviews.Author: MonetteD
Reviews.Content: I like this TV. If you are looking for a Smart TV would suggest getting this one. I see some comments that the sound isn't great but I think its just fine.(I even have to lower the volume sometimes which I never would do with my other TV) The only gripe that I have and its not about the TV is the way it was shipped. It was shipped in its original box. I spoke to numerous people from amazon saying it would come in a Amazon box. Someone said that they would indicate if a item will be shipped in its original box didn't see that.My first tv that was delivered was never delivered and I wonder its because it was shipped in its original box. I'm glad that Amazon was quick to ship it and even gave me free two day shipping. Other the that TV was easy to set up. If you are going to use this more for the internet I suggest getting a wireless keyboard that will help a lot. Especially if you are planning on going on Facebook and YOU TUBE.

Reviews.Title: great tv for the money
Reviews.Author: B. L. Ellis "scatpackbee"
Reviews.Content: I bought this tv after my plasma died on me, wanted something other than plasma due to the heat factor they have. reviewed several different ones and finally settled on this one after reading some of the reviews and I'm very glad I did. First one I got had a problem with the screen, it had a shadow at the top left of screen, contacted Amazon for a replacement and got one with no problem. For the money you can't go wrong buying this LED/LCD, great color and clarity

Reviews.Title: Buyer Beware!!
Reviews.Author: Jeff O
Reviews.Content: I purchased a large and expensive Samsung LED TV from Amazon. Amazon was great. Fast and easy delivery. Unfortunately after 10 months, the TV stopped functioning at all. It made a clicking sound when the power button was depressed, but no image or sound. Fortunately, it was still under warranty. Samsung  sent out a local repairman who fixed the TV. He mentioned it would have cost $1000 for the repair (replacing 2 circuit boards) if I was paying for it. It took him <3 minutes to switch the boards. The TV worked again. Now 2 years later - same problem. I called Samsung. They very politely told me that I was screwed. They would not fix the TV, provide the parts or even a provide discount on the repair or parts despite the fact that it was the same problem the TV experienced 2 years earlier. With further investigation I learned that this is a very common problem for Samsung TVs.  They produce a power supply board that fails easily.  Beware - if you do not want a very expensive paperweight after 3 years’ time, look at another manufacturer for your next TV.

Reviews.Title: Smart TV? More like Below Average TV.
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: It's the combination of a good TV and a broken computer. This TV is great at displaying TV shows, movies, and all that. It does everything you could ask of from a TV. Were this a regular TV at a regular price, I'd give it 5 stars. But, it's not just a normal television, it's a Smart TV. And that's where it fails miserably.To access the "Smart TV" features, you open something called Smart Hub. Smart Hub usually opens within several minutes of you asking it to start. Sometimes it even works. Other times it will just update itself for a while. Sometimes it will launch apps, other times it wont. And using the remote to access functionality and type is just clunky.Most TVs have HDMI ports. You're better off just getting a normal TV and plugging it into a computer when you want netflix or pandora. Or just buy an Apple TV. People don't seem to complain much about those.

Reviews.Title: RANDOM SHUT DOWN, SMART HUB USELESS
Reviews.Author: gio
Reviews.Content: This precise device has a capacitor problem that causes the TV to shut off and on randomly every 10/15 minutes. Besides, the smart hub is terrible, slow and doesn't connect 50% of the times; after few weeks the wifi stop working so had to connect via cable, even though, connects when it wants. Samsung customer service pretty bad. Must add that i didn't buy this from Amazon; bought it in Caracas, Venezuela and is Made in Mexico. Been told by some vendors that Samsung was aware of this defect before shipping this units from Mexico to Venezuela.

Reviews.Title: Great picture quality BUT...review from an IT perspective!
Reviews.Author: George Echeverri
Reviews.Content: I am an IT Tech and it took me hours to get this TV to connect to my wireless network. My wireless router was set up for N+G, WPA2-AES, hidden SSID, and an over 50 character passkey. After hours of troubleshooting I started reading the forums and someone mentioned to try wireless G only. I configure my router for wireless G only and wala, it finally connects to my wireless network with a healthy working connection. So, sadly this is a top of the line new Smart TV that is using an old networking technology. Because of this TV I had to downgrade my wireless speed for ALL my devices down to G. I will now probably have to buy a 2nd router just for this TV to use G and my other devices to use N. This is the first device I buy that needs to use the "wireless G only" setting on my router. All other devices even if they had G cards/adapters would work fine with the G or N setting on the router.Also, the TV takes a while to start up networking related aspects such as Netflix, and it freezes a lot doing updates. This is not due to my internet speed because I have a 30 meg connection from my ISP. Trying to access the web feature, it froze and I had to reboot it just to get it working again. I also find the Netflix more enjoyable on the Sony dvd/blu-ray players and Apple TV. I've noticed issues with Netflix sound and audio/video not matching. I hope Samsung releases updates for this TV that will clean up the networking issues. Over all, this "Smart" TV isn't so smart, the picture quality saves it from me returning it.

Reviews.Title: Samsung UN32EH5300 1080P Smart TV
Reviews.Author: Empiror22
Reviews.Content: I returned a samsung 32 in 720P TV and got this as a replacement.  The TV is great, the APPs are smooth and numerous.  I really enjoyed the TV however it was over kill for the garage work bench.  I returned it and got a very similar non smart tv.  I really like the TV but the price was a little high for a TV that is watched less then one hour a week.Pros: best TV at price in the Smart TV class, was the best over all performing TV (in this class range) i have owned.Cons price is a little much.Conclusion: would buy again if needed this type of TV.  Will check on replacements when time to replace the main TV (55-70 inch) range.

Reviews.Title: NO YOUTUBE APP
Reviews.Author: Kay
Reviews.Content: I wanted to have a tv that was capable of showing Amazon Prime and couldn't see the logo for it on this tv. I asked questions from owners and they assured me it did. WELL...it does!!!  HOWEVER, THERE IS NO YOUTUBE APP anymore on Samsung TVs according to Amazon tech support. This is misrepresentation at its finest, seeing as the YouTube logo is on the picture for this TV....I see a law suit coming on people....

Reviews.Title: Great image and sound. Bad Smart tv app. Buyer Beware
Reviews.Author: Daniel Perdomo
Reviews.Content: ok. yes read the bad reviews it really helps.  i just bought the tv today and after playing with it for a few hours i have mixed emotions.pros: great deal for the moneyless then 500 bucks is a stealgreat soundsuper lightpkease follow the picture settings in the reviews it makes a difference.the remote is easy to use. no backlight.easy to set up 2 people will doi do have samsung phones so i can mirror my kids videos and share the info with the tv so that is a big deal for our family.The BadSmart tv is horrible. i can not connect to the hub tv. because it keeps connecting and it does not work.i have a roku and works much better. so eventually i wont go to samsung to get it fixed...seems like a waste of time.good luck and i will update the review in a week

Reviews.Title: Love this tv
Reviews.Author: richard mojica
Reviews.Content: A little upset that the price dropped by $10 since purchasing it, however, it's a great tv, and it's nice that you don't need any additional components to watch amazon instant video, netflix etc.

Reviews.Title: MEH
Reviews.Author: Ssavory
Reviews.Content: Well this POS seemed super nice and high tech. I researched and saw that Samsung was the bomb.com well eh. I had it for 2 months and it was great. I finally had a guy hang the damn tv on my wall mount (which I also bought on Amazon for wayyy cheaper compared to Home Depot) and it broke. Like no power, nothing. I called Samsung and they outsource their tech support to somewhere in China. IDK what the guy was saying - it was a disaster. He did troubleshooting (same stuff I already did on my own b/c I have a brain) and then was like ok, you are covered under warranty (I better be! I've only had this thing for 2 months) so we are going to send tech support out to you in 2 wks. UGH. I had to go out of town etc... Tech support came, replaced the power source inside the tv and it worked fine. Now I'm worries a major piece of the tv is going to randomly break again and I'm going to be out 400-500 bucks. The tech guy told me if it wasn't covered under warranty that it would cost about about $400 ish to repair it on my own aka the price of the damn tv! He said that Samsung is so worried about offering newer technology with its SmartTV's and because of that are using s***ty parts.  AND SAMSUNG IS SUPPOSE TO BE LIKE THE BEST BRAND EVER. The guy told me next time go with Toshiba. I actually have a Toshiba 40 inch regular flatscreen that hasn't had ANY issues for almost 4 yrs. And I've moved 3 times with it... GO FIGURE!  Now that the tv works, its cool. Sometimes Samsung's system or servers or something is down and I can't stream netflix, which blows my mind. When I first bought this tv, the system was down for a week (I called and the guy told me this). Great visual tho. Web browser sucks. Can't wait until smarttv's are 100% like my macbook pro.

Reviews.Title: TERRIBLE!
Reviews.Author: Naomi L. Pace
Reviews.Content: I purchased this TV in September of 2013 and last week the screen went black.  Upon calling Samsung (numerous times), throughout the week, to address the issue, I was / have been given as many excuses and false resolutions as I can count on both hands AND feet.  Suffice to say, I DO NOT recommend this product to ANYONE, nor do I recommend this brand.

Reviews.Title: Worst Smart TV than I initially thought.
Reviews.Author: DAVE
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV a few weeks ago now and there was always something wrong with the TV.  The picture is terribly hard to adjust just right in order to watch a decent picture, you have to change the setting for each network or program you watch sometimes or the picture will look awful.  Also the TV screen dims itself whenever it feels like it and then brightens itself for no reason.  I checked the setting and they do not account for this defect.  Also the hub isn't as easy to use as it was made out.  The install all kinds of apps and wont allow you to remove them and it takes I think a long time to load up an app I actually use.  I would remember this when you read the sellers ad and read the feedback too as many people have left bad feedback.

Reviews.Title: Great picture, the apps are slow
Reviews.Author: Amazonist
Reviews.Content: I am giving this product three stars because it is ok.  The TV is great, the picture and sound quality are exceptional.  The overal design is sleek and attractive.  The Smart TV features I found somewhat lacking.Pros:1.) Great picture2.) Great sound quality3.) Nice overall designCons:1.) The TV comes "loaded" with several default apps.  I probably use 1/3 of them and haven't been able to figure out how to delete the others.2.)  The apps load slowly when you try to open them.  I know this isn't an issue with my internet connection, rather the apps on the TV themselves.3.)  The apps are limited in their range.  For example, I am on a Netflix account with several users.  When I log onto Netflix with my user ID I select my name and ignore the others on the account.  I am able to watch my shows without worrying that someone else on my Netflix account has "lost my place."  The app on the TV does not differentiate between users on the same Netflix account.  This became an issue when I wanted to watch the same show that another user was watching.  I had to remember what episode I was on... annoying.

Reviews.Title: Buy another Brand - DONT WASTE YOUR MONEY
Reviews.Author: dustin
Reviews.Content: The TV worked on arrival, but about a month later (after the date that i could return it) it started having a mind of its own. It now takes a really long time to turn on. Smart Tv feature is utterly useless with how glitchy it is. Netflix rarely ever plays what i want, however it will play fine on any other device i have. SAMSUNG TV IS JUST LIKE THEIR PHONES.... GARBAGE. I am considering throwing it in the dumpster... sadly.

Reviews.Title: ok  but not life changing
Reviews.Author: Pamela Decker
Reviews.Content: DIDNT UNDERSTAND THAT SOME FEATURES WERE ONES THAT HAD TO BE EXTRA FEES . THOUGHT WAS GETTING A FEW  MORE CHANNELS.  also CANT UNDERSTAND ALL THE CONNECTION FEATURES .. WANTED TO CONNECT MY rOKU  THAT WAS OK.. BUT CANT FIGURE OUT dvd PLAYER . overall its ok  great picture on real time tv.

Reviews.Title: Works great!
Reviews.Author: Jim
Reviews.Content: For the money, it is just great! I did NOT want a 120-240Hz TV. I prefer 60Hz! Don't like the motion on 120-240Hz at all...It's a Samsung, so its over saturated with lots of contrast very very bright out of the box! After toning it down a little, I am much happier.

Reviews.Title: not very smart
Reviews.Author: JP
Reviews.Content: picture not very goodNo camera for Skype and only works with Samsung camera that cost $100No keyboard and does not work with any wireless keyboardVery difficult and slow to navigate on the web because of the arrow you need to move with the remote control unitIt does not allow my Kindle HDX to mirror the image (only with Samsung equipment) and this is why I purchased this TVThe support had me waiting 1 hour to tell me that I could not link my Kindle and they are still not sure!...Now I need 2 remote with my basic Comcast cableI feel like I am going backwardsAll the reviews I read said it was the best TV out there!Not sure why?DO NOT LIKE ITwanted to add that the TV runs out of memory when watching movies on youtube and the display is usually too dim as it adjusts itself a bit on the dark sideI purchased a wireless Logitech keyboard that works but not with Netflix ?????I DO NOT GET IT!!!!!

Reviews.Title: I should have saved $150 and gotten a Visio
Reviews.Author: Amanda Booth
Reviews.Content: I purchased this tv for the smart hub. But the smart hub apps half the time do not load. They have to be constantly updated. Overall, very frustrating. I will never by by this product again.

Reviews.Title: Not bad
Reviews.Author: carla a romero
Reviews.Content: I really like all the options this smart TV has. The picture and color is not very good though. My old box TV had a better picture!

Reviews.Title: Horrible sound, horrible software, horrible TV
Reviews.Author: Dana
Reviews.Content: I spent months doing research and this TV seemed like a winner on paper. A year later, I have nothing but regrets. The sound is so horrible I am contemplating getting a sound bar. I made the mistake of getting a TV with 60mhz. I'm not a sports fan and thought 60mhz would be sufficient for the average prime time tv watcher. WRONG I can see pixels and the picture becomes distorted if I am watching anything faster than a turtle. My sister purchased the 6500 model and is more miserable than I am so I chalk it up to Samsung putting out junk. The only benefit this TV has is that I am able to stream movies via a DLNA server. HOWEVER Samsung DOES NOT mention that their TV software is NOT compatible with a Mac. I had to redesign my entire network and find third party software in order to take advantage of the TV streaming features. Bottom line.....if you are looking for a cheap tv for an extra bedroom this will do the job. Otherwise, run the other way.

Reviews.Title: Just OK
Reviews.Author: Jeffrey Pin
Reviews.Content: It's actual size is just 31".  Poor customer service.  Remote not compatible with Direct TV.  Would hardly recommend it to friends.

Reviews.Title: I H@TE SMART TVs
Reviews.Author: Loretta A. Garza
Reviews.Content: The tv pic and sound were fine I guess, but I could get past all the SMART TV cr@p. It's so hard to find SIMPLE bare bones tv's now.  Why don't manufacturers get that people will most likely have a blu-ray, roku,google chromecast, playstation or the other brand type items that have all these features?  why waste the money in adding these type fluff products when you should just concentrate on picture quality, connections and sound?  ugh.  for the record. I own an older model 52 inch flat screen hdtv SAMSUNG that i absolutely love. SAMSUNG makes a great tv otherwise.

Reviews.Title: no picture
Reviews.Author: Mellard Ashton
Reviews.Content: got sent one that didn't workalways a pain to return things  didn't replace it so don't know if they are all difficult

Reviews.Title: Disappointed
Reviews.Author: qbana
Reviews.Content: The picture is horribly blurry. Even with the AVSforum picture settings, the color is off and objects appear blurred around the edges. Seems like there is a grey film over everything except logos in commercials. Sound is not crisp and the remote is cumbersome.

Reviews.Title: It was a challenge getting started
Reviews.Author: Charles Gardinier "Charlie G."
Reviews.Content: There was little instructional (educational) information in the installation package and I started out with an inferior picture compared to my 1991 analog TV that this replaced, and I had to spend about 3 hours on the phone with totally uninformed Samsung  and Uverse service techs trying to get the source working correctly and finally resolving to buy a very expensive HDMI cord  to deliver the HD signal to the receiver. Just that piece alone could have cost me up to $200; I settled on a modest $50 product and  think that I got a reasonably good solution. After that everything straightened out and flew like a swiss watch. WIFII connection was flawless on the first pass.  Be patient on the start  up and get a professional installer.

Reviews.Title: 32 Inch Smart Samsung
Reviews.Author: Mary
Reviews.Content: We really like this TV, it works great.  I read all the reviews posted and found them very helpful.  We have not had to adjust the picture at all.  I bought the Logic Keyboard with it and it also works great.  Bad on me I didn't realize the little USB had to plug into the larger one and Then plug it into the TV.  All works well now and we are very happy. The TV upgraded it's own software and picked up our network with no problem at all.

Reviews.Title: Good TV for the money
Reviews.Author: Dean
Reviews.Content: Lots of features for such a low price. I am having to do a lot of adjusting on the picture though. Black areas don't have the detail I am use to with my older Vizio.  Flesh tones seem to be a bit flat in the highlights - but I'll get it.

Reviews.Title: Fast delivery
Reviews.Author: Meggie O'Brien
Reviews.Content: Received today, will have to open after cable is eventually in. Good thing I was home when UPS driver delivered because he walked back to his truck before I got to the door.  When I opened the door it was starting to rain and there it sat.

Reviews.Title: Smart? Not very intuitive.
Reviews.Author: Tom Plum "Tom Plum"
Reviews.Content: We have Sam phones, Sam tablets, and this Sam TV. It seems as tho there is a language / cultural barrier yet to be overcome. Check out Sam's website and sift through support and you may reach the same conclusion. Overall, the TV works fine. we've had occasions that the Smart Hub would not work. Try this, reinstall that - only to come to the determination that their servers are down. Anything that may lead you in that direction such as a website posting, a blinking light, a non blinking light would be helpful. Smart seems to be a misnomer.

Reviews.Title: Ordered twice - both damaged
Reviews.Author: Donna W "Donna W"
Reviews.Content: Really disappointed with this . . and I WANTED this TV (and usually love Amazon). But this experience was awful. Bought the TV, paid extra for expedited delivery b/c I knew I'd be home on a Friday. Television arrived. . and when I pulled it out of the box, the screen had a huge crack across the front. Amazon quickly processed an exchange. . .but I had to make special arrangements to take off work for when the UPS guy picked up the package, and delivered the exchange.  Finally got it out of the box, looked fine, set it up, turned it on. . . the screen was flawed. A large circular space of the screen (top left) and corner of the screen (top right) was totally WHITE. Had to take it apart, pack it up, send it back. AGAIN, had to make special arrangements to be home for the pick up. Not a good experience at all.I thought I wanted this TV b/c it was rated well by c.net and by Consumer Reports. BUT if I can't get an undamaged one. . . Don't recommend ordering items like this from Amazon.UPDATE: I do want to note that Amazon did provide a full refund. And it was processed quickly.  But still don't have a TV. . . :(

Reviews.Title: El articulo perfecto
Reviews.Author: Siul Vidal
Reviews.Content: El articulo perfecto. Me gusto bastante. Lo recomiendo 100%. Es de buena calidad. Si volvería a comprarle a este vendedor.

Reviews.Title: No flash support
Reviews.Author: charles haigh
Reviews.Content: Pros first: great tv. Clarity is awesome. Ease of use is amazing. No concerns.Cons: does not support flash. I phoned samsung and they said they are having a disagreement with flash player financially and so they do not support it. As such you can not stream much at all from the Internet. Espn3- nope. Many independent sports websites- nope. Ay foreign language website video- nope.Samsung acknowledged the problem, despite advertising support for flash. I returned it

Reviews.Title: Great picture but Netflix does NOT work
Reviews.Author: Almost Anonymous
Reviews.Content: EDITAfter nearly a month of messages and phone calls to Netflix and Samsung, struggling to get this TV to connect to Netflix, I was finally lucky enough to run across some information on a CNET help forum that solved the problem.If your TV that you purchase is unable to connect to services through Smart Hub (I was also having issues with Pandora, for example), switch the DNS server in your network settings to 8.8.8.8, the Google public DNS server.  For purposes of running this service at home, running through a static DNS shouldn't be an issue.I don't know if this is an AT&T; (they are my ISP) issue or what - but I'm still pretty disappointed that neither Samsung nor Netflix were able to help me solve this problem.  The picture is great, the sound is great, the navigation and settings are well laid out.  I just don't think that the TV is very "Smart" if it is incapable of performing such a simple task.---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------I purchased this TV on November 18th and it was delivered the next day which was fantastic.  For the price, the picture quality is great, the sound is decent, and setup is simple.My issue with this TV is that Netflix will NOT work on it.  Apparently this is an issue with the Netflix software on new Samsung devices that the "engineers are aware of and working on."  Annoyingly, it took me talking to 3 different Samsung reps and a Netflix rep to get this much information.For being a Smart TV it's not very smart yet.  If and when this is fixed I will write a new review accordingly, but I'm pretty disappointed.

Reviews.Title: Samsung Customer Service
Reviews.Author: Mark Colen "Mark"
Reviews.Content: A few words regarding Samsung customer service: for a leading consumer electronics firm, both internet site and phone support is a nightmare.  I wanted a simple question answered regarding the Samsung 5300 TV, does the TV have PIP?  First to the website where I tried to download a users guide.  No matter what browser I tried I could not download a manual using the link but was instead misdirected to "The Global Download Center" which proved a complete mystery as to what it was or how to use it. The FAQ was a mess.  Imagine, a huge tech company that cannot even design a workable and informative website!!I gave up and tried phone support. After a half hour and being transferred though four departments I still had no real answer!In any case I took a chance that it does and ordered the TV here at Amazon, a company that can teach Samsung a thing or ten about outstanding customer service.  Having bought Samsung before I am certain that the product will shine but I fear if I ever need technical help I'll be out of luck.

Reviews.Title: Capacitor issues! KNOWN PROBLEM! (BUT) Samsung fixed it!
Reviews.Author: Mr. Frodo
Reviews.Content: In fairness I changed my rating from lousy to good. Samsung stepped up like a boss and fixed it. Those little devils.

Reviews.Title: Not impressed with the picture quality
Reviews.Author: Amazonted
Reviews.Content: I returned the TV.  The picture quality was not good no matter how I adjust the combinations.  Down load software for smart TV does not work smoothly.  (I have no issue with WiFi and other equipments in the house).  Amazon was good in handling the return.

Reviews.Title: UN46EH5300F
Reviews.Author: Off The Beaten Path "Bill"
