logTag.type = "text/javascript"; logTag.src = "/gp/customer-media/du/log.html?ie=UTF8&p=CustomerImage&s=CustomerVideoPlay"; head[0].appendChild(logTag); } if (cv_mo3IPPFFVCPC62KcurrentClick) { return cv_mo3IPPFFVCPC62KcurrentClick(); } } } Length:: 1:05 Mins*Edited with new Video*:The back panel (cover) to the Samsung UN46EH5300F. It is not reinforced along the backbone with bends to keep it from being susceptible to vibrations from the *speaker ports* and wall mounts caused by the lower mounted speakers. Samsung UN46EH5300 46-Inch 1080p 60Hz LED HDTV (Black)The Packaging:My Samsung was in great condition and was easy to unpack and the assemble was well documented and straight fwd. Items were easy to identify and the hardest part for me was getting the plastic off the batteries. TRUE.The Picture:Out of the box the unit was satisfactory in color and richness, I only changed the back lighting up a bit to overcome some ambient window light. On standard satellite (non HD) it's default setting to to display content 16:9 thus cutting and fattening the aspect. There is a P-Size button on the remote for ease of adjustment. PS3 video gaming was just as clear as on my other HDTV, yet I had to use the P-Size button to get aspect correct. Over the air digital TV reception showed off the picture and GUI. I do like the info button and the 'Ch List' gave each channel a 'now on' schedule. Viewing movies off a small 8 GB USB as well as a large 500 GB was enjoyable and due to the movies on the USB devices being HD 1920x1080 it made the time watching relaxing.The Sound: Depending on my source material the sound was adequate. I used both the built in speakers (noting the back panel vibration) as well as the SPDIF to amp digital. *From my experiment using Frequency Test via YouTube, I found the range of the builtin speakers to be from 75Hz to 12000Hz. My back panel would rattle @ 180Hz ~ 240Hz causing annoying hum to be added to the distinguishable sound perception.* The video show a bandaid fluttering at the left speaker port with my HDTV volume up to 80. I have resolved my vibration by adding layers of electrical tape between the rub points on the Wall Mounts, and added two triangular wedges of memory foam directly above the speakers.* Remote has 'Tools' button to get quick access to sound and video adjustment. Would have been nice it aspect P-Size, had been placed there as well.The Stand:Actually the stand was a little trouble assembling. Oval base had to be assembled to an arm, then the two piece stand attached to the slotted back of the HDTV. The stand has a small footprint and even though the HDTV is light by comparison to my 47" Westinghouse, it still wobbles. IE. put your finger on the upper bezel of the TV and poke it. This causes shake, the TV will rock back and forth 4 times till steady. This comment brings me to the stability of unit in general, as the unit is light yet it is not STURDY. I noticed while playing my PS3 during music cut scenes that there was an added sound during the playing of the music, upon further inspection I found by placing my index finger on the vents of the back panel, a very noticeable vibration. Volume on TV was set at 28 and it was not at a level to annoy or be noticed by ppl in an adjacent room. I decided to inspect the immediate inside of the HDTV by removing 8 (M) labeled screws and 3 (B) labeled screws. Power and all connections removed I took the back panel off and took pictures of the two circuit boards, and the whole back, and of the labels. What I found was that the 400 x 400 wall mount brackets that are mounted to the inner panel are manufactured and mounted in such a manner that they are noticeably loose by design. Each of the four mounts have a lower angular tab that right angle latched/mate to the inner panel and are then screwed into place by a single phillips-head screws. There exists a gap and wiggle room due to these mounts, it appear to be aluminum against aluminum and the space (intended/unintended) is not padded thus causing vibration points. Two of these mounts are direction above the lower mounted speaker and thus explain my audible and tactile sensation. If I am able * Picture now attached to user images* to attach the picture (hint Amazon) I will.Peripherals:As other reviewer have noted the Samsung UN46EH5300F remote is a huge hassle to browse the web and type with. There is no intuitive (Snap Too) on the prompts, and the Text entry navigation with the remote is painfully awkward. The Samsung would not detect (if detected, the system will display in a PIP) my Logitech S510 wireless keyboard/mouse. Yet it did find a 9 year old Logitech USB gaming mouse, and a Westing Technology PS3 wireless keyboard.The system under the Menu>System>Device Manager allows for some very basic adjustments to your device. IE language, speed, pointer size.Overall:I am underwhelmed with this purchase and will be carefully considering the vibration as a precursor to overall satisfaction and durability. On the weekday I will contact Samsung's Call Center to see how eager they are to remote manage into my TV (Menu>Support>Remote Management) to introduce a beta driver for my Logitech S510.3 Stars till~~~~~~~~~~~~-1 for vibration-1 for Peripheral not recognized.

Reviews.Title: Do not buy this Smart TV if you want to be able to password protect the Web Browser app.
Reviews.Author: Probably Cam
Reviews.Content: The TV works and looks great.  But I returned it because the Smart TV software is riddled with issues, even after updating to the latest version and working with Samsung tech support.I bought the 40" Samsung UN40EH5300 Smart TV for my wife for her birthday.  The whole family was excited to set it up and get it working.  The Smart TV software detected our network, prompted me for our security passcode, and connected effortlessly.  We were browsing the web and streaming HD video from Netflix in just a few minutes.Throughout the day, however, the Smart TV software kept forgetting our network passcode, and I had to keep re-typing it to proceed.  Maybe this would settle down over time.  I wasn't willing to find out since it made using the Smart TV features a real pain, and it doesn't feel very stable so even if it self corrects, I'm worried about it breaking again in the future.The Smart TV has an impressive level of parental controls over which TV and movie ratings it will allow.  Parents can override this at any time via a 4 digit PIN if they want to watch something that's blocked.  Also, you can lock _nearly_ any app on the Smart TV screen so it also requires the PIN to gain access.  However, you cannot lock the Web Browser app!  Nor can you remove it or delete it.  I find this brain dead and unacceptable.  Why give me all these parental control features when right next to the Kids Games app (which can be locked), there's a Web Browser app that cannot be locked.  Is this my TV or not?The Smart Hub app, which is always on and serving up ads I don't want to see, also cannot be locked.  I can understand why Samsung would not want me to disable the Smart Hub app, and I could live with that if I could at least lock the Web Browser, so I consider the always-on Smart Hub app merely irritating.My kids often watch Netflix "Just for Kids", or the kids version of Amazon Instant, on the Wii or PS3.  Neither of these apps are available in the Samsung apps store.  I want to be able to let my 5 year old turn on the TV and go to her familiar "Just for Kids" interface, but I cannot with our brand new Smart TV.  We resorted to hooking up the Wii with its lower resolution so she could safely stream her shows from there without having to navigate around mom and dad's shows, but hooking up the Wii to watch Netflix pretty much defeats the purpose of getting a Smart TV.Another minor irritation: whenever you turn on the TV, a "connecting" icon spins in the upper right hand corner of the screen before you can do anything with the TV, even if all you want to do is watch TV or access the DVD player.  The "connect" time varies, but it sometimes takes nearly a minute.  Why does the TV assume whenever I fire up the TV I want to use the Smart TV features?  Instead, it should load those in the background.I'm returning this TV and will never buy a Smart TV again, since those features seem to take over the TV.  I'm getting a dumb TV instead (the VIZIO E Series E470-A0 47-Inch 1080p 60Hz LED-Lit HDTV) and I'll connect a gaming console or video streaming box for Netflix and the like, one that allows me to choose what I want in my living room, not what someone thinks I should have.For an example of Samsung's attitude on allowing consumers the freedom to lock and unlock what they want, see this thread I found online from a couple years back:############################################################ How to de-junk Smart Hub / Smart TV# by leopold55# Hi, does anyone know how to get rid of all the junk in the Samsung "Smart Hub".## I can see that you can uninstall some of the "Apps", but what about the ones on the# top half of the screen?## Yahoo, LoveFilm, & all the other video on demand. "Your Video", is particularly# annoying because it's not my video, it's yet another v-o-d service.## Would be fine to ignore if I didn't have young kids, who I want to be able to use# the TV, but shouldn't be exposed to some of this stuff - even the covers and# meta-data for these are potentially inappropriate.## As for the Samsung Apps - we'll they're mostly very poor, but again, I don't want my# kids just downloading rubbish games or surfing inappropriate YouTube stuff.####################################################################################################################### How to de-junk Smart Hub / Smart TV# by Samsung_HD_Tech# In Reply to: How to de-junk Smart Hub / Smart TV by leopold55## leopold55,## The "Recommended" Apps are part of the App package. For some of them, adding them# separately may require several installations, so those Apps are pre-installed without# the ability to be removed. Some of the Apps cannot be uninstalled, as they are part of# the Apps lineup.## I'm sorry if movie jackets, titles and name files are "potentially inappropriate".# We don't pick the movies or titles shown on any individual App. If you have pictures# or examples of what you feel are beyond acceptable standards, such as "this would# never be a movie jacket or on a marquee outside a theater", please take a photo,# upload it, and paste the link here. I'd be happy to pass it to the appropriate# department for review.## --HDTech####################################################################################################################### You are missing the point# by leopold55# In Reply to: How to de-junk Smart Hub / Smart TV by Samsung_HD_Tech## Dear HDTech,## It looks like you completely missed the point## You should be able to customise stuff not least to make navigation more efficient# - just look at any OS - less junk is good thing. Nobody likes loads of useless stuff# they're not interested in to get in the way of the parts they want to keep.##  "If you have pictures or examples of what you feel are beyond acceptable#  standards, such as "this would never be a movie jacket or on a marquee#  outside a theater", please take a photo, upload it, and paste the link#  here"## You're kind of missing the point here too. It's not just about whether stuff is# offensive. Chocolate at the check-out of a supermarket is not offensive per se, it's# that it's not helpful to parents to put it there just because the kids are going# to fixate upon it.## If you choose to place something called "My Videos" prominently on the screen, any# 7-10 year old may well think those are indeed "our videos" and start clicking on them# expecting to be able to play them. Lo and behold, they are confronted with mainstream# titles, posters and synopses which are not for them - whether they are corrupted by# them or not is totally not the point.## The whole point here is it should be possible to get rid of the annoying stuff that# you're not interested in, instead of having it distract you and potentially upset your# kids.## This is a very basic concept of good design. You're not going to make many people buy# your TVs more just because you have advertising for lovefilm, etc. For those who don't# use these services it's just junk. For those who do - they already subscribe. I'm sure# these guys are subsidising these apps in the hope they will lead to more subscribers,# but you should know better than to push this stuff so crudely## You should learn from what happened with operator sponsored pre-loaded mobile phone# and PC apps and "trial/bloatware" - people go to great lengths to remove them and it# ends up creating negative feelings about the brand###########################################################

Reviews.Title: Pictures great, but product is not as advertised.
Reviews.Author: ncb
Reviews.Content: The picture quality is great, but TV cannot do what is advertised. It cannot play HD movies from Netflix. I spoke to the Netflix customer service and they said the Samsung app does not support HD, and they were working with Samsung to add this TV. They did not know when this might happen. I spoke with three different customer servers reps from Samsung they said the app does not support HD. They suggested I tried using their browser to watch HD movies. I tried Netflix with their browser, and no movies would play even after resetting the system. So they told me that you can not play HD Netflix, although they advertised that you can.My family likes to watch the Daily Show and Colbert Report online. You cannot do that with this TV. It requires Flash player, which the smart TV has, but it is too old. I tried several different sites and I could not find a site that Flash player would work. I ask the reps for sites to check if my Flash player was corrupted or not installed at all. They refused to give a site. They said that Flash player will not work on certain sites or formats. I have yet to find a site that could play a Flash video.

Reviews.Title: Awful.
Reviews.Author: Chris Baumgartner
Reviews.Content: Terrible, awful, ridiculous, awful, terrible.A study in poor design.Before purchasing this television, ask yourself these questions:- Do I like entering long text strings ONE CHARACTER AT A TIME by arrowing down and over and up and over on a character grid using a remote?- Do I like a device which routinely updates itself at lengthy and untimely intervals?- Do I like a baffling, unintuitive interface?- Are a bunch of pre-installed, bloated applications what I crave?- Do I like to search for a show one channel at a time rather than apply a single search to all channels?- Would I love to spend time finding and installing an iPad or Android controller which ends up helping none of these issues?If you answered "Yes!" to any of these questions then this Samsung television is the answer to your prayers!  If you answered "No" then run far, far away.  Instead of buying this "Smart" TV, save the extra $100 and spend it on a Roku or Apple TV.  You'll be glad you did.  The picture and sound of this TV are good, but the "Smart" internet features are  J-U-N-K.

Reviews.Title: Lackluster compared to my TV/PS3 media setup
Reviews.Author: David J. Mittner
Reviews.Content: Before looking too much into the 3-star rating either way, understand my frame of reference. For years we've only had a single television in our living room; a 50" Samsung with a PS3 plugged in, serving as our media hub for Netflix, Amazon Prime Video, Hulu, and streaming from my NAS over DLNA. So when I judge the 5300 it's largely in comparison to that experience.When going to buy two 30-something inch televisions for our bedroom and office I didn't even consider a "Smart" TV. The plan was to get a couple Chromecasts and just stream to them from whatever device was handy. So when I saw the 5300 on a Cyber-Monday deal I jumped on it. Having built-in wifi and all our apps was very appealing. We barely ever watch conventional television so it had everything we'd need. But ultimately the experience isn't quite the same, and not quite as good, as the TV+PS3 combination.Keeping State:You spend the time to dig through the menus and start streaming a video over DLNA or Netflix and turn off the television, you have to dig yourself all the way back to resume where you left off. Obviously this wasn't a problem for us before, so long as we didn't turn off the PS3. With Smart TVs having to compete with that alternative setup I'd have expected a bit better handling of this; either put the viewer back where they left off or give them a suspend mode alternative to turning it off.DLNA:Decent, but not as good as the PS3's. It doesn't work correctly with any of our Windows DLNA servers nor did it work with MediaTomb running off my Linksys NAS. Fortunately (sort of) I was able to change my NAS to using an inferior DLNA server application. The 5300 is able to use that one, at least. Now I just have to deal with that applications shortcomings.PS3 Controller better than Remote:My 3 year old can navigate my PS3 into Netflix and find his shows. I suspect it'll be a year or two before he can properly wield the remote and make it through MediaHub. This is made worse by the fact it doesn't keep state. We have to set him up every time he wants to watch his shows, even if he was the last one using it.Less of a comparison to my current setup now...Uninstallable Apps:Some things you can delete, some things you can't. The result is a slew of applications you just can't get off the interface. The "bottom" ones you can throw into a folder which kind of works, but the "top" recommended ones you're just stuck with. Fortunately for us we at least use most of them, anyway...Ads:Seriously? I go into MediaHub on my television and have to deal with ads?Snowy Startup:Using exclusively on-demand services we don't have any input sources, so every time we turn the TV on we get a snow field on the screen straight out of the 50s. And I haven't yet found a way to have it go into MediaHub by default. I'd have expected they'd anticipate this use case and not force everyone to an input source that doesn't exist...All that being said, it's still a good television and still better than my original plan of relying on a Chromecast exclusively--though I'm tempted to plug a couple in if only to get rid of the default static screen on start up. I'm just disappointed that they couldn't provide a better user experience when they aren't doing anything actually new; they're just combining existing functions into one device.

Reviews.Title: Good TV, easy to setup and use.
Reviews.Author: Lily Serene "Lily"
Reviews.Content: Good looking TV.  Just what the description says it is.  No problems at all, but hasn't had that much use yet.  I don't foresee anything going wrong because it's been so easy so far.  I'm not giving it 5 stars because I don't love it, but then, I can't imagine actually loving a television.

Reviews.Title: Its very good but still issues
Reviews.Author: atomicx "atomicx"
Reviews.Content: I read most reviews and for now it is very nice. Probably will update later. Here below is what I like about it:1. Nice sound2. easy to work menus3. picture is very nice not super great but nice4. not a expert but no light leakage so far5. connects to internet by wifi6. not automatically turning off like others said, if you find this adjust eco mode in menu.Some issues with it1. slight glare during daylight no biggie can live with it with price paid but anal type will not like it. Maybe just at my house2. internet hookup was at first slight problem but not biggie3. slow wifi connection only because i do not have cable hookup just dsl so ok with it. Wish dsl hooked up faster4. using the remote to type could be fasterOver all with price paid way under $800 great tv for picture and internet hookup. If I paid more for example over $1000 then would not buy it. But a very nice tv for the price. Better than those low end nutjob led/lcd china made tv like hisense and other no name brand.

Reviews.Title: Mostly Marketing Lies
Reviews.Author: John A. Leo
Reviews.Content: The Samsung40EH5300 bears no resemblance to the pretty marketing claims made by the company.It took me a week to get it working reasonably well and then another month (about 20-25 hours) to get most of the settings right, although I still have to fiddle with them.The Samsung40EH5300 is advertized as a 120hz type of TV, but the function provided is much, much worse than the 60hz setting. This is a 60hz TV and NOT 120hz.Changing from one cable channel to the next takes 2 - 5 seconds (skipping ahead 15-20 channels takes about 90 seconds - This definately kills channel surfing unless you have 60 minutes to cycle through your channels)depending on the picture resolution of the next channel.Advertized prominately is connecting a hard drive to the TV to show your family photos. This is so excruciatinly slow as to be worthless. There is no index of any kind and you can not skip to the "Z" titles without going through each of the 1000 pictures before "Z". Maybe you are supposed to view your photos only during a 12 hour Sunday afternoon - not mentioned in the Marketing HYPE.The CPU in this TV is a real joke.  For what I paid for this Samsung40EH5300, I could have purchased a real computer with a crisp monitor. The picture crispness is no where near what I was led to believe by the company marketing HYPE. I tried to return the Samsung 40EH53300 to Amazon, but I was told that since it was not technically broken (only lies in the marketing literature) I would have to pay an extra $90 for shipping to purchase a TV that worked, which I can't afford.One last thing. The TV comes with a "remote controller or wand". In order to use this device, you must point it within about 25 or 30 degrees of the right, lower corner of the TV. Thats about 6 or 9 inches in width. If you click while pointing a foot away or (GASP) at the screen, you can click all day and nothing will happen. My Cable box also has such a remote. I can point it 180 degrees from the box, the signal bounces around the room, and the channel is changed in half a second. The technology exists, SAMSUNG just won't let you have it.

Reviews.Title: Don't buy any Samsung TV's
Reviews.Author: Timothy R O'Gara
Reviews.Content: The TV showed up with over 70 dead pixels. I contacted Samsung 4 times and had to do troubleshooting,etc. That was fine. When I had to request service I was informed that I have to repackage and send it in for 30 days. The worst and most rediculous customer service I have ever seen. I ahve purchased other TV's on line and they send a service tech to my home for repair.They also stated that they have a NO RETURN POLICY!I can't even believe it. I will never buy anothey Samsung product and AMAZON  should have a disclaimer with tis information before anyone buys a Samsung product.

Reviews.Title: It's not worth to buy it
Reviews.Author: Rajasekar
Reviews.Content: 1. There is no enough built in memory to watch any film in the web browser since it crashes abruptly.2. You tube application is not at all working from day one onwards and amazon tech persons keep on saying that there is a problem with youtube apps and samsung application. But this is not true since my friend brought the same tv and he has no trouble to login to You tube apps.3. No proper guideline available from Amazon tech or available in online how to use apps.

Reviews.Title: Save your money
Reviews.Author: Liber8tor
Reviews.Content: I purchased this exact TV just over 1 year ago.  I paid $900 US.As soon as the TV was past 1 year warranty period, the LED screen failed.  Did Samsung engineer this to fail... "just in time"?  I think so.  Highly probable.Samsung service ranges from non-existent to awful.Their "SMART" software is old and stogy and freezes up more than it functions.  (Takes me back to my old AOL-Dial-up days on my GATEWAY Desktop when most screens would take hours to load and then would freeze.  Ahhh... the good old days.Save your money.  Purchase a refurbished LED TV somewhere for $299.00 and hook up a ROKU Box for $49.00.  You will be far ahead in the game.

Reviews.Title: Not very smart
Reviews.Author: James
Reviews.Content: Constantly requires new updates, but none of the bugs are never fixed. The most obvious reason you would want this tv is for youtube. The youtube app has never worked. The youtube app will never work. It's just there to taunt you.The problem I've been dealing with most recently is the Spotify app requires me to update my firmware. The tv doesn't update the firmware automatically, so I have to download it onto a flash drive from the samsung website. The zip file hosted samsung website is corrupted so I can't update. Terrible product, terrible support. Do not buy.

Reviews.Title: BEWARE OF DAMAGED PRODUCTS and POOR CUSTOMER SERVICE
Reviews.Author: bbz
Reviews.Content: WARNING: Tiger Direct's contract with Amazon is that any product that is DAMAGED upon arrival can only be refunded and not exchanged.  And they do not explicitly tell you this until there is a problem that cannot be fixed.We bought this TV during the Black Friday Sale for $600.  We chose to buy it from Tiger Direct because we studied the return & exchange policies on Tiger Direct's profile page prior to the purchase, and everything seemed fine at the time.  We also chose this seller over local stores that were also selling the TV for the same price, because we trust Amazon.  A week later it arrived with a terrible fist-size crack on the screen.  We do not think the damage resulted in transit by UPS, because we have purchased many many delicate items shipped by UPS with no problem at all.  Right away we contacted Amazon to file for an exchange.  All Amazon was able to do was to contact Tiger Direct on our behalf requesting for an exchange of the damaged TV.  Amazon did not mention anything about the item not being exchangeable.  3 days later we received a convoluted email from Tiger Direct:"Due to the number of orders placed for this item against the number of stocks we have, we were unable to determine if your purchase was included in the processing priority list. This is the reason why we have not cancelled your purchase until we are able to confirm that we are unable to fill your order within the specified timeframe provided by Amazon.com. Unfortunately, our stocks were limited and we are still waiting for the manufacturer to provide us a delivery date."The email did not address our request for an exchange.  It does not even tell you that the item is not exchangeable.We called Samsung regarding the issue.  Samsung warranty does not cover for cracked screens.We called Tiger Direct's customer service line.  After waiting for ONE WHOLE HOUR, an exhausted and ignorant CSR took down our information for a refund, while we were asking for an exchange.  When we corrected the CSR, he told us it is policy that damaged items through Amazon can only be returned and not exchanged.  We asked to speak to a manager regarding this, CSR replied "No you cannot because it is policy and no one can overturn that".  When we finally got through to a manager, he reiterated that the item can only be refunded and he cannot sell us an orange where there isn't one (???).The end result is that we have wasted two weeks of our time and missed out on a good Black Friday deal from other more credible sellers.Advice:  Do not buy TV's from Tiger Direct.  In our case, we will NOT buy anything from them.  Ever.

Reviews.Title: Samsung refuses to cover TV under warranty
Reviews.Author: AH
Reviews.Content: I purchased from somewhere else and the TV only lasted 6 months and color went crazy.  Samsung was really nasty to me about it saying it is out of warranty.  Finally they sent me shipping labels to send it in for repairs.  After receiving it they said it was not covered under warranty because it was not made in the USA.  They refused to fix it and sent it back damaged.  I would never, ever purchase another electronic item from SAMSUNG.  They really know how to treat customers.  They stink!!!  I got better service from Wal-Mart. I'll just purchase from another manufacturer.

Reviews.Title: samsung not so smart TV.
Reviews.Author: jedidiah
Reviews.Content: my ratings is nothing to do with amazon, my overall experience is great, delivered on time as promised.the only problem is this tv which I am so disappointed considering its samsung smart tv. which is not really smart when it comes to connecting my wireless network when using the hub, it taking a long time connecting and just end up having an error saying not connected to internet, checking my settings and it says connected and ready to used, go back to hub and it gives me same error. i used all troubleshooting but no help, i know that the problem is not my network because  I can use all my  wifi device without a problem so decided to return it back to amazon, which is so easy to do, asking me if I want the replacement with the same brand, my answer is NO, it might happen again, waste of time.

Reviews.Title: Malfunction
Reviews.Author: gabriela de espino
Reviews.Content: After 6 months the TV malfunction, started to turn on and off by it self. Apparently it's a frequent problem and Samsung tech support was not able to help.

Reviews.Title: This TV could not have been more broken.. who cleared this to be sent?
Reviews.Author: Gabrielle Marush
Reviews.Content: I can't believe this passed whatever inspection Amazon Warehouse has in place. The styrofoam corners were in the box .. but not on the tv, which looked like it had just been tossed in the box sideways. There were deep scratches on the back of the tv and scuff marks on the screen. Upon turning it on, we saw that it was completely broken. The screen was black and red, with white spiderweb-like lines all over the plasma screen. Complete trash. I have no idea how this got sent out. Giving Amazon the benefit of the doubt, I can only assume it was supposed to be in a trash pile and somehow made it into the 'good to send' section. I will be spending the extra $75 and buying a brand new tv, which I should have done from the beginning.

Reviews.Title: Samsung 32 inch LED Smart TV
Reviews.Author: Dilip Raje
Reviews.Content: Not up to the expectation. Session restore error comes often. Also keying website address or search string is pain. Internet browsing for watching video or anything else is awful. Youtube search box not visible.

Reviews.Title: Great Smart Buy
Reviews.Author: selena hughes
Reviews.Content: I love My TV! It does more than i thought &its; a really cool smart TV at an excellent price

Reviews.Title: Meh
Reviews.Author: Jason Brinkle
Reviews.Content: We haven't had a TV in our house for years. We bought this one at Costco because I was attracted to the idea of the streaming apps (e.g. Amazon Prime) to the TV without having to wire a tablet or laptop. The concept is still cooler than the reality, unfortunately. The TV had a hard time staying connected to the WiFi in an area where all our other wireless devices were fine and the apps were slow. My laptop cold boots faster than the Amazon app could load. The poor connectivity and underpowered nature of the thing made us return it.For a television, I'd give 5 stars. For trying to be a smart TV, it's only 3-stars "smart."

Reviews.Title: TV Samsung UN40EH5300 40-Inch 1080p 60Hz LED HDTV, Black broke it
Reviews.Author: Guillermo
Reviews.Content: Buy a new Samsung UN40EH5300 40-Inch 1080p 60Hz LED HDTV, Black and sent me damaged and now I can not change it because it came late to Venezuela and ended the time of return it.

Reviews.Title: Change settings like described
Reviews.Author: Tyler Cummings
Reviews.Content: I use mine as a second computer monitor while I am laying in bed. Two 32" monitors are way better than just one when you need quick glances between the latest facebook updates and what else I can blow my money on online. Enjoy works great

Reviews.Title: luv'n it so far...
Reviews.Author: Dawn Cross
Reviews.Content: So far so good. First day and I called customer service the TV was going to light to dark. Easy fix after I called the awesome samsung customer service. Just had to go t o menu then system then eco system. It was just an energy saving tool. Great tool too. You can adjust the brightness just like on your phone or computer. I own all samsung devices so I'm used to the interface.  It is pretty simple to use if you use samsung devices.

Reviews.Title: great smart tv
Reviews.Author: Edgar
Reviews.Content: Excellent resolution, low price and good brand, ideal for romms I love this tv, I browser in this and review fb

Reviews.Title: Quality TV
Reviews.Author: Ponch
Reviews.Content: We have now had this TV for over 6 months.  It works like a charm.  Easy to set up the wireless smart tv feature.  Colors are great. Sound -- well it is what you can expect from a flat screen tv -- get a sound bar for great sound.  All of it is pretty easy to use.  Easy set up.

Reviews.Title: NOT as "smart" as liked it to be
Reviews.Author: usman
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV for PlayStation 4 but the huge selling point was the "smart" feature of it. Which isn't as smart as I thought it would be.The apps constantly freeze, especially you tube, Netflix and web browser. My internet speed on average is 8 Mbps so its not the connection. simply surfing YouTube or switching between the apps will cause the screen to go blank for 3-5 minutes as it catches up with what I am trying it to do.I have tried uninstalling apps and then updating them again.As far as PlayStation game play, its fantastic, frame rate and picture quality are excellent. I would've given it 5 stars for it but its marketed as beyond a normal TV and that's simply not the case.

Reviews.Title: I thought it was a computer monitor
Reviews.Author: Isabel Smith "Isabel Smith Art and Design"
Reviews.Content: It was a TV -- but doesn't it look like the desktop of a computer? What do I know? My son's tv is now a computer. Its all so confusing. But as I read the box, I got a sinking feeling so before taking it out of the box, I called the people up and realzied: I'm old. Its a tv. They were great and took it back without question. that's the way to do business.

Reviews.Title: Sweet tv
Reviews.Author: David Shifflett
Reviews.Content: I would first like to say that this is an excellent tv and provides me with the exceptional entertainment that i always wanted from a TV. You should by this you wont regret it.

Reviews.Title: Good TV
Reviews.Author: Lorenzo Jones
Reviews.Content: It's good and does a lot but I did expect a little bit more. The picture quality is great but the internet apps could run a little faster and offer a few more options. If you have a Samsung tablet or phone it's great to play videos from phone to tv wirelessly.

Reviews.Title: Not as I expected.
Reviews.Author: Amarnath Ramnanan
Reviews.Content: This TV, although is touted as having a very clear and crisp picture quality, I am having some difficulty in getting there. My previous Samsung 46" 640 has a much better picture quality. Maybe I still need to tweak it up a bit. I cannot give a final rating until I've tried all my options.

Reviews.Title: He loves it...
Reviews.Author: Courtney Mason
Reviews.Content: My brother ordered this TV on Black Friday since his previous TV was not working properly. While he hasn't started using this particular smart TV he already knows he loves it. It's a very large one with a lot of technology which is great for those who want to do more than just watch a TV program or movie.

Reviews.Title: Nice picture, but requires additional purchases
Reviews.Author: Marzs
Reviews.Content: I got a smart TV so I could stream movies. After purchases it I didn't realize that I needed additional purchases. First you will need either an additional Ethernet cable or if you have a wireless router or you need an additional adapter. I don't have a wireless router (tried it, it didn't work right for me) and my router (Charter) only has one connection, so you will need additional ports. So I ordered an 5 port Ethernet switcher and was told the gigabit one is the best for streaming, so I am waiting on that. So far I am not sure if the smart part of the TV works, but the TV itself is nice. When you get it the picture has a real dark background, so I looked at other reviews that gave their specifications to program picture (there were two) the older specs are better. Now the picture is perfect. I really like this TV, but the volume doesn't seem to get louder after about 45, so I will probably end up ordering a sound bar. I ordered this on Thanksgiving day and I got it the next Tuesday, pretty quick considering I don't have Amazon Prime.

Reviews.Title: TV
Reviews.Author: Mary Munster
Reviews.Content: Very nice TV looks smaller than it really is make sure you have measured the area you would like to put it in!  Love the features of the TV!

Reviews.Title: Great Buy
Reviews.Author: chloe
Reviews.Content: Great deal.  I have looked all over for this.  Amazon had the best price.  The quality of the TV is excellent.  LOVE IT!

Reviews.Title: Samsung smart TV
Reviews.Author: Joe Rickertsen
Reviews.Content: Some apps like YouTube agree very slow on this device, this saddens me and the speakers crackle, they sound like they've been used to the max way to much. The color  is very good on this device though.

Reviews.Title: Too Many Accts to register.
Reviews.Author: George G Brumfield
Reviews.Content: TV is fine and works great, however smart tv requires absolutely too many accts to register in order to view programs.Also, many of the free ones will not load. Will continue to work with it too see if it improves.

Reviews.Title: Good product, my 3rd HDTV from Samsung
Reviews.Author: Vlad Vanek
Reviews.Content: Works well, i use it primarily for a TV viewing therefore I cannot comment on all features.  Installation is easy, right from the box. Colors are great, one can adjust them to ones liking, I always adjust color and tint to get human faces looking natural, then the rest of pictures fit with correct colors and tint.

Reviews.Title: Yowza!
Reviews.Author: Lachoneus
Reviews.Content: The TV works like a charm! I use it for both the Smart TV functions (Netflix and Amazon Prime, mostly), but also as a second PC monitor. The sound is good and the picture is also.

Reviews.Title: Samsung UN32EH5300 32-Inch 1080p 60 Hz LED HDTV (Black)
Reviews.Author: A. Parker
Reviews.Content: I like the HDTV. But I dislike the fact that in order to use the preloaded apps you have to pay for the use of them. I would rather not have the preloaded apps that requires my spending more to utilize them.

Reviews.Title: Samsung 50 inch
Reviews.Author: Betty R. DeMeo
Reviews.Content: I was hesitant at first to purchase the TV.  What I love about it is the picture is so clear and the sound is spectacular.  You can see so much more with the 50 inch .

Reviews.Title: It's ok
Reviews.Author: Christina M Meisenhelter
Reviews.Content: Shipping was good. Tv not as crisp as expected even after adjusting to recommendations. Called cable company to upgrade to the box to hd. Will see if that helps. Love having a smart tv and streaming amazon prime free movies and listening to pandora, although sometimes it stops mid movie and has to think before continuing. Gets annoying but this is the Internet connection not the tv so I will upgrade my Internet speed and see if that helps. I'm trying to research a good blu ray player to be able to upgrade and utilize the 3d capabilities but need to figure out which surround sound/blu ray combo to go with. It's a work in progress!

Reviews.Title: nice picture
Reviews.Author: Art
Reviews.Content: The first thing we noticed is the crisp, clear picture as compared to our Vizio set. This was a replacement for that one and We're glad we found an internet TV.

Reviews.Title: Great
Reviews.Author: Mathias
Reviews.Content: Everything was what i expected. Very good product I recommend it by 100%. Samsung always is a guarantee. I'm happy with it

Reviews.Title: Fine TV, lousy Samsung customer service
Reviews.Author: MAK
Reviews.Content: Amazon has always been excellent to deal with and this transaction was no exception. Samsung customer service is anything but service. The remote was DOA on arrival and call after call to Samsung have got me nowhere. Basically, calling customer service is like leaving a message with someone's assistant (and the assistant putting the message in the round file). Amazon offered to send out another TV - an offer which I am leaning to taking. It's been one week with no contact from Samsung, hopefully soon. I can use their smartphone remote in the interim.As to the television itself, fine picture, fine features (particularly for the price), the SMART Hub features handy, and all works well.

Reviews.Title: ok
Reviews.Author: K Stevens
Reviews.Content: This tv was our 2nd choice. Our 1st choice was out of stock, everywhere! So we got this tv and it's not bad. It's a good tv, but it has it's ups and downs. We've had a few problems with it and a prism tv set up. The picture quality isn't as good as I'd hoped it would be, but it's better then alot of the others that we looked at. So, it's got it's ups and downs! But, it's still a pretty good tv set!

Reviews.Title: Samsung Smart TV
Reviews.Author: Sergio Quintero
Reviews.Content: I was kind of excited at first, but what they don’t tell you is that when you’re are trying to view YouTube on your smart tv is does not work as expected, you can’t really view high definition videos on you tube, It does not work properly, I was very disappointed, other than that the tv works fine! I just have to figure out how to live with not watching You Tube on my tv.

Reviews.Title: Best of the Best so far!
Reviews.Author: galaie jah
Reviews.Content: i boutght this on 2/25/2013 and got it 3 days later. So far so good setup is easy so problem yet so 5/5.will keep you updated.4/16/2013: the product is still great, 5/5. but i wanna buy a wireless keyboard and a mouse can someone please help me know which one is best for my tv.

Reviews.Title: Wow
Reviews.Author: Patrick C. Reid
Reviews.Content: what a great TV.  I did not know why i bought a smart TV but im sure glad i did

Reviews.Title: Way more than we needed
Reviews.Author: Pig
Reviews.Content: Well, if you dont have fast internet you can save yourself a lot of money and get the same tv without all the software.  We live in a rural area and highspeed is outrageous expensive and not reliable.  So, we have tried to make this work but its just not gonna happen.  Easy enough for us to use though I am not sure if my parents would be able to use the TV as intended.  Reaction is slow from button to movement on the screen so patience is good (not my forte).  We had to plug the internet cable in rather than wifi for speed but still not good enough.  But maybe someday.  Good picture but we over spent on things we cant use without pulling our hair

Reviews.Title: Not what I was hoping for
Reviews.Author: Laura
Reviews.Content: I love the apps--Netflix and Pandora, primarily--but non-HD channels are poorer quality than those on an old tube tv, the volume is weak, and I can't figure out how to format the picture so text isn't cut off.  I'm finding that words in any corner of the screen are cut off, so I'm wondering what else I'm missing, and Samsung Customer Service was unable to resolve this for me.....

Reviews.Title: It is not at all smart
Reviews.Author: JV
Reviews.Content: I bought this tv thinking that I can stream Netflix, YouTube, and other apps but I am able to stream only Netflix and it also doesn't work many times. YouTube never works and browser never works. It is not worth the money. Don't buy it. Instead one can go for a HD tv and all these can be streamed fron DVD players or any other game devices.

Reviews.Title: TV power cord is not fitting well
Reviews.Author: Maheswarnath
Reviews.Content: the TV power chord is not goodalso the smart TV when  using the browser its saying as memory insufficient and getting the browser closed and not working properly,

Reviews.Title: HDTV 5 stars- Smart TV 1 star!!!
Reviews.Author: D. Shannon
Reviews.Content: I will make this short for new buyers:1. This is a 5 star HDTV  for watching DirecTV, Dish, Cable or local broadcast  HDTV AND BluRay and regular DVDs!2. The "Smart TV" features are  so difficult and clunky to set up and use,  as  many other reviewers have detailed , I regard  this  as a worthless feature and rank it 1 star and in need of major improvements.  Any computer user will be appalled  at the software running "Smart TV".  This is not an  i Pad ( or any other tablet) experience!!!3. For Macintosh users who want to use the USB input to All Share Play  to play their Macintosh edited .mov video and other Mac music and video files from a USB thumb drive,  most music and video files  have to be converted to Windows format compatible  files  before using the USB input. Smart TV does not recognize these  Apple files, such as extensions .mov and . aif.  Using a format converter on the Macintosh and knowing which of the dozens of file types listed in the included e-manual to convert  to,  this USB input  feature can be made to work if you are tech savy enough to know how to convert files to mp4 and set video pixel dimensions correctly, but most Apple product users are not!  With the world wide success of Apple products one would think Samsung would not boycott Apple off this "Smart TV", but that appears  to be the case.  I was finally successful in converting years of  Mac  home movie and music files  to formats that would play on this Samsung "Smart TV" after hours of file conversion work .  It would not have been difficult  for Samsung to support these Apple file types  without these problems.

Reviews.Title: SMART TV is not really SMART
Reviews.Author: GAP
Reviews.Content: first of all, i bought this tv from buy.com thanksgiving firesale for $460 bucks.TV is really good, light weight, slim and works perfectly fine.Product is mainly advertised as SMART TV but the tv does not have the required accessories. Definitely a SMART remote should have been part of the deal.I went ahead and got a wireless keyboard / mouse for $30 and hooked it up with TV and finally thought i can use my tv as a laptop - what was i thinking !SMART features are very premature or Samsung reserved the best features for future year's TV or for higher price TV models.Web Browser crashes:Web browser crashes so often and it is increasingly annoying to watch any videos from the TV. I read some articles on CNET forums and many reported this issue so it is clearly SOFTWARE limitation.The external keyboard i bought does not work within Samsung apps like youtube / netflix - without which browsing using the standard remote is a SEVERE punishment.I wish i read many of the reviews before building the expectation on this TV. Now i am going to use this as a Standard TV and not as a SMART TV.This TV is exclusively made for US and this can't be used directly in ASIA without appropriate transformers.

Reviews.Title: Meh
Reviews.Author: Mizzhell
Reviews.Content: It is astounding to me that Samsung would create a TV that connects to the Internet and, ostensibly, to various streaming sites (but not Amazon) and then give you some crappy remote to navigate it. Really - no keyboard? It is impossible and irritating even to peruse flicks you might want to see. I am not a TV person and would be easily impressed, honestly, but I just am not. My old giant box that I got rid of was less of a headache than this. Overall, just wish I'd bought a TV without the SMART.

Reviews.Title: 50% smart TV not a 100%
Reviews.Author: mohan
Reviews.Content: After doing research for couple of months, I bought this TV. Flash player does not work in this TV. I watch ESPN3 using my laptop. ESPN's use flash player, so i dis pointed with this TV. So it's 50% smart TV not a 100%. One more problem with searching in the You tube or internet, it's difficult to use the remote control and pressing on character one by one. Some times i think instead of buying LED with smart TV, buy LED without smart TV option and use with streaming box like Google TV. So that you can save some money.

Reviews.Title: It was a Lemon
Reviews.Author: Juanita Cordova "Cmm12698"
Reviews.Content: We received the TV and tried for several days to get the HDMI inputs to work, guess we just got a bad TV, will stay away from this TV and go with something different.  Really surprised that I had an issue with a Samsung TV, but guess they don't make them like they used too.

Reviews.Title: Samsung Smart LED HDTV
Reviews.Author: B1tchDuck
Reviews.Content: I chose this TV to replace a 27" flat screen TV.  (Yeah the kind that still has the big part at the back).  I have to say how happy I am with this purchase.The box arrived via USPS and in great condition.  It is SO lightweight!  I was very surprised and almost felt as if they shipped me an empty box! They didn't. :)Total time to unplug/remove my old TV, remove this one from the box, read directions, hook up cables, initial TV set up, and start exploring TV capabilities - 45 min.  It was THAT easy!A few of the features I like best, so far about it are the size of the screen. It's 32 inches so it's big enough I don't have to squint to see the shows, but it's not obnoxiously big, either.  Also, being an Amazon Prime member, I can access Amazon VOD - no special sign up, no dual membership.  Just log in with your e-mail address and start watching! It has some fun things for Kids, too!I have had this TV for a few days and so far I am very happy with it!

Reviews.Title: Picture sucks
Reviews.Author: LaurenRoseLeClair
Reviews.Content: No matter how you put the settings, the picture is not clear and crisp like my plasma.  The good thing is it is light and the features for the Smart TV settings are nice, but man the picture stinks

Reviews.Title: Sucky mcsuck
Reviews.Author: James Fleming
Reviews.Content: Great picture, but not able to download adobe flash player; therefore you can't watch any sports or other streaming services in less that have an app already created (Netflix,YouTube)

Reviews.Title: TV SUCKS!!
Reviews.Author: james L Kopsi
Reviews.Content: It really is a bad version of a smart TV. Very difficult to navigate and does not mirror well or very easy with other Samsung devices. I wish I could send it back..

Reviews.Title: Good deal
Reviews.Author: Arnold L. Rheingold "happycamper"
Reviews.Content: Easy yt set up.  Great picture.  Good bargain.  The built-in WI-FI works well.  It is about as good as cheaper TV get.

Reviews.Title: Samsung5300
Reviews.Author: Carolyn Cahill
Reviews.Content: Picture is good but not knock your socks off great. I have a Sony a year older that has a better picture.

Reviews.Title: Cannot control external speaker volume
Reviews.Author: Tom Walden "TW"
Reviews.Content: I do not like to listen to commercials, so when they come on I want to turn off or mute the volume. The TV has an external speaker connection. The problem is that the volume control of the TV does not control the output of the external speaker. So I have no way of muting my external speakers as they are just speakers, they are not a audio receiver unit with a separate remote control. I tried all the sound menu settings, but never got it to work the way I needed it to.

Reviews.Title: Very Happy I Found a Bargain Price
Reviews.Author: K. B. Barkley "Jamaican Dreamer"
Reviews.Content: Nice TV indeed, great add-ons, interesting features, & I got this overrated Samsung SmartTV on a bargain price... thank goodness. I almost was fooled into a QVC payment plan so-call deal & I would've paid double the price I paid with Amazon Warehouse Deals glad I did a very DEEP research before making my SmartMove. Basically what's so great about this TV is you can Facebook/Twitter, surf web, watch YouTube, & watch TV at the same time, wow! My TiVo has some of the same features somewhat, this SmartTV is just another Samsung Galaxy gadget in a larger size with almost the same price tags!!!

Reviews.Title: Does not support .MOV video formats
Reviews.Author: David Fosnight
Reviews.Content: Disappointed in lack of support for .MOV video formats...  However, Picture quality very good and has a great set of features...IT DOES NOT SUPPORT .MOV VIDEO FORMATS!!!  The main reason that I purchased this 'Smart' TV was to connect to my NAS (network hard drive) and play my videos for family and friends.  I take all of my videos with an awesome Cannon PowerShot SX230 HS which stores video in the .MOV format...  What a BIG disappointment when I found that this 'Smart' TV does not support this format.If you intend on using your 'Smart' TV to play this popular video format look to a manufacture other than Samsung.  AND verify before you buy!

Reviews.Title: Defective out of the box
Reviews.Author: Elizakat "Kat"
Reviews.Content: I just went through 3 very frustrating hours on the phone with Samsung, my cable provider and Amazon. The WORST was Samsung. They had me on hold for 57 minutes and could not resolve my problem but said I either had to drive the tv 2 hours for repair or return it. I called Amazon and they don't have any more of this model in stock if I wanted to exchange it. So consider yourself lucky you can't buy it. But if you do buy a Samsung product and need help - good luck talking to anybody that can resolve your issue. I will be going to an actual STORE to buy the LG smart tv and sending this junk back to Amazon. Flimsy stand too btw...

Reviews.Title: Not enough memory to stream online content
Reviews.Author: Saumil Maniar
Reviews.Content: I would suggest buying a higher model if your sole purpose is to stream online video. Apparently the 700mb memory is not enough.

Reviews.Title: RETURN LABEL IS ON THE BOX, AND IT'S GOING BACK!
Reviews.Author: Esther M.K.
Reviews.Content: Flesh tones are horrible.  Super exaggerated highlights and inconsistent colors that change from channel to channel, scene to scene and ad to ad.  I've made DOZENS of setting adjustments and spoken with Samsung six times.  Just when I think I've got it, a new ad comes on and this TV is all but un-watchable all over again.  e.g.: A picture showing a room-full of people of different ethnicities will be great, except for one person who's skin tone will be so white it practically glows, or is so washed out they look like they should be in a coffin.  Also, most channels seem to have a white haze, which dulls the picture and sharpness.  I've turned off all of the power saving settings as they seem to enhance this effect, but I still don't like it.Samsung has lot's of excuses, (if they don't hang up on me first), but it's not acceptable anyway you look at it.  (Watching the Blue-Ray player is even worse, so NO, it's not my satellite provider as Samsung suggests.  And I have other flat screen TV's that have GORGEOUS coloring and sharp pictures in my home, so I know what watching a TV should look like... even though you are doing your best to make me feel like an idiot).  I've worked hard over the past three days to get some improvement, but enough is enough and it's going back.A big thank you however to G. Peck, the reviewer who listed his settings on his review.  After copying them, there was a drastic improvement, but still not enough to make me want to keep this set.I will say that I like the sound quality of this TV, even though many did not.  On the other hand, apparently you can't have an external speaker playing in conjunction with the TV speaker.  (I have both going simultaneously with my other TV's however).  Of course I couldn't use my external speaker at all, because according to Samsung, I have the wrong cable.  It's the same cable that I had working with my SONY just seconds before, but Samsung says I need to buy a Samsung cable....  Also on the positive side, if you can call it that, the remote control is better than many I have used.  Although dull, the keys are back-lit which is nice, and MOST of the keys are thoughtfully placed.  It's all moot for me, as I use a universal remote which was incredibly easy (easier than my other electronics) to program to this TV.I will also add that I agree with the many reviewers who don't like the glossy screen.  It's way too reflective and glaring, as well as hard to see from an angle. Nope, I don't like it at all, and really don't have much good to say about this TV!

Reviews.Title: Only small comments
Reviews.Author: Fred C Andrews
Reviews.Content: I would prefer the manual to be in print form.  I detest the form of information inserting.  The picture is superb.  Fred Andrews  retired

Reviews.Title: Found it Cheaper
Reviews.Author: Kati B.
Reviews.Content: I found this TV at Walmart for  $678.00. and the lady said they were going to put it on sale in 2 weeks. So shop around people.

Reviews.Title: Great TV but poor build quality
Reviews.Author: AK529
Reviews.Content: I decided to give this tv a try since my 3 year old Samsung ln32b530 started making those clicking sounds. The picture and sound quality on this was really good and much better than my tv I was replacing. The tv was considerably thicker than my older tv which I found surprising since this one is led version and my older one was lcd. Being thicker allowed it more room for the speakers, which sounded so much better than my older tv. This tv is loaded with tons of features. Its got wifi,ethernet, dln, 2 usb ports, 3 hdmi ports, a web browser and tons of apps. Its very hard these days to find a 1080p 32 inch tv. They dont make that many any more. Only Samsung and a couple of other manufactures make them now. Most tvs in the 32inch size are now 720p not 1080p. In my case I needed a 1080p since I was using it for gaming and as monitor. Also my older tv was 1080p. Overall I really liked this tv with its set of features, sound and picture quality and price. But the second day I got it I decided to take off all the plastic tape around the bezel edges and found that the bezel was extremely loose. The two top corners were loose and continued about halfway down. I really didnt feel like exchanging this one and trying to find another one. I didnt know for sure if the next one would be the same or better. I had also read on avs forums and here on amazon of others complaining of the same issue. I have had a number of issues with the Samsung products in the last 3-4 years. My first tv bought in 2008 had the clicking sound. Then Samsung replaced it in 2009 and now that one is also make the clicking sound. Ive owned 4 Samsung blu ray player which also had quality control issues. More recently I tried 3 Samsung galaxy note 10.1 tablets they all had creaking and clicking sounds. Also my recently purchased samsung galaxy s3. I had to exchange because a loose power button and other issues. Samsung makes great products, with lots of features at an affordable price. But the build quality and quality control issues make me want to purchase other products. Anyway back to the review of this tv. It was great except for the loose bezel. If you want to a tv with vga output or a swivel stand then this isnt the tv for you. I also found the power controls weird since they are on the bottom right. Just one button like a joystick allows you to control power, volume, channels, input or other settings. The tv is extremely light and the overall foot print takes up less space than my older tv. Its not as wide or not as tall but it is thicker. It makes a great tv for monitor and also has picture and picture. So you could be browsing the web and have picture and picture on and catch up on some news. In the end I realized I really missed my old tv. So I got my old tv fixed since it was cheaper than getting a new tv. So as long as you get on that doesnt have the defects mine had the loose bezel your fine. It makes a great tv for the bedroom and or as a monitor and gaming.Update after owning for 1 month: So I ended up repurchasing this tv since my repaired tv started making noises again. This tv is still the best 32 inch 1080p led  on the market. Most manufactures dont even make 1080p tvs in this size any more. This is tv is great deal if you can get it for around $400. Considering it has so many features like wifi, dlna, 2 usb ports, 3 hdmi ports, picture in picture, apps and a browser. The second tv I purchased also had a loose bezel, mostly in the top right corner. I tried tightening the screws to make the bezel less loose but it didnt help. Other than the bezel being loose I am very happy with this tv. Sound and picture quality is great. It has very small footprint which is great for the bedroom or desk. I use mine mostly as monitor with my laptop, also do some pc gaming with it, use it with my apple tv 2 and hd pvr. The tv is a little on the thicker side considering it is an led. I really like having picure and picture and being able to use my iPad to control the tv with the samsung app. The tv has tons of apps. There are a few apps I wish it had like slacker and vevo. The dlna and usb port only plays some of my mvks, plays all avi files and aac music files from itunes. I like that I can use my Samsung galaxy s3 to play media files to the tv.

Reviews.Title: Awsome TV, but...
Reviews.Author: ekhamidova
Reviews.Content: Well i bought this tv from amazon and base on online review, has good and bad review. it has a very nice picture quality and sound. easy to set up. remote control is nice but has a little bit issues with responding, example you have to press several times to get respond and does not matter from what distance, i had many issues at the beginning with this Tv and talk to many online TECH, "THE SAMSUNG APP". i could not download the app or if i could did not let me to save the icon on the SMART HUB, the first page to have shortcut. For a week talk to many people and everybody said something. Finally i got so upset and called the again and ask for manager and he walked me through, RESET whole tv and deleted apps. and it is working now. Another issues is as soon as you turn on TV will take time to update.... do not why. they said it is OK. as i said i owned many samsung product and this is nice, built in WI-FI is a great thing. many apps that you can use. %80 of apps, not useful. I use thsi TV as my computer monitor and has enought HDMI , great sounds quality, sharp, great for bedroom or office. i really enjoy this. Another problem is , there is no AMAZON APP. price is great, bought it $590. let me tell you i bought this TV 5 times from different website and amzon, after you purchase they will tell you it is not available. it is hard to find this TV. i will recommend to buy this tv.

Reviews.Title: Good picture and apps, but not compatible with Amazon Instant Video
Reviews.Author: Lake House
Reviews.Content: The Good:-easy to set up network-good picture-good soundThe Bad:-typing text boxes with the remote's arrow keys is clunky-Amazon Instant Video is not supported either through an App or on the browser.Other:-Wound up returning it.

Reviews.Title: Stopped working
Reviews.Author: Sara
Reviews.Content: I bought this television because of the brand and the price. It worked great for about two months and then began spontaneously restarting. Now it will not even get past the start up screen. I was unplugging it and "letting it rest" for a couple of days and it would work again. Now, however, nothing seems to work. I should have spent the money towards a better television. Do not buy this model unless you want to waste your money.

Reviews.Title: Not so happy, internet connection not working
Reviews.Author: Sam Sun
Reviews.Content: The quality of the picture is good, but has problem to connect to the internet. On the setup, I hooked a wireless with this TV, but when I went to SmartTV to  use browser, the error message came out, saying the internet is not connected.  Try to google the error msg, I found many people has same problem, but the solution offered by Samsung customer service never worked. Although many helpful tips are listed online, but none of them come from Samsung. I will try those tips to see if any of them worked.

Reviews.Title: The Picture Quality is below my expectation
Reviews.Author: JJ
Reviews.Content: Updated on 12/5/2013 (changed rating from 2 stars to 3 stars).Now I found that for some TV shows, the Netflix app shows better picture quality which is close to 1080p streaming, but for most movies, it still looks bad. I then set up my Roku box with 720p output to compare its PQ with TV's built-in Netflix app. They look similar and both have the same jaggy and fuzzy edges when playing movies. This indicates that upscaling is causing all of these image quality issues. Of course if 1080p streaming is available on Samsung Netflix app, then the issue might disappear.A 1080p TV is considered to be "newer" model compared with an old 720p LCD TVs, which means people have higher expectation on the image quality for the same source. However a 720p source being displayed on 720p TV looks natural because no video scaling is required. To get comparable or similar performance, a very high quality sclaer is required when showing 720p contents on a 1080p TV because all of these pixels need to be digitally processed and up-scaled. If this is not done right, it will certainly create artifacts and image quality issues. At least in my setup, my 720p TV seems to have a much better picture quality when using Roku 720p source, compared with the same Roku 720p source on my Samsung 1080p TV. Because of upscaling, I do expect the 720p source on a 1080p display should look slightly worse than on a native 720p display, but not this bad. The amount of jaggy shows that the scaler configuration is really bad, probably just the simplest bilinear scaler.---------------- end of update ------------------------The TV has several picture quality (PQ) issues:1) In the netflix app, the resolution must be much lower than 1080p, or the scaler is using a real bad configuration. I can see big jaggy and noise in Hunger Games which should be the HD content from Netflix server. I compared this PQ with Amazon instant video app from the same TV and Amazon Instant Video PQ looks much better than Netflix. Amazon version looks more like 1080p streaming. I don't know who is responsible for low quality netflix movies, either netflix or samsung. However, since the netflix app is provided in Samsung firmware, I assume samsung should be responsible for this. In this netflix mode, the screen adjustment setting is disabled so we can't play with scaling to confirm if Netflix app is cheating us using lower resolution or not. But based on the amount jaggy and low quality image, I believe the app is not doing 1080p streaming.2) The panel has very noticeable pixel structure. I don't know why the small LEDs look so crisp clear. I do expect they blend more, with less mosaic effect. The panel looks a little bit more fuzzier than my old 720p LCD TV even though I believe the pixel density is similar.3) The compression noise reduction feature barely works. There is still a lot of mosquito noise on the edges. Even on the Netflix movie selection menu, and main menu background image, I can see a lot of noise.4) The "dynamic" picture mode is over-enhanced. The same for "natural" mode. The "standard" is tuned for energy saving so it looks like having low contrast. The only mode I recommend is "movie" mode but still there some enhancement going on even after I turned off almost all the picture adjustment functions such as noise reductions. Overall, the contrast is mess-ed up and even in its best movie mode, it is still over enhanced.The only good thing about this TV is its black level. It looks fantastic. But its video processing is creating too many problems for contents with resolution lower than 1080p. If using blu-ray, or using 1080p streaming, this TV is great.I wish the TV has a setting that can bypass most video enhancement, with a nominal scaling setup

Reviews.Title: Disappointed
Reviews.Author: Joseph OBrien
Reviews.Content: This TV is great in every aspect that a TV should be, however, the Smart Hub is typical Microsoft-windows-Android let down material.I bought the TV for my gym and didnt want to pay for another FIOS box.  The smart hub feature supposedly would allow me to tap into HBOtogo and watch movies, series, etc while I worked out.  Instead, HBO is not available and every other service (with subscriptions) is.  For instance, I can join Hulu plus, or Netflix or Blockbuster, but cant use my Amazon Prime service or HBO togo.I should have bought a less expensive TV and instead gotten a ROKU box.  Bummer.  Waste of $500, when I could get a great 32 inch TV for 200-300.

Reviews.Title: I WONDER IF
Reviews.Author: donkey
Reviews.Content: Any way to connect this to Acoustic Audio AA5170 5.1 CH multimedia speaker systembean tacos with cheese and valentina sauce

Reviews.Title: nO PICTURE
Reviews.Author: DALE

Reviews.Title: Unfortunately, your
Reviews.Author: YANG KEEN.LEE
Reviews.Content: This thing is a very good thing I think the picture is called Best Value Product description only regret if you aspire to be a little more product photographs look in different directions, especially behind the remains regret things you could not see well received thank you

Reviews.Title: Great idea - product not yet ready for market
Reviews.Author: kjd
Reviews.Content: This is a waste of money - and worse - it cannot be returned!!  I've only had it for 2 days - maybe I just haven't learned everything about using it yet.  BUT!!!a.  I haven't watched commercials in years.  When I had cable, I recorded everything, then fast-forwarded through the commercials.  When I started watching tv on my laptop, I would switch to a different window and play games during the commercials.  There is NO WAY to escape the endless mind-numbing commercials on this TV.  I feel like I am watching 1950's tv.  When is the test pattern scheduled??b.  The 'apps' are extremely non-intuitive!  One would expect to be able to set up each app to play one's usual programs with a minimum of extra 'clicking'.  No such luck!  You have to enter each app each time as if you were a newcomer setting up your preferences.  And the remote is not a good tool for navigating all these menus.  It takes a LOT of clicking to get to your programs.c.  There are no apps for my favorite channels (or at least, I haven't found them yet - they are not well organized).  Yes, I can go to the internet app, locate my program, bookmark it, select it, wait - wait - wait- OOPS!  it runs out of memory every time before the program can load!  Back to my laptop for at least 60% of my tv time. Will I switch back and forth between my laptop for favorites and the tv for less favorites?? Not likely.d.  Many others have recommended getting a wireless mouse and keyboard.  I have enough trouble locating the remote when I need it.  I really don't want 3 loose pieces (plus the mouse pad and something hard to use the mouse on) wandering around the apartment!e.  I'm considering connecting my laptop to the tv and using it as a monitor.  But then I would have to get up and go to the tv every time I had to change stations!  Did I mention 1950's tv??I gave it two stars because the picture and sound are adequate (sound is NOT good).  If one had cable or some other paid subscription service, it would probably be ok as a tv - which I WILL NOT DO!!  I may try some kind of antenna.  But really, it is only a tv.  It isn't smart enough to qualify for that name.

Reviews.Title: waste

Reviews.Content: This tv is ok Not all that its cracked up to be.... a few flaws that need to be improved and hd is sub par I've seen better

Reviews.Title: Horrible Sound
Reviews.Author: digy07
Reviews.Content: The sound on this TV was unbearable! I used it in a bedroom which isn't loud to begin with. I had to turn up the volume so loud to hear the dialogue when a show was on and then turn it way down when scenes involving music or background noise came on because it would be way too loud. There was no happy place with this tv. The only way I'd consider keeping it was if I had a sound bar. The picture was fine, not great but it is a cheaper tv so it's ok. The apps were good. I use Amazon Instant Video so that was the selling point for me. At the end of the day I returned it and bought a Samsung plasma with a Samsung SMART blu-ray player instead.

Reviews.Title: i like it
Reviews.Author: Shermun F.
Reviews.Content: Tthe Samsung UN32EH5300 32-Inch 1080 60Hz HDTV  it did not blow me away but i like it and i think u would like it too

Reviews.Title: Great picture
Reviews.Author: Boots
Reviews.Content: This tv is great! It has Internet built-in. The size is just right for a bedroom. The only drawback is it is advertised as having a Direct TV tuner built-in but you still need equipment between the wall and the tv,not sure where you would use the built-in tuner.

Reviews.Title: Wireless Absolutely does not work
Reviews.Author: Nagesh Somasundaram
Reviews.Content: TV Did not connect to my wireless. When I called Samsung I was told my teeny weeny phone will connect to wireless because it apparently has a bigger antennae then the 40 inch TV:( made absolutely no sense to me. Next suggestion from Samsung was to go buy a $100 wireless repeater and place it next to the TV. I was going "Huh if i have to buy a repeater and place it next to the TV I would have bought a TV that was a 100 cheaper and plunged an Ethernet cable to it."has a good resolution when I plugged the BluRay to it though. so if you are buying it hoping to connect to wireless dont. just pick up the Samsung LN40E550 40-Inch 1080p 60Hz LCD HDTV and save yourself money.

Reviews.Title: Many Promises But No Firm Deliveries: GET A SONY OR WAIT FOR APPLE
Reviews.Author: Ron Cope
Reviews.Content: Samsung promises many things for this product. The problem is that they simply don't deliver. The set is really not reliably wireless. It has to be hard wired into your wireless system. The only way I was able to get it work was to connect it directly to the LAN. Or, I got a signal booster to make it work. Also, don't think you can browse the web with this set. The software is bulky at best and at worst really non-functional. Streaming is spotty at best and the programs they offer are the best that are available now, but nearly every wireless set that promises to deliver streaming and web-browsing is promising the moon and delivering thin air. Let's face it, the software and strength of the wireless connection is not yet widely available. Samsung builds a nice picture and OK sound but not the future or otherwise in terms of a great overall experience. Plus, don't waste your time with the customer service people: they just read from a manual and are not really able to think on their feet as is sometimes needed. Plus, of course, they know their sets don't have the best software and wireless connectivity. So they "lie" and act as if the problem is yours not theirs. The bottom line is that right now the best you can do is buy a nice TV and don't ask it to stream and connect. That's where Apple or some other company still has an opportunity to introduce a better experience which will offer us what the companies and sets today promise but don't really deliver.

Reviews.Title: Dope for TV
Reviews.Author: c dwight
Reviews.Content: TV is great for regular viewing of cable and movies but the WIRELESS INTERNET FEATURE REALLY REALLY SUCKS!!!LOLIts a great TV for the money.

Reviews.Title: Smart TVs are a waste of time (For now at least)
Reviews.Author: Mattey
Reviews.Content: I have been buying most of my movies and tv shows through iTunes over the years, and one of the first things a potential SmartTV owner needs to consider is that you can't access anything from Apple's ecosystem on these devices.  They run the Google Android OS (Complete crap on every device) which means no itunes access, so you either need to start your media library over again or just get a normal LED TV (for WAY less i must add) and just connect a $90 Apple TV to it.  I returned this and bought a 40" Samsung LED HDTV for less, and even with the purchase of the AppleV i still saved money.Other considerations for SmartTVs  Yes they offer apps like Hulu and Netflix, but each manufacturer customizes the OS to their preferences so these App companies have an infinite number of platforms to support (Too many different flavors of Android, it's impossible to keep updates steadily streaming into the multitude of app stores).  Do not expect to get all of the bugs resolved, or even to get meaningful support, for any apps that run on a SmartTV.  They also run very slowly, and the controls are clunky.If you're an Android person you 'might be okay' with this purchase, but i have not found a single person who has been excited or even happy for the long term, for their SmartTV purchase.  Always running into problems and just reducing the scope of what they try to use, to the point of it being used like a regular TV.  What a waste of $$$.

Reviews.Title: This TV does not have the youtube app
Reviews.Author: Kiran Manku
Reviews.Content: this tv does not have the youtube app and to change the position of the mouse and to type the lettes you should have lot of pations it is toooooooooooooo slow...

Reviews.Title: This TV does not have a headphone jack on the television.
